འ-འ	brod nas dam pa dam pa 'a 'a byas pas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 344.1.
འ-འོ	lay participant in monastic ritual. (a term heard being used in Nepal) 495 190.3. an animal in the class of cats? 'a 'o zhum bu byi la gsum la 'dam ka gda' ste. Zhi-byed Coll. II 9.4.
འ-འུ	gtso bo'i rjes su 'dzin pa. Btsan-lha. de'i nyin bar la bre mo'i gtam 'a 'u dang dang ding ku re dang ngag 'khyal ci smras kyang bzlas brjod du song nas / ngag gi nus pa gong gi sngags bsgrangs pa dang 'dra bar 'byung ste. Zhi-byed Coll. II 66.6, (also, 260.2).

འ-མ	a spelling for a ma, 'mother' used in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 159.1-3.
འ-མོ	gtso mo. Btsan-lha.
འ-པ	Samdo A 139v.1. 'a pa dkar po. Examples in Samdo A II 246v.1; III 23v.1, 106r.3, 106r.5 (a pa); V 12v.2, 13v.3, 50v.2. Probably should be read a pa, an exclamation of surprise, or of not being able to bear something.
འ-ཕིམ	opium. LW 460.
འ-ལ-འུ-ལ	KTDN 118.5.
འ-མེ-ཉིད	Or, 'a mo nyid. Said to be Bon equiv. to stong pa nyid, although it doesn't seem to ever occur in Bon texts (although this could be disproven). 348 103.4.

འབམ	nad rigs shig yin zhing, de'i nad rtags ni rkang ba na zhing lus stod smad res mos su na, so rnyil skrangs shing khrag 'dzag, rkang pa skrangs zhing dmar thig nag thig 'byung. Dag-yig. While the feed are sick, the upper & lower parts of the body are sick by turns. The gums swell up and bleed. The feet swell up and red & dark spots appear. SRZT 111. Text 3, 47, 80. See also lce 'bam, thig nag 'bam & rkang 'bam. Lag-len 256.

འབྲ-གོ	A kind of fruit? See Yisun. JD 88. = ma nu rta rkang. YTTM 291.20. = ma nu rta skam, ha re Nu ka, kSis khar. DG 251.6. See Clifford, list, under ha ri Nu ka.
འབྲད	gris 'brad, scraping smooth with a knife. Jackson.
འབྲག	mar snod ko sgro. Btsan-lha.
འབྲམ-ཟེ	zas kyi dum bu hral hrul. Btsan-lha.
འབྲན	ma ldad par blo blag tshor re 'di la 'bran kyang myi mchi' gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 296.6.
འབྲང	bod la 'brang tsam na ni bod la yong ba na. Dpe-chos 508. Btsan-lha 542.
འབྲང-རྒྱས	A ritual object that is a 'mountain' of rtsam pa with lots of butter flecks & with a sheep or goat carcass leaning against it. It has a stupa-like structure. One is present at Ladakhi marriage ceremonies. Brauen, Ladakhi Marriage Ritual 111. a kind of sacrificial cake. Karmay, Treasury. TS7 II 805. See Slob-dpon Bsod-nams-rtse-mo, Writings on the Hevajra & Cakrasamvara 360.3 (i.e., Sa-skya Bka'-'bum version p. 112.3.4). Zhi-byed Coll. V 215.4. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 60, says it is a special cake offering for the first day of the New Year, made in each house; it had a special song called sbrang rgyas kyi glu. This is one of those items used in Tibetan rituals for which Sa-skya PaNDita couldn't find any Indian authority.

འབྲོང-ཁྲག-བདུན-པ	a medicinal preparation. BP 152.3.
འབྲོང-རྩེ-ཨར-བརྒྱད	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 82. Lag-len 58.2. TMC 10 (10).
འབྲོང-གི-རྔ-ཙེབ	This refers to nomad tradition when someone arrives at the site of butchering before the tail has been cut off they must be given one half of the animal's meat. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 43.
འབྲོངས-པ	O.T. = nye bar bsten pa. Skt. upalaDita. Blan 294.1 q.v. Btsan-lha.

འབུ-ཐ	O.T. translit. of Skt. Buddha. P. tib. 849.1 ff. Spelled 'Bhu ta in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 259.1, 'Bu ta in 260.2. I notice the spelling 'Bu ta in fol. 2 of a ms. said to be personal book of Khri-srong-lde-btsan (Precious Deposits I 80). The spelling 'Bu ta also occurs in Dge-'dun-chos-'phel-gyi Gsung-rtsom (1990) I 264 (note spelling 'Bud 'da' on p. 263), in citation from 'Bri-gung Dpal-'dzin.

འཆིང-བུ	= mching bu. Kaolin. Chayet in TH&L 32. rin chen phal pa. Btsan-lha. Haarh, Yar-lun 362. R.A. Stein discusses this word, also spelled mching bu, in his article on Zhang-zhung language, at p. 236. In 12th cent., it usually refers to an inferior type of jewel (opposite of the wishgranting jewel). slob ma la dad gus yod kyang / bla ma mtshan nyid dang ma ldan na / 'ching bu la gsol ba 'debs pa dang 'dra ste / dgos 'dod kyi 'bras bu myi 'byung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 465.3. dngos grub kyi sbyor ba log pa / be dur rgya spangs nas 'ching bu len pa lta bu. Ibid. II 480.4 (also, I 440.7.).

འདོད-རྒྱལ	conceit, self-assurance; sheer imagination; Kawamura (badly) translates it as 'conceit, self-assurance.' Das says it means 'conceit, self-assurance.' In my experience it is usually used to refer to a word for which there is no etymology, because it resulted from an original act of naming, hence not meaningfully derived from any other word.

འདུ-འཕྲོ	[= 'du ba dang 'phro ba] contraction & expansion, a term often used in sAdhana works; visualized objects merge into one ('du) and one visualized object radiating out into many ('phro). Radiation & absorption of light into oneself or the visualized object. Skt. saMhAraNa and spharaNa.

འདུ-ཤེས-ལྔ	Five 'ideas' the child has in the womb. [1] shin tu gcog pa'i 'du shes. [2] nyams pa'i 'du shes. [3] mun khung gi 'du shes. [4] yid phyir dbyung ba'i 'du shes. [5] yongs su... 'du shes. Zhi-byed Coll. V 522.2.
འདུ-ཤེས-གསུམ-པ	Stein.
འདུད-རྒྱ	A gesture of respect used by monks for rin po ches, done while bowing slightly (right hand clasped on top of left, with palms together). Zangpo, Robes 41. This often means bowing very low, and at the same time raising up the eyes as far as possible, and sucking in the breath.

འཛིད	do po'i snon ma. 'dzin pa'am 'chang ba. Btsan-lha.
འཛིན-བརྩོད	Streit, Kampf.
འཛིན-ཁྲི	chu srin gyi ming gi rnam grangs. Gser Sbram 298. 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho sdug bsngal chu srin 'dzin khris gang ba las. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 69.3.
འཛིན-མ	1. chung ma. 2. sa gzhi. 3. ma ma. Blan 531.
འཛིན-སྟངས	habit-pattern, posture, habitual notion. Skt. miSTi. Thurman. It literally means 'modes of grasping' or 'modes of taking care' and may be either positive or negative. According to Jinpa, 'mode of apprehension' (although that isn't precisely it). I think it might have the sense of [philosophical or theoretic] stance.

འཛོམས-པ	(Khams) ancient variant of the name sgrung-mkhan, storyteller, whose profession is to narrate fables. He put a square cap on his head and takes a little flag fastened to an arrow with silk ribbons of five different colors in his hands. Tells stories of Gesar & recites benedictions.

འགྱེལ-བ	nyon mongs kyi rdzong 'gyel, 'to bring down the fortress of afflictive emotions.' The phrase mkhar 'gyel ('khar 'gyel) is often used in Zhi-byed Coll. in the sense of destroying the foundations for the kleshas and the poisons so that they do not arise (example, V 177.5).

འཁོལ-ཁོང	Btsan-lha.
འཁོན-འཛིན	resentment
འཁོར	yid shes 'khor gyi tshor ba: feelings that accompany the mental consciousness. dbang shes 'khor gyi tshor ba: feelings that accompany the sense consciousness. Lati Rinbochay, Death 35, 36.
འཁོར-འདས	'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa; (= 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa) saMsAra and nirvANa. In Rdzogs-chen thought, they are indistinguishable in terms of the substantiality of their respective dharmas. This basic identity is labelled 'Realm of Dharmas,' etc.
འཁོར-བ	saMsAra; saMsAra, vicious circle. Klong-chen-pa 9.11. 'to take ones turn.'
འཁོར-བཞི	The four retinues are male and female monks and male and female householders (catuparisa in PAli).
འཁོར-ཆ	Achard, L'Essence 178 n. 86, 184 n. 112.
འཁོར-གསུམ	1. rdor gong. 2. ang dar. 3. mda' gzhu. Kretsch. armour, weapons and helmet (lit.: three wheels). Sources. bya byed las gsum. Stein. 1. mda'. 2. mdung (lance). 3. gri. Wylie 151, n. 340. BA 252. man, horse, and cow. As a debate term: An exclamation uttered when an opponent in debate says something against scripture and reasoning. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 7. It is nicely explained in Sobisch, Dissert. where it means not being able to give three kinds of answers (i.e., statements ending in [1] rtags ma grub, reasoning insufficient; [2] 'dod, begging the question; [3] khyab pa ma byung, not giving full coverage). See also Dreyfus, Sound 217. When used to describe biographies: 1. klogs pa thos bsam gyi 'khor lo. 2. spong ba bsam gtan gyi 'khor lo. 3. bya ba las kyi 'khor lo. See Smith, Catalogue 212. In vinaya terminology, this refers to the 2 knees and the middle of the back, all of which should be covered by the robe when seated crosslegged (Dalai Lama XIV, Advice from Buddha Shakyamuni, p. 67, n. 29).
འཁོར-ལོ	As part of a loom, the 'spool.' See Dag-yig 325.
འཁོར-མ	Stein.
འཁོར-མིག	A part of a door. See Dag-yig 167.. Original entry: (dpyi yi) 'khor mig. DD illus. 16. Socket.
འཁོར-མོ	rgyun chad med pa. Btsan-lha.
འཁོར-པ	families dependent on the monasteries ('serfs'). Epstein, Dissertation 43.
འཁོར-ལོས-བསྒྱུར-བའི-རྒྱལ-པོ-བཞི	gser gyi 'khor los bsgyur ba / dngul gyi 'khor los bsgyur ba / zangs kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba / lcags kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba rnams so. 600 30-31.
འཁོར-ལོ-བཞི	1. mthun par gyur pa'i yul. 2. dam pa la bsten pa. 3. legs par smon pa. 4. sngon ma yang bsod nams.
འཁོར-ལོ-དྲུག	spyi bo bde chen gyi 'khor lo / mgrin pa longs spyod kyi 'khor lo / snying ga chos kyi khor lo / lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo / gsang gnas bde skyong gi 'khor lo / nor bu'i dbus kyi 'khor lo dang drug go. 600 81-82.
འཁོར-ལོ-གསུམ	Stein. klog pa thos bsam gyi 'khor lo / spong ba bsam gtan gyi 'khor lo / bya ba las kyi 'khor lo'o. 600 18.

འཁོར-གྱི-འཁྱམས	Btsan-lha.

འཁྲི-མ-ཆོད	rib ma chod. Gces 584.3. re ba ma chod. Btsan-lha.
འཁྲི-སྙམ-ས-ལེ	See gnyan.

འཁྲིས-ཁ	Stein.
འཁྲོ-ནག	See khro nag. DG 113.3.
འཁྲུ	Original entry: (tshad) 'khru. SRZT 99.
འཁྲུ-གཅོད	See mon char.
འཁྲུ-ནད	SRZT 96.
འཁྲུ-སྐྱུགས	Original entry: (byis pa) 'khru skyugs. SRZT 120.
འཁྲུ-ཡད	thabs de zab kyang gang zag chags zhen can thog ma nas 'khru yad pa la goms pa'i stobs kyis. Zhi-byed Coll. V 429.2.
འཁྲུད-མ	Btsan-lha.
འཁྲུད-པ	Stein. zol po tsho rna can lo ma 'khrud ni g.yo can rnams gzhan gyi skyon 'tshang 'bru zhes pa'o // dbus par la zog po hes 'byung ba ltar na brdzu ma zhes par 'jug go. Dpe-chos 515.
འཁྲུག-གློ-ཀུན-སེལ	a medicinal preparation. TMC 38 (82).
འཁྲུགས	'agitated.' a stage of fever disorders. Text 44.
འཁྲུགས-གློ-ཀུན-སེལ	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 33. Lag-len 25.4. BP 203.6. BP 215.2.
འཁྲུལ-འཁོར	Tummelplatz (exercise ground, playground). Kretsch. Stein. 4 172A.6. Usually means hatha-yoga-like exercises. For a Bon text on yogic postures with illustrations, 'Khrul-'khor Dpe-ris, see Everding's Bon catalog, no. JS 2738.
འཁྲུལ-པ	Error. Whatever it is that went wrong with saMsAra. Skt. saMbhrAnti, bhrAnti. wandering, confusion, perplexity, mistake. Germano, Poetic Thought 866, 939, translates 'distortion,' 'straying.'
འཁྲུལ-ཞིག	Stein.
འཁྲུལ-འཁོར-བཅུ-གཉིས	dus 'khor nas bshad pa'i 'khrul 'khor bcu gnyis ni / sgyogs kyi 'khrul 'khor / glu / gri gug / gur / lcags mda' / ral gri / me'i 'khrul 'khor / rlung gi 'khrul 'khor / shing rta'i tshad / khang bzang / khyogs kyi mtshan nyid / chu gyen du 'dren pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnams so. 600 157.
འཁྲུལ-པ-དྲུག	legs pa'i gdams ngag mi tshol bar don med tha snyad slob pa 'di yang 'khrul / ri khrod dgon pa mi 'grims par 'khor ba'i mun khang brtsigs pa 'di yang 'khrul / gcig pur don nyid mi sems par 'khor mang nang du chos byed 'khrul / bdag med bsam gtan mi bsgoms par / longs spyod 'du 'dzi byed pa 'khrul / sbyin pa chags med mi gtong bar / ser snas zas nor gsog pa 'khrul / de chos tshul bzhin mi spyod par / mi chos sems 'dzin byed pa 'khrul lo. Bka'-gdams Thor-bu 40v.5.

འོང-འགའ	O.T. = res 'ga'. Blan 296.4.
འོང-བ	Sometimes, in negative, it means something like 'it just won't do,' as in the following quote: chos spyi rnam gyi go ba la rten pas myi 'ong / don rang gi mtshan nyid rgyud la skye dgos / nyams len dal khom byas pas myi 'ong / brel ba bzhag nas rings pa byed dgos... Zhi-byed Coll. IV 37.4. In other cases, 'there is no such thing' or 'there is no such case' (examples in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 53.6 ff.).
འོང-ཁ	(Gtsang) edge of the field, hedgerow. MTTP.
འོང-ང	= 'ong ba. "to come." Kuijp (1986) 33.
འོར	bor ba. Btsan-lha. nad cig gi ming ste, chu skrangs kyi skabs thog mar 'or zer. Dag-yig. Text 36, 37, 65. Lag-len 276.4.
འོར-འགའ	res 'ga'. lan 'ga'. Btsan-lha.
འོར-བ	O.T. = bor ba. Blan 297.1. ne le la 'ol ba zer bas yul skad 'ga' zhig la 'or ba zer ba yin nam. Dpe-chos 504, q.v. Btsan-lha.
འོར-ཅིག	lan cig. Dpe-chos 509. thengs cig. bor cig. Btsan-lha.
འོར-ནད	SRZT 37. Kong-sprul/1 38: A water-swelling disease characterized by slightly more swelling than skya rbab. When the swelling pours downward on the side of the ribcage, it is 'or. Note: This distinguishes it from the tsha chu types of dmu chu where the swelling generally starts in the lower part of the body and spreads upward. See also Donden 104.
འོར-ཏེ	ma gtogs pa. Btsan-lha.
འོར-ཆེ-བ	drin che'am thugs rje che zhes pa lta bu'i yul skad do. 367 II 132.6. Btsan-lha. (obs.) meaning something like 'kindness.' Samdo A III 129r.5. or che dad pa kho na de yin. Zhi-byed Coll. II 273.3. nga la yang bya rgyu de ka las myed 'or che. Ibid. II 274.4. 'or che gzhan don byed pa'i bsam pa tsam yang skye bar dkon pa yin. Ibid. II 282.6. 'or che nyams len byas pa'i 'dri lugs yin. Ibid. II 293.3. 'or re che rjes su yi rang dungs byas na. Ibid. V 269.4. gzhan phan gyi dkyus thog ma bcad na // khrom lha mi'i 'or che mi 'byung bas. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) X 96.5.
འོར-ཆེ-མ-འདོད	snyan grags spang ba'am mi 'dod pa. Btsan-lha.
འོར-མ-ཚོགས-ཤིག	bor la chu tshags kyis btsag par gyis. Btsan-lha.
འོར-བ-མ-བཅོལ	zhing las ma bcol. Btsan-lha.
འོས-འགེབ	ji 'os sam mtshams ran pa. Btsan-lha.
འོས-པ	'respectible ones,' a type of tIrthika (mu stegs pa). O.T. = gcer bu pa (Skt. nirgrantha: 'free of all ties, of possessions'). Blan 301.1. mu stegs pa'i bye brag gcer bu pa. Btsan-lha.
འོས-མ-འདས	thabs gzhan med. Btsan-lha.
འཕག-པ	O.T. = 'jug pa. Also, cha ba. Blan 294.2. 'jug pa. Btsan-lha.
འཕགས-པ	'gro ba. bskyod pa. tshad nges can zhig las brgal ba'am lhag par du. Btsan-lha.
འཕགས-ལམ-ཡན-ལག-བརྒྱད	yang dag pa'i lta ba / yang dag pa'i rtog pa / yang dag pa'i ngag / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba / yang dag pa'i dran pa / yang dag pa'i dran pa / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'phags lam yan lag rnams so. 600 116.

འཕར-བ	1. 'Promotion,' as when a student is promoted to a higher level. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 35. 2. Name of an animal in Bon Kanjur (192-vol. version) CLXV 272a.4. འཕེའུ	O.T. = gsol ba. Blan 295.2. zas sam gsol ba. Btsan-lha.
འཕེལ-འགྲིབ	Stein.
འཕེལ-བ	Stein.
འཕེལ-བྱེད	SS 433.6.
འཕེལ-གདུང	Discussion by Laufer, Kleinere Schriften I 68-69, giving a history of the very strange European idea that Tibetans are a coprophagous people. He traces the first report of this back to the 17th cent. work by Köppen, Die lamaische Hierarchie, p. 348. One might also refer to Capt. John G. Bourke (an American), Scatalogic Rites of All Nations: A Dissertation upon the Employment of Excrementitious Remedial Agents in Religion, Therapeutics, Divination, Witchcraft, Love-Philtres, etc., in All Parts of the Globe, W.H. Lowdermilk & Co. (Washington 1891); from its many citations one may see the continuity of this particularly nasty (but amazingly persistent) 'image' of Tibetan religiosity.
འཕེལ-ཚ	a clan. Btsan-lha.
འཕེན-མེད	skyon med. Btsan-lha.
འཕེང-བ	= 'phreng ba. "garland, chain, mala." Kuijp (1986) 33.

འཕོ-འགྱུར-མེད-པ	untransformed and untransported (neither altered nor transferred to another place apart from its own).

འཕྲ-ཏིག	BA 927 translates this as 'conclusion,' but I have very big doubts, and want to translate this as 'inset dot.' It could mean 'very fine point.' Name of the Zhi-byed texts of Pa-tshab belonging to the Zhu-lan genre (the others were called 'phra gcod).

འཐེམས-པ	Zhi-byed Coll. II 153.4 (also, line 7), 165.4.
འཐེམས-པ-མི-འཕྱུག-པ	chad lhag spong ba'am / kha tshang ba dang / mnan pa. Btsan-lha.
འཐེན	With meaning of 'descended from.' Lhagyal in Karmay, New Horizons 438.
འཐེན-འཁྱེར	contention
འཐེན-པ	Stein.
འཐེང-རྐང-མ	See tshig 'theng po (BBNP 466).

འཐིབ-གནོན	gnyid 'thib bzhin pa'i skabs / glo bur du gzhan gcig gis mnan pa lta bu'i snang ba byung ba la zer. A feeling of being pressed down upon (by a ghost or spirit) in ones sleep. Gser Sbram 136 (and see Norbu Chophel, Folk Culture of Tibet, p. 28).

འཚག	'dzom pa dang gsog pa dang 'dzem pa dang gnyer ba dang rgyas pa sogs. mdangs bzang ba'am nyams rgyas pa'am yan lag dang nying lag rgyas pa sogs. Btsan-lha.
འཚལ	O.T. = shes pa. = mchog pa. = 'dod pa. = zhen. Blan 303.4, 516.5. Kuijp in JAOS 111, p. 100. = shes pa, = chog pa, = 'dod pa, = dgos. BBNP 473. shes pa. 'dod pa. za ba. dgos pa. Gser Sbram 92.

འཚེམ-ཐང	a type of slit-cloth, with the cloth sewn together with embroidery stitches, thang ka. Most were products of Chinese seamsters. See the art history by Dkon-mchog-bstan-'dzin, Bzo-gnas 134-5. See under tshem drub ma.

IV 121.4. tshe 'dir zad par byed pa yin te / 'tshengs pa yin gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 310.7. bsssgrub pa nyams su blangs pa'i mi la ma 'tshengs pa mi 'ong. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 53.7.

འཚོ-བ-གསུམ	The 'three preservers.' Generally when they are exhausted, medical treatment is ineffectivee and death is inevitable. 1) lifespan. 2) merit from good actions. 3) karma. Das.

འུ-བུ	we; me, myself, we. Samdo A III 193v.1. nged cag. nga tsho. Btsan-lha.
འུ-ཅག	There are many regional variant forms of this pronoun-- 'u bu cag, rang cag, nged cag, 'o skol, yu gu cag, 'am cag, 'a cag, 'u rang, etc.-- all meaning 'we.' BBNP 473. nged cag. Btsan-lha.
འུ-ཅས	'u cag. Gces 583.2.
འུ-ཅིས	'u cag gam bdag cag. Btsan-lha.
འུ-ལག	see rkang 'gro. See Kolmaz, Ch'ing shi kao 84, n. 9. Tsering Shakya, Dragon 134, says Chinese abolished it, but then made use of it themselves to ease their transportation problems.
འུ-ནི	'di ni. nga ni. Btsan-lha.
འུ-རང	= rang cag. "we." Kuijp (1986) 33. BBNP 473. nga rang. Btsan-lha.
འུ-ཤ	'bras btsos pa'i khu ba. Btsan-lha.
འུ-སུ	zar ma. The black variety is called shu te. Btsan-lha. = me tog brgya pa, yan lag brgya pa, ta tsha. JD 186. a tree. SS 422.5. KP1 192.1. KP3 314.6. KP4 507.4. coriander. LW 514, Das. Slovar' 211, 397, 399, = Coriandrum sativum L., Linum baicalense Jus., or L. ustitassimum L. JD 186: The leaves, stems & flowers are similar to go snyod. The fruit is like a closed charmbox (ga'u). The flowers range in color from light yellow to grey. Acc. to Dag-yig, it is a cultivated herb. Fundamentals 16.2 (item 17). coriander. Clifford, list.

Precious Deposits V 162 ff. has illus. and says that with the slingshot it was possible to cast stones over one hundred meters away. [2] This same spelling may also be used to represent Mongolian 'ordo,' meaning a settled or semi-settled area, like a 'village' (example in Karma-pakshi's bio. by Zhwa-dmar II).

ཨ-བྱག	a flower. = lug mig ser po, me tog gur gum. KP1 52.2. KP3 262.4. KP4 401.3. SS 459.3. TM IV 64. = da da gi. YTTM 292.10.

ཨ-དཀར	[1] 'white A' as a meditation object, with meaning of 'unproduced' or 'unarticulated.' Samdo A II 320v.5. Note the A dkar theg-pa among the Nine Vehicles of Bon, and the practice of using the letter 'A' as a meditational focus in Shingon Buddhist practice. [2] A medicinal; see dkar gong.
ཨ-དྲུང	messengers. TS7 I 191.

ཨ-གར	See a ga ru, of which it is simply a shortened form.

ཨ-ཧོ	rmad du byung ba. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-ཇ	(Dbus, Gtsang) Mrs. the lady. MTTP.
ཨ-ཀམ	firewood, fuel; firewood, fuel. Das.
ཨ-ཀྲད	soles (of boots). Huber, Pure Crystal 146.

ཨ-ལྕེ	Lady (title of female member of nobility). Sources. sring mo dang ming po. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-ལྕི	mes mo'am pha'i ma. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-ལྡོག	ldag pa. "to lick (clean)." Kuijp (1986) 33.
ཨ-ལེ	interjection of surprise. Beyer, CT Lang. 147.
ཨ-ལི	dngos po'i gshis la ri mo gzugs kyi a li med pas chos nyid smra brjod dang bral bar blo thag chod. Zhi-byed Coll. V 497.4.
ཨ-ལོང	rna rgyan a long. A jewellery item illus. in Yisun. Acc. to Yisun, 'roundness of a grip or handle.' Samdo A IV 171v.2. a long gi rnal 'byor la bslab pa ni / a long 'byed 'dzums kyi rtsa grul la. Zhi-byed Coll. III 80.4.
ཨ-ལུ	byis pa. Yisun. Occurrences in the Zhi-byed Coll. preclude the meaning 'child,' however. 'a mas bus pa brid pa la / a lu byin pa de la 'chags / phyis 'a ma mthong ba'i tshe na a lu bor nas spang du rgyug. In Zhi-byed Coll. (lost ref.). a lu ngo shes byis pa de dus brid du myed. Zhi-byed Coll. I 298.7. See dwa ba.
ཨ-ལུགས	goms gshis sam srol lugs. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-ལུང	Nomads 265.
ཨ-མཆོད	performers of rituals in private houses. TS7 I 191. Hermanns, in his 1951 article in Journal of the Anthropolotical Society of Bombay, wrote that the a mchod was a follower of the oldest Tibetan creed. Acc. to Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 41, it is a monastic office.
ཨ-མི	grandfather. See a myes. CFMS 106, where it is spelled a li.
ཨ-མོང	(Gtsang) = rnga mong. camel. MTTP.
ཨ-མྲ	Chinese, tshi zi. See BBNP 484. a particular tree & its fruit. Metaphorical usage in Dgongs-gcig (1990) 143.1. Also see Zhi-byed Coll. V 202.1 (spelled a smras).
ཨ-མྱེས	mes po. Btsan-lha. grandfather, or man old enough to be your grandfather. T&BS I 352.
ཨ-ན	'o na. Gces 583.1. Btsan-lha. interjection of grief. Beyer, CT Lang. 147.
ཨ-ནེ	a ne'i srang la sgo phubs bag re yod. Zhi-byed Coll. V 333.5.
ཨ-ནུ	O.T. Skt. = chung ngu. = phra mo. Blan 307.3.
ཨ-པ	interj. Samdo A IV 255r.6. See 'a pa. 367 I 235.
ཨ-ཕ	western Tibetan equiv. to sku ngo, 'noble.' Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 38.
ཨ-ཕྱག	See ldum bu a phyag.
ཨ-ཕྱི	pha dang ma'i a ma. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-པོ	= bdag, = nga rang. BBNP 473. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-ར	interjection of physical pain. Beyer, CT Lang. 147. beard.
ཨ-རཎཌ	See dan rog.
ཨ-རག	date-wine. LW 483.
ཨ-རྫོ	= a rdza bo. (Amdo) good, good one. T&BS I 356.
ཨ-རེ	kye ma re. Gces 587.5. Compare e re. Immediately before verbs, it interjects a note of astonishment, hope, dearness or extreme regret. Samdo A III 195r.2. en tsam mam yud tsam. ya mtshan pa kye ma re. Btsan-lha. rang la bzhag nas gzhan du 'tshol ba a re 'khrul. Zhi-byed Coll. I 317.3.
ཨ-རིལ	testicles. Dag Yig.
ཨ-རུ	An item made of horn used in feeding young sheep and goats. Illus. in Yisun. See ltum bu a ru. See ldum bu re ral.
ཨ-སྒ	the floor. MTTP.
ཨ-ཤ	See tha ram.
ཨ-ཤད	a thung shad kyi dbyibs can. yi ge'i tshig shad ring po. The vertical stroke used in Devanagari to make an 'a' long. It looks like the Tibetan punctuation mark shad, hence the name.
ཨ-ཤེ	oh weh. (Ausruf der Trauer). Kaschewsky2. A type of bka' btags. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 10.
ཨ-ཤུ	See kham bu.
ཨ-ཤྭདཐ	1. khyab 'jug. 2. mya ngan med pa'i shing. Blan 532. A shwad tha / rgya gar rdo rje gdan gyi byang chub ljon shing. Gser Sbram 307.
ཨ-སྐྱ	mi skya. Gces 583.5. mi nag skya bo. BBNP 479. a bo dang skya bo zhes pa'i bsdus tshig. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-སྔོན	(Amdo,Khams) the sky. MTTP.
ཨ-སྲས	novelty seekers. See Dreyfus in JIABS 21 (1998) 263. Probably should be rather: a gsar.
ཨ-སུ	Interjection of sexual satisfaction. Beyer, CT Lang. 147.
ཨ-ཐ	See a pa'i sha.
ཨ-ཐས	See a 'thas.
ཨ-ཐོ	byis pas a tho [me tog] 'thu ba ltar. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum IV 476.2.
ཨ-ཐུན	bon sku gtso mchog. Btsan-lha.
ཨ-ཐུང	BA 456. The 'short a.' Evans-Wentz misinterpreted it as half of the Tibetan letter 'a', when it is actually the Skt. ligature that makes the letter 'a' long (although it is possible this is based on the understanding of his informant). See a shad.
ཨ-ཏི	List: 1. a ti. 2. spyi ti. 3. yang ti. 4. thod rgal. 91 I 578.2.
ཨ-ཏྲི	208 I 310.1.
ཨ-ཙ	interjection of pity. Beyer, CT Lang. 147.
ཨ-ཝ	SS 467.4.
ཨ-ཝི	an interjection? Samdo A V 50v.3.
ཨ-ཡ	a beauty. Sources. Opposition. Kaschewsky2. See zwa. See forthcoming study by Charles Ramble.
ཨ-ལ-ལ	interjection of delight. Beyer, CT Lang. 147. an exclamation of amazement or general satisfaction. Tucci, Religions 234.
ཨ-ལ-ཁ-སུ	See mdzo mo shing.
ཨ-རཀ-ཏ	See dong ga.
ཨ-ཀ-མ	lci ba ser kha ma. Dagyab. dried cow manure for fuel.
ཨ-ཀ-རུ	= lci ba med. = a gar, a ga ru. JD 111. a tree. SS 415.2. KP3 329.5. KP4 538.5. Clifford, list. = kanti da ya kaM, mdzes sbyin, gu ru, lci ba, shing sha pa, dri nyal, nus ldan, baM shi ka, rgyud ldan, rA dzarha, rgyal po la 'os, khri ma dza, srin skyes, nri pa nrI ya, mi bdag dga' byed, snying sel, lo ha, dzo ka kaM, ka pi tA na, chu 'thung snod ldan, ka pi lA, ser skya, bhas ma gar bha, thal ba'i snying po, rA dza hi, rgyal po mnyes byed, lo ha kri ma dza, dmar po srin skyes, gandha kASTaM, dri'i shing, ka kA sya, bya rog gdong, si ta tsan da naM, tsan dan ser po, kA le ya, dus skyes, kA li, dus ldan, ba na tsan da naM, nags tsan dan, shing nag, war nna daM, mdog sbyin.
ཨ-ཀའི-ཕུང-པོ	Evidently means a pile of faeces. Zhi-byed Coll. II 195.4; V 351.7 ff. dper na / a ka'i phung po myi gtsang bar 'dug pa bzhin no. Zhi-byed Coll. V 353.2. de'i snying a ka'i phung po yin te / skyug bro ba'i gnas su song ba'i ming ngo. Zhi-byed Coll. V 254.7.

ཨ-ན-ལེ	a person put the SitAtapatrA Mantra a na le on the neck of a goat. Then a wolf ate it together with the mantra. This is a parable for how the teacher and student are both brought to ruin if the student is bad. BBNP 479.

ཨན-ཁྲིའུ	glegs bam gyi gzhi'am stegs bu. Btsan-lha.
ཨན-སྟོང	DD illus. 12.
ཨན-ཙམ	cung zad tsam. Btsan-lha.
ཨནདྷ-མུ-ཤ	a kind of animal illustrated among the ritual substances in the Fifth Dalai Lama's Secret visions (St. Petersburg version, made available on a compact disk in digital form). It looks rather like an armadillo, anteater (or even possibly a tortoise). Although I couldn't locate the complete term in Monier-Williams, it probably means 'egg' or 'musk bag' (aNDa) 'mouse' or 'rat' (muSa). Hence perhaps 'muskrat.'
ཨང	A post-verb particle that conveys a sense of urging or encouraging, or one that expresses doubt.. btang gi ang, wird auf jeden Fall senden. auf jeden Fall. Kaschewsky 86.
ཨང-ག	See under dal 'byor gyi ang ga.
ཨང-ཀ	grangs yig gam go rim. Btsan-lha.
ཨང-རག	lioncloth. = ang rta. = 'og rta. (not used by traditional Tibetans, who use a short skirt called smad g.yogs; T. J. Norbu). Dag Yig. dor ma yu thung ngam smad gos shig. Btsan-lha.
ཨར	a clan. Btsan-lha.
ཨར-བཙུན	chang btsun te rab byung chang 'thung mkhan la byed snyam. Dpe-chos 512. Btsan-lha.
ཨར-དམར	See a gar dmar po. Clifford, list.
ཨར-གཏད	nam mkha' ar gtad, integration into space. Norbu, Cycle. N. of a ritual. Karmay, Arrow 362. Achard, L'Essence 65 (nam mkha' ar gtad), 242, 252 (rgya mtsho ar gtad).
ཨར-ཀ	See bod lcam.
ཨར-ཁུང	a sbra'i sdod khung. Marmot's burrow. Nomads 254.
ཨར-ལས	construction. Gateway 5.
ཨར-ནག	Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). Sanskrit, agaru. 'black aloewood.' An abbreviated form of a gar nag po (black a gar). DG 227.6: The leaves & flowers are the shape of re lcag. The flowers are yellow. Since the bark is suitable for making paper it is in the family of 'paper trees' (shog shing). With aging or bruising, the roots and trunk are dark black, but when young they are white colored and foul smelling. Since it is of the family of 'paper trees,' it is necessary to extract the poison before using it in medicine. See a ka ru. = a gar nag po. See ri skyes ar nag.
ཨར-པ	ar pa zer ba ni 'ga' zhig tu tshong dpon zhes 'byung bas tshong pa'i ming ngam / yang na mkhar las sam sa las byas pa la bod pas ar po rgyab pa zer bas na sa las pa zer ba yin snyam. Dpe-chos 506. jag pa. chung ngu. tshong pa. sa las pa. Btsan-lha.

བག-ལེ-བ	purportedly a borrowing from Prakrit form similar to Bengali bAklA, 'bark.' Pelliot, Notes on Marco Polo 465 (it might mean 'cotton').
བག-ཕྱེ-ཆུ-བཙོས	meat pieces cooked with kneaded flour shaped like ears in hot water. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 56.
བག-ལ-ཉལ	dormancies; quiescent. dormancies. Thondup, BM 241, 419. Acc. to Khangkar, Yellow Annals, 59 & 75, despite their differences in meaning in Tibetan, this word and phra rgyas, q.v., both stand in Tibetan for single Chinese or Sanskrit terms. Both refer to klezas in their latent 'unconscious' form. The seed metaphor is used because they are like underground potentials for the eruptions of fullblown klezas.
བག-ལ-ཞར	bag la nyal. Gces 585.5.
བག-ལ-གཞའ-བ	lkog tu gyur pa. Btsan-lha.
བགས	 See under bags (?).|O.T. = rim gyi. Blan 299.4. 
བགས-ཀྱིས	445 III 25.5, 46.4. ga le. Gces 583.3. = rim gyis. BBNP 473. rim gyis. dal bus byas. Btsan-lha.
བཻ-དཱུརྱ	The identity of this gemstone in different periods is problematic, but the Skt. word vaidUrya is probably the source, via Greek & Latin, of the English word beryl (see the entry in Hobson Jobson). Beryl is a class of stones that includes emerald and aquamarine etc. The Skt. word is a 'strengthened' derivative of the place-name VidUra, the mountain that was the main source of lapis lazuli (called Lajwurd [lAzaward in Arabic], source of words azure and lazuli, in Yule-Cordier, Marco Polo I 162). However, the colors blue [i.e., green], white and yellow which are used in titles of works by Sde-srid Sangs-rgyas-rgya-mtsho suggest rather the beryl (or perhaps still other stones). rin po che be dur rgya ni g.yu' bzang po la zer. Zhi-byed Coll. I 440.7. The blue beryl is identical to aquamarine. See the arguments in an article by Marianne Winder. = shin tu dangs pa. JD 32. LW 465. DG 81.4.
བཻ-ར-ཊ	See mu men.
བཻ-རཱ-ཛ	See g.yu. DG 79.6.
བཻ-ཌཱུར-ཆུར-བསྒྱུར	See stabs seng.
བཻ-དཱུརྱ-འདྲ	Mdo 240.
བཻ-དེ-ཧི	See pi pi ling.
བཀ-ཤི	from Mongolian, = btsun pa. Blan 311.3. From Uighur. Beyer, CT Lang. 141. See Kuijp's article on the subject.

Bka'-ma Rgyas-pa XVII 432.1. phung po'i bdud / nyon mongs pa'i bdud / 'chi bdag gi bdud / lha'i bu'i bdud rnams so. 600 37. Also mentioned in the Bsam gtan chapter of Sgam-po-pa's Thar rgyan. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) XI 474-475 (here the klezamAra is primary; if done away with, the other 3 are done for).

བྷ	a kind of tree. Zhi-byed Coll. I 426.2 (also, 219.6). A porcelain mark found on cups produced in Grwa-nang in the 11th century. One or two pieces are said to survive. The meaning of the mark is unknown. Rinchen Sandhutsang, 'Tibetan Porcelain,' Tibet Soc. Newsletter no. 12 (Fall 1984).
བྷ-བྷ	father. Borrowing from Urdu. Francke, Antiquities II 146.
བྷ-ལིང	A kind of ritual object associated with the masculine side. Blondeau in Karmay, New Horizons 258.
བྷ-ཏྲ	a kind of tree, which ought to be found in Caritra, according to Sa-paN in his Sdom Gsum. Discussed in Zangpo, Sacred Ground 31.

བྷེ-ཏ	a plant that produces leaves & flowers & fruits simultaneously. Samdo A IV 156r.6, 257r.2.
བྷེམ	sgom. Gces 588.2. Used in this sense in the polemic by 'Bri-gung Dpal-'dzin (which would seem to place its usage in around the year 1400 very roughly). It occurs, with spelling bhai, in the text translated as Liberation through Seeing with Naked Awareness (in the Kar-gling Zhi-khro), where it is simply translated without comment.

བཀའ	Dung-dkar 151.
བཀའ-འབུམ	Explained as an earlier way of saying what is now called gsung 'bum. Dung-dkar 178.
བཀའ-འགག	= bka' shag 'gag pa. Ushers of the Kashag; 7th rank; 3 laymen. Each served one of the bka' blon. Petech.
བཀའ-འགྱངས	(zhe sa) dus thog tu sgrub dgos pa'i don chen po zhig gnas skabs dus tshod nges can zhig gi ring phyir 'gyangs byed pa. Dung-dkar 153.
བཀའ-བཅད	hon. for bcad mtshams.
བཀའ-བློ	Btsan-lha.
བཀའ-བློན	= bka'i gung blon. Minister, ordinary member of the Kashag; 3rd rank; 4 laymen (1728-1751, 1804-1878) OR 3 lay + one monk (1751-1804, 1878-1959). Petech. Gung blon seems to be an O.T. title that lies behind Bka' blon. Dung-dkar 175-176.
བཀའ-བོ	bka' ni, bka' de ni. Nomads 232.
བཀའ-བརྒྱད	Nomads 255-7.
བཀའ-བརྩན	Btsan-lha.

བཀའ-བསྲུངས	Dung-dkar 182.
བཀའ-བཏགས	bka' khrims bsgrags pa. Btsan-lha. rgyal khrims sogs kyi bka' shog lta bu. Utpal 21.4. Dung-dkar 161.
བཀའ-བཞི	Foreign policy of Srong-btsan-sgam-po. Dung-dkar 180.
བཀའ-ཆད	punishment; disfavor, punishment. Karmay, Treasury.
བཀའ-དོག	yongs grags ma byas par gsang ba dam po yod pa'am mi nyung shas la ma gtogs gnang mi chog pa'i dbang dang khrid kyi rigs. Dung-dkar 163.
བཀའ-དྲིན	Mistaken Tibetan tr. for Skt. "pra tya ya," which should rather be gzhan gyis 'dren pa, OR rkyen. Blan 311.6. bka' drin ni bla dpon sogs kyi phan btags pa. Utpal 21.3.
བཀའ-དྲུང	= bka' shag drung yig. Head of secretariat office of the Kashag. Divided into 1) che ba; 6th rank; 2 laymen. 2) chung ba; 7th rank; 3 laymen. Petech. Dung-dkar 163.
བཀའ-གསུམ	See bka' rnam pa gsum. Dung-dkar 182.
བཀའ-གཏན	gong rim srid gzhung gis sprad pa'i bka' shog dang gtan tshigs yig rigs. Dung-dkar 160.
བཀའ-གཙིགས	edict. Dung-dkar 178-179.
བཀའ-ཁོལ	Btsan-lha. Ka khol ma?
བཀའ-ཁོན	Btsan-lha.
བཀའ-ཁྲ	Dung-dkar 151. Also explains the phrases bka' khra'i rgyab la chod yig gis 'doms dgos, and, bka' khra'i bags smyug bzhi zur rim 'gros.
བཀའ-ཁྲིམས	= bka'i khrims yig. legal decree, decree of a legal code. Sources.
བཀའ-ཁྱབ	Verordnung, Erlass. Kaschewsky2.
བཀའ-ལུང	rim pa gong ma nas sprad pa'i yig cha dang bka' shog sogs / sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi lung bstan la yang bka' lung zer. Dung-dkar 181.
བཀའ-མཆིད	O.T. = yang dag pa'i gtam. OR 'bel gtam. Blan 291.3. gleng mo. yi ge, springs yig. Btsan-lha.
བཀའ-མགྲོན	= bka' shag mgron gnyer. Intermediate official entrusted with forwarding petitions from lower officials, transmitting the reply or orders, etc.; 6th rank; three laymen. Petech. Dung-dkar 153, explains it as a contraction of bka' shag and mgron gnyer.
བཀའ-ཤག	= bka' blon shag lhan rgyas. Council of ministers, the office rooms pertaining to it. Petech. Dung-dkar 176-178, 181.
བཀའ-ཤོད	= bka' shag shod drung. Member of a subordinate secretarial section of the Kashag concerned mainly with ecclesiastical affairs. 2 laymen responsible for documents such as travelling passes (lam yig). One was allotted to the monk Kalon as private secretary. Headed by bka' shod dge rgan, an office abolished by Dalai Lama XIII. Petech.
བཀའ-ཤོག	rim pa gong mas gsham 'og la btang ba'i bka' yig. Dung-dkar 182.
བཀའ-ཐུབ	dka' spyad snying rus. Dung-dkar 163.
བཀའ-ཚབ	= bka' blon las tshab. Deputy Kalon, officiating during absence of a Kalon. Petech.
བཀའ-དྲང-གསུང-དག	Dpa'-ris.
བཀའ-བློ-མི-བདེ-བ	Btsan-lha. nyes pa gleng du mi 'jug pa'am gleng mi bde ba. Dung-dkar 175.
བཀའ-བློ-བདེ-བ	Btsan-lha. gdams ngag sogs nyan pa'i don no. Utpal 21.4.
བཀའ-འཁོར-ལོ-རིམ-པ-གསུམ	Dung-dkar 152.
བཀའ-མཆིད-རྣམ-པར-གཏན-ལ-དབབ-པ	bgro gleng ngam rtsod pa byed pa la go. Dung-dkar 160.
བཀའ-ནན-ཕེབས-གཞི-ཆེད-བཟོས-བྱུང-འདུག-ན	gong rim nas skyon brjod nan po byed dgos pa'i gnad don ched mngags bzos pa. Dung-dkar 172.
བཀའ-བཟང-སྤྱི-སྨིན	chog mchan thob pa'i bka' yig bzang po spyi bo'i steng du smin pa zhes pa'i sdud tshig. Dung-dkar 180.
བཀའ-ཁོན-གྱི-གཅུགས	Dung-dkar 151.
བཀའ-ལ-བཏགས	Dung-dkar 181.
བཀའ-ལ-ཐོགས	Dung-dkar 181.
བཀའ-ལ-སྒྲ-ཇི-བཞིན-པས-ཁྱབ	Dung-dkar 181.
བཀའ-ལ-དོན-ནི-དགུ-ཡིས-བསྟན	Dung-dkar 181.
བཀའ-རྨེད-པ	Btsan-lha.
བཀའ-བློན-བཞི	The four minister's government was set up in 1721. Dung-dkar 176.
བཀའ-བློན-སྲམ	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 293.
བཀའ-བློན-ནང-མ	= nang blon. household official. Sources. Interior minister.
བཀའ-བློན-ལས-འཕར	'Joint Kalon' = distinguished senior officials promoted to 3rd rank & taking part in Kashag meetings as a supernumerary member. Petech
བཀའ-བློན-ལྡིང-བཅུ-དཔོན	bka' blon / lding dpon / bcu dpon gsum mo. Dung-dkar 176.
བཀའ-རྒྱ-མ	dpar skrun byed mi chog pa'i gsang sngags kyi chos dpe'i rigs rtsom pa pos dam bsgrags yod pa. Dung-dkar 157.
བཀའ-རྒྱ-གནང-རྟེན	Dung-dkar 157.

བཀའ-དྲིས-སྔོན-པོར-ཞུ-ལན-ལྗང-གུ	Dpa'-ris.
བཀའ-དྲིན-བསྐྱང-ལེན	Dank für eine Gnade [Zurückerstattung einer erwiesenen Gnade]. Kretsch. Dung-dkar 163.
བཀའ-དྲིན-གསོལ-འདེབས	Dung-dkar 163.
བཀའ-དྲིན-གསུམ-ལྡན	bka' drin gsum ldan zhes pa'i bka' drin gsum ni / dbang bskur ba / rgyud bshad pa / man ngag gnang ba'i bka' drin no. 600 22. Dung-dkar 163 gives both sUtric & tantric lists.
བཀའ-དྲིན-བསམ-ཤེས	bka' drin ma brjed par sems la 'jog pa dang / shes rtogs byed pa / bka' drin ha go ba. Dung-dkar 163.
བཀའ-དྲིན-གྱིས-དགབ-པ	bka' drin gyis yongs su khebs pa'am yongs su khyab pa zhes pa'i don. Dung-dkar 163.
བཀའ-བསྡུ-བ	Dung-dkar 169-170.
བཀའ-རྟགས-ཀྱི-ཕྱག-རྒྱ	Dung-dkar 161.
བཀའ-བཙན-ཁྲིམས-ལོག	Dpa'-ris.
བཀའ-ཉེས-ཡན-པོར-མ-སོང-བ	Dung-dkar 160.
བཀའ-འགྱུར-གྱི-ལུང	Dung-dkar 154-156.
བཀའི-སྣ-བོ	bka' blon gyi ming gzhan / bka' don ltar gyi las ka sgrub mkhan sne khrid pa'am 'go khrid mkhan yin pa'i don. Dung-dkar 182.
བཀའི-འཕྲིན-བློན	btsan po'i bka' brgyud bsgrags byed mkhan gyi blon po'i go gnas kyi ming. Dung-dkar 183.
བཀའི-ཆུ-བོ-ཆེན-པོ-བཞི-འདུས-པ	Dung-dkar 182.
བཀའི-ཕྱག-རྒྱ-དྲུག	Six things that signified the power of the Emperor: power of his orders—casket (sgrom bu) where his edicts were stored, power of his marketplace (khrom)—flag (ru dar), power of his territory—fort (sku mkhar), power of his religion—temple (lha khang), power of his heroism—tiger skin cape (stag pags kyi slog pa), power of his cleverness—secretariat (yig tshang). Dung-dkar 182. His unnamed source is Lde'u 270: phyag rgya drug la / bka' rtags kyi phyag rgya sgrom bu / khrims rtags kyi phyag rgya ru mtshon / yul rtags kyi phyag rgya sku mkhar / chos rtags kyi phyag rgya lha khang / dpa' rtags kyi phyag rgya stag gzig / mdzangs rtags kyi phyag rgya yig tshang dang drug go.
བཀའི-དགུང-བློན-གཉིས	Dung-dkar 182.
བཀའས-རྨས	bka' gnang ba'am gros bsdur gyi gzhi 'don pa gnang ba gnyis kar go chog. Dung-dkar 182.
བཀབ	gos bkab ni gos kyis g.yogs pa. Utpal 21.2.
བཀད	Btsan-lha. mgo bkad ni las kyi mgo 'dzugs pa. Utpal 23.4. thags kyi bkad ni de'i mgo 'dzugs pa. Utpal 23.4.

བཀད-ས	O.T. = 'dug sa. = mdun khang. Blan 299.1. Btsan-lha. bkad sar ni g.yos khang ste za ma skyo khang. Utpal 21.2. bkad sa ni zas kyi g.yos khang ngam zas za ba'i khang ba zhes dbyangs can dga' blos gsungs pa ste sbyin pa'i bkad sa zhes pa lta bu. Gser Sbram 223. Dung-dkar 151.

བཀག-གླུ	a special song one must sing in order to persuade the beer servers to stop giving one beer. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 60.

བཀྲ-ཤིས-རྫས-བརྒྱད	me long / gi wam / zho / dur ba / bil ba / dung dkar / li khri / yungs kar rnams so. 600 105. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs 58n.
བཀྲ-ཤིས-སྒོ-མང	lit., auspicious many-doored. 1. a type of stupa with many apertures, each occupied by a buddha- or bodhisattva-image. 2. a temple shaped externally like such a stupa. MTTP.
བཀྲ-ཤིས-ཐེམ-པ-ཡར-སྐྱོད	Dpa'-ris.

བླ	O.T. = rung. = bzod. = chog. = steng. Blan 304.5, 516.6. = rung, = chog, = bzod. BBNP 476. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 201. TS6 132. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 33. Btsan-lha. 192-vol. Bon Kanjur CXX 299: brla yid sems gsum las med / brla yid sems la dbyig pa dang kha dog ma nges / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin / dper na sems rta 'dra / yid mi 'dra / brla de gnyis kyis gsos 'dra / yid mi dang sems rta kha lo bsgyur / brla de zas 'dra ste med na 'chi dang 'tsho dang 'gro / sngon gyis bsod nams kyis rtsa dbugs yang dog gis sems che chung 'dra / snying dang srog rtsa'i nang na gnas nas... TR XV no. 2-3, p. 14b.

བླ-ཁབ-ཅན	steng g.yogs sam thog g.yogs yod pa'i khang pa. Btsan-lha.
བླ-གཉེར-སྦྲེལ-མ	those holding the joint office of bla ma and gnyer pa (monastic officials with secular responsibilities). Sources.
བླ-མར-བྱ-བ	mthon po'i gnas su 'jog pa. Btsan-lha.
བླ-སྐྱལ-བ	O.T. = mi zad pa. Blan 285.1.
བླའི-གྲྭ	las byed pa'i grwa'am tshogs sa. Btsan-lha.
བླའོ	chog gam mchog. Btsan-lha.

བླབ-རི	= bla re. "canopy." Kuijp (1986) 33.
བླག	'bad pa cher mi dgos pa. Btsan-lha.
བླག-ཅོར	skad chen po 'don pa. Btsan-lha.
བླགས	See rna blags. Blang 286.6. Sinitic vocabulary for klog, 'to read.' Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 161-2. blags che ltar yong ba ni brlag tshabs chen po yong ba. Dpe-chos 511. See de Jong, Tibetan blag-pa and blags-pa. BSOAS 36 (1972) 309-312. Michael Hahn has written an article on this word (Blags und Verwantes [Miscellanea Etymologica Tibetica VI]. IN: H. Eimer, Studia Tibetica et Mongolica [Festschrift M. Taube] Indica et Tibetica Verlag [Swisttal-Odendorf 1999] 123-126.)
བླན	tshur 'gug pa dang / nang du phyogs pa dang / kha drangs pa sogs. Btsan-lha.
བླན-པ	brda rnying ste / 'gugs pa dang / phyogs pa / drangs pa / bskyar ba / 'debs pa / sgyur ba bcas don du ma la 'jug ste / 'dir lan 'debs pa'i don. Gser Sbram 184.

བློ-གཏད	trust, reliance. Translated as 'reference point[s]' in Dilgo Khyentse, Hundred Verses of Advice of Padampa Sangye 61.
བློ-ལྡོག	reverse tendencies.
བློ-མཐུན	discussed in Havnevik, Dissertation 183.
བློ-རྡེག	A common word in titles of Bon books, Geshe Dagkar says it means something like 'elevating the thoughts' (something that really impresses you). Also spelled glo rdeg, glo brdeg, etc. blos gsal 'debs byed pa. Btsan-lha.

བླུན-པ	Sinitic vocab. for byis pa. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163.
བོ	Evidently, in nomad dialect, the syllable "bo" may be used in the meaning of LT "ni." See dgung sngon po & bka' bo in Nomads.
བོ-བ	(regionalism) rang bzhin gyis zag pa'am lhung ba. to fall or leak naturally. Yisun. bla ma la gus pa'i blo shor na bo ba'i dri ma yin pas. Zhi-byed Coll. I 137.6.
བོ-དེ	de bzhin du bo des ma nu'i don byed pa yang ngo. Zhi-byed Coll. I 440.6-7.
བོ-ལ	bo la dang ka ko la mnyam par sbyor ba. Gold Ms. II 263r.3. Here it seems to mean pho mtshan (although it ought to mean mo mtshan?). Samdo A III 285v.1, 291r.5.
བོ-མོ	= bu mo. "girl." Kuijp (1986) 33.
བོ-ཤིང	sp? KP3 306.5.
བོ-ཐོ	See under bong ba (BBNP 480).
བོ-ཟགས	I believe this is a compound of bo and zag[s], leaked and dripped, but with a more specific or metaphorical application (zags pa, meaning leakage, could mean leaking secrets...). dka' thub kyi bo zags bsrungs. Zhi-byed Coll. III 26.3. bo zags ltem log tu myi gtang ngo. Ibid. IV 137.7. bo zags ltems log bsrung. Ibid. IV 158.1. dum bur song ba tsam gyis bo zags su song ba yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 183.6. gdams ngag gi khyer so bo zags ldem log gi snad (gnad) 'dri myi shes. Zhi-byed Coll. V 232.1. dang po blo sbyong gi dus su bo zags ltem log bzhi las thar na / bar gyi nyams len dka' thub la bar chad yong mi srid. Zhi-byed Coll. V 317.2. An 'etymology': dka' thub kyi gdams ngag med par bo zags kyi bsrung sdom mi shes pas / grub pa la thob don mi snang bar / dang po blo sbyong gi dus su nus pa'i rtsal gzhan la phyung na bo ba yin / pha rol gyi zas gos la spyad na zags pa yin / bya ba gzhan gyi dus su spyad na sna ltebs pa yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 319.2 (but see further on following lines 6-7). bo zags gsum med. Zhi-byed Coll. V 330.6. sngar bo zags su song bas phyis kyi rjes rnyag pa chos nyid yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 449.7. de ltar sgrub pa bo zags ltem log la mi lta bar tshar du 'jug pa ni 'phags lam gyi shing [r]ta'i srol la byed pa yin no. Zhi-byed Coll. V 451.3. dka' thub kyi bsrung sdom ma shes na bsgrub pa bo zags la 'gro. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 40.3. The syllables bo zags ltebs log seem to be explained one at a time in a passage in Zhi-byed Coll. I 137.6 ff.

བརྣབ	gzhan nor la chags pa. Btsan-lha.
བརྣབ-པ	O.T. for 'dod pa. 367 II 127.5.
བརྣག-དཀའ	bsran dka' ba'am bzod dka' ba. Btsan-lha.
བརྣག-པ	O.T. = bsam pa. Blan 285.6. aggressiveness, ferocity, revenge, evil disposition. Karmay, Treasury. In Bon works, it seems to mean something that really 'gets to' you, that strongly impresses ones mind. brnag pa in Bon works often means 'memory' (actually, fut. of rnog pa). gnag rdzi dga' bo ji bzhin du // bar chad med par brnag pa bskyed. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 297.2.
བརྣམ	bzhugs pa. Btsan-lha.
བརྣན-པ	O.T. = nges bzung. Blan 288.2.

བསྡུ-ཁྲལ	harvest tax, levied on grain after the harvest. Sources.
བསྡུ-ཐུན	common or general tax collection. Sources.
བསྡུ-བའི-ཚིགས-སུ-བཅད-པ	subject of Mimaki article in Indianisme et Bouddhisme 233 ff.
བསྡུ-བའི-དངོས-པོ-བཞི	mkho ba sbyin pa / snyan par smra ba / don spyod pa / don mthun pa'o. 600 42. Das 724. These are said to be symbolized by Buddha's webs between his fingers. Stein. See Gser Sbram 86. bsdu ba bzhi ni / sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 192.2.
བསྡུས	'gathered' diseases which are located in their appropriate place in the body rather than 'hiding' in inappropriate places or 'diffused' throughout the body. In cases of 'diffused' or 'hiding' diseases, treatment must begin with a 'gathering medicine' (bsdu sman).
བསྡུས-གྲྭ	See Vostrikov, Critical 60. elementary classes in logic, or the books used in those classes. 76 5.
བསྡུས-པ	changs bu. Btsan-lha.
བསྡུས-པ-འཇོམས-སྦྱོར	a medicinal preparation. BP 182.6.
བསེ	Norbu, Drung 85. zangs. ri dwags bse ru. Btsan-lha. a kind of copper. Namdak. There is an argument that this is a Zhang-zhung word, which means something stiff and thin (in this case human skin leather). See Vitali in Lungta 14 (2001) 10. There is in fact a ZZ word for 'skin,' with spelling variants pad/bad/sad.
བསེ-འབྲས	See go byi la.
བསེ-འབྲུ	KP3 308.7. See se 'bru.
བསེ-དུག	See BP 53r.7.
བསེ-རག	= lto 'dre. Skorupski, TA.
བསེ-རེངས	bse rengs nga rgyal ba'i mi de la yon tan gyi 'od 'char te mi mchi'o gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 51.5.
བསེ-རུ	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 297. For a strange bowl said to be made of rhino horn, see Po-ta-la (1996) 187. = rwa gcig pa, spyi bor gcig skyes, gcig pur skyes pa, gangs kyi rus pa, rwa'i nyi ma. JD 234. SS 497.3.
བསེ-སྦུར	= spu ra rog po. JD 255. SS 503.2.

བསེ-སླག	bse yi gos. Nomads 252.
བསེ-སྨུག	See smug stag.
བསེ-ཞོ	See shrI khaNDa.
བསེ-མ-ནུ	See ma nu. = seng 'bru. YTTM 292.26.

བསེལ-བ	O.T. = skyel ma. = 'jigs pa las skyob pa. Blan 292.5. 'jigs pa las skyob pa'i skyabs. Btsan-lha.

བསེལ-པོ	skyel ma. Btsan-lha.
བསེན	gnyen gyi brda rnying. Btsan-lha.
བསེན-མོ	bon gyi brdar gdon 'dre mo. Btsan-lha. 467 IV 18.5. Nasty spirits that emerge when you view your teacher as having lust. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 454.5.
བསེན-པ	sems la bcags shing mdza' ba. Btsan-lha.

བསེར-བ	Hon. for rlung. = bser bu. Blan 312.1, 516.3. ser sna'i dbang du song ba. Btsan-lha.
བསེར-བག	rlung.

བསྒངས	Btsan-lha.
བསྒོ-བ	Skt. paribhAvati, suffused, animated, invigorated. M.Vy. Schopen (1986).
བསྒྲགས-པ-གསུམ-གྱི-དཔེའུ-ཙེ	gsang sngags kyi bon rgyas 'bring bsdus gsum lha klu mi gsum yul du bsgrags par bsgrags pa skor gsum mo // dpe'u tse ni bka' sgrom lta bu la go. 506A 335.
བསྒྲལ-བའི-ཞིང-བཅུ	sangs rgyas bstan bshig dkon mchog dbu 'phang dmad // dge 'dun 'du sgo 'phrog dang theg chen smod // bla ma'i sku bsdo rdo rje spun dbyen byed // sgrub par bar chad byed dang dam tshig bral // snying rje med dang log par lta ba can // zhes pa ltar ro. 600 135.
བསྒྲེ-བསྒྲེ	'jon mdog byed pa. Btsan-lha.
བསྒྲེན	btsog pa. Btsan-lha.
བསྒྲེན-མོ	Spelled sgren mo in Yisun, where it is defined as 'naked.' tshong 'dus la sgo gnyis la rngas byas nas / gser zho cig tshags myi byed pa gro khur za zhing bsgren mor sdod pa'i myi re ngan. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 122.6.
བསྒྲིལ-རྫས	used to refer to the cloth wrappings for books. book cover. Vitali, Tho.ling 67.
བསྒྲོས-པ	gros byas pa. Btsan-lha.
བསྒྲུབ-བྱའི-ཆོས	The 'predicate' of a syllogism. Dreyfus, Sound 206.
བསྒྲུག-པ	zad pa. Btsan-lha.

བཤད-ཁྲིད	A method of teaching in which the teacher explains to the students the meaning of every word of a text. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 16.

བཤལ-སྨན	See dong ga.
བཤལ-ཐག	bu tsha 'khor ba'i bshal thag. Zhi-byed Coll. V 207.1. Das says it means leftover dishwater, but it seems to mean rather the rope that attaches to the field-leveling farm implement. Yisun says: bshal la 'drud byed thag pa, the rope that drags the bshal la.

བསྐ-བ	a class of medicinals. KB 49.1. This is one of the 'six tastes' (ro drug).
བསྐལ-བ	O.T. = bar chod pa. = rgyang ring ba. Blan 303.5.

བསྐལ-པ	kalpa; O.T. derivation from Skt. kalpa. Blan 307.6. Bon texts frequently use this word in the sense of destruction and negation (Namgyal Nyima).

བསྐར-བ	Btsan-lha.
བསྐོར-འགྲུལ	yul bskor ba'i 'grul bzhud. Nomads 232.
བསྐོར-བ	For Islamic sinistral circumambulation & discussion of same, see Humanitas Religiosa 36. See discussion in Huber, Pure Crystal 13.
བསྐོར-གྱིས-བསྐོར	don du bskor gyis bskor na zhes pa / don hril gyis dril na zhes pa'am / don mdor bsdus na. 367 II 129.6.
བསྐོས	As a group of deities, they are the assigned arbiters who distinguish true from false, etc. See Blondeau in Karmay, New Horizons 258.
བསྐོས-པ	= bskos thang, the orders or influence of former Karma. MTTP. rgyal sar bskos ni rgyal po'i sras khri 'don byas te rgyal sar mnga' gsol ba lta bu. Utpal 35.4.
བསྐོས-ཐོབ	assignment. Karmay, Treasury.

བསྐྲུ-བ	O.T. = gzhan la thabs kyis 'bred pa. Blan 302.2. bskru ni sprangs pos zas slong ba bskyed cing. Utpal 34.3.
བསྐྲུན-པ	O.T. = bskyed pa. = btsugs pa. Blan 302.2. bskrun ni rgyu las 'bras bu bskyed cing bskrun pa'am gsar du bskyed pa'am btsugs pa'ang bskrun pa yin. Utpal 34.3.
བསྐུ-མཉེ	The 'Kumnye' of the Nyingma center in California. Actually means 'massage,' mainly as a form of medical treatment. For a historical foot massage, see BD of T&TB I 269. Zhi-byed Coll. II 344.5.
བསྐུ-སྒྱུ	Btsan-lha.

བསྣོ-བ	des gnyen po'i mthu bsno ngar yin bar ngo yer phrad pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. V 140.1 byas tshe bsno bar rig pa'i rtsal. Zhi-byed Coll. V 140.3. mtha' ma dpa' sde bsno ngar dang 'gros nas. Zhi-byed Coll. V 176.7.

བསྣོལ	cf. rma bya mjing bsnol (n. of a Nyingma tantra). Mkhyen-rab-rgya-mtsho 1557 203.2. Rnying Rgyud 1982 XI 336.3. Compare rgyab bsnol, which means 'addorsed.'

བསོ	bso bso zhes pa'i sgra'i khyad par. Btsan-lha.
བསོ-བསོ	bso bso ni khas bso bso'am shu shu zer ba'i sgra bsgrags pa. Dpe-chos 509.
བསོ-མ	See so ma.
བསོད-ནམས	merit. Much of what Pha-dam-pa says seems negative about merit, but he seems to mean to say that the conscious pursuit of merit is a worldly concern, not a spiritual one. See Zhi-byed Coll. IV 233.6 for example, or ibid. IV 238.2, where merit can be reduced to a delusion for one who has renounced the world and started practicing.
བསོད-ཉམས	O.T. = 'dod pa la lhag par longs spyod pa'i ming. Blan 292.5. Btsan-lha.
བསོད-པ	O.T. = bzang po. = legs pa. Blan 287.2. bzang po'am legs pa. zhim po. Btsan-lha. yon bdag gis kha zas bsod pa [zhim po] phun sum tshogs pa brims pa. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) VI 184.2.
བསོད-ཟས	legs pa'am bzang po'i zan. Btsan-lha.

བསོད-ནམས-དཔལ-འཛོམ	It looks like a woman's name, but it is actually a name for cilantro, the herb, in common contemporary usage.

བཏོལ-བ	Haarh, Yar-lun 344, 358, 361, etc., where he thinks it means 'making incisions.' Probably an obsolete form of gtol ba. Or, it just means the 'arrival' of the embalmed corpse at the tomb, or its 'taking out of concealment.' slebs pa. gsang ba brtol ba. Btsan-lha.

བཙན-ཐབས	Generally means 'radical method[s],' as distinguished from 'gentle' ('jam).
བཙན-ཐོད	glo bur ba. Btsan-lha.
བཙན-འདྲན-བདའ	btsan shed kyis 'gran bsdur byed bcug pa. Btsan-lha.
བཙན-བཙུན-འཕན-དར-བ	btsan po dang btsun po dang / 'phan zhes pa dbus par la med pas phan chad zer ba'i yul skad yin nam / yang na brda rnying la 'phan pa ni chag pa dang nyams pa la 'jug pas na ba dang rgas pas nyams pa dang dar ma rnams kyang zhes pa la 'jug / dar ba ni dar ma. Dpe-chos 507.
བཙན-ཐབས-རྣལ-འབྱོར	Acc. to BA 476, this is identical to hatha yoga.
བཙན-ཐབས-སུ-བྱས-པ	dbang shed kyis sam nus pa ji yod kyis byas pa. Btsan-lha.
བཙངས-པ	brdzangs pa. Btsan-lha.. O.T. = bsangs pa. Blan 283.2.
བཙས	bdas pa'am rlon pa byas pa. Gces 585.4. rngan pa. bdas pa'am rlon pa byas pa. Btsan-lha. Karmay in Karmay, New Horizons 390, argues that rtsas is an old form of btsas, and that it meant a 'fee.' spyan rgyang gis btsas [~gces srung] pas. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 99.3.
བཙས-པ	See gru btsas pa. Blan 304.3. skyes pa. skyag pa. Btsan-lha.
བཙས-འཕྲོག-པ	btsas zos pa. Btsan-lha.
བཙས-མ-བརྔས-པ	ston thog brnga ba. Btsan-lha.
བཙེ-རྒོད	'khor g.yog. Btsan-lha.
བཙེན-གྱིས	See tsen gyis. Samdo A IV 56r.2, 56r.3.
བཙེས	gnod pa skyel ba. Btsan-lha.
བཙོ	a spelling for dzwa, the magical 'bomb.' Karmay, Treasury vocab.
བཙོ-ལག-མཁན	= khrus mkhan. BBNP 473.

བཙོད	madder; madder. See Lo Bue in TS7 II 578. Used for a red dye. See Chödag. JD 164. = dhi de. YTTM 292.3. SS 479.5, 497.5. = manydzi ka, rak ta, rA smra, ha sna, bzlog bsgyur. DG 237.4. Mdo 337. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 134.5.

བཙུམ-པ	pf. of 'dzum pa. to close (or squint) the mouth or eyes.
བཙུན-ཁྲལ	monk tax. Goldstein, Taxation 20. obligation incurred by families having 3 or more children to join the state mon. located in the Rdzong. Sources. It might be the middle son that would be required for this. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 41.
བཙུན-པོ	rje bo. Btsan-lha.
བཙུན-མོའི-མཆིལ-མ	JD 60. See sindhu ra.. empress spit. JD 60.

བུ	In O.T. woodslips, the broken off piece is referred to as bu (child), while the larger piece was called ma (mother). Tsuguhito Takeuchi (lecture, London 2002).
བུ-བརྒྱུད	issue, progeny, descendants. Sources.
བུ-བཟངས	ya med dam khrel med. Btsan-lha.
བུ-ཆེན	eldest son delivered as hostage to guarantee good behavior of his relatives. Sources.
བུ-དགའ	chos lugs phyogs do dam byed mkhan gyi go gnas shig. Gser Sbram 136.
བུ-གནས	bu snod. womb.
བུ-གཏེ	sons kept as hostages. Sources. Might not the "bu" be short for bu lon? See under gte ma. mi gta' ma. Btsan-lha.
བུ-གུ	a kind of stag. LW 496.
བུ-ལེ	Namdak.

བུ-ངུ	= bong bu. "donkey." Kuijp (1986) 33.
བུ-རམ	= ta la. JD 128. LW 456. Clifford, list.
བུ-རྡོ	child stone, a stone one carries around to holy sites, in hopes of giving birth to a child. Havnevik, Dissertation, p. 55.
བུ-རོན	A type of horse. See under rong bu.
བུ-རྟ	Kuijp in TH&L 302 n. 26. Military term used during Yüan, it means an elite cavalry unit. TS5 671. rta dmag. Nomads 243.

བུལ	a type of mineral salt used by nomads to enhance the color of tea. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 39. See bul tog.
བུལ-བ	spyir 'gor ba'i ming dang skabs 'gar nyul ba la'ang 'jug ste. Btsan-lha.
བུལ-ཁྱི	a dog kept by nomads to watch over the flocks at night. Opposite of sha khyi, hunting dog. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 37.
བུལ-ཏོག	natron ('native sesquicarbonate of soda'), a cleansing substance. = dzi bu ka, pod tsha, lhad tsha. JD 67. In laundry instructions — gos dri ma can la sogs pa 'khru bar byed pa la / chu tshan mo la bul tog la sogs pa'i 'dag chal dang bcas pa dang / 'khru ta shing so yang 'jam pos mi slong bas... Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum V 292.4.

བྱ-གཏོང	'phrin gtong ba'am gsang brda. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-ཁྲ	See skya ga. = ri bong za. JD 242.
བྱ-ཁྱི	(Dbus, Gtsang) = glag. a large Tibetan bird of prey. But see Terrone in TS9 VIII 222, where the 'bird dog' is a tiny dog found in the nests of cliff-nesting birds, which has the power to detect poison in food.
བྱ-ཁྱུང	JD 240. For gnyen po bya khyung, see KP1 130.1, KP3 288.4, KP4 459.5.
བྱ-ཀྲི	See kaNTa ka ri.
བྱ-ལག	red colored flat top of the wa sgor. Velm I 137.
བྱ-ལེ	clitoris. DD illus. 22.
བྱ-ལེབ	See bya ma byi. fruit bat.
བྱ-མེན	? Shastri in TS9 I 140.
བྱ-ན	O.T. = tshod ma. = sbags pa. Blan 304.2. Tib. deriv. from Skt. byanydza na [vyañjana, in the sense of a condiment, sauce, seasoned dish?], = tshod ma. = zas sbags ma. Blan 308.6. skyu ru mtshod ma'i ming. Blan 516.2. zas sam lan tsha dang tshod ma. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-ཕོ	= khyim bya. "domestic bird, chicken." Kuijp (1986) 33.
བྱ-རྡང	Also, bya ldang, bya gdong, bya gdang. "a type of small temple or tabernacle of the gsas mkhar type, set up on mountains or near houses, which in ancient times was devoted exclusively to the protectors of the sNang gshen theg pa." Norbu, Drung 242-3. TS6 129, and note. In more modern Tibetan at least, this means a 'bird roost' (a set of nesting boxes for domestic poultry). Also spelled bya ldang. dgra bla'i gnas. Btsan-lha. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 389.
བྱ-རྡོ	Also, bya sdo, jag to. A type of horse. TS7 II 614. See (rdo) thal.
བྱ-རྒོད	JD 240. SS 499.3.
བྱ-རྐང	n. of a kind of triangular zigzag stitch. See under rta so. Evidently name of the birds' footprint stitch made with blue thread used when sewing together the bla gos robe. Zangpo, Robes 45. = lo btsan, ti mu sa. JD 196. YTTM 292.1. SS 490.2. See lo btswan 'thong po. a fern. Clifford, list. Mdo 248.
བྱ-རྐོན	O.T. = bya rgya. Blan 296.5. bya 'dzin byed kyi rgya. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-རྙང	sgying ba'am glal ba. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-རོག	gzings las 'phur ba'i bya rog gar bder 'gro bar gyis. Zhi-byed Coll. I 310.2. lta ba gzings kyi bya rog la dris. Ibid. II 226.7. Flick, Carrying Enemies 45, 48. = pho rog, gtor ma za, bden sgrogs pa, mig la khyung mig. JD 242. SS 537.1. bya rog gzings 'phur gyi gdams ngag yin no. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) X 123.5.
བྱ-རུ	This Bon term is hardly ever used in Chos texts. A most interesting example of Chos usage is in the Consecration text by Atisa. There is also an occurrence of it as finial of a mchod rten in Rgod-tshang-pa's biography; 64 I 40.6. It's possible (although it depends on the reading) that it appears in the following quote from Tsong-kha-pa's Sngags-rim Chen-mo (PRC ed.,), p. 236: phyogs can ni bya dang zla ba yar ngo mar ngo gnyis ka la 'jug pas / pa tshab kyis bya ru bsgyur ba 'gyur nyes pa yin sung ngo. It's symbolism of method and insight is discussed in Bon Kanjur, 3rd ed. XC 675.3.
བྱ-སྒ	gzengs bstod kyi ster cha'am rngan pa. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-སྒབ	glo bu bya sgab. DD illus. 2, 19.
བྱ-སྒྲུང	grong tshes kyi lo rgyus. Gces 583.5. grong mtshes kyi lo rgyus. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-སྐྱིབས	Schopen in JIABS 17 (1994) 151. brag ldeng ka'am bug yod pa. Btsan-lha. brag phug. Utpal 29.4.
བྱ-སྨྱང	yibs nas lta ba. rkang lag rnams shad du rkyong ba. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-སྟག	SS 545.6.
བྱ-ཐལ	See rgod brum.
བྱ-ཚན	byis pa ma'i khong du gnas dus kyi brun. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-ཝང	= pha wang, lpags 'dab can, byi'u so can. JD 249. SS 500.2.
བྱ-ཞུ	feathered hat. Karmay, Treasury vocab. bya zhu can gyi chos ni sa le 'od. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 186.1.
བྱ-ཚེ-གཟེ-མ-ཐ-རམས	sgo lcags bye brag pa zhig. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-བློ-ཁལ-ཁེལ	bya snyam pa'i blo kha re kho re. Btsan-lha.

བྱ-བླགས-མང	don med kyi bya byed mang ba. Btsan-lha.
བྱ-རྒྱུད-ཀྱི-ལྷ-དྲུག	stong pa'i lha / yi ge'i lha / sgra'i lha / gzugs kyi lha / phyag rgya'i lha / mtshan ma'i lha'o. 600 82.

བྱན	See nang byan. lan tshwa. Btsan-lha.
བྱན-བྱས	log g.yem. Btsan-lha.
བྱན-གཡོག	See under byan pho.
བྱན-ལག	byan chud dam yid 'ong ba. Gces 587.1. Btsan-lha.
བྱན-མོ	bag ma dang zas g.yos mkhan la'ang byan mo zer. Dpe-chos 508.
བྱན-ཕོ	zas g.yos pa lta mkhan. Btsan-lha. Acc. to Tsuguhito Takeuchi (London 2002), the byan po was the chief cook, a member of the 4-person watchman unit in Central Asia (his assistant was called byan g.yog).
བྱན-ཆུད-པ	see byan tshud pa, rang byan tshud pa, etc. snang ba la byan chud pas rang rig khong nas 'char ba'i dus dang drug. Zhi-byed Coll. II 361.7.
བྱན-ཚུད-པ	Said to be a synonym of byang chub pa. Dagyab.
བྱང-བུ	name-card used in death ritual. TS7 II 1071. LW 446.
བྱང-ཆོག	'name card ritual' for deceased. TS7 II 1071. Illus. and explanation in Nomads 280.
བྱང-ཆུབ	clear comprehension ('pure realization'). bodhi. The "chub" goes back to an Old Translation of rtogs pa--chub pa--'realization.' Sometimes byan tshud pa, q.v. is said to be a synonym.
བྱང-ཅུབ	byang chub. Btsan-lha.
བྱང-ཁྲ	See pad me.
བྱང-ལུག	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 297.
བྱང-པ	= brang ha la, stag chung dmar khra, mo nad dpa' bo. JD 262. SS 503.1. TM IV 65.
བྱང-རྐྱང	See Dhongthog under 'trousers.'
བྱང-ཤིང	wooden slate which, when covered with chalk dust, serves for writing exercises. See Das, JTL&CT 81.
བྱང-སེམས-དཀར-དམར	SS 524.2.
བྱང-སེམས-དཀར-པོ	Text 15. See cong zhi.
བྱང-སེམས-དམར-པོ	See brag zhun.
བྱང-ཆུབ-སེམས	bodhicitta; bodhicitta. "clearly comprehended mind." equivalent to Awareness (rig-pa), Ultimate Truth, self-engendered Total Knowledge and Dharmabody. (Klong-chen-pa 2.9 comm.) It is beyond subject-object dichotomies and, so, equivalent to Realm of Dharmas as well (see dbyings). See analysis in Klong-chen-pa 12.18.
བྱང-ཆུབ-སེམས-དཔའ	Bodhisattva. For three types, the shepherd (lug rdzi), the leader (rje dpon), and the oarsman (gnyan pa), see 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) X 15.1 ff.
བྱང-ཆུབ-སེམས-དཔའ-སེམས-དཔའ-ཆེན-པོ	byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa'i sgra bshad ni / nyes skyon byang zhing yon tan khong du chub pas na byang chub dang / 'gro ba'i don sems shing bdud las tshar gcod pas na sems dpa' 'am // yang na bden pa gnyis la yang yang byang zhing de'i don chub pas na byang chub dang / bden pa gnyis kyi don yang yang sems la sran tshugs pas na sems dpa' zhes a lag sha'i shes rab snying po'i 'brel pa las gsungs / sems dpa' chen po ni byang sems kyi sa thob pa'i sems dpa' ste / mdo sdud pa las / gtong ba che dang blo che ba dang mthu chen dang / rgyal ba rnams kyi theg chen mchog la zhugs pa dang / go cha chen po bgos shing bdud kyi sgyu 'dul ba / de yi phyir na sems dpa' che zhes rab tu brjod / ces gsungs pa ltar ro. Gser Sbram 43.
བྱང-ཆུབ-སྙིང-པོ	Bodhi Heart, clearly comprehended essence. Klong-chen-pa 12.2. byang chub kyi snying po la gnyis las rtogs pa byang chub kyi snying po ni ye shes chos kyi sku'am thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la bya zhing / gnas byang chub kyi snying po la 'og min dang rdo rje'i gdan lta bu 'jog. Eimer, Dbyangs 58.

བྱིའུ-ཁྲ	JD 242.

བྱིད	O.T. = dar yol ba. = rgan po. Blan 304.6. dar yol lam rgan po. yal ba. Btsan-lha. self-erasing traces, like breath on a mirror, as in the phrase: chos rnams me long gi byid bzhin du shes par gyis gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 213.7.
བྱིད-པ	a tsa ras 'dzam bu'i gling sum gnyis su phyin nas zhal te snying byid pa btang ste nyan mkhan myi gda'. Zhi-byed Coll. II 302.4.
བྱིད-པོའི-ཁ	sbubs thur byid po'i kha, a medical instrument pictured in JD 277 (item 3).
བྱིག-ཤུ	Tibetanization of Bhikshu. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 187.
བྱིལ-བྱིལ	= byug byug. BBNP 478.
བྱིལ-པོ	rtswa'i gur. Btsan-lha.
བྱིལ-ཏུག	KP1 127.6. KP3 287.5. KP4 458.2.
བྱིལ-སྲན-མ	KP4 529.4.
བྱིམ-པོ	so dmag gam bya ra byed mkhan. Btsan-lha.
བྱིན	'majesty, charisma, prestige.' Used to translate Chinese concept. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 164 (= rlabs, gzi byin, gzi brjid).
བྱིན-བུ	byin bu sdan [i.e., gdan] du bting. Zhi-byed Coll. V 170.3.
བྱིན-གཞུག	blood vessel. DD illus. 24.
བྱིན-ཀྱོག	blood vessel. DD illus. 24.
བྱིན-པོ	rtswa byin po ni rtswa mang ma'am rtswa mang. Dpe-chos 505.
བྱིན-རླབས	Germano, Poetic Thought 831. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 198-9. Bell, Religion 86: byin gyis rlobs. Lit., 'Make blessings to flow like waves over.' byin gyis brlabs pa / byin ni sku gsung thugs kyi gzi byin dang / brlabs ni bsgyur ba'i don te blo bsgyur par go dgos. Gser Sbram 78. byin rlabs / 'phags pa'i lam chos kyi don gang yin pa la gnas pa'i dbang thob cing mthu yod pa ni byin rlabs zhes bya'o zhes chos kyi rnam grangs kyi brjed byang [by Ka-ba Dpal-brtsegs] du gsungs. Gser Sbram 79. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 112.
བྱིན-ཐོབ	what is received by way of blessing (used in combination with skyed thob, what is obtained by generating it oneself). Samdo A III 273v.3, etc.
བྱིན-པའི-ཉྭ-སྙིང	DD illus. 30.
བྱིན-པ-ལེགས	See dgo ba.
བྱིན-རླབས-བཞི-ལྡན	'khor lo chen po'i rdzogs rim byin rlabs bzhi ldan ni / lus byin rlabs / ngag byin rlabs / yid byin rlabs / de kho na nyid kyi byin rlabs rnams so. 600 48.
བྱིན-གྱིས-གཞོལ-བ	rim gyis thur du bab pa. Btsan-lha.
བྱིན-གྱིས-རློབ-པ-པོ	an unusual form noticed in the Guhyasamaja bskyed-rim work by Mkhas-grub-rje. The ones who do the blessing...
བྱིན-ཆེད-པོ	nus pa chen po. Btsan-lha.
བྱིང-གུར	N. for stone rings, acc. to Bellezza, Divine Dyads 261.
བྱིང-ངས	fish.
བྱིང-རྒོད	sinking and scattering. The two extremes to be avoided when attempting to bring the mind to the state of settled concentration on the object of meditation in the early stages of the Path. This settled concentration is called Peaceful Abiding (zhi-gnas). These two are mental/moral failings which prevent the Two Accumulations of Total Knowledge and Merit. They are, then, manifestations of obscuration (sgrib pa) and afflictive emotions (nyon rmongs) within the context of initial stabilization (zhi gnas) in meditation.
བྱིང-བྱིང-ཐུ-ལུ	'bu bye brag pa zhig. Btsan-lha. = rdzib rdzib, zhol spur ba. JD 255. SS 503.3.
བྱིང-ཆེ-ས	equivalent to khyab che se (?). BBNP 477.
བྱིང-ཆེ-སེ	khyab che se. Btsan-lha.
བྱིངས	Sometimes used for Skt. dhAtu in the sense of the verbal roots (in other cases, Tibbetans translated dhAtu by dbyings, with the initial 'd'). Stein.
བྱིངས-སེ-ཉོགས-སེ	phrase interpreted in 367 II 126.3. sems la 'char rgyu nges po med pa. Btsan-lha.
བྱིས-ནད	children's ailments. SRZT 119 ff.
བྱིས-པ	simplistic, childish, immature, unsophisticated (as used by some authors, = commoners, ordinary people).

བྱུང-ཚོར	A term used in Bon Abhidharma, for which I haven't been able to find a good explanation. II 466.6. myi gzhi' phung po la byung tshor gnas / des dbang po dang rnam shes 'brel / der bzung yul dang / 'dzin pa'i shes pa gnyis dbang po dang gsum tshogs nas... Zhi-byed Coll. IV 8.3.

ཅས-ཅུས	tshugs shor ba mi brtan pa dang mi drang ba. 'khyog po. Btsan-lha.
ཅེ-རེ	See che re.
ཅེ-སྤྱང	spyang khu'i bye brag ste / spyang khu dang 'phar pa gnyis 'dus pa las ce spyang skyes par bshad la / dzam bu ka zhes pa'i skad dod ce spyang dang wa gnyis la 'jug pas skabs 'gar wa la'ang ce spyang zhes byung ngo. Eimer, Dbyangs 55. DG 96.6.

ཆ	Stein. (16) 'digits' of the moon, symbolic for byang sems dkar po.
ཆ-འཕྱི	mi mthun pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆ-བ	mi cha ba, = O.T. mi shes pa. Blan 291.5. O.T. = 'jug pa. Blan 294.2. A category of religious expert. Samdo A III 200v.3. Namdak. 'gro ba'i brda rnying. thub pa. brgyan pa'am bzhag pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆ-བུ	A special term used in Blo-gsal-gling for the monastery manager, instead of the usual phyag mdzod. Dreyfus, Sound 348.
ཆ-ཆད	= tshegs che. BBNP 479. Btsan-lha.
ཆ-ཆེན	a larger unit of measure made up of 12 cha chung. = 1/2 gru mo. = zhal tshad. = zhal. = gdong. = mtho. = thal mo. = mthil. Jackson.
ཆ-ཆོ	Btsan-lha.
ཆ-ཆོས	[cha chod?] Lautmalend für "Lärm, Unruhe" Kaschewsky 82. No doubt the same word as ca co, cacophony, blabber.
ཆ-ཆུང	= sor mo. = sor. 1/12 of a cha chen. Contains 4 rkang pa and 8 nas. Jackson.
ཆ-ག	an obsolete term. mcher pa'i cha ga is equiv. to mcher pa'i mu la (see DD 174).
ཆ-གང	Which part?
ཆ-གསུམ	See gtor ma cha gsum.
ཆ-ལ	= phyogs gcig pa. BBNP 469-470. Btsan-lha. tshogs su cha la [~mnyam du] bsgom. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 222.2.
ཆ-ལག	ancillary, supplementary. Karmay, Treasury.
ཆ-ལང	cymbals. Karmay, Treasury. A pair of cymbals used by Dalai Lama XIII in 1900 illus. in Precious Deposits IV 86-7.
ཆ-མེད	O.T. = rgyus med. Blan 291.5. = nges med. 367 127.2. = rgyus med. BBNP 473.
ཆ-ངེས	See under 'theng khyer ling nge cha nges.
ཆ-རྐྱེན	= cha lag mthun rkyen. Das. ancillary. Karmay, Treasury.
ཆ-སིངས	'bru sogs nyal te ma skol bar bcud btsags pa. Dpe-chos 515.
ཆ-ཡོད	OR cha shes, to have information about (something), to have some idea. Kretsch.

ཆ-མ-ཡིན	'os ma yin.

ཆད	= kha chad. Versprechen. Kaschewsky2. An O.T. word in connection with funerals (compare CT mchad, cemetary). See Mike Walter's forthcoming article, and Sgra 'Grel, p. 21 (bottom). The latter reads bang so'i dur mchad.
ཆད-ཀ	chas ka'am rgyu nor. Btsan-lha.
ཆད-ཁུངས	genesis, origin (of families, lineages, etc.). Sources.
ཆད-པ	O.T. = dur gyi gnas. Also, = bang so. Blan 296.5.
ཆད-རྡོ	promise. this word is related to brjed rdo, an inventory, an aid to memory (mi brjed pa'i dran rten). the component rdo ('stone') acts as a tshig grogs, an auxiliary or qualifying element suggesting the indissoluble nature of the promise or inventory.
ཆད-ཐོ	mna' skyel du 'jug pa. Btsan-lha.

ཆིག-རྫོགས-སུ	[to confer] at one and the same time the four degrees of ordination. Karmay, Treasury. sa lam chig rdzogs su gtong pa yin gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 325.3.z
ཆིངས-དན	treaty. Sources.
ཆིངས-ལུགས	Stein.
ཆིས	ma chis las (= ma mchis lags). "does not exist." Kuijp (1986) 35. See Richardson in HP,PE 25-27, where he suggests the tr. 'proper attention to public affairs,' administration of affairs, due attention.'
ཆོ	Stein.
ཆོ-འབྲང	ma'i khyim rgyud. Btsan-lha.
ཆོ-འཕྲུལ	prAtihArya; projections, magical displays. Skt. prAtihArya, extraordinary occurrence, miracle. In Gcod has special meaning of magical interferences (Edou, Machig 73).
ཆོ-ཆད	cho chad ni ma 'grig. Dpe-chos 508. Btsan-lha.
ཆོ-ཆོ	sound of dogs. 4X 122.6.
ཆོ-ག	thabs. Btsan-lha.
ཆོ-ལོ	O.T. = rgyan po. Blan 297.1. Karmay, Confucius 570. Namdak.
ཆོ-ལུ	see chol bu.
ཆོ-རབས	narrative on ancestral generations. TS6 130. cho rigs yin khungs. Btsan-lha.
ཆོ-རིགས	cho rigs zhes pa'i cho 'brang ni ma'i brgyud pa dang / rigs ni pha'i brgyud pa'am rigs la bshad. Eimer, Dbyangs 55.
ཆོ-རིས	bloodline (of horses).
ཆོ-ངེ-བཏབ	deliriously weep, shouting together with weeping.
ཆོ-ལོ-འཛིན-པ	sngar gong ma'i dus kyi go sa dang bka' yig yod mkhan. Btsan-lha.
ཆོ-འཕྲུལ-གསུམ	rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul / kun tu brjod pa'i cho 'phrul / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul lo. 600 24. Gser Sbram 159, q.v.
ཆོབ-ཆོབ	yar chob chob. 367 I 236.
ཆོད-ཚད	A Gcod term (used by Brahmin Aryadeva in his PrajñApAramitA treatise), which Edou, Machig 72, translates as 'definitive sign of realization.' It seems to signal realization without meditative 'experience' (nyams).
ཆོད-སོ-བདོག-པ	kha chad bdog pa khas blangs pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆོད-དེ-འོང-བ	rbad de yong ba. Btsan-lha.
ཆོག	mi chog, O.T. = mi phod. Blan 300.2. bcag pa'i [gcog pa'i] bskul tshig. Dagyab.
ཆོག-གེ	suspension; suspension. Thondup, BM 364.
ཆོག-བཞག-བཞི	See cog bzhag bzhi. Thondup, BM 70. Achard, L'Essence 92 etc.
ཆོག-ཚོད-འཛིན-པ	Stein.
ཆོག-ཆོག-པོ	tsog tsog byas pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆོལ-བ	mistaken tr. used instead of khol ba. Blan 311.5.
ཆོལ-བུ	I believe this is equiv. to khol bu, which means scattered or miscellaneous. Zhi-byed Coll. II 423.4: skal ldan las can kha yar la snying gtam chol bur gsungs pa lags s.ho. Elsewhere in the same collection, we find the word cho lu, which I believe has the same meaning.
ཆོལ-ཉོག	nyon mongs pa'i chol nyog tu spyod pa'i sems can 'di rnams snying re rje. 602 13v.1. See under 'byol nyog, jol nyog, etc.
ཆོལ-ཟངས	dri chu 'dor ba'i snod. rkang lag bkru ba'i snod. Btsan-lha.
ཆོལ-འགྲོ-བ	nyams 'gro ba. Btsan-lha.
ཆོམ-རྐུན	chom rkun ni rkun ma. Utpal 24.1.
ཆོང-ཞི-ཟླ-འོད	TR XV no. 2-3 (p. 13).
ཆོངས	See bcags.
ཆོར-བྱེད	Stein.
ཆོས	dharma. In Klong-chen-pa, almost always means small 'd' dharma, not the teachings of the Buddha (Dharma), but the constituents of apparent existence, 'knowables.' Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 167-9.
ཆོས-འབྱུང	Often means 'Dharma origins,' or 'history.' At other times means the dharmodaya, an inverted pyramidal structure that forms a 'star of David' at the top, and underlies the generation of mandalas. It appears in many mandalas between the Vajra wall and the Lotus ring, in the form of an outer white and an inner red circle (the white & red signify emptiness & bliss). For example of a description, see Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment 57.
ཆོས-འཁོར	holy place. MTTP.
ཆོས-བདག	a prophesied patron of a gter ston. Gyatso, Apparitions 177. This seems to be used in the Pratyutpanna SUtra.
ཆོས-བདུན	rnam par snang mdzad kyi chos bdun. See Germano, Poetic Thought 902.
ཆོས-བརྒྱད	'jig rten gyi chos brgyad ni / rnyed na dga' ba / ma rnyed na mi dga' ba / snyan pa thos na dga' ba / mi snyan pa thos na mi dga' ba / bde na dga' ba / mi bde na mi dga' ba / bstod na dga' ba / smad na mi dga' ba rnams so. 600 102.
ཆོས-བཞི	dge sbyong gi chos bzhi. Thondup, BM 78. Stein. Mkhyen-rab-rgya-mtsho 1557 595.4.
ཆོས-ཅན	The 'subject' of a syllogism. Dreyfus, Sound 206.
ཆོས-ཆབ	Term used in describing Kanjur volumes. Dung-dkar 156.
ཆོས-དམག	'gog pa. Gces 584.4. rtsod pa. 'gog pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆོས-གསུམ	bshad pa'i chos / sgrub pa'i chos / 'bras bu'i chos so. 600 9. Sinitic vocab. for sde snod gsum. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163.
ཆོས-ལམ	"principled or rule-governed way." Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 316. Sinitic vocab. for 'Tao' (as Chinese translation for Dharma). Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 162, 167.
ཆོས-ལྔ	ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam rtog dang / de bzhin nyid dang / mi rtog ye shes so. 600 61.
ཆོས-མཆོག	highest worldly realization. Dharmottama, a logician.
ཆོས-མཛད	(hon. for chos pa?) title of a semi-ordained religious practitioner from a noble family. Sources. "A designation given to a monk who sponsors a food offering and a monetary distribution to all the monks of his college, and who also makes a donation to the college itself. Such a monk is exempted from common chores that are the responsibility of younger monks." Pabongka, Liberation II 269. 'monk-sponsor.' Dreyfus, Sound 51, 52.
ཆོས-ཉིད	Dharmaity. Skt. DharmatA. 'real condition of existence.' Norbu, Cycle. See Guenther in TH&L.
ཆོས-པ	in the sense of 'follower of Dharma.' Samdo A V 154r.6.
ཆོས-རྩེགས	In architecture, the horizontal woodwork immediately above the lotus design. It is decorated with squares forming a kind of pyramidal indentation pattern. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3.
ཆོས-ཤིག	khyer zhig. bcos pa'i skul tshig. Btsan-lha.
ཆོས-སྐུ	Dharmabody. Skt. DharmakAya. The lower vehicles delight in drawing distinctions between the 3 bodies of Buddhahood. Rdzogs-chen discussions base themselves on the root identity where they cannot be distinguished, from which they have never moved, and it is this identity that is called Dharmabody. See also sku.
ཆོས-སྨན	= a mri ta (amRta). SS 544.3.
ཆོས-སྨྱོ	'religion madness.' mental disorder due to improper practice of meditation. Epstein, Dissertation 141.
ཆོས-སྲིད	= chos kyi rgyal srid. theocratic rule. Sources.
ཆོས-ཐོག	"Dharma Sessions" in the monasteries, in which debate is the main preoccupation. There were 4 such sessions per year, each session lasting one and a half months. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 8. chos rwar tshogs pa'i dus.
ཆོས-མ-འདྲེས-པ-བཅོ-བརྒྱད	18 unique qualities of the Buddha. Germano, Poetic Thought 953.
ཆོས-ལ-གཟའ	As ex. of an irreg. Old Tantra term, corresponding to gza' gtad, see the work of Dge-rtse in Rnying Rgyud 1973 XXXVI 455.
ཆོས-ཡེ-བལ	another ms. reads: chos ye bral. BBNP 478.
ཆོས-ཡེ-བྲལ	gtan nas med. Btsan-lha.
ཆོས-གསུམ-སྤང-བ	chos gsum spang ba la / skyes pa'i yul spang / khyim dang thab spang / las dang bya ba spang ngo. Bka'-gdams Thor-bu 38r.2.
ཆོས-ཀྱི-སྒོ	Also, chos kyi sgo mo. Sinitic vocab. for chos kyi rnam grangs. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163, 176.
ཆོས-ཀྱི-འཁོར-ལོ	Stein.
ཆོས-ཀྱི-འཁོར-ལོ-རིམ-པ-གསུམ	dang po bden bzhi'i chos 'khor / bar ba mtshan nyid med pa'i chos 'khor / tha ma legs phye'i chos 'khor ro. 600 19.
ཆོས-ཀྱི-རྒྱལ-པོ	1. sangs rgyas. 2. gshin rje'i rgyal po. 3. mi yi rgyal mchog tu gyur. Blan 528.
ཆོས-ཀྱི-ཡི-གེ	Sinitic vocab. for mdo (sUtra). Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 175.
ཆོས-ཀྱི-རྣམ-གྲངས-ཉི-ཤུ-རྩ-ལྔ-རྫོགས-པ	Klong-chen-pa 7.9 comm.
ཆོས-ཀྱི-ཁུད-པ	chos kyi skyes sam rdzongs pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆོས-རྒྱལ-མེས-དབོན-རྣམ-གསུམ	srong btsan sgam po / khri srong lde btsan / mnga' bdag khri ral pa can no. 600 25.
ཆོས-གོས-གསུམ	bla gos / mthang gos / snam sbyar ro. 600 18. There is a rule that these must be with the monk (but not necessarily wearing them) at all times when absent from the monastery, otherwise they will have to be blessed over again. Tibetan practice is to wear the whole set of three during gso sbyong, when teaching, and during ordinations.
ཆོས-གཞིའི-མི-སེར	subjects of monastic estates. Dargyay, TVC 24, etc.
ཆོས-ཟད-བློ-ཟད	Phrase common in works of Padma-gling-pa, Works XIV 551, for example.
ཆོས-ཟད-སྣང-བ	See snang ba bzhi.
ཆོས-ཟད-ཆེན-པོ	Great Dharma Exhaustion. Fourth of the snang ba bzhi. See Sky Dancer 209, note 7.
ཆོས-མཁན-ན	(regionalism) = ci zhig smos. BBNP 470.
ཆོས-སྤྱོད-བཅུ	yi ge 'bri ba / mchod pa 'bul ba / sbyin pa gtong ba / chos nyan pa / 'dzin pa / klog pa / 'chad pa / kha ton du bya ba / chos kyi don sems pa / chos kyi don sgom pa rnams so. 600 145.
ཆོས-ཉིད-ཟད-པའི-སྣང-བ	= phyag rgya chen po mchog gi dngos grub thob pa. 91 I 619.2, 637.3. See also snang ba bzhi.

ཆོས-ན-མར	chos kyi nang na. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ	1. (mod.) <Ch. qu. district, an administrative area smaller than a prefecture (zhou) and a county (xian), but lrager than a xiang. Also refers sometimes to a region, which is an area larger than a prefecture. Barnett, Resistance. 2. a 'secret' way of saying 'ten,' used by gamblers. Norbu, Drung 229. 3. dkyus sam srid. Btsan-lha. chu / 'dir dkyus sam srid kyi don te chu zheng gab pa lta bu. Gser Sbram 223.
ཆུ-འབམ	Lag-len 268.1.
ཆུ-འབོག	chu brgal ba. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-འཆིང	thog phibs sam rgya phibs. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-འཛིན	1. sprin. 2. bha ga. Blan 528.
ཆུ-འཁོར	waterwheel. Combe 52.
ཆུ-འོ	chu dang 'o ma bsres pa. Watered down milk. Nomads 237.
ཆུ-འོད	shwa 'od dam chu log. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-འཐུང	See rta.
ཆུ-བ	'robe,' derives from Turkish juba, acc. to Beyer, CT Lang. 140. The more proper spelling is probably phyu ba, q.v. yu ba. lus kyi lhu tshigs 'dzin byed rgyus pa. lus kyi rtsa. Btsan-lha. See mkhrig ma'i chu ba, gru mo'i chu ba, sgyid khung chu ba, rting pa'i chu ba, phrag pa'i chu ba, (chu ba) sbal mgo. See chu rtsa.
ཆུ-བན	a container for carrying liquids. Havnevik, Dissertation 215.
ཆུ-བེམ	a container. Havnevik, Dissertation 217.
ཆུ-བོ	May stand for Skt, ogha, in which case it means, in the psychological sense, 'flooding' by klezas / emotions (like, I would suggest, a late stage in the experience of fear, in which the fear takes over and paralyzes one). See Richard Sorabji, Emotion & Peace of Mind, p. 7, on 'flooding.'
ཆུ-བྲན	chu chung ngu.
ཆུ-བུན	tshos kyi bye brag cig. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-བུར	Or, chu thor, 'blister.' Dhongthog.
ཆུ-བྱ	See so bya.
ཆུ-བྱི	JD 258. SS 503.4.
ཆུ-དག	KP1 100.2. KP3 275.4. KP4 438.4.
ཆུ-དེབ	See (sngo) deb.
ཆུ-དཀར	a drink made by pouring some milk into boiled water, drunk mainly by nomads who cannot afford to drink tea. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 45.
ཆུ-དངོ	chu ngogs sam chu 'gram. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-དྭངས	See under ke ta ka. Gser Sbram 298.
ཆུ-གང	O.T. = snying stobs. Blan 302.1; BBNP 476. The hon. form is chab gang. "force of character, moral quality, courage, honesty, loyalty, integrity, etc." Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 317. As translation of Confucian term for 'honesty,' see Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163, 195-6. snying stobs. legs pa. Btsan-lha. chu gang che bas phung mo ngan khrel ba la ngo mtshar mi byed pa'i mi yang mthong ste. Zhi-byed Coll. V 459.4.
ཆུ-གླེ	chu gling zhes pa'i yul skad do // mtha' chus bskor ba'i gling ngo. Dpe-chos 506.
ཆུ-གྲི	gri thung so gcig pa dang so gnyis pa. Btsan-lha. 'water knife.' surgical implement for removing tumors. skrangs zhal ba'i chu gri. JD 276 (item 4). chu gri literally means 'water knife,' but most likely this is a disguised borrowing of the Sanskrit word chUrI which simply means 'knife' (also in ordinary modern Hindi, Nepali khukri, etc.). 'khyog dang ldan pa'i gri zhig. Dagyab. Means 'curved knife' in general.
ཆུ-གྲོག	chu'i lbu ba. chu grang mo. chu grang mo la sman phye btab pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-གཤའ	glo bur du rdol ba'i chu drag. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-གཏོད	chu gtod chu gtod du thug rj me ni sa spungs chu rdol du gang nas yod pa. Dpe-chos 516.
ཆུ-གཏོར	See also mchod gtor, chab gtor. Acc. to BA 674, this practice was first introduced by Atisa.
ཆུ-ཁ	river bank; river bank.
ཆུ-ཀླུང	also occasionally used to mean 'ocean.' Btsan-lha.

ཆུ-པིར	water brush used for 'washes' in painting. Jackson.
