ཆུ-རས	wet cotton cloth. A gtum mo practice. Huber, Pure Crystal 87.
ཆུ-རྡོ	chu shel. Btsan-lha. JD 50. SS 505.4. DG 138.3.
ཆུ-རྒྱུས	Text 54.
ཆུ-རིས	water design, wave design. Jackson. The ripples of the river. MTTP. The art-history by Dkon-mchog-bstan-'dzin, Bzo-gnas 135, uses the term chu ris ma to refer to Chinese 'ink' drawings, something that never really caught on in Tibet.
ཆུ-རྟེན	= la ma. "bundle of grass, bundle of grass roots." Kuijp (1986) 33.
ཆུ-རྩ	= ser po zab lag, zab lag can. JD 147. SS 493.6. = thab lag can, gser gyi sdong po. YTTM 292.27. = chu chung ba, la chu, dpal chen pa, la rgod, chu ba, bya slag can, rgyal po bser ser can, 'dab ma chu lo, rkang la chu lo. DG 277.2. For dye for monastic robes, in Khams a similar dye plant is called la chu'i rtsa ba. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 130.1.
ཆུ-རྩྭ	ser por kha bsgyur rgyu'i rtswa zhig go. Dpe-chos 515.
ཆུ-རུག	zas zos pa ma zhus pas phyir lud pa. sngo sdum gyi rtsa ba zhig. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-སྦུར	= ldong mo myur mgyogs rta, sbal ba mjug ma can, tshe gcig lus gnyis. tadpole. JD 262. See bur 'gyogs.
ཆུ-སྡོར	367 I 236. thug par 'debs rdzas mar chur. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-སེར	Germano, Poetic Thought 903, 'lymph.' lus kyi rma las byung ba'i gsher khu'i ming. Dag-yig. 10 kinds of 'serum' stay in the joints and, if disturbed, cause arthritis. Text 12, 25, 36, 41, 42, 43, 48, 52, 78. The symptoms and various sorts: The flesh and skin puff up. It is the kind of disease which produces open sores and itching. Although there are many sorts, there are the following basic categories: 1) 'White chu ser' which accompanies 'cold disorders' and 2) 'black chu ser' which accompanies 'head disorders.' The most turbulent sort of 'black chu ser' is leprosy (MDZE). SRZT 102.
ཆུ-སྒྲོག	chu la phye btab pa'i thug pa sla mo zhig. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-ཤེལ	Combe. Acc. to Das, a magic stone supposed to have the power of producing water or rain. See Lhalungpa 220, n. 25. yul sems rten 'brel las skye ba chu shel la zla ba shar ba lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 476.4. = tsan dra kan ti. DG 87.6.. = tsandra kanti (tsan dra kan ti). JD 35.
ཆུ-ཤིང	driftwood. Skorupski, TA. = smyug ma, = e raNTa. See BBNP 480. Some say it means smyug ma, others 'om bu, and still others shing gi bye brag cig. Btsan-lha. chu shing la phye na snying po myi gda'. Zhi-byed Coll. II 15.7. 'bras bu thogs pa na sdong bu dang bcas pa skam 'gro ba'i shing zhig yin la / la las smyug ma la nges 'dzin / a kyA yongs 'dzin gyis / chu shing ni chu klung gi 'bram bye ma'i nang du skyes pa'i 'om bu yin par bshad cing / 'om nag ces kyang 'byung ngo zhes gsungs. Gser Sbram 299. See 'om bu.
ཆུ-ཤོ	JD 151. SS 485.3.
ཆུ-སྐྱར	mchu ring po can gyi chu bya zhig. mthing ril. Btsan-lha. Eimer, Dbyangs 57. don ni chu skyar bzhin du bsam. Flick, Carrying Enemies 44-46.
ཆུ-སྐྱེགས	bad kan gyi nad mchi ma skyur mo skyugs pa. Btsan-lha. chu bya'i ming. Utpal 28.4.
ཆུ-སྐྱེས	1. zla ba. 2. gza' lhag. 3. pa wa sangs. 4. lha yi drang srong. 5. padma. Blan 528.
ཆུ-སྐྱོམས	chu dkrugs pa. Btsan-lha.
ཆུ-སྐྱུར	Text 13, 82.
ཆུ-སྨན	See mon lcam.
ཆུ-སྙིང	DG 83.3.
ཆུ-སོ	urinary organs; bladder, external and internal urinary organs; = gcin lam, and, sometimes, = lgang ba. Dag-yig. lte ba'i 'og gam 'doms/ Chödag. lte 'og sor bzhi'i mtshams/ Dagyab. the urinary organs. Das. the urinary opening. DD illus. 21, 22.
ཆུ-སྤེ	mkhar rdzong dang khang pa'i thog. Btsan-lha.

ཅོར	gtam btsan po'am mi snyan par brjod pa. Btsan-lha.
ཅོར-ཅོར	fizzing of beer. Beyer, CT Lang. 147.
ཅུ	O.T. for chu. Btsan-lha.
ཅུ-གང	gypsum; Namdak. JD 76. = bhaM pa lo tsA na, smyig ma, kha bcud, tA ma kSi ri, yang tag shir, tag shir, rtsi 'jam, sta shing. YTTM 291.13. SS 416.2 (a tree). Gypsum. TM I 49. DG 152.4. TM IV 60. Clifford, list. Bamboo manna. Das. Singh (p. 354): The internal siliceous excretions of a special variety of bamboo is called vaMzalocana, or vaMzalekhana. Hübotter/1 (p. 68). Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). TM I 49: gypsum. RR & Das say Bamboo manna. JD 76: In Sanskrit, bhaM pa lo tsA na. There are 3 types: 1) 'Tree cu gang' comes from an Indian tree called waM sha ro tsA na (= vaMzalocana) which is similar to bamboo (smyug ma). 2) Pretapuri cu gang. 3) Water cu gang comes from the water of mountains such as Kailash. Dutt 272: siliceous concretion found in the joints of the female bamboo is called VaMzarocana. Described as sweet, tonic, aphrodisiac & used in cough, consumption, asthma, fever, etc. Used in lung prescriptions. Bambusa arundinacea, Willd. (= sitopala?). Dag-yig: 1) A kind of white earth & stone used for making whitewash (dkar rtsi). There are several types. For example, the white earth used as a whitewash on the sides of walls is called "earth cu gang." That which is hard like rock & makes a powder when burned in fire, used in paint, is called "stone cu gang." For the white encrustations found in rivulets that fall from steep precipies, the term "water cu gang" is used. Most generally cu gang (alone) refers to "earth cu gang" and "stone cu gang." 2) a soft white essence of a plant similar to bamboo (smyug ma) which grows in hot areas is called "tree cu gang." This word, in Bon texts of the funerary Dur genre, might refer to the burnt offering of food to the deceased.

ད-ནུར	OR, da bur, "place for burning." Borrowed from Persian. Velm I 67. Persian 'towers of silence' are called dakhma. This da nur might be the Persian (and Hebrew) word for 'oven.'
ད-ར	buttermilk; or, dar ba, 'buttermilk.' Havnevik, Dissertation 299. Dhongthog. Have seen it spelled dar ra.

དག-པ-འཇིག-རྟེན-པའི-ཡེ-ཤེས	A term used by ZAntipa in his Hevajra sAdhana, for the ye shes in post-meditation phase, rjes thob (aftereffect of the AvikalpajñAna in meditative equipoise, mnyam gzhag). Skt. zuddhalaukikajñAna.

དང-ཐོག	Evidently a contraction of the words dang po & thog ma, meaning the very first or the original. Used several times in Bon Kanjur (192-vol. version) CXLII 41-42, to mean the yig mgo (the 'leading letter,' or snake-heads used at the beginning of a dpe cha page).

དར-མ	As a Tibetanization of the word 'Dharma,' see Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 182-3. In O.T. times it generally referred to the Dharma in its scriptural form, and especially the volumes. Beware, since this form in C.T. almost always means 'young man.'

དབང-ལག	dbang po'i lag pa. 'Indra's arm.' a medicinal plant with an arm-shaped root. Rock, NAga Cult I 278; II 481 ff. JD 138. SS 491.1. = dbang po lag pa. KP1 56.5. = (bdud rtsi) dar ya kan. དབང-པོ	Distinguished from stobs in the following: slob dpon rtsa rgya pa'i zhal nas yul la dbang du byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po / myi mthun phyogs 'joms pa'i don gyis ha stobs gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 301.3. See dug mo nyung.

དབང-རྩ	See rtsa dkar.
དབང-སྡུད	'subjugation, bringing under one's power.' Pabongka, Liberation II 107, n. 37.

དབང-ཏང	dbang cha'am mthu stobs. Btsan-lha.
དབང-ཐང	Norbu, Drung 62: "ascendancy-capacity." Uray, Earliest Evidence 358, sees this as well as rlung rta as concepts borrowed from China.
དབང-ཚོང	to force someone to sell at extortionate rates. Sources.
དབང-ཡོན	initiation fee (an additional tax imposed on the public ostensibly for blessings bestowed on it by state monks). Sources.
དབང-འདུ-མི	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 301.
དབང-གིས-འཆུ-བ	dbang gis 'phrog pa. Btsan-lha.

དབང-ལག-ཞོ-གསུམ-རིལ-བུ	a medicinal preparation. BP 286.4.
དབང-ལྡན-ཁུང	between the eyes.
དབང-ཟ-བ	mna' za ba'am smod pa. Btsan-lha.
དབང-ཐང-ཆེ-བ	O.T. = skal ba che ba. = dpal che ba. = skal ba bzang ba. Blan 300.2-.3. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 178.
དབང-པོ-ལྔ	dad sogs dbang po lnga ni / dad pa'i dbang po / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po / dran pa'i dbang po / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po / shes rab kyi dbang po'o. 600 62.

དབྱིག-དབྱིག	bskor ba'i rnam 'gyur ram ri mo sogs sub pa'i ming. Btsan-lha.
དབྱིག-པ	dbyug pa. Btsan-lha.
དབྱིག-གི-གདངས-ཅན	gser snod kyi sgra ltar mtho zhing zab pa. Btsan-lha.
དབྱིལ	See a bhi sha. KP1 127.6.
དབྱིངས	dhAtu; expanse; Realm. Short for chos kyi dbyings (Realm of Dharmas): the 'objective sphere' of Total Knowledge insomuch as it may be said to have one. Skt. dhAtu. Note that Realm with a capital letter is used to translate Tibetan dbyings, but the word should not be taken to connote a circumscribed space. The word 'realm' with a small 'r' translates Tibetan khams which may connote a particular realm ruled by one of the senses, circumscribed by the limitations of that sense. Sometimes, as in medicine, it means an 'element' distributed within a larger organism. Both dbyings (and byings, q.v.) and khams translate the same Skt. word dhAtu, but in different usages of that word. Germano, Poetic Thought 882, translates 'dhAtu.' zab cing phra ba'i don dang skabs 'gar dgongs pa'i don. Btsan-lha.
དབྱིངས-སྣང	Germano, Poetic Thought 882.
དབྱིས	zheng tshad. bod kyi rus rgyud.

དགའ-འདུན	O.T. = skyes pa'am bud med rkyang pa dga' spro la tshogs pa. Blan 305.4. Btsan-lha.
དགའ-འཁྱིལ	1. g.yung drung. 2. rgyal po'i pho brang. Blan 527. See also Nomads. A swirling design resembling the yin-yang symbol, only often having 3, rather than 2, swirling 'drops.' Illus. in Yisun.
དགའ-བ	comfort, contentment.
དགའ-བྲོད	elation. One of the 4 types of demons in Gcod demonology. I notice one use of the word in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 183.3 (compare IV 211.5): dga' brod kyi blo de bdud kyi byin brlabs 'jug pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir ro.
དགའ-དྲག	(Dbus) = yag gi red, better. MTTP.
དགའ-མོ	Stein.
དགའ-དགའ-སྤྲོ-སྤྲོ	happily. Soundings 21.
དགའ-ས-ཡག-ས	circle of friends. Dargyay, TVC 49.
དགའ-རུ-རེ	Btsan-lha.
དགའ-བ-བཞི	sngags kyi dga' ba bzhi ni / dga' ba / mchog dga' / dga' bral / lhan skyes kyi dga' ba'o. 600 47.
དགའ-བ-ཟ-བ	Btsan-lha.
དགའ-སྤྲོ-དགེ-བསྐོས	'fun disciplinarian.' A kind of clown who performs at rituals for the phar phyin class at Se-ra Monastery. In Tibet his performances lasted 14 days, in exile, 7. I witnessed several performances.
དགའ-ལྡན-མཁན-པ	See phur mong.
དགའ-རབ-དབང-ཕྱུག-གི-མེ-ཏོག-གི-མདའ-ལྔ	dregs par byed pa dang / rmongs par byed pa dang / kun tu rmongs par byed pa dang / brgyal bar byed pa dang / sems med par byed pa'i me tog gi mda' rnams so. 600 57.
དགའ-འཁྱེར-བ	Stein.
དགབ-པ	Btsan-lha.
དགག-པ	pratiSedha; refute, negate. Skt. pratiSedha. Thurman.
དགག-སྒྲུབ	accomplishment / hindrance, accomplishing / hindering, refutation / proof. Klong-chen-pa 9.15, 11.3. Skt. pratiSedha, prohibition, obstruction, refutation. (Roerich's Dictionary).
དགག-བྱའི-མཐའ-བཞི	yod pa'i mtha' / med pa'i mtha' / gnis ka'i mtha' / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mtha'o. 600 38.
དགག-སྒྲུབ-གནང-གསུམ	In Vinaya, means abstinence, observances and authorizations (a way of categorizing rules of conduct). Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 8.
དགག-སྒྲུབ-མེད-པ	Neither preventing nyon-rmongs, nor striving for ye shes. Rnying Rgyud 1982 XI 337.1.
དགག-བྱ-ངོས-འཛིན	At the core of Tsong-kha-pa's view of Emptiness, the idea that the object of negation must bve thoroughly identified. Dreyfus, Sound 284.
དགང-ཅན	= ma lus. "each and every." Kuijp (1986) 34.
དགར-བ	to pen up (men, cattle). Beckwith in TS7 II 1046.
དགེ	Btsan-lha.

དགེ-བཅུ	Good qualities of a habitable place. TS7 I 269.
དགེ-རྒན	= dge bskos rgan pa. Chief disciplinarian of a monastery. Petech.
དགེ-རྒྱས	ZubhakRstna. N. of a god.
དགེ-རྩམ	A tax for feeding monks. See Goldstein, Taxation 11.
དགེ-སྦྱོང	sgra bshad ni / sha ni po shadha zhes pa gso zhing sbyong ba ste / rang gzhan gyi nad dang sdug bsngal gso zhing sbyong bar byed pa'i don no // zhes tA ra nA tha'i byams smon 'grel par gsungs la / spyir so thar gyi sdom khrims lhur len gyis sbyong bar byed mkhan thar 'dod rab byung dge tshul slong pho mo spyi'i ming. དགོ-དགོ	See pha bong dgo dgo.
དགོག-ཏུ-གྱུར-པ	Btsan-lha.
དགོན-བུ	= dgon chung. BBNP 482.
དགོན-དུང	O.T. = chu med pa. Skt. jaGgala (arid land, desert, quite the opposite of the English usage of 'jungle,' which has to be lush with vegetation; see Hobson-Jobson). Blan 295.1. Btsan-lha. M.Vy. 5299.
དགོན-ལག	branch monasteries. Sources.
དགོན-པ-བ	one who dwells in solitude (or in wilderness, i.e., away from the villages).
དགོང-བ	Btsan-lha.
དགོངས-དོན	underlying purpose or intention.
དགོངས-པ	1. Buddhathought. 2. When preceded by genitive--intended meaning (of)..., the meaning behind..., intention. 3. Underlying meaning/purpose. Skt. sandhi—conjunction, transition; abhisandhi—purpose, intention; aza—wish, desire prospect. Intimation, implication, intention. Thurman. Sometimes, 'permission.' Germano, Poetic Thought 959.
དགོངས-ཅན-བཞི	Dung-dkar 153.
དགོངས-པ-ལྔ	Original entry: [sangs rgyas kyi] dgongs pa lnga. 129 V 136.1.
དགོངས-པ-ལོན-བྱུང	Stein.

དགོས-པ-བཞི	dge ba'i bshes gnyen sdig pa'i grogs por ma song ba zhig dgos / yi dam gyi lha bdud du ma song ba zhig dgos / stong nyid bsgom pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por ma song ba zhig dgos so. (There only seem to be 3 necessities listed here!) Bka'-gdams Thor-bu 39r.1.

དགུ	besides the usual meaning 'nine,' it also often means 'many.' A special expression using ma and dgu: rtog ges ma brtags dgu brtags kyang // zhen pa'i 'ching las grol mi srid. Samdo A III 185r.2. myi rig dgu rig / myi dran dgu dran / myi shes dgu shes / myi mkhyen dgu mkhyen / mi gsal dgu gsal / myi 'gyu dgu 'gyu ba 'di yin no. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 258.1.
དགུ-དྲུས	(sp?) KP3 325.6. See rgu drus.
དགུ-གཞུར	= dgu bzhur. a game using 9 black & 9 white pebbles. BBNP 477, 480.
དགུ-ཁྲ	dgu khra ma thug pa lhag lhag rtse ba ni / rtsed mo'i rnam pa rde'u dkar nag dgu dgu lta bu bzhag ste rtses pas phan tshun rgyal pham de bsnyon med du go ba zhig yin nam slar zhib tu rtsad bcad mdzod. Dpe-chos 516.
དགུ-ཕྲུགས	dgu tshan. Gces 586.5.
དགུ-སྟེ	Btsan-lha.
དགུ-ཐུབ	SS 458.3.
དགུ-ཐུག	A soup served at new years (29th day of the last month) with dumplings containing 'omens.' The dumplings may be in various symbolic shapes, and contain symbolic objects. The person getting a dumpling containing paper will be learned and virtuous (or a victim of theft); wood indicates life as a poor man walking with a stick; a pebble indicates life as durable as a diamond rock; salt suggests cleverness and reknown; wood (repeated?) is for disease; and cayenne pepper for a temperamental personality (sharp tongue). charcoal of course means one has 'dark thoughts.' onion means you will have body odor. Chab-spel Tshe-brtan-phun-tshogs has written an article on the subject (included in his volume of collected works). Other explanations of the objects found in Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 63.
དགུ-ཟི	a kind of knife. Btsan-lha.
དགུ-ན-མེད	Btsan-lha.
དགུགས	Btsan-lha.

དཀར-ནག-ཁྲ-གསུམ	Dung-dkar 133.

དཀར-ནག-ནད-ལས-གྲོལ-བ	a medicinal preparation. BT 9v.4.
དཀར-ན-ཞོ-དམར-ན-ཁྲག	Proverb: If it's good, its definitely good, if bad, it's definitely bad. 367 II 131.3. [literally, If it's white, its yoghurt, if red, it's blood].
དཀར-མོ-ཉ	See thar nu.
དཀར-མོ-རྩེ-རྒྱལ	N. of a white hat worn by Bonpos in Amdo. Tsering Thar's article on Tantric practitioners in Kokonor.

དཀྲེ	penis; (?) O.T. = mo mtshan gyi tog. Blan 306.3. pho mtshan gyi tog. Btsan-lha. the tip of the penis. Also called Myos byed, tog, 'dod pa'i rgyal mtshan. DD illus. 21.

དཀུ-བ-རྣམ-པ-ལྔ	A group of 5 smelly food substances known from the Vinaya. After eating, one shouldn't visit a temple for 7 days. Dung-dkar 141.
དཀྱར	4 14B.3. Acc. to Jaeschke, this is a Zangskar & Ladakhi term for a kind of snowshoe. Rockhill says the word and the object it stands for is unknown in other parts of Tibet; see Das, JTL&CT 26. Yisun doesn't have it, but in Dag-yig, it is said to be a kind of boot known in regional dialects as 'gyur rta.
དཀྱེལ-པོ-ཆེ	blo gros can zhes pa'i don. Dung-dkar 151.

དམད	smad pa'am phab pa. Btsan-lha.
དམག	For cognates, see Beckwith in TS7 II 1051.
དམག-དམངས	popular forces. Sources.
དམག-དཔོན	commander. Sources.
དམག-དུམ	detachment of the army. Sources.
དམག-གྲལ	battle line. Sources.
དམག-ཁྲལ	soldier tax. Each village required to supply central government with a fixed number of soldiers. Goldstein, Taxation 14.
དམག-རུམ	mun pas thibs pa. Btsan-lha.
དམག-སྟོངས	dmag rogs. Btsan-lha.
དམག-ཚོ	militia (composed of ordinary taxpayers whose common obligation is to take up arms during time of war). Sources.
དམག-གི-བྲང	dmag mi sdod gnas sam dmag sgar. Btsan-lha.

དམན-པ	blun pa'am blo rig mi gsal ba. Btsan-lha.
དམན-པ-ས-བརྒྱད	rigs kyi sa / brgyad pa'i sa / mthong ba'i sa / srabs pa'i sa / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa / nyan thos kyi sa / rang rgyal gyi sa rnams so. 600 112.
དམར-བསད	niedermetzeln. Kaschewsky2.
དམར-བྱང	dmar byang bya ba ni sngan chad yi ger ma thegs pa la zer ba yin no. Zhi-byed Coll. II 134.1. Perhaps a 'red register' of orality is opposed to a 'black register' of book writing.
དམར-དཔེ	? Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 23.
དམར-གསོད	execution. Sources.
དམར-གསུམ	Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 172.
དམར-ཁྲིད	Teaching method in which the subject is explained using practical examples and diagrams. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 16. See BA 927. Used on analogy with a physician who cuts open a cadaver and points directly to the various internal organs. A kind of metaphorical 'dissection.' don de gsal rjen du khrid pa. Dagyab. gsal bar khrid zin pa'i don. Chödag. 27 98. Compare nag khrid.
དམར-ལམ	dmyig gi rtsa ma 'khrugs na snang ba dmar lam myi mchi'. Zhi-byed Coll. II 343.5. snang ba thams cad dmar lam gyis song nas / phyi rol gyi thams cad mi mdzes pa dang. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 489.3.
དམར-ལས	sha khrag gi las ka. Nomads 246.
དམར-ལེབ	an insect (srin bu). See ma ru rtse.
དམར-མཆོད	blood sacrifice. TS7 I 143.
དམར-རྫས	depiction of sacrifices; depiction of sacrifices. Jackson.
དམར-རྒྱན	meat offering (lit.: red ornament, offering to MahAkala), used euphemistically for execution. Sources.
དམར-རུ	('village dialect') = dmar po. BBNP 466.
དམར-ཤད	= smyag shad, smag shad. JD 109. SS 524.1. = 'brog dgar, smya ga. DG 220.4.
དམར-སྐྱ	pink; pink. Jackson.
དམར-སྲང	A currency unit, perhaps equivalent to a certain measure of copper. In O.T. document, a woman was sold for several of these. See Takeuchi, Old Tibetan Contracts.
དམར-ཐབ	me thog tu khrag dang sha khu sogs shor ba. There are also terms for ovens with water spilled on them, nag thab, and milk products, dkar thab. Btsan-lha. Part of a set of kosher kitchen tips.
དམར-ཚག	redness (of the eyes). Text 27.
དམར-ཚན	A water with various other substances added to make it red. It is supposed to contain blood of 3 animals. See Karmay in JA (1995) 173, etc.
དམར-ཟལ	dmar khra. Btsan-lha.
དམར-རྒྱངས-ཀྱིས	= dmar lam gyis. BBNP 484. Btsan-lha.
དམར-རུ-ལ-བྲིས	dmar por bris pa'i ming dang skabs 'gar dmar ru la bris zhes pa blo la bzung ba la go dgos pa yod de. Btsan-lha.
དམར-ཆེན-བཅུ-གསུམ-ཐང	BT 7v.3.
དམར-ཆེན-རིལ-བུ	BP 201.3.
དམར-ཆེན-སྐོར-གསུམ	ku ru kulle / tshogs bdag / 'dod rgyal lo. 600 19.
དམར-ཆུང-སྐོར-གསུམ	ku ru kulle gser gyi snying thag can / nor rgyun ma dmar mo / lha mo ti nu ma'o. 600 19-20.
དམར-པོ-སྲིན-སྐྱེས	See a ka ru.
དམར-པོ-དྲི-ལྡན	See ldong ros.

དམར-ཐང-བཅུ-གཉིས-སྦྱོར	rgya lugs dmar thang bcu gnyis sbyor. a medicinal preparation. BT 15v.5.
དམར-མོ-སྤྱི-འཇོམས-བཤལ-སྦྱོར	BP 236.1.
དམར-ཐག-བཅད-པ	See 192-vol. 2nd ed. of Bon Kanjur LIX 201.5: gang zhig rig pa'i rtsa[l] ldan gyi // don du dmar thag bcad pa ni // don ni sems nyid ma bcos pa // dmar thag byung tshor dran pa'i rgyu // bcad pa ngo bo stong pa nges...
དམར-ཐག-ཆོད-པ-དང	Original entry: [nyi ma] dmar thag chod pa dang. sobald die rote Sonne untergegangen war. Kretsch.
དམེ	(sometimes spelled rme) 'impurity' to be ritually cleansed away, usually this is a 'blight' caused by murder, especially the murder of a member of the same clan or family. See Karmay in JA (1995) 164. This 'blight' is ritual purified through fumigation, while mnol is ritually purified through lustrations. See under nang dme. 'a type of impure condition brought about by murders, violent quarrels, etc., among members of the same family or the same religious confraternity.' Norbu, Drung 259, n. 6. TS6 131. Btsan-lha.
དམེ-བ	dbre ba'am btsog pa. Btsan-lha.
དམེ-བོ	rus gcig pa gsod mkhan. Btsan-lha.
དམེ-མ	= btsog ma. BBNP 481. Btsan-lha. See bra ma.
དམེ-མོ	murduress. mi gsod pa'i bud med. Btsan-lha.
དམེ-རག-མོ	a woman who has murdered her husband, or some equivalent crime (see Norbu, Drung 263, n. 81.
དམེའ-བྱུང	phan tshun gsod res byas pa. Btsan-lha.
དམིག	ZZ = mig. Bru II 290.6. = mig. "eye." Kuijp (1986) 34. bu ga. Btsan-lha. A spelling for mig, 'eye,' in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 287.7, for examples.
དམིག-དམག	chess. TS7 II 1055.
དམིག-རིལ	= mig 'bras. "eyeball." Kuijp (1986) 34.
དམིགས-བུ	O.T. = long khrid. Blan 298.2. long ba 'khrid mkhan. Btsan-lha.
དམིགས-གཏད	mental object (in meditation or otherwise. In meditation, the focussed-on object or visualization). Klong-chen-pa 8.9.
དམིགས-པ	directing one's thoughts to the benefit of a particular person or object, to give someone one's attention, to perform special prayers. A translation that works in most of it's contexts is 'focal object' (suggested by Pempa Dorje, Sarnath).
དམིགས-རྣམ	(a compound) focal object and its (pure or impure) aspects.
དམིགས-ཡུལ	object of meditation, object of attention.
དམིགས-པ-བཞི	zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa bzhi ni / khyab pa'i dmigs pa / dpyad pa rnam sbyong gi dmigs pa / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa / nyon mongs rnam sbyong gi dmigs pa'o. 600 28. khyab pa'i dmigs pa bzhi ni / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan / rnam rtog med pa'i gzugs brnyan / dngos po'i mtha' / dgos pa yongs grub bo. 600 28-29.
དམོད-བཙུགས	bden tshig gi dmod bcol ba. dam bdar ba. Btsan-lha.
དམོད-མོ	bden pa bdar ba. Btsan-lha.
དམོད-པ-བོར	gzhan la log smon 'debs pa. Btsan-lha.
དམོད-པ-ཟུག-པ	mthu dang byad ka zug pa. Btsan-lha.
དམོད-མི-དམའ-བ	dpangs mtho ba. Btsan-lha.
དམུ	gdon bgegs sam 'byung po'i bye brag cig. a clan. Btsan-lha. Discussed in Karmay, Arrow 252 ff.
དམུ-ཆུ	lus skrangs pa'i nad cig gi ming ste, yul skad du <<chu skrangs>> zer. Dag-yig. SRZT 38. Text 36, 65. Lag-len 276.4. Kong-sprul/1 38 ff.: An advanced stage of 'water swelling' disease in which the swelling becomes obvious externally. (The earlier stages are called skya rbab and 'or nad.) This disease can accompany other diseases in which case it is difficult to diagnose and cure. It can come at the end of colds, flu and 'bam, so it is necessary to keep a close watch on the pulse and urine. When not accompanied by another disease, it is easily recognized and treated. The several types of dmu chu are subsumed under the categories of hot (tsha chu) and cold (grangs chu), q.v. In colloquial language, it is called literally 'water swelling' (chu skrangs, this according to Dag-yig). Donden 104: "Protrusion of the stomach due to an accumulation of water there. This and other ailments involving an accumulation of water occur as a result of poor digestive heat."
དམུ-གི	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 301.
དམུ-གཤེན	Karmay, Treasury vocab.
དམུ-ལུམ	zu lum Gces 590.1. gzu lum. Btsan-lha.
དམུ-རྫིང	char chu bsags pa'i rdzing bu (a cistern?). Dpe-chos 514. Btsan-lha.
དམུ-རྒོད	mi bsrun pa dang 'dul dka' sogs du ma. Btsan-lha.
དམུ-སྐས	Karmay, Treasury. nam mkhar yar mar 'gro sa'i skas ka. Btsan-lha.
དམུ-ཐག	nam mkhar 'gro sa'i dpyang thag. Btsan-lha. Karmay, Treasury vocab.
དམུ-ཚ	sword (?). Generally meaning 'nephew of dmu'. Karmay, Treasury.
དམུ-ཡབ	skyid lang shor ba'i spyod ngan rgyags che ba. Btsan-lha.
དམུ-ཡད	= dngos grub. Generally means bdud rtsi: nectar, ambrosia. Karmay, Treasury. Btsan-lha. See in the Zhang-zhung dictionary (this word also occurs in Dunhuang Tibetan texts). Namdak.
དམུ-ཞག	g.yang dang bcud. Btsan-lha.
དམུན-པ	O.T. = blun pa. Blan 291.6. Btsan-lha.
དམུར-དམུར-བ	kha ldad rgyag tshul. Btsan-lha.
དམུས-བྱུང	O.T. = tshi chad. = yi chad. Blan 285.3. spro ba shi ba'am sun byung ba. Btsan-lha.
དམུས-ལོང	mngal nas long ba. Btsan-lha. skyes dus nas mig med pa la 'ga' zhig tu bshad. Eimer, Dbyangs 56.
དམུས-པ	O.T. = tshi tshad pa. Blan 305.1. yang yang nyams nyes byung ba. smon pa. Btsan-lha.
དམྱལ-བ	tsha ba'i dmyal ba brgyad ni / yang sos / thig nag / bsdus 'joms / ngu 'bod / ngu 'bod chen po / tsha ba / rab tu tsha ba / mnar med rnams so. 600 100-101. grang ba'i dmyal ba brgyad ni / chu bur can / chu bur rdol ba / a chu zer ba / kye hud zer ba / so tham tham pa / utpal ltar gas pa / padma ltar gas pa / padma ltar cher gas pa rnams so. 600 101. leb leb mor byed pa. Btsan-lha.
དམྱེ	gnyen tshan nang gsod byed pa. Btsan-lha.

དམྱིག-ཟི-ཟི-པོ	mig rab rib. Btsan-lha.
དམྱིག-ལི-གོང-ལྡོང-པོ	mig ril la skyon yod pa. Btsan-lha.
དམྱིགས-པ	dmigs pa'am bsam yul. Btsan-lha.
དམྱིགས-ཕྱེ	dbye ba phye ba. Btsan-lha.
དམྱུགས-པ	phyir bton pa. Btsan-lha.
དངགས	O.T. = dag [ngag?]. Blan 304.5. ngag dang tha snyad. Btsan-lha.
དངགས-ཀྱི-དཔེ	= kha ngag gam kha skad kyi dpe. dngags is an obs. word for ngag, or for tha snyad. BBNP 475.
དངན	See Blan 302.3.
དངན-འཐེན	gzhan gyi nor ram rdzas khyer ba phyir brgyangs nas mi sprod pa. Btsan-lha.

དངོས	a rather uncommon (and probably rather old) form of first-person pronoun, noticed by C.Stearns in his study of Dmar-ston's history.

དངོས-རྒྱུ	direct cause; direct or immediate cause (as for instance, the Vajropama SamAdhi is the direct cause of Enlightenment).
དངོས-སུ	explicitly; explicitly, directly...
དངོས-པོ-བརྒྱད	gzhi shes / lam shes / rnam mkhyen / rnam rdzogs sbyor ba / mthar gyis sbyor ba / rtse mo'i sbyor ba / skad cig ma'i sbyor ba / 'bras bu chos kyi sku rnams so. 600 115.
དངོས-པོ-དགུ	a special category used by Rong-zom-pa. See Almogi, MA thesis 14. 1. dkyil 'khor. 2. dam tshig. 3. sgrub pa. 4. dbang. 5. phrin las. 6. sngags. 7. phyag rgya. 8. ting nge 'dzin. 9. mchod pa.
དངོས-པོ-གནས-ཚུལ	things just as they are.
དངོས-པོ-མཚན-མ-མེད-པ	devoid of [without] thingness and labels.
དངོས-གྲུབ-བརྒྱད	thun mong gi dngos grub brgyad ni / ril bu'i dngos grub / mig sman gyi dngos grub / sa 'og gi dngos grub / ral gri'i dngos grub / mkha' la 'phur ba'i dngos grub / mi snang ba'i dngos grub / 'chi ba med pa'i dngos grub / nad 'joms pa'i dngos grub rnams so. 600 113. thun mong gi dngos grub brgyad ni / bcud len / ral gyi / sa 'og / myig sman / rkang mgyogs / ri lu / mchil lham / gnod sbyin mo rnams so. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 211.3.
དངོས-གྲུབ-དགུ	sa 'og gi dngos grub / steng 'gro'i dngos grub / ral gri'i dngos grub / tshar gcod phan 'dogs kyi dngos grub / ril bu'i dngos grub / mig sman gyi dngos grub / gter gyi dngos grub / rkang mgyogs kyi dngos grub / bcud len gyi dngos grub bo. 600 123. དོ	As in mtsho do. island in a lake. Karmay, Treasury.

དོ-ཧ	This Skt. borrowing actually means mi zad pa, but Tibetans took it to mean gnyis la rgod pa. Blan 310.5. An etymology is proposed in Sa-pan's Sdom Gsum (1971) 91r.5. See also Kurtis Schaefer's dissertation, which has an important discussion.

དོན-ལྔ	glo ba / snying / mkhal ma / mtsher ba / mchin pa'o. 600 60. Text 56.
དོན-མོ	(f.) liberated sheep. Holler in TS9 II 208.
དོན-མཐུན	O.T. = tshong pa. Also, = 'gron po. Blan 304.4. Btsan-lha.
དོན-པོ	don gyi snying po. snyegs pa dang 'ded pa. Btsan-lha. dgos pa. Can find this word used in a citation from Rje-btsun Grags-pa-rgyal-mtshan, in Tsong-kha-pa's Sngags-rim Chen-mo (PRC book-style ed.), p. 433: sa steng rgyas par kun tu btsal byas kyang // phan pa'i don po gdams ngag dam tshig ste. dge sdig gi don po shes nas rnam smin la mi 'dzem pa de snying med yin. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 53.5. N. for liberated sheep, 'god sheep.' Holler in TS9 II 208.
དོན-རྒྱུགས	Debating examination to test comprehension of the main study topics. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 39-40.
དོན-དམ-གཉིས	rnam grangs pa'i don dam dang / grangs ma yin pa'i don dam mo. 600 4.
དོན-དམ-དུ-གྲུབ-པ	ultimate status. Skt. paramarthasiddhi. Thurman.
དོན-དུ-གཉེར-བ	provide for, strive to procure; to provide for, strive to procure.
དོན-དུ-བསྐོར-གྱིས-བསྐོར-ན	don hril gyis dril na. Btsan-lha.
དོན-སྣོད-ཀྱི-ཚ-བ	SRZT 49.
དོན-བྱ-ཚུལ-བཅུ-གཅིག	byang chub sems dpas sems can gyi don bya tshul bcu gcig ni / bye ba byed pa dang sdug bsngal gyi grogs kyi don byed pa / thabs la rmongs pa'i don byed pa / phan 'dogs pa'i don byed pa / 'jigs pas nyen pa'i don byed pa / mya ngan gyis gzir ba'i don byed pa / yo byad kyis 'phongs pa'i don byed pa / gnas 'cha' bar byed pa'i don byed pa / blo mthun par 'dod pa'i don byed pa / yang dag par zhugs pa'i don byed pa / log par zhugs pa'i don byed pa / rdzu 'phrul gyi sgo nas gdul bya'i don byed pa rnams so. 600 152.
དོན-གྱིས-འཐོབ	by implication, by extension of this point, for that same reason... Jinpa.
དོན-སྙིང-ལྐོག-མར-འབྱིན-པ	'jigs skrag chen po skyed bcug pa. Btsan-lha.
དོན-གྱི-དབང-གཟིགས	to see the real point (of this general interpretation by a highly honored person).
དོང	An O.T. word that occurs in the tantra Dgongs-'dus. Stein in JA (1995) 125, says that it means aller [in French].
དོང-བུ	ga'u lta bu'i sgrom chung. Btsan-lha.
དོང-ཆུ	well water; khron chu. well water.
དོང-ག	JD 91. = bdud rtsi gsar bu, sa'u ci'u. Spelled dong ka in KP3 336.6. = bshal sman. YTTM 291.16. SS 447.3. purging cassia. Clifford, list. = kaNDi ka ra, shyA ma ka ra, nya sha ka ra, sha myang ka, a rak ta, rA dza brik Su, ljon shing gi rgyal po. DG 202.3.
དོང-གྲ	See (sman) sga. Spelled dong kra in YTTM 291.16.
དོང-པ	= dong po, ldon po. tube (of bamboo). Sources. quiver (for arrows). = sag thag, = stag ral. BBNP 467.
དོང-རལ	mda' ltong. Btsan-lha. See 'bri mig.
དོང-སྤྲུག	'khor ba dong sprug ni dong nang gi mi gtsang ba nyal nyil thams cad sprug nas ma lus par byas pa ltar gnas skabs de'i 'khor ba'i sems can ma lus par sangs rgyas par mos pa'i don te / rnying rgyud kyi dgongs pa 'khor ba dong sprugs kyi man ngag ces pa zhig kyang yod do. Dpe-chos 514. Btsan-lha.
དོང-སྟེ	O.T. = song ste. See 'dong. Blan 295.6, 516.3. song ba. Btsan-lha.
དོང-ཙེ	coin; 'copper coin,' derived from Chinese acc. to Beyer, CT Lang. 141. gsum pa sgal tshigs gser gyi dong tshe ltar rtsegs pas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 87.3 (also, I 132.2). Evidently it is quite an old word in Chinese, since there is a Karlgren reconstruction (an added note note to Das entry).

དཔྱད-གསུམ	bsreg bcad brdar ba gsum gyis brtag. The Buddha said, Let monks and scholars accept what I say not out of veneration for me, but after testing it well by burning, cutting and rubbing.

དྲ-འཆག-པ	phyi ru 'byung ba'i dra 'chag pa'i stobs kyis / nang du gsal dangs kyi 'dangs 'chag. Zhi-byed Coll. V 236.5. na so rgas nas 'byung ba dra chag pa'i nyams len des. Zhi-byed Coll. V 238.2.

དྲ-བ-དྲ-ཕྱེད	Fabric temple-hanging forming a kind of latticework of jewels and auspicious symbols which seem to be spit out of the mouth of a kIrtimukha. Illus. in Yisun. drwa ba drwa phyed / dra ba dra phyed de / sgo 'phyor dang mthongs sgor sogs kyi mdzes rgyan. Gser Sbram 299.
དྲ-བ-ཐིག-སླད	See se yab.

དྲྭ-བ	For a study of the original idea of 'Indra's net,' see Hartzell, Dissert. 835-6.

དུ-བ	Namdak.
དུ-ག	a slight deformation of Skt. duHkha. Zhi-byed Coll. II 25.7.
དུ-ཁུ	smokey liquid. Huber in Huber, Sacred Spaces 93.
དུ-མ	"the manifold" (of saMsAra and nirvANa).
དུ-རུ	du ma'am mang po. Btsan-lha.
དུ-ཀུ-ལའི-རས	M.Vy. 9162: daukUlaka. Silk, Dissert. 378.
དུ-རུ-ཀ	[= tu ru ka] From Skt. tu ru Shka, forgetting that it meant only gar log, they thought it just mean ngan pa and, so, could say bskal pa du ru ka/ me du ru ka/ chu du ru ka/ sa du ru ka/ , etc. Blan 310.3. du ru ka dang ma ki ta'i ri lu. Zhi-byed Coll. III 76.7.
དུབ-པ	see under bud med kyis dub pa.
དུབས-སུ	dus su. Btsan-lha.
དུད-ཆུང	"small smoke, small household." Unlike the khral pa, these did not hold significant amounts of land and did not hold it for long term. Their tax burden was light. There are two types, "tied" and mi bogs. Goldstein, Taxation 5. Dargyay, TVC 27. Epstein, Dissertation 203. TPS 14.
དུད-ཁ	smoke colour. Jackson.
དུད-ཁུ	du ba'i mdog. color of smoke.. a disease. BT 18v.4. Text 82.
དུད-ཀྲལ	dud khral. Btsan-lha.
དུད-མཁན	See bong bu.
དུད-པ	Also, dud grangs. Here 'smoke' means a household, used in Mongol period census (Petech 1983: 186).
དུད-རྡོག	Haarh, Yar-lun 231.
དུད-རྡུལ	'khrug pa. Btsan-lha.
དུད-སྔོན	bluish smoke color; bluish smoke color. Jackson.
དུད-གནམ-ལ-བཏང-ཚད-ཤོག	"Whoever sends smoke to the sky... come!" A drafted labor tax only occasionally invoked for public works projects such as canal repair. Goldstein, Taxation 20.
དུད-འགྲོའི-མེ	See gi wang.
དུད-སྣ-ཕོ-ལོ	rgyu nor dang phyugs zog thams cad 'phrog pa. Btsan-lha.
དུད-པ-བྱ-བལ	See nya lcibs.
དུད-རྔོག-ཆགས	dud 'gro lus la spu yod pa'i rigs. Btsan-lha.
དུག	poison; On poison folklore, see David-Neel, My Journey to Lhasa 303. Maraini 54-5. Also, McGovern's travel book. Refers to contaminants of all sorts and not 'poison' exclusively. Sha dug (meat contamination) for instance, means contamination found in flesh foods, what we would popularly know as 'food poisoning' (although of course it is likely to be caused by microorganisms). Reg dug (touch contamination) may at times refer to syphillis. Tibetan medicine recognizes many different types. Text 10, et passim.
དུག-འཆེར	Giftdorn.
དུག-གསུམ	'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go. 600 11.
དུག-ལྟང	dug lang ba. Btsan-lha. dug ldang??
དུག-མ	female poison giver. Havnevik, Dissertation 243. dug gtong mkhan. Btsan-lha.
དུག-ནད	SRZT 131 ff.
དུག-པ	ngan pa. rnying pa. Btsan-lha.
དུག-ཕྱུང	As a Bon ritual, see Karmay in JA (1995) 173.
དུག-པོ	dug tse ste gos rnying lhan pa can lus rgyab dros pa tsam la brten. 367 I 241.3. dug po spung nge ni gos rnying ral chad spung nge bar byas nas zhes pa'o. Dpe-chos 516. hrul ba'i dug po gon. Zhi-byed Coll. II 441.2.
དུག-སེལ	to guarantee against poison, by taking the first sip or bite. MTTP.
དུག-ཤོ	(coll.) a plant that thrives under dirty environmental conditions. MTTP.

དྭ-ལིས	A kind of rhododendron? = da li. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). Singh (p. 179): From Sanskrit tAlIza, perhaps Taxus baccata Linn. or more likely a species of Rhododendron. Clifford, list.
དྭ-ཕྲུག	orphan; Waisenkind ('orphan'). Kaschewsky 83. Samdo A II 285r.6. da phrug ma dang phrad pa yis / the tsom dri ma sel bar byed. Zhi-byed Coll. I 304.5. Spelled do phrug in the following: gnyer byed myed pa'i do phrug gos sar pa'i re thag chad pas. An orphan who isn't entrusted to anyone has no hopes for new clothes, but isn't unhappy in wearing wornout ones. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 120.3. Daruka (Tib. Dwa-rog??) meaning 'young boy,' is a name of Shiva's son.

ཛིག	four; a 'secret' way of saying 'four,' used by gamblers. Norbu, Drung 229, n. 65.
ཛིག-མགོ-པ-ཏྲ	A Tibetanized borrowing of Skt. CipaTa, a monstrous looking face used as a decorative element on the capitals of Tibetan temple pillars. The more correct Tibetan spelling is Tsi pa Ta. Following is a quote from a forthcoming work of mine: "Rdzi 'go pa thra, Dzig mgo pa tra, Rtsi par and Ci mi 'dra [chimera?], probably all derived from the original Tibetan Tsi pa Ta, a loanword from Sanskrit CipaTa, which means 'flat-nosed' (but note also gzi gdong, 'splendorous face,' which may be a direct translation of KIrti-mukha)."
ཛོ-གི	This Tibetan way of writing yogin discussed in Dge-'dun-chos-'phel-gyi Gsung-rtsom (1990) I 267.
ཛོ-ཧ	a type of large seafaring vessel. See Aris, Discourse 59.
ཛོ-ཀ-ཀཾ	See a ka ru.
ཛུ-ལང-ས-ཀི	See dpa' rgod.
ཛྭ	= btso. 'bomb.' Karmay, Treasury. Has other spellings, including btso, tswo, dzo, etc.

ཨེ-ཨེ	interjection. Aha! Beyer, CT Lang. 147.
ཨེ-གོ	do you understand? do you get it?

གཡབ-དར	part of shaman's costume. TS7 II 1095.
གཡབ-གཡུག	to wave. MTTP.
གཡབ-མོ	a beckoning gesture. bsod nams bar chod kyi g.yab mo yin pas 'jig rten gyi che thabs shig. Zhi-byed Coll. II 251.5. longs spyod chags sdang gi g.yab mo yin pas nor yang ma sog. Ibid. III 25.5. Ibid. IV 124.5. bsod nams bar chod kyi g.yab mo yin. Ibid. V 276.2. byang chub thob tu mi ster ba'i 'dre phyi nas nang du g.yab mo g.yob pa yin par go ba long gsol. Ibid. V 276.5. a beckoning gesture with a flag or the hand. Yisun.
གཡབ-འདོར-བ	g.yab mo byed pa. Btsan-lha.
གཡབས-པ	bsdu 'gugs byas pa. Btsan-lha. g.yob pa'i 'das pa / tshur bkug pa'am phyogs gcig tu bsdus pa'i don. Gser Sbram 79.
གཡག	yak; [1] flatulence. = 'og rlung. "wind from bowels, fart (= rtug dri)." Kuijp (1986) 34. Yaks are famous for letting them, and so they are named in their honor. [2] A clan. Btsan-lha. [3] [male] yak. srin po'i g.yag 'di rgyab yan (i.e., rgya yan) btang myi bya. Zhi-byed Coll. I 285.3. JD 242. = (f.) 'bri. = yul 'brong. SS 540.5.
གཡག-རྒོད	JD 235. SS 498.1. = ri g.yag, 'brong. Clifford, list.
གཡག-རུ	g.yag rwa. Btsan-lha.
གཡག-ཤིང	sgo'i a shing 'dan bu. Btsan-lha.
གཡག-སྙིང	See pa yag. See pa re pa kon.
གཡག-བྲུས-པོ	rgyags pa. Gces 582.3. g.yag rgyags pa. Btsan-lha.
གཡལ-བ	yawn; = glal ba. "to yawn." Kuijp (1986) 34. An archaism, an unchangeable verb.
གཡལ-ལེ-གཡོལ-ལེ	dodgily. Soundings 31.
གཡམ	O.T. = zhar. Blan 292.4. zhar dang zhor. Btsan-lha.
གཡམ-པ	Haarh, Yar-lun 353, 383, etc. a naturally occuring stone slab. Yisun. Zhi-byed Coll. I 424.1.
གཡམ-རྒྱུག	zhor la rgyug pa. Btsan-lha.
གཡམ-སྒྲོམ	yam shing gi sgam mam rdo sgam. Btsan-lha.
གཡམ-ལ-རྒྱུགས-པ	zhor la rgyug pa. Btsan-lha.
གཡན-དགབ	One of the 13 essential possessions of a monk. It seems to be a very large cloth applied to the flesh of one afflicted by the disease g.yan pa, which is accompanied with itching. It was evidently not so much meant to cure the disease as to protect the robes from being soiled by the wounds. g.yan pa'i nad can gyis sha la sbyar nas gyon par bya ba'i gos shig. Btsan-lha.
གཡན-པ	'brum bu chung ngu'i nad cig. Btsan-lha. pags nad za 'phrug can zhig. Dag-yig. eat, devour, gnaw. Jaeschke. See Das. ringworm and similar skin diseases. Goldstein. rma'i na tsha za kong che zhing rnag chu ser 'dzag pa'i pags pa'i nad. Chödag. Text 46.
གཡན-སྒོག-པ	i tsha dang sgog pa. Btsan-lha.
གཡན-སྐྱོ-བ	'dzem med spyod pa'am co 'dri ba. Btsan-lha.
གཡང	Compare Southeast Asian concept of "yang" in Bonnefoy, ed., Asian Mythologies. It would seem quite an obvious idea to compare it to Chinese yang, as in yin-yang. A clan. Btsan-lha. Blondeau in Karmay, New Horizons 261. da res la rdog sna dred na / mi lus kyi g.yang nyams su 'gro bas / chos mi bya ba'i thabs med. Zhi-byed Coll. V 514.2.
གཡང-ཊི	(note the reversed 't'). A precious 'stone' taken from mines, of which the image of 'Phags-pa illustrated in Pho-brang Po-ta-la [1988], illus. no. 56 is made. It looks rather like 'jade,' but not really.
གཡང-བཞི	Vitali, Tho.ling 10.
གཡང-ཆོག	a ritual. See 12 XV.

Donkin, Dragon's Brain Perfume: An Historical Geography of Camphor, Indological Library vol. 14 (Leiden 1999), 307 pp. The word is Indic (Sanskrit karpUra) or perhaps Javanese in origin, although it could have come into Tibetan via Arabic (kAfUr). ག-རེ	'ga' re. Gces 586.4. Btsan-lha. As an interrogative, this doesn't seem to be in use in C.T., but I have noticed it used at beginnings of clauses (in Mani Bka'-'bum, other examples in Yisun), as a particle expressing reflection and doubt, perhaps to be translated 'What to do?'

ག-ས-ག-ལ	(coll.) all over, everywhich way, here there and everywhere.
གའུ	Thondup, BM 58. See also ske'i ga'u & ga bu. The term is used frequently in descriptions of the final burial of the emperor. See Haarh, Yar-lun, 213, and chap. 15.
གའུ-གསུམ-སྒྲོམ	A jewellery item illus. in Yisun.
གབ	brjod pa'i gab, = brjod pa'i tha snyad. BBNP 481.
གབ-འདྲེ	hidden ghost (in the machinery of samsara), metaphor for errant conceptualization. Samdo A V 59r.1.
གབ-ཁུང	Btsan-lha.
གབ-ལེ	apparently means 'custom,' 'tradition.'

གལ-ཏེ	a kind of food container. Btsan-lha. chos 'byung ba'i rgyur rkyen du sna tshogs 'gro ba'i brda ru / rten 'brel gyi gal te phyag na 'dzin. Zhi-byed Coll. II 140.3. 'khor ba la rang bzhin myed pa'i brda' ru / rten 'brel gyi gal te'i grib ma la bzhad. Ibid. II 167.1 (also, 296.4).

གམ-ཕྱེ-དམར-པོ	man ngag gam phye dmar po a medicinal preparation. BP 183.4, 229.1, 384.2.
གན	'heads' of a coin. Choix, P. tib. 1055 (note). bang mdzod. Btsan-lha. This syllable may preface the name of an article that is considered a treasure (ex., gan dril, 'treasured bell,' or gan dkar, 'treasured porcelain').

གདམས-ངག-མ-འགྲུས-ཀྱི-བར	gdams ngag ma lon gyi bar ram gdams ngag ma thob kyi bar. Btsan-lha.
གདན-བཞི	rdo rje gdan bzhi zhes pa'i gdan bzhi ni / bdag dang / gzhan dang / sbyor ba dang / gsang ba'o. 600 48.
གདན-གསུམ	sa skya pa'i lugs kyi gdan gsum tshang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa'i gdan gsum ni / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gdan / rig ma dang lha mo'i gdan / khro bo dang khro mo'i gdan no. 600 23.
གདན-ཚུགས	zhal tshugs sam / kha zas. Btsan-lha.
གདན-ཐིང-བ	gdan bting ba. Btsan-lha.
གདང	In Bon texts, may mean 'laundry items' (or items of apparel) of the deities (Namgyal Nyima). In general seems to refer to stretched out ropes, whether for clothes hanging or animal tethering. rta phyugs 'dogs byed kyi thag pa. Nomads 240.
གདང-ཆད	rta phyugs kyi gdang thag rnying pa. Nomads 240.
གདང-གང	first time. MTTP.
གདང-ཁ	bya pho gdang khar 'dzegs pa ni khyim bya skas kyi gdang bu la yar 'dzeg pa. Dpe-chos 508.
གདངས	in Rdzogs-chen, a kind of neither-subjective-nor-objective energy-manifestation. Norbu, Dzog Chen and Zen 34, n. 19. See mdangs. radiation. Germano in JIABS 17 no. 2 (1994) 316. nad las grol ba. bya gdang. Btsan-lha. rang gdangs is equiv. to rang mdangs. Stein.
གདངས-བུ	skas kyi gdangs bu. Btsan-lha.
གདངས-གདངས	See kha gdangs gdangs, zhal gdangs gdangs.
གདངས-གསུམ	Achard, L'Essence 105 n. 18.
གདངས-པ	byed lugs. nad sangs pa'am drag pa. Btsan-lha. ru rbal gyi myig 'di gdans na myi mthong btsum na mthong par 'dug gsung. He said, when the turtle opens its eyes wide it doesn't see, but when it squints it sees. Zhi-byed Coll. II 177.4.
གདར	= bdar in Gzer-myig. "right to the bottom, end, etc." Kvaerne, Bonpo Wheel 283, n. 25. bdar ba. nar mo dbyibs can. mthar thug pa. Btsan-lha. ka ra'i gdar la phyogs myed bu ram gyi shing 'di bza' dgos. Zhi-byed Coll. II 212.5.
གདར-ཤ	membrane (of an egg), integument. Frequently used in Rdzogs-chen (and elsewhere) as metaphor. Klong-chen-pa 10.21. gdar sha gcod pa means to solve something through testing and investigation. Also spelled bdar sha, which might be more correct.
གདས-པ	O.T. = smra ba. = zhus pa. = zhu ba pa. Blan 297.1-.2. smra ba'am / zhus pa'am / go ba sogs. Btsan-lha.

གདེང-ཚད-བཞི	confidences. See dengs bzhi.

གདེངས	confidence, assured expectation, competence. Karmay, Great Perfection 25 n. 25, 130, 144.

གླང-ཤིང	the wood of the glang (or glang ma, willow?) tree. See mdzo mo shing.
གླང-སྣ	[1] 'Elephant snout,' an architectural detail found in the capitals of pillars (see illus. in Pho-brang Po-ta-la [1988], illus. no. 14 following p. 29). See also Po-ta-la (1996) 49. [2] Also n. of a flower, mem tog glang sna. JD 181: Grows from a single root. The leaves are hard, dark green and notched. The middle of the dark, mottled flower is shaped like an elephant's trunk, hence the name. Fundamentals 16.2 (item 17). KP1 48.3. Sde-srid/2 531.5: It grows in sunlight and shade. It grows from a single root and stalk. It has a hundred tiny flowers. See me tog glang sna.
གླང-ཐབས	'colic.' SRZT 90. Text 12, 14, 16, 38, 49, 65, 66, 75. Lag-len (text 11, no. 16). SRZT 90: Contributing causes are 'hot' and 'cold' classified disorders due to 'worms' (srin bu) and disagreeable diet. Although there are many types, they may all be placed in the categories of 'hot,' 'cold,' 'worm,' and 'infectious' glang thabs. Whenever there is pain below the upper opening of the stomach (lhen sne), it is "stomach glang thabs." If below the navel, it is "intestinal glang thabs." If in the vicinity of the navel, it is "abdominal glang thabs." If on the right side, it is "blood glang thabs." If on the left side, it is "worm glang thabs." If in the middle it is called "tsampa (parched barley flour) glang thabs." If there is jumpiness, lethargy and sweating, it is "hot glang thabs (caused by 'heat disorders'). Without the jumpiness and lethargy, it is "cold glang thabs (from 'cold disorders'). When it is caused by too much milk or sweet foods, the pains are like a hot piercing or as if wound up in a ball. When there is much jumpiness and lethargy, and one cannot bear to stand up, it is 'worm glang thabs." When it feels like a knife is stirring around in the stomach and intestines, it is 'infectious lhan thabs. See Glang thabs (Acute Diseases of the Organs of the Abdominal Cavity) and their Correction in Tibetan Medicine, ed. by B.V. Semichov, in TM IV (1981).
གླང-པོ-བརྒྱད	phyogs kyi glang po brgyad ni / sa srung bu / padma dkar po / g.yon phyogs / mig sman / sa la dga' / me tog so can / sa kun la grags pa / cha mdzes rnams so. 600 106.

གཉན	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 296. a clan. Btsan-lha. T&BS I 327. Discussed in Karmay, Arrow 253 ff. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 35. In 64 I 79, these spirits are clearly associated with trees just as btsan are associated with rocks, nAgas with water. = ru ru, e rgya, kri na sa ra, 'khri snyan sa le. JD 232. SS 498.2.
གཉན-འདུལ	JD 172.
གཉན-ཆེན	class of mundane deities inhabiting the middle air (bar snang) between klu and lha. Pre-Buddhist in origin, they were forcibly enlisted to the service of Buddhism. MTTP.
གཉན-ཁམས	(Dbus, Gtsang) realm of the Gnyan (i.e., the atmosphere). MTTP.
གཉན-ནད	gnyan gyis bskyed pa'i 'go nad rigs shig ste, 'di la klad gzer sogs nad rigs mi 'dra ba bco brgyad yod par bod kyi sman gzhung du gsal. Dag-yig. Text 39, 43, 70.
གཉན-པ	exalted, dignified, solemn. Karmay, Treasury.
གཉན-རིམས	SRZT 55.
གཉན-རྩེ	a clan. Btsan-lha.
གཉན-སྐྲངས	SRZT 58.
གཉན-ཚད	Text 22, 32.

གཉང	bshang ba'am dri chen. Btsan-lha.
གཉས-བ	nges pa. Gces 590.1. Btsan-lha.
གཉེ-བ	KP1 74.6. KP3 274.3. KP4 417.5.
གཉེ-མ	DD illus. 17.
གཉེ-པོ	pho nya. Btsan-lha.
གཉེམས-པ	perhaps cognate to snyems pa, 'prideful, arrogant.' "vigorous, forceful, bold, courageous." Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 317. drag po. Btsan-lha. Zhi-byed Coll. II 22.3, 22.6.
གཉེན-དཀར	spun mched gnyen nye ring dang dga' nye blo dkar gyi bsdus ming. Btsan-lha.
གཉེན-པོ	'joms byed dang zhi byed. overcomer or pacifier. Seems to mean rather a kind of friendly opposition, an antidote, a harmony restorer. Counteragent, aiding force. bag ma bsu skyel byed mkhan. Nomads 237.
གཉེན-སྒྲིག	gnyen byed pa. Nomads 237.
གཉེན-ཏེ	bos te. Btsan-lha. 'brel te'am 'dren te.

གཉེན-ཚོངས	Word used for wife-sale (marriage by sale), in opposition to mjal tshongs (?). Used in O.T. document.
གཉེན-ཟླ	fit for matrimonial alliance (as to birth, etc.). Sources.
གཉེན-དུ-སྡེབས-པ	to intermarry. Sources.

གོ-གར	Btsan-lha.
གོ-ཁ	thab kyi sgo. Nomads 233. Door of the oven. See illus. in Nomads 269.
གོ-ལ	[1] Generally, a globe or anything globular. "Globe," from Sanskrit guda (globe, ball), and of course Skt. gola (a ball, globe). See Vai.Dkar. 437 I 28.1. [2] Betel nut. Chag 84, 97. Mentioned in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 160.2 among food items not known in Tibet. [3] In Namdak, Bzo-rig 90 ff., it is a general term for armor, including helmet, body armor and iron fortified boots.
གོ-ལབ	Btsan-lha.

གོ-པན	rol mo. gri leb thung ba. Btsan-lha.
གོ-ར	O.T. deriv. from Skt. go la. = zlum po. Blan 309.3. O.T. = btson ra. Skt. bhandhagara. Blan 294.2. (Amdo) = sha bag leb, small wheat loaf filled with meat. MTTP. ra ba. Gces 587.3. Btsan-lha. Also called go kha, it is a kind of low-walled area in front of the lower opening of the stove proper. See Nomads 269. rtsis dang go rar mi chud pa. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 250.4.
གོ-རེ	O.T. = rdzogs pa. Skt. purna. Blan 292.6. Btsan-lha. (In Amdo) 'bread, cake.' T&BS I 355.

གོལ	see gol sa.
གོལ-མ	Btsan-lha.
གོལ-ས	"turnoffs" on the road to Enlightenment, "side-tracks." = lam gol (Skt. unmArga), taking the wrong way. Perhaps = Skt. vivarta, to turn away, go astray. Or, utpatha or vipatha, wrong route.
གོལ-ཤོར	Stein.

གོལ-ས-བཞི	Bka'-ma Rgyas-pa XVII 432.4. gzung 'dzin ma spangs na kha lta yin pas gol / nyon mongs ma spangs na ming gi sgom chen yin pas gol / phyogs ris ma spangs na spyod pa tshul 'chos yin pas gol / bya ba ma thongs na skye bo tha mal yin pas gol lo. Bka'-gdams Glegs-bam 38v.4.
གོལ-ས-དྲུག	Explained in comm. to Klong-chen-pa 5.7.

གོར-ཤི-ཤ	= ba glang mgo (ox head), a particular type of white sandalwood. BBNP 469. tsan dan gyi nags bzangs na / gor shi sha bya ba yod de / de'i mtha' ma na de bas zhan pa'i tsan dan gyis skor nas yod skad. Zhi-byed Coll. I 436.5.
གོས-ཅན	See tsandan.
གོས-ཁྱུད	dhoti. Vitali, Tho.ling 71.
གོས-པོ	Btsan-lha.
གོས-རིས	(gold) brocade designs. Jackson.
གོས-སྐུ	thang kas made with cloth. There are 4 types, according to the art history by Dkon-mchog-bstan-'dzin, Bzo-gnas 134-5. The first, dras drub kyi gos sku, is a thang ka made by sewing cloth pieces onto a paper backing, on which the design has been placed. This is also called lhan drug gos sku. The second is like the first only it has stuffing inside the cloth pieces like a quilt. It is called gos sku 'bur ma. For the third, see under 'tshem thang (also called by some gtsags sku). The fourth, 'thag thang, is one in which the picture is entirely pre-woven into the cloth (like those mass-produced ones nowadays, which are not highly esteemed).
གོས-རལ-ག	Btsan-lha.
གོས-སྔོན-ཅན	1. Phyag rdor. 2. stobs bzang. 3. gza' spen pa. Blan 527.
གོས-བོར-བླངས	Btsan-lha.

གྲངས-ཆུ	Lag-len (text no. 11, item 17), says: One of the two categories of dmu chu [q.v.]. The symptoms are as for general phlegm disorders (bad kan). The urine is a bluish color and soft foam gradually fills the container. The swelling itself, tender and peeling, generally increases gradually from the lower part of the body.

གྲིབ	See discussion in Epstein, Dissertation 90 ff.
གྲིབ-སྨྱོ	'pollution madness.' A morbid fear of polluting objects, characterized by paralysis and/or chronic illness. May result in bla 'khyer. Epstein, Dissertation 139.
གྲིབ-ཚོད	This might be the Tibetan corresponding to chAyA in the sense of sundial. See Schopen in SUryacandrAya (1998) 167.
གྲོ	JD 213.
གྲོ-བ	Btsan-lha. strawberry colored horse.
གྲོ-བོ	"reddish grey color (of horses), swarthy, dappled." etc. See Kuijp in JAOS 111, p. 100.
གྲོ-ག	birch; 4 128B.2. birch bark (or the birch itself). gro ga theb mo gang la nyi ma cig la rdzogs par bris te. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 244.6. As a writing material for magic spells, see Zhi-byed Coll. V 142.7. Birchbark was very commonly used for writing material in Kashmir (as was the palm leaf in much of the rest of India); see Hartzell, Dissert. 550. An amazing Islamic-style bound birchbark book in Sanskrit illus. in Precious Deposits 113-116.
གྲོ-གཅུད	"Kabtse" or Tibetan pretzels. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 10.
གྲོ-ཁུར	a brief way of saying what Pha-dam-pa's two foods were, gro mo and khur ma (dandelion). Zhi-byed Coll. IV 154.4.
གྲོ-ལོ	evidently something edible. gro lo la zas byas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 301.5. Acc. to Yisun, the leaves of the gro ma (q.v.): gro ma'i lo ma.
གྲོ-མ	a particular Tibetan root vegetable, a 'wild sweet potato.' Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 41. Spelled dro ma, it was eaten by Pha Dam-pa. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 352.3 (also, BA 912, where it is mistakenly translated 'peas'). Evidently marmots horde them (see gro mdzod). = 'gro los 'dzin, tsi tsis 'dzin. JD 167. KP1 93.4. SS 510.6. A potato-like wild root eaten by Tibetans (but not by surrounding peoples). Das, JTL&CT 123.
གྲོ-མཛོད	a sbras bsags pa'i gro phung. Nomads 234. A pile of gro ma roots collected by the marmots.
གྲོ-མོ	feminine form of the strawberry colored horse denoted by gro ba, q.v.
གྲོ-ཚིག	black pigment made from burnt wheat. Anyetsang in TSB 15 (1980) 6.
གྲོ-ཞིབ	flour; "fine flour" used in book-making. Man LXI no. 102 (p. 84A).

གྲོན	Btsan-lha.
གྲོན-པ	Stein.
གྲོང	Tucci, Lhasa 49. mi rigs bzhi yod pa ni grong dang / bzo rigs bco brgyad yod pa grong khyer dang / grong khyer du ma yod pa grong brdal dang / grong brdal du ma yod pa yul ljongs dang / yul ljongs du ma yod pa yul 'khor zhes kong sprul yon tan rgya mtshos gsungs la / brgyad stong 'grel chen las / bzo'i bye brag bco brgyad tshang ba la grong khyer dang / de ma tshang ba'i khyim gcig gnyis sogs la grong dang / tshong ba mang po yod pa'i gnas la grong rdal dang / mi rigs bzhi tshang ba'i yul phyogs la ljongs zhes gsungs / mngon brjod 'ga' zhig tu / bye ba'i grong gis nges bcings yul // 'bum phrag grong gis yul 'khor dang // brgyad brgya'i grong gis grong khyer te // zhes bshad do. Gser Sbram 297. Similar explanation in Zhi-byed Coll. V 103.6 ff.
གྲོང-འཇུག	For a possible reason why it might be called such, see Hartzell, Dissert. 717: "[The Trika system.] This is a further step in the type-identity hierarchy whereby the group of cosmic principles or planes intersecting with the individual bio-psyche (tattvas) is called a grAma or village— since the tattvas refer to both the constituent elements of the individual and those of the cosmos."
གྲོང-བརྡལ	a town with a large population, a city. Sga 332.
གྲོང-བཤུལ	the personal property left by a dead person. Sources.
གྲོང-ཆོག	General word for rituals, etc. for which monks might be called into the villages. Very popular with Tibetan people, but often criticised for seeming to violate the monastic ideals.

གསང-ཆེན-དོན-གྱི-ཐེག-པ	epithet of Ati. Also, gsang chen snying po, in that Ati is said to be the summation of the underlying intentions of the lower Vehicles. Klong-chen-pa 6.10 comm.

གསས	bon brda lha zhes pa. Btsan-lha. Namdak. 56 57.

གསས-མོ	Together with gsas po, a category of religious expert. Samdo A III 200v.2. See Yisun. lha 'dre'i lus g.yar bud med. Btsan-lha.

གཤང	[flat-]bell. See refs. in Velm I 87. TR XV no. 10, p. 10. This instrument, a flatbell (like a small cymbal only supplied with a clapper) in use primarily but Bonpos (but also by some dpa' bo and Bka'-brgyud-pas) is of Persian-Turkic origins, evidently. See Esin, History of Pre-Islamic 107, 239.

I 312.2. seng ge la 'jigs pa'i gang zag cig seng ge'i gsob mthong bas sdang ba'i dus der / tshig gi brda' gtan la phebs te / 'di seng ge ma yin te blud pu yin no byas pas 'jigs pa'i ya nga dang bral. གསུང-གཞས	(hon.) singing, songs. MTTP.
གསུང-རབ-ཡན-ལག-དགུ	gleng gzhi / rtogs brjod / de lta bu byung ba / skyes rabs dang bzhi gcig tu bsdus shing / mdo sde dbyangs bsnyad sogs brgyad rnams so. 600 128.
གསུང-རབ-ཡན-ལག-བཅུ-གཉིས	mdo'i sde / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde / lung du bstan pa'i sde / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde / ched du brjod pa'i sde / gleng gzhi'i sde / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde / de lta bu byung ba'i sde / skyes pa rabs kyi sde / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde / rmad du byung ba'i sde / gtan la phab pa bstan pa'i sde rnams so // 'khor lnga sde bzang po la bden pa bzhi'i chos 'khor bskor ba'i skabs kyi bzlas pa bcu gnyis ni / 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // 'di de kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // 'di ni 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // 'di ni lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // zhes ngo bo la bzlas pa dang /... More discussion, see 600 171-173. Pabongka, Liberation II 184.
གསུང-དབྱངས-ཡན-ལག-ལྔ	'brug sgra ltar zab pa dang / snyan zhing 'jebs la rna bar snyan pa dang / yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar byed pa dang / rnam par gsal zhing rnam par rig par byed pa dang / mnyan 'os shing mi mthun pa med pa'o // zhes rnam bshad rigs pa las bshad do. 600 66.
གསུངས-སོ-འཚལ	gsungs pa tshang ma thams cad. Btsan-lha.
གསུར	burnt offerings. Pabongka, Liberation II 135. glo. Btsan-lha.
གཏའ	gte ma. Something made to substitute for wealth taken. pawn. Btsan-lha.
གཏའ-ཆེན	sbas pa chen po. Btsan-lha.
གཏའ-མ	pledge, pawn. lo bcu gnyis tshun chad la ma byung na ngas gta' mar spyan bzhag gi gsungs / de ltar mi byed na nga gta' mar ci 'jog gsungs / de yang rim gyis pa... 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) VI 157.5.
གཏའ-གམ-པ	nar son bong tshod zhan pa. lang tsho la ma bab par rgas nyams ston pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏའ-ཉི-རི	gte ma'am gta' ma nyis 'gyur gyi ming. Btsan-lha.
གཏད	evil spells. Skorupski, TA. Havnevik, Dissertation 283. magic imprecation. Stein.
གཏད-ཀ	spelled stad ka in Zhi-byed Coll. V 349.7, 350.2 ff.
གཏད-མེད	unsteady, unreliable, unstable, unpredictable.
གཏད-ར	(= gtad sa). Ziel. Kaschewsky2.
གཏད-སོ	predictable/conservative. Klong-chen-pa 12.9. Neg.: gtad so med. See so. objective. Thondup, BM 271. blo gdengs 'cha' ba'i yul lta bu sogs. Dagyab. Like the object in which one places trust, etc.
གཏད-ཡར	Something used in ritual. 476 III 66.7.
གཏད-མེད-དུ	unpredictably, unexpectedly.
གཏད-རབས-བདུན	bstan pa'i gtad rabs bdun ni / nyan thos chen po 'od srung / kun dga' bo / sha na'i gos can / nye sbas / dhi dhi ka / nag po / legs mthong rnams so. 600 96.

གཏལ	brgyab pa'am brdegs pa'am brdungs pa. Btsan-lha.

གཏམ	talk, discourse, report (not necessarily even oral). Gyatso, Apparitions 245.
གཏམ-འདྲེས-པ	O.T. = phebs par smra ba Blan 301.2. phebs par smra ba. phan tshun gtam 'dres shing smras pas ngo shes pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏམས-པ	O.T. = khangs pa. = bcol ba. = bshad pa. = bstan pa. Blan 302.6, 305.3 ff. khengs pa. bshad pa. bcol ba. bltams pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏན-དེབ	Vitali, Tho-ling 5, corrects to rten deb, register of icons. However, it may not requre correction, and would mean 'permanent inventory' or 'inventory of permanent [possessions of the temple].'

གཏན-ཁྲ	Stein.

གཏན-པ	dge slong gi chos gos sra brkyang. Btsan-lha.. Original entry: [mgar ba'i] gtan pa. See stan pa.
གཏན-ཚིགས	Scherrer-Schaub in TH&L 434 n. 39. As a general term for 'edict,' see French, Yoke 267.

གཏང-ཀ	Haarh, Yar-lun 370.
གཏང-རག	skad kyi gtang rag gis gdon par bya'o, one must recite [it] with measured intonation. See Schopen in SUryacandrAya (1998) 165. The usually meaning is: thanks giving.
གཏར-དམིགས	points for phlebotomy, = gtar ga'i gdab dmigs. See DD 203.
གཏར-ག	'bleeding as medical treatment, phlebotomy.' Text 8 et passim.
གཏར-རྡོ	Namdak.
གཏར-ཚན	gtar tshan ni lcags dang rdo sogs me la bsregs pa'i dmar 'bar ba de'o. From Namdak, Bzo-rig 119. Namdak.
གཏར-ཀ-དྲུག	Hackin, Formulaire 3. Skt. tarka.
གཏར-འཇུག-པ	gta' mar 'jog pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏེ-བ	smra ba. nor sogs kyi gta' ma. Btsan-lha.
གཏེ-མ	security for a loan. The thing given as a security generally was higher in value than the loan itself. Jampel Kaldhen, Interest Rates in Tibet, TJ 1 no. 1 (1975) 109.
གཏེ-པ	mistaken Tib. for gta' ma. Blan 311.5. gte par mi gzhag pa (do not place them [the books] as pawns). Gold Ms. I 118r.1. "hostage," acc. to Francke Antiquities II 105, in a note by K. Marx, where it is said to also be spelled ste pa. ste phyir thon la yong phugs su chug. Zhi-byed Coll. II 453.4.
གཏེ-བར-འཛུད	gta' mar 'jog pa ste / gzhan las nor blangs pa'i nor tshab la 'jog pa'i don no. Dpe-chos 505. Btsan-lha.
གཏེའུ	nyes can gtso bo'am rtsod gzhi mkhan. Btsan-lha.
གཏེབས-པ	'debs pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏེམས-པ	= bltem pa. activate. Germano, Poetic Thought 818, 940. As ex. of an irreg. Old Tantra term, corresponding to bstim pa ('make to dissolve into, throughly combine'), see the work of Dge-rtse in Rnying Rgyud 1973 XXXVI 455.
གཏེར-དགུ	padma can / dung can / padma chen po can / chu srin can / rus sbal can / rnga yab can / dga' ba can / sngon po / sbyin byed rnams so. 600 120.

གཙོ-བོ-ལྔ	lta ba'i gtso bo las rgyu 'bras la yid ches pa / dge sbyor gyi gtso bo sems can la mi gnod pa / sgrub pa'i gtso bo srung sdom ma nyams pa / dam bca'i gtso bo thub pa / spyod pa'i gtso bo kha snyen sgrub pa'o. Bka'-gdams Thor-bu 39v.3.

གཙོ-བོ-བརྒྱད-པ	Prescriptions 93. Lag-len 37.4. = rje'u gtso bo brgyad pa'i sbyor ba. Lag-len 66.4. TMC 29 (59). BP 173.4.

གཙོད	antelope; A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 298. Also called gtso & gcig ru. Norbu, Drung 123. Panthopolops hodgsoni. TS6 135 n. 29. Hodgson's antelope. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 42. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 51. JD 232.

གཙོགས-ཆེ	blo rig rgod pa'am pho rgod. Btsan-lha.
གཙོས	chiefly.
གཙུབ-ཤིང	yun ring brdar nas me len pa'i shing. Btsan-lha.
གཙུབ-སྟན	me 'byin pa'i shing gi sbyor ba. Btsan-lha.
གཙུག	rtse mo. gtan nas sam rtsa ba nas. Btsan-lha. Discussed in Karmay, Arrow 253.
གཙུག-ཆེ	dbu 'phang mtho ba. Btsan-lha.
གཙུག-གཙུགས	pho brang. Btsan-lha.
གཙུག-ལག	O.T. = sde snod. Skt. ArSa, vihAra, zAstra. Blan 292.5. 488 8.3. "cultural tradition." Coblin in JAOS 111, pp. 317-8. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 169. In some contexts obviously referring to astro-sciences in particular. See Btsan-lha. See Schopen in SUryacandrAya (1998) 165-6. Hahn in Facets of Indian Culture 458-9. I think it means 'the ancient lore' (which might include predictive techniques, such as astrology, divination, etc.).
གཙུག-མཁན	gtsug lag mkhan. Btsan-lha.
གཙུག-ཏོར-སྡེ-ལྔ	gtsug tor gdugs dkar / gtsug tor dri med / gtsug tor rnam rgyal / gtsug tor 'bar ba / gtsug tor phur bu rnams so. 600 65.
གཙུག-གི-ནོར-བུ	gtsug gi nor bu dang / zhabs kyi padma zhes pa rnams spyi gtsug nor bu dang / zhabs padma'i gzugs su bkod pa'i gzugs rgyan yin gyi / nor bu dang padma dngos ma yin no. Eimer, Dbyangs 54-55.
གཙུག-ལག-མཁན	ju zhag rtsis rgyag mkhan gyi mkhan po. Btsan-lha.
གཙུག-ལག-རྩིས	Text in 212 X.
གཙུག-ལག-གི-ཚིགས-སུ-བཅད-པ	verse of the Sage. Recited on specific occasions like at rest stops and after eating, and over the water used to wash the bowls of the monks before given as a curative agent to lay persons, and before stepping on the shadow of an image or stUpa. See Schopen in SUryacandrAya (1998)166.
གཙུག-ལག-ཀུན-གྱི-མ-མོ	dbyangs gsal gnyis. Btsan-lha. Referring to two main astrological systems?
གཙུག-ལག-ཁང-སྐྱོང	Guardian of the VihAra, a monastic office in India, distinct from the gtsug lag khang gi bdag po. See Schopen in SUryacandrAya (1998) 175.
གཙུག-ལག-ཁང-གི-བདག-པོ	Owner of the VihAra. A person, normally a lay person, who owns the monastic property. Prayers in their honor were said daily in Indian monasteries. Separate prayers were said for donors. See Schopen in SUryacandrAya (1998) 175.
གཙུག-ཕུད-ཅན	1. rma bya. 2. khron pa. 3. me lce. 4. drang srong bye brag pa. Blan 530. See rma bya.
གཙུགས-མྱེད	'khon med pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏུ-ལུམ	O.T. = bzi ba. Blan 296.3. = bzi ba, 'intoxicated.' BBNP 469. See gti lum pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏུག-གཤར	Also, gtug bsher. contest. Karmay, Treasury.
གཏུག-ཐུག-ཆུ-བ	DD illus. 16.
གཏུགས-པ	zad pa. chad pa. Btsan-lha.
གཏུམ	a clan. Btsan-lha.
གཏུམ-བུ	rdo ril yas gtun mas gtun zhes mchig gi yas rdo mas rdo. Btsan-lha.
གཏུམ-མོ	Germano, Poetic Thought 910.
གཏུམ-པོ	See bong nag.
གཏུམ-པོ-དམར-པོ	See bong dmar.
གཏུན	pestle.
གཏུན-བུ	phag sna'i gtun bu. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 412.4.
གཏུན-ཁུང	mortar. Jackson.
གཏུན-ཤིང	sked pa nyag cing rtse gnyis zum po 'bras sogs rdung byed kyi shing. thrashing stick. Btsan-lha.
གཏུར-བུ	= shubs. Blan 516.4. gos kyi shubs sam dra phad lta bu'i gtur bu dag mnyam por bsdams pa'i bam po. Btsan-lha. See Schopen in SUryacandrAya (1998) 168.
གུ	As in gyur cig gu, in O.T., "smon pa'i tshig" [optative suffix?]. Blan 285.5. mi gu. O.T. = mi zhum. Blan 294.4.
གུ-གུལ	frankincense. O.T. derived from gu ghu la. Blan 308.4. Beyer 263, 283, 416, 461. TS7 II 1074. Daniel Potts & A. Parpola, et al., Guhlu & Guggulu, WZKM 86 (1996) 291-305, which suggests that Skt. word comes from Akkadian. = 'dre 'jigs thang chu, bgegs skrad, 'dra 'dul klu dug (sp?). JD 126. LW 453. SS 429.4 (here it is a tree). DG 243.1. = khum bha na, bum pa can, u lu kha la, kau shi ka, ku ra, gug gul, gu khu la, bha yi sha, gu bu lu, 'dre bdud klu dug, 'dre gsod, gza' gsod, gza' dug, ljon pa'i bcud, gsod byed spyang nag, rdzas kyi phyag rdor. Indian bdellium (frankincense). Clifford, list.

གུཉཛ	See ma ru rtse.
གུར	N. of a tantra. 75 13. T&BS I 344. For a discussion of varieties of Tibetan tents, see Dung-dkar 17-18, where he lists lding gur rta gzugs ma, lcog gur, dmag gur, sbra gur.
གུར-བུ	O.T. = gru bzhi. Blan 288.4. Btsan-lha.
གུར-གུམ	saffron; saffron. O.T. derivative from Skt. kunku ma. Blan 308.4. See Hobson-Jobson. True saffron & turmeric are often confused. JD 77. = kung ku maM, ku sumbha, dhA raM, (spang gi me tog) chos gos ngur smrig. YTTM 291.14. SS 416.3. LW 453, 474. saffron. TM I 50, 51. DG 155.2. TM IV 101. Clifford, list. Singh (p. 100): From Skt. kuGkuman. Crocus sativus, saffron. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). JD (p. 77) distinguishes five types: 1) 'birdfoot' (bya rkang ma) coming from the Vindhya range of India; slightly bluish colored. 2) Kashmiri (kha che ba), the most highly regarded for use in medicine. 3) leb rgan ma, a type of Indian gur gum which is not so fragrant, but of a very clear yellow color. 4) Nepalese, of a vermilion (li khri) color. 5) Tibetan, the least used in medicine. Dag-yig: The best comes from Spain, but Tibetan tradition calls it Kashmiri gur gum. Otherwise there is a 'herb' (rtsa gur gum) that grows in India, Nepal & Tibet which is used in medicine as a substitute for gur gum. Mdo (pp. 351-2): describes the Tibetan substitute called rtsa gur gum. For 'flower gur gum' (me tog gur gum), see under (me tog) a byag.
གུར-ཁྲ	a variegated colored yak-hair tent, which is more portable than the sbra gur. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 44.

གྱ-ལོག	Btsan-lha, where it seems to be a kind of skilful method involving saying the opposite of what you mean. I think it means 'reverse psychology.' skam thag chu nang du gcod pa 'khor 'das gya log gi gnad 'di cha myed. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 129.6 (similar, V 396.7). gya log gnad kyi skor (title in Zhi-byed Coll. III 72.1). skam thag chu nang du gcod par byed pa gya log gi gnad 'di ltos cig ces bstan no. Zhi-byed Coll. II 72.7. bya log gi gdams pa 'di grub pa'i mtha' gzhan la cha med pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. V 264.2. 'khor 'das gya log gdams pa'i gnad. Zhi-byed Coll. V 286.2. 'dir tshogs mi 'grub pa'i dus su bsags na che ba gya log gi mtshang bla ma'i man ngag go. Zhi-byed Coll. V 467.7. It's possible this is related (or the 'same' as) the rare term ja log, found in Rnying-ma works.

གྱེན-ལོག	rebels, overthrowers (of the power holders in Cultural Revolution times). Tsering Shakya, Dragon 327. An early Red Guard movement in Tibet took this name, with its main support from Red Guards from China and lower to middle ranking cadres.. = gyen ldog. dma' sa nas mtho sar g.yo 'gul byed pa'i don te: rlung gyen ldog / rba rlabs gyen ldog / dbugs gyen ldog lta bu / Dag-yig. Any kind of upward agitation from a low to a high place, as in the rising of wind, waves or breath.

གཟར	to uncover (the shoulder).

གཟེ-བ	O.T. = gur. Blan 295.3. bya ba sgrim zhing myur ba'am spyod lam dang cha lugs mdzes pa. gur. Btsan-lha. 'phags pa'i thugs rje byin chen la gze ba'i phyir ro. Zhi-byed Coll. V 268.6.
གཟེ-མ	[1] = rdzi ma. "eyelash." Kuijp (1986) 35. [2] Part of the locking mechanism of a Tibetan door. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 4. [3] a medicinal. JD 141. SS 496.5. KP1 43.6. KP3 258.3. KP4 395.3. Varieties: lug gze, ra gze. = gho kSu ri, gho khu ra, bhU kaNDa, sa'i tsher ma, a dzi shi ra, ra mgo, si gha, sa ha ga, ga da ra. DG 263.1. [4] evidently a substance that a vessel might be made out of. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 133.5.
གཟེ-མཆུ	kha gyong po'am kha rtsod dga' ba. Btsan-lha.
གཟེ-རེ	= bzod bsran chung bar mi bya. BBNP 482. gzhan la gze re ma skyangs na chos pa mi btub. Zhi-byed Coll. V 75.5.
གཟེ-རེག	gze' reg skyungs. Zhi-byed Coll. II 450.6.
གཟེ-ཟོང	tshong. Gces 585.6. tshong las. Btsan-lha. zog po rnams kyi gze' zong mdzod. Zhi-byed Coll. II 283.6.
གཟེ-རེ-ཅན	sran chung ba. khyad du bsad pa. Btsan-lha.
གཟེ-རེ-མི-བྱ	bzod sran chung bar mi bya. Btsan-lha.
གཟེ-མ-མཆུ	phung bkrol byed mkhan. Btsan-lha.
གཟེ-མ-ར-མགོ	See under gzed ma.
གཟེབ	shackle. Also means 'basket' or 'tent' (or rather, yurt) or a fence with loop-holes built in (like a basket) or wooden/cane cage. Klong-chen-pa 8.9. See stung. bya dang byi'u bskor rgyu'i shing gi dra mig can. gur. lcug ma las byas pa'i sgrom kha sbyar. Btsan-lha. gzeb las thar pa'i brtson de blo sems bde'. Zhi-byed Coll. I 287.4. Generally seems to mean a closed box-shaped basket made of either bamboo or willow, used as either a storage vessel or bird cage. Figuratively speaking, it means being 'boxed in.' gzeb ni skabs 'dir bya dang byi'u bskor rgyu'i shing ti dra mig can gyi snod kyi ming la bya'o. Eimer, Dbyangs 56.
གཟེབ-བཅུ	Klong-chen-pa 12.14 comm. 464 44.3.
གཟེད	a subspecies of sman mo. Norbu, Drung 82. guardians of fruit trees. TPS 727.
གཟེད-མ	tsher ma'i bye brag gze ma ra mgo. Gze ma ra mgo is a type of thorny 'stick-tight' (in the language of the Hoosiers), with the thorns sticking out in all directions, hence symbolic of bad actions that harm everyone else (a possible shape for the dumplings in dgu thug).
གཟེད-པ	skas. Btsan-lha.
གཟེད-ཞལ	Aris, Discourse 66 n. 16.
གཟེག	phrad ma khad nas shes pa'i gzeg khyer te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 398.6.
གཟེག-ཆ	nus pa'am 'khos ka chung ba'am phra dngos chung ba. Btsan-lha.
གཟེག-གཟན	mu stegs pa'i bye brag cig. Btsan-lha. Atom Eater. KaNAda, founder of VaizeSika philosophy. Das 1107. Gser Sbram 185.
གཟེག-པ	gyen du 'dzeg pa. Btsan-lha.

གཞོན-ནུ-མ	gzhon nu ma'i bde ba, metaphor for meditative experience, 'young woman's bliss.' shes pa nyams su myong la brjod ma shes pa gzhon nu ma'i bde' ba lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 471.2. mtshan nyid bde' ba nyams su myong ba gzhon nu ma'i snyom 'jug lta bu. Ibid. II 478.7.
གཞོན-ནུ-བུམ-སྐུ	youthful vase body; youthful vase body. Thondup, BM 58. Karmay, Great Perfection 185, 187. Germano, Poetic Thought 963. Note the story of Skandha (called Gzhon nu gdong drug in Tibetan), who was, according to some accounts, gestated in a vase from the seed of six different gods. Note also that the UpaniSads define the Atman thus: "Atman is brahman in a pot" where the pot is the body, and breaking the pot allows one to realize the primordial unity of the Atman and the Absolute Brahman. See White, Alchemical Body 18.
གཞོང-ཞུང	gzhong pa. Btsan-lha.
གཞོངས	O.T. = ljongs. Blan 297.3, 516.3. ljongs sam shongs. Btsan-lha.

གཞུ-གུ	= gzhug. final, next. MTTP.
གཞུ-ཁེབས	In architecture, a thin horizontal piece forming the very top part of the pillar-capital adjacent to the main beam. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3.
གཞུ-མཆོག	gzhu'i sne mo'am rtse mo. Btsan-lha.
གཞུ-རིང	In architecture, the part of the pillar-capital below the gdung gdan which it supports. It may be decorated with the monstrous face called CipaTa (see tsi pa ta). See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3.
གཞུ-སྤྱན	bow eye; "bow eye." Jackson.
གཞུ-ཐུང	The 'short arrow,' in architecture it occurs immediately below the gzhu ring. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3.

གཞུར-བརྟག	O.T. = zur zab (zur za ba?). Blan 289.2. zur za. Btsan-lha.
གཞུར-མེད	gzhom pa med pa. Btsan-lha.
གཟི	Nomads 289. JD 34. SS 408.6. DG 89.3, 92.2. Skt. ojas, held to be the quintessence of the 7 bodily elements (hence the purest of the pure products of repeated smelting/digesting), and the most powerful of them all. Silk, Dissert. 318.
གཟི-བརྗིད	Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 164, 199.
གཟི-བྱིན	Used to translate Chinese term meaning 'majesty, prestige, charisma.' Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 164.
གཟི-དོམ	A type of eye shade made with fur bristling outward. Illus. in Yisun.
གཟི-རིས	designs drawn with the tip of the gzi burnisher on gold. Jackson.
གཟི-རྟེན	object held beneath the canvas during burnishing with the agate (gzi) burnishing tool. Jackson.
གཟི-རེ-ཆུང	gzer re chung. Gces 587.5.
གཟིག	leopard; A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 293. Acc. to Allen, Search 64, this is the Tibetan name for the snow leopard. = thig le can. JD 237.
གཟིག-བཅོམ	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 293.
གཟིག-ལྷ	mo lha. Nomads 249, 289-290.
གཟིག-མོང	porcupine; porcupine. Das.
གཟིག-ཆེན-སུམ-འགྲོལ	a medicinal preparation. BP 279.6.
གཟིག-མཇུག-པ	See brag spos.
གཟིགས-སྟངས-གསུམ	Germano, Poetic Thought 948. Gazes used in Thod-rgal practice.
གཟིམ-དཔོན	4 minor attendants of ya sor spyi khyab. Velm I 140. steward-in-chief. Sources.
གཟིམ-ཆུང-པ	= gzim spyong ba. official police/body guard at Dalai Lama's residence. watchmen. TS7 I 191.
གཟིམས-འགག	household guard. Sources.
གཟིམས-ལམ	hon.: = rmi lam. dream. MTTP.
གཟིམས-ཆུང-པ-ཏྲ	hon.: ornate dwelling. MTTP.
གཟིངས	shspu gzings la ni shi 'gro ba tshun la. BBNP 479.
གཟོ	drin dran pa. Btsan-lha.
གཟོབ	spyod lam gyi gzob ma shor na chos mthar myi phyin pa yin. Zhi-byed Coll. II 306.5. khyod gzhan don byed na lus kyi gzob zhog. Ibid. II 306.6. lus kyi gzob shig. Ibid. II 443.7. mthon po'i rtse ni ltung ba'i gnas yin gzobs. Ibid. I 297.4. da res gzobs la song. Ibid. II 227.7.
གཟོད-མ	O.T. = dang po. Blan 295.3. dang po. Btsan-lha.
གཟོན-པ	See rnar gzon pa. Blan 286.5. mi nyan pa. Btsan-lha.
གཟོང	rang bzhin rtag thub pa gser la gzong rtsugs pa lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 473.2.
གཟོང-ཁ	drilling instrument. i khung 'bigs byed lag cha'i so. Yisun. thog ma'i bsgrub pa gzong kha 'dal na phyis kyi nyams len myi 'grub pa'i rgyu byed. Zhi-byed Coll. II 239.2. go cha dang gnyen po gzong kha brdal nas lam la 'khrul pa sol myi srid. Ibid. II 21.2. nyam len gyi gzong kha bdal ba la zer ba yin. Ibid. IV 138.5. sgrub pa la gzong kha ma brdal ba cig gal che ba'o. Ibid. V 185.1. ngo sprod la gzong kha brdal ba'i mi de la zab mo'i rtsi mi skye. Ibid. IV 53.1. medical implement pictured in JD 277 (item 8). Lit., 'chisel-tipped.'
གཟོར	As ex. of an irreg. Old Tantra term, corresponding to zor, see the work of Dge-rtse in Rnying Rgyud 1973 XXXVI 455.
གཟུ-བོ	phyogs lhung spangs pa'i dpang po. 'phrin skyel ba. Btsan-lha.
གཟུ-ལུམ	brdzus ma. Gces 589.1. = rang bzo. BBNP 465.

གཟུ-བོའི-བློ	pure mind. Thondup, BM 207. Germano, Poetic Thought 896, translates 'impartial outlook.' See Dorji Wangchuk in TS9 X 278, where he says blo gzu bo means 'objectivity.'
གཟུག	See Dagyab under sha gzug.
གཟུག-མོ	porcupine; porcupine. Norbu, Drung 123.
གཟུགས-འཚོང	O.T. = smad 'tshong. Blan 293.1.
གཟུགས-མོ	species of antelope; See Emmerick in G. Meulenbeld & D. Wujastyk, Studies on Indian Medical History, Motilal (Delhi 2001) 62, where according to Das it is a species of antelope, but elsewhere some kind of weasel. I think it's a porcupine. = ri dwags rna can, rlung zhon, tsher spu can. JD 248. gzugs mo byi thur, in SS 537.3.
གཟུགས-མོ-བྱི-ཐུར	ze mong ngam sgang thur. Btsan-lha.
གཟུགས-ཡོད-པའི-ཁམས	Early translation of Skt. rUpadhAtu. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 177.
གཟུགས-བརྙན-གྱི-ཆོས	Sinitic vocab. for dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163, 185-6.
གཟུགས-འཛིན-དབང-རྩ	DD illus. 26.

གཟུང-སྟེ-འདུག	bskor te 'dug. Btsan-lha.
གཟུངས	Discussion of its meaning as 'power of retention.' Pabongka, Liberation II 293. sngar thos pa'i chos don mi brjed par 'dzin pa. Btsan-lha. gzungs zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge ji srid du brjod pa'i don gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'am / ji skad du brjod pa de nam du yang de dang mi 'bral bar gzung ba lta bu la bya zhes lo tsA ba dpal brtsegs kyis gsungs la / gzungs kyi ngo bo ni / dran pa dang shes rab khyad par can gyis byed las dge ba'i chos rnams 'dzin cing mi dge ba'i chos rnams sel ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'o. Gser Sbram 299. ngan 'gror ltung ba las 'dzin pa'am / yang na chos kyi tshig don mi brjed par 'dzin pas na gzungs so zhes bstan dar lha rams pas rdo rje rnam 'joms kyi gzungs kyi 'grel par gsungs. Gser Sbram 359. Almogi, MA thesis 83 n. 241.

གཱ-ལ-ཨོཀ	Karaoke. TS9 II 457.
ཧཱུཾ-རྡུགས	hUm rdugs ni u thug pa. Dpe-chos 512. Btsan-lha 1016.
ཧ-བར	khyis ha bar snyeg pa ltar, explained as: du zhugs pa'i tshe kyag kyog srab srub thams cad du rgyug pa ltar. BBNP 472. kyag kyog srab srub thams cad nyul ba. Btsan-lha. a narrow passage between two mountains. a short break during busy work. Naga in TJ 24 no. 3 (1999) 71.
ཧ-བོ	mallow. TM IV 64. See brag skya ha bo.
ཧ-གི	= pha rol. "the other side." Kuijp (1986) 35.
ཧ-ཧོ	See brag rgya ha ho.
ཧ-ལ	= pha la. dorthin, weg. Kaschewsky2.
ཧ-ལམ	almost.
ཧ-ལས	sich wundern; Ausdruck der Überraschung. Kaschewsky2.
ཧ-ལྗང	Chinese word for 'fire.' Zhi-byed Coll. V 36.1.
ཧ-ལོ	4 287v.4.. See pho lcam. YTTM 291.25. SS 480.1.
ཧ-པུ	a special kind of cloth. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 190.3. ha pu ngur dmar rab kha the'u ma nyams pa yug gcig 'bul zhing mchis. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 289.1. See the mysterious definition of hapuSA in Monier-Williams: "N. of a partic. substance forming an article of trade (commonly called Habush, and said to be of a long form and black colour, and smelling like raw meat or fish; it is of two kinds)." It would be quite outrageous if this 'trade article' turned out to be Ethiopian slaves (see Hobson-Jobson, 428, under Hubshee). There is a possibility, though, that the names of both the type of cloth and the item of trade called Habush, derived from an Arabic name for the Abyssinians, HabashI.
ཧ-རེ	4 215v.3.
ཧ-རྒད	shugs chen gyis gad mo dgod pa. Btsan-lha.

ཧོར-དུད	'Mongolian smoke.' Tucci (TPS 14) has an argument that this is just Mongolian ordu, wrongly spelled and falsely etymologized in order to make sense to the native Tibetan speaker.

ཧོས	bon. ye srid g.yung drung bon gyi gsang mtshan. Btsan-lha. A secret name for the eternal Bon.

ཧྭགས	refined sugar. O.T. = bu ram gyi dwangs ma'i sha kha ra. Also, gal la. Blan 293.4. ka ra'i bye brag bu ram gyi dwangs ma'am sha kha ra'i ming. bu ram gyi lbu ba'i phye ma rdog por ma byas pa dang / rdog por byas pa ni kha ra'am sha kha ra dang ka ra zhes bya ste. Btsan-lha 1018. "The hwags of brown sugar is said to refer to the clarified sugar or the best part of it." Naga in TJ 24 no. 3 (1999) 71.

ཇ	tea; 'tea,' deriving from Chinese, acc. to Beyer, CT Lang. 141. On tea taxation by Dalai Lama's government, see Tsarong in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 29. For comments on the history of tea consumption in Tibet, see Das, JTL&CT 159. LW 505.
ཇ-འདུར	See Mengele, dGe-'dun-chos-'phel 146, where it is explained as a paste made of tea and tsam pa.
ཇ-དམ	thermos jug. Schmied 160.
ཇ-དམར	reddish tea color; reddish tea color. Jackson.
ཇ-ཧོང	ngur smrig. Rtse-le VIII 430.
ཇ-ཁ	tea colored.
ཇ-ཁུག	pouch for tea leaves. Illus. in Yisun.
ཇ-ལྗང	greenish tea color.
ཇ-ལོག	An Old Tantra term, it is mispelled as rda log, q.v. Jean-Luc Achard has some idea what it means. See discussion in Achard, L'Essence 181 n. 102. It occurs in titles of some Rnying-ma tantras that are found only in vols. CI and CHI of the Nepalese National Archives version of the Rnying-ma Rgyud-'bum.
ཇ-མ	Küchenmeister. Kaschewsky2. Similar to lag bde.
ཇ-མཆོད	'tea offering.' Epstein, Dissertation 176.
ཇ-མདོང	Tea churn. Illus. in Yisun.

ཇ-སིག	a block of tea. Karmay, Treasury. Btsan-lha. Jaeschke says ja seg is tea-powder. ja'i shing lo gru bzhi sogs ma bcos pa. Dagyab.
ཇ-སུན	I suspect it means a 'tea break.' se gol gnyis gsum bzhi tsam zan kham ldad yun tsam mam ja sun zhig gi bar tsam mam. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) VI 250.5. Apparently za sun means a 'meal break.'
ཇ-ཐབས	Stein.
ཇ-ཏོར	ras gur. Btsan-lha.
ཇ-ཙི	ferry.
ཇ-བླུག-ས	a place (bowl) to pour tea in. slop-bowl. Pouring the tea out into it is a sign of taking leave. Das JTL&CT 52.
