ཀཥ-ར	See ya bakSha ra.
ཀཥ-ར-ཀ-ཀོ-ལི	See nye shing.
ཀཥི-ར	= sha ni gan dha. YTTM 292.12. See shrI khaNDa.
ཀཥི-ར-ཀ-ཀོ-ལི	See lug mnye.
ཀཥིས-ཁར	See 'bra go.
ཀ	  Stein.  Has meaning of 'desire' ('dod pa), 'root' (rtsa ba) and 'ab-original' (gdod ma).  Btsan-lha.
ཀ-འཇི	ngo bo mthong bas shes pa gser ka 'ji la bdar ba lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 473.2. mtshang shes pa la bdud kyis myi tshugs pa gser ka 'dzi la bdar ba lta bu. Ibid. II 481.1 (also, 484.2). Ibid. I 434.2. rang gis bsags pa'i gser la ka 'jis brdar myi dgos. Ibid. I 310.3. Seems to be the dka' 'ji in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 244.3 (dka' 'ji'i khu ba dkar dmar dang bsres la). ka 'ji'i dkyil 'khor du tshig dbang rin po che zhus. Zhi-byed Coll. V 86.6.
ཀ-འཕན	Pillar hanging (with kIrtimukha at top). Illus. in Yisun. ka ba'i rgyan gos chen ka 'phan. Chödag. See Dung-dkar.
ཀ-བ	pillars; khang pa'i gdung ma 'degs byed shing. Chödag. For the architecture of the pillar, see Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3. a clan name. Btsan-lha. On pillars in the Jo khang temple called Ka ba Shing lo can and Ka ba Seng mgo can, see Das, JTL&CT 163.
ཀ-བད	ku ba bil ba'i ming. ka bed. Chödag. ka bad dang ku ba gnyis ka rdo thog shing skyes kyi ming. Utpal 12.1.
ཀ-བེད	gourd; Btsan-lha. Karmay, Arrow 348, where it is said to mean 'squash' (i.e., gourd). = ku ba chen. JD 182. ka ped. SS 477.6. = kha Da ka, ras mi ci, khru gcod gtso bo, chag chang ku ba. DG 213.1.
ཀ-བཤད	ka phreng du bkod pa'i li (?) la'ang. Chödag.
ཀ-བསྟོད	ka phreng du bkod pa'i bstod pa. Chödag.
ཀ-ཅ	wealth, possessions. O.T. = dkor q.v. Blan 302.1. = nor. 367 I 237. nor dngos po spyi'i ming / ka cha. Chödag. nor spyi'i ming. Utpal 13.2. CSKG. Gold.Ms. I 4r.3. ka ca dang sog run ma rem par. 601 40r.3. 'dod pa zad pa dang ka ca 'du ba dus mnyam. Zhi-byed Coll. II 345.3. Perhaps a Tibetanization of Skt. kAñcana (money, wealth, property).
ཀ-ཆ	ca lag. Gces 584.2. general word for 'wealth' (nor). BBNP 478. Btsan-lha. See ka ca.
ཀ-ཆུག	like that (de ltar). Btsan-lha.
ཀ-ཅི	ras ka ci zer. Chödag.
ཀ-དག	[= ka nas dag pa] Pure from the letter 'A'. Abbr. of ka nas dag pa, pure from [the letter] 'ka'. 'Ka' is the first letter of the Tibetan alphabet. This is a term from the Old Translations, and we no longer know the Sanskrit equivalent. Acc. to 208 I 309.4, the Skt. is khazuddha (sky-like pure??). Stein. Often translated 'primordial purity.' Germano, Poetic Thought 914. rtsa ba nas dag pa'am chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi don du gsungs. Chödag. Btsan-lha. Discussion by Klein in Karmay, New Horizons 220 n. 100.
ཀ-དབྲག	spaces between pillars. ka ba'i bar mtshams. Chödag.
ཀ-དིར	shing zhig. Chödag.
ཀ-དཔེ	ka kha sogs ka mad sum cu tham pa. Chödag.
ཀ-གདན	ka ba 'debs byed gdan lta bu / ka stegs. Chödag. The pedestal of the pillar in Tibetan architecture. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3.
ཀ-གདུང	= ka ba & gdung ma, the pillar[s] and beam[s].
ཀ-གཞུ	ka ba dang gdung ma'i bar gyi shing. Chödag. ka zhu rnams la chu srin pa tra zhes pa. Namdak, Bzo-rig 78. The correct English word is 'entablature.' See Dung-dkar.
ཀ-ཇི	(dbus) = ka ci, Benares linen or a kind of coarse white cotton cloth largely imported into Tibet from Nepal and India. Deriv. from KAzi, n. of Benares. MTTP. nor dngos po spyi'i ming / ka ca. Chödag.
ཀ-ཀ	kA ka'i zur chag gam bya rog. Chödag. Skt. kAka (crow).
ཀ-ལྷ	See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs 64-5.
ཀ-ལི	mo'i mgo rus. Chödag. ka li'i ni thod pa.
ཀ-ལོ	A way of referring to both the bre and the bre khebs above a pillar. See Dung-dkar.
ཀ-མང	ka kha sogs ka mang sum cu tham pa / ka dpe. Chödag.
ཀ-མགོ	head of the pillar, capital. Generally considered a synonym of ka gzhu, q.v.
ཀ-པཱལ	ka ba li ste dpe cha 'jog snod kyi ming. CSKG. Evid. Indic. See ka ba li.
ཀ-པད	Btsan-lha. a tree. KP4 576.4.
ཀ-ཕིབས	See Dung-dkar.
ཀ-ཕོར	= ga phor. See Dung-dkar.
ཀ-ཕྲེང	ka kha rim bzhin bsgrigs pa'o. Chödag.
ཀ-པིད	rtsa ba myu gu skyu ru bil ba ka pid gsol. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 299.5.
ཀ-ར	shel ka ra dang bye ma ka ra lta bu. Chödag. za ba'i rnam grangs kyi ming. CSKG. JD 129. LW 455. See dam bu ka ra.
ཀ-རག	'a white earth color' Jackson [see mo dkar] sa dkar zhig. Chödag. White from mineral, chalk or lime. Anyetsang in TSB 15 (1980) 6.
ཀ-རཉཛ	sman zhig. Chödag. ka ran dza / shing sman gyi rigs shig. Gser Sbram 308. sman 'jam 'bras kyi ming. CSKG. = lag pa'i thal mo. JD 87. = sgrul skong 'dra. YTTM 292.1. a tree. SS 427.1. = lag skyes. DG 192.6. For a medicinal preparation called ka ran dza drug pa, see RR 77. Skt. karañja (the tree Pongamia glabra).
ཀ-རྡོ	A part of a house construction. The stone at the base of a [wooden] pillar. The plinth. See Dag-yig 67.

ཀ-ཙ-ར	See discussion of this word, which is in fact sometimes used to refer to to mixed Nepali-Tibetan people (and has a derogatory ethnic meaning in Nepal), by Amy Heller in Orientations 33 no. 10 (Dec 2002) 61. When in Nepal, I heard it interpreted as meaning 'mule' (neither donkey nor horse...).

ཀར-གྱིས-ཕྲུག	na ba'i bye brag ste kar rtsen kar 'ong. Chödag.
ཀར-ཤ-པ	steng du kar sha pa ni bu can cig bzhag la... kar sha pa ni lce 'og du bcug la. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 30.5.
ཀར-ཤ-པ-ནི	383 275. Karsha pa na: 'gron bu'o. Chödag. karsha pa na'i zur chag ste dngul zho'i dong tse dang la las 'gron bu'i ming dang mtsho tik tu dngul zho phyed las byas pa'i dong rtse'i rnam pa 'dra ba dang / rnam 'byed las / ma sha ka lnga ni karsha pa na'i bzhi cha'i dpe yin par gsungs pa dang / yang na de la dngos dang ming du btags pa tsam gnyis / dang po ni dngul gyi dong tse dang / gnyis pa de'i rin gyis 'gron bu'o. Chödag. karsha pa .na ni gser sogs kyi dong rtse. Utpal 16.5. dkar sha pa ni'i khog par brdzangs te. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 244.3. See mgron bu, 'cowrie.' See discussion by Schopen in IIJ 44 (2001) 107. M.Vy. no. 9377 says this is a silver coin worth 1,600 cowries. Dung-dkar 42 argues against it's meaning being cowries, saying that it means money of all kinds. Skt. kArSApaNa.
ཀརཎཎ	rna ba'i ming. CSKG.

A stone, also used as a mark of very high ranking persons. bya ke ke ru is a bird that lives on one of the stages of Meru who feeds its chicks nothing but a single diamond and this completely satisfies them. ཀེར-ལེབ-སྒུར-གསུམ	ker ker mi dang / leb leb sa / sgur sgur phyugs te sngar bod sa gnas srid gzhung skabs khral 'ul 'gel sa'i yul gsum. In old Tibet, the three things that could be taxed, the upright, the flat, and the bent over (humans, land & livestock). Dung-dkar 93.

ཁ	= kha sang kha'i nyi ma. 'der gestrige Tag' Kaschewsky 82. unmittelbar bevor. Kaschewsky2. a 'secret' way of saying 'five,' used by gamblers. Norbu, Drung 229, n. 65.. 'mouth.' DD illus. 17.
ཁ-འབྱམས	dry thinking about the infinity of words. Germano in JIABS 17 no. 2 (1994) 300. See also Yisun. bag of hot air. Ehrhard in TS5 56. In the phrase: nag po kha 'byams bdud kyi lta ba. Seems to be similar in meaning to kha lta can, etc. rtog pa kha 'byam gyis sgro 'dogs myi chod pa yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. II 238.4. rtogs pa kha 'byams myi rten pa. Ibid. II 390.7. de kho na nyid shes rab go yul du shor ba rtogs pa kha 'byam gyi bar chod. Zhi-byed Coll. V 381.6. stong stong po gcig kho na bsgoms pas gol sa che la rgyu 'bras khyad du gsod la nag po kha 'jam du song nas ngan song du 'gro ba'i nyen yang che la. Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 394.5.
ཁ-འདའ	see khan da. bu ram gyis kha 'da' nyo'am, "Would you buy khanda in place of brown sugar?" Zhi-byed Coll. II 347.1.

II 443.7. ngo bo rgyud la skye ba dang kha 'dzin dang bral ba dus mnyam. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 42.3. Said to mean 'respond to the wishes' by Holler in TS9 II 214.

ཁ-བཏགས	some types: nang mdzod (of fine silk), a she (of coarse silk), mdzod she (of ordinary cloth). Used for many purposes, including for guiding the souls of the dead; 'way-cloths' used in funerals in many Himalayan communities. Ramble in Mandala & Landscape 220, n. 66. Different types discussed in Precious Deposits V 167 (it places their origin in one that 'Phags-pa brought from his meeting with Khubilai).

ཁ-ཚར	1. = rim bzhin gdags pa. additional. Karmay, Treasury. 2. fringe [on a cloth]. 'minor ingredients in a medicinal mixture.' I.e., all the medicines in a compound other than the main ones contained in the medical prescription books. These may be added in specific circumstances at the discretion of the doctor, of course. snam bu thags zin pa'i kha tshar 'go rtsom pa'i phun tshar gnyis. Chödag. 'fringe.' Goldstein. Text 8.

ཁ-ཁུ-སིམ-པོ	quiet; (sp?) quiet.
ཁ-གསལ-བ	brighter (color). Jackson.
ཁ-ཁ-བརྒྱུད-པ	kha na kha la brgyud pa. Gces 584.2. kha nas kha la. Btsan-lha.
ཁ-བླན-ཏེ	kha blan te ni khe 'then te zhes par 'jug. Eimer, Dbyangs 58.
ཁ-དུམ-པ	O.T. = 'chams pa. = mthun pa. Blan 306.1.
ཁ-བའི-ཕྱེ-མ	DG 146.3.
ཁ-འཆམ-པ	kha 'thun pa. Gces 583.3.
ཁ-རྔོ-བ	opportune, favourable (?). Coblin in TH&L 89.
ཁ-དོག-འགྲོ	= khang stod (steng) 'gro. 'I am going upstairs.' Kuijp (1986) 35.
ཁ-བདེ-པོ	one who is able to persuade in a convincing and clever manner. eloquent, talkative, loquacious.
ཁ-ཤོག-པ	See thang phrom dkar po g.yung ba.
ཁ-ཌ-ཀ	See ka bed.
ཁ-ལྟ-ཅན	People who have superficial philosophies (denying karma and its results). Samdo A III 311v.5. See kha lta rkyang pa, nag po kha 'byams.
ཁ-ལྟ-རྐྱང-པ	'simply surface view' (prob. = opaque surface view of reality). Phag-mo-gru-pa, Gold Ms. II 276r.6, III 98r.4. See kha lta can. kha lta rkyang pa'i rjes su ma 'brangs par. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 576.1. las rgyu 'bras la nges shes skyes tsam na // chos byar med kyi kha lta yang rdzun por gda' // 'brug char med kyi kha lta rkyang pa la // blo gtad 'dug gam mi 'dug soms. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 309.1.
ཁ-གཡར-བ	to give the name of someone else to deflect blame for one's own actions (to write a book under someone else's name).
ཁ-དར-བ	sich vermehren, sich ausbreiten. Kretsch.

ཁོང-མོ-འབྲོང	a pregnant 'brong? T.N. says it is synonymous with 'brong. Norbu, Drung 262, n. 71.
ཁོངས-གཟོ-བ	Btsan-lha.
ཁོར-པ	Btsan-lha.
ཁོར-ཟུག	O.T. = khor yug. Blan 290.1.
ཁོས	= mkhos. = khod. Institution, administration, settlement of the state. Uray, Narrative 19. Helga Uebach, in her paper given at St. Andrews (2001), says that it means extention of Tibetan state power over her imperial possessions, often concluded ceremonial following a matrimonial alliance. She also discusses the related forms skos, 'khos, khod, etc. Chris Beckwith, in his book, interprets the term variously as 'gather, mobilize, levy.'. impv. of 'gas. khos shig. Split! Gash!
ཁོས-ཀ	rang la khos ka myed pa nga gzhan la zhal ta gtong ba de myi bden. Zhi-byed Coll. II 455.3 (also, V 67.5). rang la khos ka myed par gzhan la zhal ta mkhas. Ibid II 183.4. "While you yourself are not up to the task, you are good at advice for others." myis chos par bzung rang khos ka myed. "While people take you for a follower of Dharma, you yourself have no initiative (are not up to the task?)." Zhi-byed Coll. II 436.2. Ibid. V 74.6-7. bdag gi lus la blo ltos med yang nas yang du na ba 'di'i 'khos kas na ma cig gsob gog dgyel bar thag chod pas da res sos na. Zhi-byed Coll. V 466.6.
ཁོས-པ	O.T. = 'dun pa. Blan 289.1.
ཁོས-རང	Btsan-lha.
ཁོས-རང-ཆབ-མི-འཚལ-བ	O.T. = mdun ma chud mi za ba. Blan 288.3.
ཁྲ	hawk; [1]terms (of a treaty, chings dan gyi :::). <khra ma, = judicial decree. Sources. [2] hawk. dgos pa'i dus las khra'i rtsal ni gzhan du myin. Zhi-byed Coll. I 270.1. On the hawk, see skya ga. See SS 537.4.

ཁྲ-ཤོག-པ	See thang phrom nag po.
ཁྲ-གླག-སྤྱང-གསུམ	Nomads 259: sems can 'di gsum ni gling ge sar gyi dgra lha'i wer ma bcu gsum gyi nang nas gtso bo gsum yin pa ltar... If they follow you in your travel, it's a good sign.
ཁྲ-རྒྱབ-པ	einlegen (z.B. Edelstein wird in Ring oder Goldplatte 'eingelegt'). Kaschewsky 82.
ཁྲ-ཕུང-ངེ	bunt zusammengewürfelt. Kaschewsky 82.
ཁྲ-ཕུང-ཕུང	stark leuchtend, rundherum leuchtend. Kretsch.
ཁྲ-མེར-བ	See Chödag. = khra lam me. = khra lham me.
ཁྲ-ཆེ-ལེ	OR khrog chi li. "bunt schillernd, durcheinander." Kaschewsky 82.
ཁྲ-བོའི-ཤ	Stein.
ཁྲབ	reins. rta khrab zung cig tu sbrel nas / bla ma la gtong mi nus. Zhi-byed Coll. V 308.2.
ཁྲབ-ཁྲབ	in 4 114B.1 it is something in the body. Chang says 'cartilege.'
ཁྲབ-མ	Held, Recke. Kaschewsky2.
ཁྲབ-བརྒྱ-བྱང-བུ	go cha'i steng gi lcags leb lta bu la go dgos / brgya ni mang po ston pa'i tshig. Gser Sbram 23.
ཁྲབ-གསར-མ	'proverbial' expression explained in BBNP 468.
ཁྲག-འགྱུང	See ba sha ka.
ཁྲག-འཐུང	See ba sha ka.

ཁྲག-གི-ཁྲུག-གི	(<'khrug pa, to disorder) = khrag khrug. disorderly. Soundings 27.

ཁྲག-ཤོག-པ	See thang phrom nag po.
ཁྲག-འཀྲུགས-ཀུན-སེལ	a medicinal preparation. BT 33r.2.
ཁྲག-རླུང-སྟོད-འཚང	See Mengele, dGe-'dun-chos-'phel 62.
ཁྲག-རླུང-དུད-པ	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 85. Lag-len 60.5. TMC 9 (8).
ཁྲལ	Stein.
ཁྲལ-པ	taxpayer. The highest sort of (the 3 kinds) of mi ser. They were tied to the agricultural land which they held hereditarily. So long as they kept certain obligations to their lord, they could not be evicted. They had the heaviest tax burdens, including corvée service. Goldstein, Taxation 4.
ཁྲལ-རྒྱུག	taxation, administration of taxes. Sources.
ཁྲལ-རོགས	a type of spyi mi employed by a khral pa. Goldstein, Taxation 23.
ཁྲལ-རྟེན	the landholdings that were the basis for assessing taxes.
ཁྲལ-སྐྱོར	substitutes. Dargyay, TVC 65.
ཁྲལ-ཚབ	'substitute taxpayer' settled in a district by the authorities in order to provide a replacement for a previous taxpayer who had died without issue, but whose obligation to render taxes is still borne by the community (see khol tshab). Sources.
ཁྲལ-ཞིང-ཁྲལ-ཁྱིམ	'taxable fields, taxable houses' forming part of a single tax estate. Sources.
ཁྲལ-མ-ཁྲོལ	undefining (perceptions) or undefining (appearances). Thondup, BM 309. bar du rigs pa khral ma khrol du bzhag pa'o. Rgya-ras-pa in Gling-ras-pa, Bka'-'bum II 531.2.
ཁྲལ-འཁུལ-བ	Btsan-lha.
ཁྲམ	Namdak. Todeszeichen, Zeichen des Yama. Kaschewsky2. dgra la khram byas nas mi thams cad shi skad ni dbus par la dgra la kham byas nas mi thams cad bsad skad ces 'byung bas gam nyug byas te thams cad bsad zer zhes pa yin snyam. Dpe-chos 517. gzhan la khram 'debs kyang ma myong snyam bas. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 155.3 (also, 155.1, 155.4)
ཁྲམ-པ	'hustler.'
ཁྲམ-ཤིང	SKC 120.1. Norbu, Drung 81. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 226, 342, 348. There is a considerable discussion in TPS 592 and footnote.
ཁྲམ-ནག-རེར-འཆའ-བ	g.yo khram gyi khram yin pas khram nag seng bar 'gro. 367 I 241.2.
ཁྲང-ཐང-བ	sra brtan rgyun chags pa. 367 II 132.6. Btsan-lha.
ཁྲེ	JD 213.
ཁྲེ-རྒོད	JD 213. LW 502.
ཁྲེའུ	khra bo. Dpe-chos 517. Btsan-lha.
ཁྲེབ	Btsan-lha.
ཁྲེགས-ཆོད	Breakthrough. (Klong-chen-pa 8.9 comm.). a special practice of Rdzogs-chen. 91 I 642.2. Padma-gling-pa, Works XIII 401.4. Tucci, Religions 131, etc. Ruegg 312. Germano, Poetic Thought 841. Nomads 269-70.
ཁྲེལ	Acc. to Namgyal Nyima, this word is different from ngo tsha, which means shame (on account of the perceptions of others), but means something more like English 'conscience,' which doesn't depend on the perceptions of others.
ཁྲེལ-གད	Also, khrel bgad, khrel rgod, khrel dgod. a scornful or ridiculing laugh. lha ye shes spyan can gyis khrel gad byas par rtsi ba yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 249.4.
ཁྲེལ-གྱིས	= 'ba' zhig. BBNP 483.
ཁྲེལ-མེད	khrel med pa'i ngo bo ni / dmigs yul nyes spyod la dmigs nas rnam pa gzhan rgyu mtshan du byas nas rang stobs kyis 'dzems pa med pa'i rnam pa can byed las nyes spyod 'phel bar byed pa'i sems byung ste / kun btus las / khrel med pa gang zhe na / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzems pa ste nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no zhes gsungs la / nyes spyod la gzhan rgyu mtshan du byas nas rang stobs kyis 'dzems pa med pa'i sems byung zhes kyang bya'o. Gser Sbram 238.
ཁྲེལ-ཡོད	decorum.
ཁྲེམ-མེ	lhang lhang ba. 367 II 129.3. Btsan-lha.
ཁྲེས-པོ	Lasten, Bürde. Kaschewsky2. khres po sgres gsol cig la dbus par du khres po khur la rgyug cig ces 'byung la khres po ni khur bo'i ming yin. Dpe-chos 512.
ཁྲེས-ཀྱིས-བོར-བ	= lings kyis bor ba. BBNP 483.
ཁྲི-ཁ	khri kha nas dud lings kyis mtthong zhes par dbus par la khri kha nas ming cig ma thogs zhes 'byung la / khri kha nas dud lings kyis mthong zhes pa ltar na khri steng nas mar 'dud de gzengs bstod cig ma byas zhes pa yin snyam. Dpe-chos 517.
ཁྲི-ལོ	a small type of gshang bell. Helffer in Karmay, Habitants 347, 348.
ཁྲི-མོན	btson gra. Gces 588.2. Yisun (also spelled khri mun). Bu-ston, Works VII 764.1: khri mon las thar byed pa. Zhi-byed Coll. II 245.7: btson ra'i khri mon la bde' skyid kyi gnas su mthong nas.
ཁྲི-མོང	gzhan snang yid la myi 'gyu ba khri mong du tshud pa'i rtson bu lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 475.7.
ཁྲི-པ	abbot; Only exceptionally, used for lay patrons, with reference to their high seating. It usually would refer to a 'chairholder' or abbot of a monastery. Schrempf in Karmay, New Horizons 331.
ཁྲི-རྩེ	ZZ = lag ngar. Bru 291.3.
ཁྲི-ཤིང	rang stobs kyis gyen du skye mi nus par ljon shing sogs gzhan la brten na gyen du 'gro nus pa'i shing zhig yin. Eimer, Dbyangs 56. Should be spelled 'khri shing.
ཁྲི-སྙན	May be spelled khri gnyan. See Yisun, which says khri snyan is simply an abbr. form of khri snyan sa le, in turn a Tibetanization of krishna sA ra, the black speckled antelope. khri snyan myig sgyu la chu'i gdung pa ma chod na. Zhi-byed Coll. II 159.3. 'phar spyang dred la khri snyan zhe myi sdang. Zhi-byed Coll. I 289.2. myig rgyu la chu myed par ma go ba'i khri snyan sa le snying rje. Zhi-byed Coll. II 160.6. khri snyan bu la brtse ba myi gtong ba lta bu thugs rje'i gdung ba dang ldan pa dang drug. Zhi-byed Coll. V 248.4.

ཁྲི-གླིང-པ	Btsan-lha.

ཁྲོ-བ	The preferred translation is 'belligerence,' since it is an intention to harm beings directly visible in one's immediate environment (not beings in the past or future).

ཁུལ	this term originally indicated a district, but was later replaced by rdzong. It is still used with a less well defined meaning. Petech.
ཁུམ-འཕྲིག	Btsan-lha.

ཁུངས-བཅད	have been substantiated. Sources.
ཁུངས-ཕྱུང	See comments of Dorji Wangchuk in TS9 X 270. He says it means 'undermining,' but also possibly to 'challenge' or 'question.'

ཁུར-ཆུང	See rtsa mkhris.
ཁུར-དྲོགས	Btsan-lha.
ཁུར-མང	dandelion; Spelled khur mangs, Das says it is the dandelion; Pha Dam-pa ate it. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 352.4. BA 294. KP1 75.5. There are white, black, chinese (rgya khur) and 'fox' (wa khur) varieties. KP4 418.4.
ཁུར-མོང	JD 209. SS 520.3.
ཁུར-པོ	khur po stod du bsig byas nas sha bo ngal zhes pa ni / khur bo khur nas lam du ngal gso long med par 'gro bai tshe thang chad pa na sa la 'dug long med kyang khur po stod la bkyag nas yud tsam re bsdad pas shin tu ngal ba la chung zhig phan pas de la sha bo ngal zer. Dpe-chos 506.

ཁྱ-གེ-ཁྱོ-གེ	(<khyog, to be crooked) = khyag khyog. crookedly. Soundings 25.

ཁྱབ-པ	penetration, interpenetration, concomitance, invariable concomitance (Thurman), disseminate. Or, just simply, 'extent, range of coverage.' Skt. vyapti. Stein. For khyab che, see Sopa in JIABS III, no. 1, pp. 70 ff.
ཁྱབ-འཇུག-རིལ-མ	See rgya skyags.
ཁྱབ-འཇུག-གི-འཇུག-པ-བཅུ	nya / rus sbal / phag rgod / mi'i seng ge / mi'u thung / rA ma Na / nag po / shAkya thub pa / rigs ldan / kIrti tsi rnams so // de la 'jug pa dang po ni / sngon rig byed bzhi rgya mtsho'i nang du nub pa khyab 'jug gis nya ru sprul te bton pa dang gnyis pa ni / rus sbal gyi gzugs kyis 'jig rten btegs nas rgyun du gnas pa dang / gsum pa ni phag rgod kyi gzugs kyis tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad mnan pa dang / bzhi pa ni smad mi la stod seng ge'i gzugs kyis lha min gyi dbang po 'gro skyob gser can lto dral nas bsad pa dang / lnga pa ni / mi'u thung du sprul nas lha min stobs ldan gom pa gsum gyi sa bslang zhes bslus pa dang / drug pa ni / dza mAd agna'i bu dgra sta rA mar sprul te rgyal rigs srid sgrub la sogs pa bsad nas rgyal srid med par byas pa dang / bdun pa ni / rgyal po shing rta bcu pa'i bu rA ma Nar sprul nas rang gi chung ma srin po lingka mgrim bcus phrogs pas spre'u ha lu manydzu la grogs bcol te srin po btul ba dang / brgyad pa ni / nag la rtsod pa'i dus su sems can gyi don byas pa dang / dgu pa ni / sangs rgyas shAkya thub tu sprul nas sngon rgyal rigs bsad pa'i sdig pa sbyangs pa dang / bcu pa ni / rigs ldan bram ze'i bu kIrti tsi ces bya ba ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bas sems can mang po btul ba'i mthar dus ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'o. 600 137-140.

ཁྱག	mi rnams skyid la khyag chung// sdug la khyag che/: People can bear great suffering, but only a little happiness (Phadampa). Thondup, EL 126.

ཁྱེའུ-སུས	Btsan-lha.
ཁྱེད	"to halt, stop." <<re shig khyed la sdod cig>>, "halt and remain awhile!" Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 319.
ཁྱེད-བྱ	See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs 110n.
ཁྱེད-རས	= khyed rang gis. "You." Kaschewsky 82. (dbus) = khyad rang gis. MTTP.
ཁྱེམ-བུ	Btsan-lha.
ཁྱེན-ཧུན	LW 520.
ཁྱེན-ཏེ	See khun ti.
ཁྱེར-ཀ	phag gi lus la khyer ka myed kyang / zas dang / skom dang / gnas phyogs ris med pa'i stobs kyis... Zhi-byed Coll. II 103.1.
ཁྱི	A propos du chien au Tibet, by Corneille Jest, in Ethnozootechnie, no. 25, pp. 33-37. = khri. "throne." Kuijp (1986) 35. as a unit of measure, the distance between the tips the of thumb and the little finger spread out. Vitali, Tho.ling 61. 'khor ba las blo myi ldog pa'i thos bsam bsgom gsum khyi yin. The learning, reflection & meditation of one who has not turned the mind from sangsara is a dog! Zhi-byed Coll. II 267.1 (other examples follow). Pha-dam-pa often uses 'dog' in this sense. Pa-tshab also uses it (Zhi-byed Coll. IV 42.5 ff.). Six good qualities that can be learned from the dog. Flick, Carrying Enemies 49. Simile of the hungry dog cracking a bone in its mouth who, even though his mouth is bleeding, thinks he's happy (compared to thinking one is happy with a woman). Flick, Carrying Enemies 111. = ku ku ra tsa, gzhan la zug, nor skyong, padma. JD 246. SS 500.1.
ཁྱི-འཚེད	dog cooker. Roesler in Facets 167.
ཁྱི-དམ	'dog brand,' having the word 'dog' branded on the forehead as a legal punishment. French, Yoke 323. See also Havnevik, Dissertation 66, 251. Ahmad Shah, Four Years in Tibet 38.
ཁྱི-དུག	SRZT 137.
ཁྱི-གུ	rtog pas rtog pa spong ba khyi gus khyi gu 'byin pa lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 474.5. Generally, khyi gu means 'puppy,' although I'm not certain that is the exact intended meaning here. It may mean something you cough up, like phlegm (see khyi phrug).
ཁྱི-གཞོབ	ash made from burnt dog hair. Btsan-lha.
ཁྱི-ཕྲུག	'puppies,' dough-like lumps that the oracle spits into the water to show that the cause of the disease has been extracted. Epstein, Dissertation 209.
ཁྱི-རྒན	as an insult, occuring in songs of D.L. VI, and other places, discussed by H. Decleer in a review article.
ཁྱི-རྟ	In origin, a transcription of Skt. kITa, 'insect,' but misinterpreted for obvious reasons to mean dog and horse. Emmerick in G. Meulenbeld & D. Wujastyk, Studies on Indian Medical History, Motilal (Delhi 2001) 61.
ཁྱི-ཤིག	flea; 'dog louse' or rather 'flea.' Roesler in Facets 179.
ཁྱི-ཤིང	Mdo 58. DG 214.3.
ཁྱི-སྣ	n. for an artistic motif. Vitali, Tho.ling 74.
ཁྱི-ཐོར	leavings for the dogs. de dang ngas khyi thor cig zhag gsum mchan du bcug na. Zhi-byed Coll. II 145.7.

ཁྱོབས-པ	skyobs pa. Btsan-lha.
ཁྱོད	you. "This pronoun, which usually means 'you,' has a technical sense in the Collected Topics (and in debating language in general): it refers to whatever phenomenon is being introduced in the logical operations." Dreyfus, Sound 199. The variable (Onoda discusses this in his book at some length).
ཁྱོགས	Also, khyogs dpyang, khyogs khri, 'gyogs byams, 'byogs khri 'do li, do le, etc. sedan-chair, litter. Called shing-chyam in Das, JTL&CT 130, which contains a discussion on why in Tibet they were used for only the Dalai Lama, Panchen Lama, Amban and Regent. Several illus. in Precious Deposits V 99-100.
ཁྱོང	khyung. Btsan-lha.
ཁྱོར	unstable. Soundings 25.
ཁྱོས-པོ	Btsan-lha.

ཀླན-པ	Btsan-lha.
ཀླན-ཀ-ཅན	rtsod pa yod pa'am rtsod gzhi slong mkhan. Dung-dkar 114.

ཀླས-པ	Btsan-lha. byams klas pa dang mtha' klas pa ni mtha' thug pa med pa rgya che ba'i don. Utpal 16.1.
ཀླེ-བོ	a vessel made with willow, bamboo and the like. Btsan-lha.
ཀླེ-བོ-མ-བྱེད	Btsan-lha.
ཀླི-ཅི-དོན	See shing mngar.
ཀླིང	Btsan-lha.
ཀློག-གྲྭ	Dung-dkar 124.
ཀློག-སྦྱོང	Dung-dkar 124.
ཀློག-ཀྱང-ཀླག	klog kyang klag ni yi ge dang gsung rab klag pa. Utpal 16.2.
ཀློང	[= klongs]. receptive centre. Skt. Avarta, 'spiral inward' [M.Vy.], 'turning-place, whirlpool.' Nisarga, 'array, nature.' Vipula, 'large, extensive, vast.' Stein. 75 2. See Germano, Poetic Thought 937, for the cowardly translation 'space.' This seems quite close to Sino-Tibetan words for 'middle' (related to Tib. gzhung); Coblin, Sinologist's 53. nags klong ni nags tshal chen po'i khrod. chu klung ni chu chen po. dba' klong ni rba rlabs. Utpal 11.2. Achard, L'Essence 88 n. 41.
ཀློང-འགྱུར	totally realized state. Thondup, BM 282.
ཀློང-དགུ	1. lta ba. 2. spyod pa. 3. dkyil 'khor. 4. dbang. 5. dam tshig. 6. sgrub pa. 7. phrin las. 8. sa lam. 9. 'bras bu. Divisions of klong sde. Mkhyen-rab-rgya-mtsho[1557] 291.3. Dung-dkar 125.

I prefer the translation, 'perfectly internalized.' khong du chud pa. dbang du gyur pa, brtan pa thob pa. Btsan-lha. klong du gyur ni khong du chud cing rang byan tshud pa'i don. Utpal 11.3. Dung-dkar 126.

ཀོ	ni; See da ko AND 'di ko. kun rdzob las zin ko mtha' yas med ni dbus par du kun rdzob las zin ko 'thas med ces 'byung ste kun rdzob tu las gang zin tshad mthas med pa ste sra 'thas rtag brtan du med pas bsgyur nus zhes pa'i don no. Dpe-chos 517. According to Btsan-lha, this is an O.T. equivalent of the particle ni. ni zhes pa'i sgra ste 'di ko 'di ni lta bu. ཀོ-སྒྲོ	ko ba'i khug ma chen po. Nomads 231.
ཀོ-ཤག	ko lcag. Btsan-lha. Mispelled ko sha in Dung-dkar 96, where it is explained. In Sa-skya times it replaced the horsewhip (rta lcag). It could be used, as a punishment, on either cheek or buttock.

ཀྲ-ཀ	khams na sgun 'brum (rgun 'brum) skems pa la kra ka srung dgos pas / de la dang po kra ka gcig bsad de gsob phyar bas des thub skad. They say that in Khams, when they dry raisins, they have to protect them from the kra-ka. So first they kill a kra-ka and fly it as a scarecrow (?), and that does the job. Zhi-byed Coll. I 417.5. Here it seems to be a strange spelling for ka ka, or, kA ka ('crow'), although it may intend another bird.

ཀྲི-ཀྲིའི-རྨི-ལྟས-བཅུ	Ten dream signs of King Kri-kri. rgyal po kri kri'i rmi ltas bcu ni / glang po che'i lus skar khung nas thon kyang mjug ma de la thogs pa rmis pa ni dang po'o // glang po che phal bas spos kyi glang po che skrod pa ni gnyis pa'o // mi gtsang bas gos pa'i spre'us spre'u gzhan la mi gtsang ba skud pa ni gsum pa'o // spre'u gcig gis spre'u'i tshogs la dbang bskur ba ni bzhi pa'o // tsan dan sbrul gyi snying po dang shing phal ba mgo snyom pa ni lnga pa'o // phye bre gang dang mu tig bre gang brje ba ni drug pa'o // gtsug lag khang gi nye 'khor na yod pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu rkun pos khyer ba ni bdun pa'o // gtsang zhing yid du 'ong ba'i khron pas skom pa'i mi'i rjes su bsnyegs kyang mi 'thung ba ni brgyad pa'o // skye bo mang po sde ris su bcad nas rtsod pa ni dgu pa'o // ras yug gcig mi bco brgyad kyis bgos pas thams cad la tshang ma re thob cing / rtsa ba'i ras yug ma nyams pa ni bcu pa'o. (See 600 129-133 for interpretation of these dream signs, predicting the future of Buddhism.)
ཀྲི-དབེན-ལོ-ཉི-ཤུ-རྩ-གསུམ-པ	Dung-dkar 109.
ཀྲི-ན-ས-ར	See gnyan.

ཀྲི-མི-ཛ	See rgya skyags.
ཀྲིཥཎ-ཕ-ལ	See so ma ra dza.
ཀྲིག-ཅར	chags can. Chödag.
ཀྲིག-གི	Stein.

ཀུན-ཏུ-རྒྱུག-པ	Skt. AdhAvamAn (?) 'laundered, clean.'
ཀུན-ཏུ-སྐྱོ-བ	Skt. saMvega, 'aesthetic shock'. See Schopen (1986) note 8.
ཀུན-ཏུ-སྦྱོར-བ-གསུམ	Dung-dkar 78.
ཀུན-ཏུ-རྟོག-པ	sems kyi rnam par rtog pa ste / sems la phyin ci log gi rtog pa sna tshogs 'char ba dang / sems zhi bar mi gnas pa dang / yul mngon sum du mthong ba min par rtogs pas sgro btags sna tshogs byed pa'o. Gser Sbram 357.
ཀུན-ཏུ-ཤིས-མ	lha mo u mAH kun gyi ma / kun la bkra shis ma. Chödag.

ཀུན-བྱེད-རྒྱལ-པོ	See spang rtsi. a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 54. Lag-len 35.4.
ཀུན-ཕན-ནོར-བུ	Dpa'-ris.
ཀུན-ཕན-བདེ-བྱེད	a medicinal preparation. See se 'bru kun phan bde byed.
ཀུན-ཕན-ཉིན-བྱེད	Dung-dkar 84. The sun.
ཀུན-འབྱུང-གཉིས	'khor bar 'phen pa'i las kyi kun 'byung dang / de kun nas slong byed kyi nyon mongs dug gsum gnyis ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i gzhi rtsa lta bu yin pas kun 'byung zhes brjod srol yod. Dung-dkar 85.

ཀུན-འདེད-པོ	gshin rje. Chödag.

ཀྱག-ཟོས	shiteating[/er]? gdams ngag snod du bzhag nas rang rgyud tha mal du sdod pa kyag zos yin. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 46.7. chos bya bsams med pa'i mi de 'bras bu mdo don gtor ba yin te kyag pa zos pa'i khyi yin gsung. That person, who has no thought of doing religious practices, is losing the meaningful opportunity for results. He is a shiteating dog. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 48.3.

ཀྱིས	One of the forms of the instrumental ending. Beyer, CT Lang. 353-354, says that when affixed to final verbs, this is a 'promise particle.' Another use with final verbs, it implies a disjuncture between the preceding and following verbal statements.

ལཱ-ཏ	NMH 71.6.
ལཱཀ-ཥ-བྲ-པཱ-ད-ན	See zhu mkhan.
ལ-འུར	myur du. Gces 584.3. = mgyogs pa, = myur ba. BBNP 472, 478. Btsan-lha. Something sudden or on the spur of the moment. Samdo A IV 253r.6. la 'ur bros cig 'bros pa'i dus ni da res yin. ལ-བོ	Namdak.
ལ-བསྭེ	Acc. to Aris, Hidden Treasures 51, it is a combination of la cha (shellac or wax) and bse ko (varnished leather).
ལ-བཙས	476 IV 414.7. cairn. Karmay in JA (1995) 172, etc. "formed by heaps of stones in which poles bearing klung rta flags are put up. They are set up on to top of passes in honour of the local deities." Norbu, Drung 235, n. 46. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 141. Karmay in Karmay, New Horizons 383.
ལ-ཅ	usual spelling, la cha. rdza ma tshig na la ca myi 'go ba yin. Zhi-byed Coll. II 213.7. Most likely derived from Sanskrit, as is the English word lac. See Hobson-Jobson. gus pa'i blo myed na rgyud la byin brlabs myi 'jug pa rdza grang la la ca myi 'go ba lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 471.7. dper na rdza ma tshig na la ca myi 'go ba bzhin no. Zhi-byed Coll. V 307.1.
ལ-ཆ	See under la ca. JD 128. lA kSa. wax. LW 513. SS 533.4.
ལ-ཆུ	See chu rtsa. For la chu'i rtsa ba, see under chu rtsa.
ལ-དོར	similar to la bzla ba. Namdak.
ལ-དུ	An Indian sweet with cardamon & pepper. Thondup, EL 122. mar dang bag phye sogs rdzas brgyad las grub pa'i za chas. Btsan-lha. Mentioned in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 160 among food items not known in Tibet.
ལ-གཅན	sho gam. sho khral. bya ra byed sa'i gnas. sa srung ba'am sho gam pa. Btsan-lha.
ལ-གོར	O.T. = mgyogs pa. = skyen ba. See la mo. Blan 288.6, 309.2. mi thogs pa'am mi 'gor ba dang mgyogs pa. Btsan-lha.
ལ-ཁ	See rgya skyags. la kha'i ltang bu mi 'dur ram. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 125.5. la kha'i bya sgro ji bzhin du // rkyen gyis phar sgyur tshur sgyur byed. ལ-ཀོ	= lwang ko. T&BS I 210.

ལ-ཉེ	a sign, omen (?). Gold Ms. I 20v.4. rtags mtsham. Btsan-lha. SKC 127.1. la nye'i sgo nas dngos grub 'byung lugs dang. Zhi-byed Coll. I 188.6.

ལ-ཡོགས	a change in fortune due to external circumstances without any necessary link to past causes. Epstein, Dissertation 124.
ལ-ཁྱི-མོ	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 293.

ལ-གཅན-གྱི-ལྕེ-རྟེན	la gcan gyi brjod pa'am khag skyel ba. Btsan-lha.
ལ-ནུ-བཻ-ཌཱུརྱ	DG 81.4.
ལ-ཡོགས-སྡིག	gzhan la ngan byas pa'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal ba rang thog tu smin pa. Btsan-lha.
ལ-ན-རྒ-ཀུན-དོང	See btsong.
ལ-བཟླ-བ	[= la dor ba] pass over the pass. An O.T. tr. of Skt. niyama which later translators rendered as thag gcod pa, 'absolute settlement, decisive event...' This, like some other O.T. translation terms, has an evident Tibetan flavor, which is a good thing. Klong-chen-pa 9 (title, etc.). Thondup, BM 269. Karmay, Great Perfection 54 n. 55. Germano, Poetic Thought 896. Karmay, Treasury.
ལ-འུར-ཤོག	= la gor shog. "Come quick!" Kuijp (1986) 35.

Just as they, even though there haven't died (any of their own relatives), make a pretense of being afflicted. Ibid. I 421.4. skyabs 'gro gzhan gyi lad mo tshun chad dus der byed. Ibid. V 170.1. thub pa'i lad mo spyan ras gzigs kyis byas pa. Zhi-byed Coll. III 101.1.

ལན-བུ	plait (ponytail or braid).
ལན-ཆགས	a particular type of generalized karma which designates a relationship across lives in which the roles of the parties are reversed (a former master becomes the servant to his former servant, etc.). May also refer to the entities that seek retribution; divided into sha 'khon (those who bear malice towards our flesh) and rgyu 'khon (those who bear malice toward our property). Epstein, Dissertation 81, 106. Tucci, Religions 181. bu tsha lan chags snyog pa la byams par byas kyang mgu' ba myi 'ong. Zhi-byed Coll. II 304.7.
ལན-གློན	dri lan 'debs pa'am bzang ngan gyi lan slog pa. Btsan-lha.
ལན-ཀན	O.T. = kha khyer. = steg bu. = pu shu. Blan 298.5, 300.5, 517.1. khang pa khyams mtha skor du spang leb bam shing gi dra mig. Btsan-lha. fence, railing, enclosure. Spelled lan khan in Das. khang pa'i bya 'dabs pu shu'i ming. Utpal 14.4.
ལན-ལྡོན	lan 'debs pa. Btsan-lha. bzang lan ngan gyis ldon ba'i gang zag de dud 'gro las ma 'das pa yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 460.5.

ལར	lar ci byas dgos myed yin gyis / rang gi nyams kho na skyongs cig ang. Zhi-byed Coll. III 15.6. lar byas pa'i chos rnams 'jig pa yin. 601 18r.2. lar mdzad spyod lam du ma slongs na. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 128.1.

ལར-རྒྱ	customs, mores, integrity, accord. A kind of "feel" for culture that one must be born into. Nornang & Epstein in JTS II 79. See the compound bstan lar. Etymological meaning seems to be "sealed in wax" (imprint, impress?). "general interest." Essais 137. bya ba'am las don. Btsan-lha.

ལས-ཡན-ཀིན	kha khyer ram stegs bu. Btsan-lha.
ལས-འཕྲོ-ཅན	one who has good karma or good fate derived from suffering in former lives. MTTP.
ལས-བྱེད-པ	(mod.) cadre. A person in a position of responsibility in the bureaucracy. Barnett, Resistance.
ལས-གསར-དུ-བྱེད-པ	a variant, and better, rendering of Skt. navakarmika, more commonly rendered lag gi bla, & probably the earliest monastic office to be mentioned in inscriptions. Schopen in IIJ 44 (2001) 116. He or she was a monk or nun put in charge of building or construction projects that would last a limited number of years.
ལས-དབང-ཅན	one who has merited good fortune. MTTP.
ལས-ཚན-བཅུ-གསུམ	bod kyi bla dpon chen po rnams la dgos pa'i las tshan bcu gsum ni / gsol gzims mchod gsum / 'jal yig mdzod gsum / thab 'dren gdan gsum / skya rta mdzo khyi bzhi rnams so. 600 174-175.
ལས-དོན-རུ-ཁག	(mod.) 'work team' a temporary unit of party members formed to conduct investigations or give political re-education in a particular institution or locality. Barnett, Resistance.
ལས-ཚོགས-བཅུ	rgyud kyi las tshogs rdo rje slob dpon gyis // dam tshig dbang dang bzlas brjod gtor ma dang // sbyin bsreg bum chog tsha tsha rab gnas dang // srung skud 'dogs dang gshin po'i cho ga bcu.
ལས-སུ-བསྐོ-བ	karmadAna. M.Vy. Silk, Dissert. 230, 234, etc. Person responsible for care of visiting monks.
ལས-སུ-རུང-བ	ready for action, horny (the latter usage found in Vinaya text).
ལས-སྩོགས-པ	la sogs pa. Btsan-lha.

ལས-ཀྱི-གནས-ཀྱི-རིག-པ	las ka'i rigs la mkhas pa'i rig pa'am shes rab.

ལྕགས-འབྱུང-བའི-རྡོ	SS 504.5.
ལྕལ-ཏི-ལྕལ-ཏི	'khyar re 'khor re. Btsan-lha.
ལྕམ	= drab. See 367 II 130.6. A part of a house construction. See Dag-yig 67. rafter. Beyer, CT Lang. 146, according to which it is equivalent to phyam. skabs 'gar dra ba la 'jug pa. Btsan-lha.
ལྕམ-དྲལ	a che ming po'i ming. Blan 516.5.
ལྕམ-ལྕམ	Stein.
ལྕམ-མོ	See bod lcam.
ལྕམ-པ	Fundamentals 16.2 (item 17). Malva verticellata L. Hübotter/1 1, 115; Chinese malve; heals retention of urine & diarrhea. Hübotter/2 2, 74. JD 141. SS 479.6. Types: pho lcam, mon lcam, mo lcam. KP1 190.2. = nyi dga'. YTTM 293.18. DG 263.4 Mdo 322. Tibetan medicine knows three kinds. JD 141: 1) Male lcam pa (pho lcam) groows on tall stalks in meadows. It has large leaves and wide mouthed white flowers. 2) Female lcam pa (mo lcam), smaller than the preceding. 3) Neuter lcam pa (ma ning lcam pa, = mon lcam). Dag-yig: A perennial herb. It grows to a height of 25-90 centimeters. The main stalk grows straight. The leaves are almost circular in shape. The flowers are brownish-red or light red depending on the species (rigs). The flowers open in the 8th or 9th month. The fruit is made into a medicine. There are three kinds: male, female & neuter.
ལྕམ-ཤིང	architecturally, this refers to 'joists' (the 'beams' that hold up the floorboards).
ལྕང-ཀ	nya sod na lcang ka na yang lcang ka / ko ba nyed pa dang 'dra mod. Zhi-byed Coll. III 24.4.

ལྕེབ-པ	to take a suicidal leap, an O.T. method of suicide, generally involving drowning (or, in old times, water swallowing). Example of usage in Haarh, Yar-lun 405 (final line). Zhi-byed Coll. II 280.5; IV 196.2; V 466.3.

ལྷག-མ-བཅུ-གསུམ	See spang bya lhag ma bcu gsum. In vinaya terminology, lhag ma means 'remainder,' since in these infractions of the rules, unlike the 'defeats' (pham pa) which have no remainder that may be purified or absolved, these do have some remainder that may be purified.

ལྷོག-པ	lhog pa ni skrangs nas 'brum pa chu bur 'dra ba sogs 'byung ba'i rma rigs so. Dpe-chos 510. der yul la chags pa'i blo mi skye ste / dper na lhog pa'i ro phyir byung ba la gces 'dzin mi skye ba bzhin no. Zhi-byed Coll. V 499.3. mi phyugs gnyis kar byung ba'i 'go nad rma rigs shig ti ming. tshig bsdus na <<lhog>> ces 'bri chog ste: rma lhog, tsher lhog, skrangs lhog ces pa lta bu. Dag-yig. See under lhog. SRZT 65. 'cancer' acc. to Dhongthog.

ལྷོག-དུག-ནག-པོ	See nya sman pa.
ལྷོགས-པ	bzlog pa. bsdus pa'am 'thu ba dang blangs pa sogs. klog pa. Btsan-lha.

ལྷོན-པ	thos pa'am son pa. Btsan-lha.
ལྷོང-བ	spyir lhong yang ba la yang bla ma byin rlabs che ba dang / gdams ngag gi gnad zab pa dang / rang go cha che ba gsum 'joms na lhong nas yong ba yin gsungs so // de yang lhong ba bar chad thams cad dngos grub kyi snga ltas yin pas / lhong rab la dngos grub rab... Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 514.2. rang bzhin bsgrub pa gnad du bsnun pas / lus sems la na tsha byung ba'am / duh kha'am / bar chad la sogs pa byung ba de lhong byung ba yin gsungs. Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 515.5.
ལྷོང-ཚད	Edou writes about lhong tshad as a level of accomplishment (Edou, Machig 217, also 73) and talks about 'symptom (of realization).' These are bodily or mental discomforts, which may transform into interferences on the level of magical projections, cho 'phrul. Tulku Thondup (Masters of Meditation & Miracles, Shambhala [Boston 1996], pp. 185-86) uses the term slong tshad in the meaning of 'stirrings-up' that are eliminated in the practice of Gcod. Havnevik, Dissertation 273.
ལྷོངས	ngang dang ring. Btsan-lha. dam pa bdag gis gting gi go ba ma lhongs sam zhus pas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 338.6.
ལྷུ	lhu tshigs. Gces 589.3. so nam gyi lhu ni / kha gso ba'i las skal. Dpe-chos 506. 4 113r.2. dbang po'i sgo 'dod pas gson po lhu gzug tu bsil ba bas 'bum 'gyur gyis sdug. Zhi-byed Coll. V 522.2. lus kyi tshigs pa zhig nas tshigs pa gzhan zhig gi bar gyi dum bu'i ming ste: lug sha lhu sne'i ming. Dag-yig.
ལྷུ-མགོ	lhu sne'i ming. Dag-yig.
ལྷུ-ཚིགས	lhu gnyis 'brel mtshams kyi ming. dum bu mang po bsgrigs nas grub pa'i yo byad kyi dum bu'i ming ste: sga cha lhu bzhi, 'phrul 'khor gyi lhu bsgrigs lta bu. 'di la <<lhu lag>> kyang zer. Dag-yig.
ལྷུད-པ	lud pa'i brda rnying. Btsan-lha. Namdak.
ལྷུག-པ	relaxed with presence, alertly relaxed. Norbu, Cycle. diffuse, exuberant.
ལྷུགས-ཤིག	blugs shig. Btsan-lha.
ལྷུམས	mngal lam rum. Btsan-lha.
ལྷུན-གྲུབ	lhun gyis grub pa; [= lhun gyis grub pa] naturally-arrived-at. naturally derived. As when something 'just comes' to you without looking for it. 'natural' is an OK translation, but 'spontaneous' is not quite to the point. Usually an adj., but sometimes a noun or verb! Skt. anAbhoga/nirAbhoga, unbent, without circuitousness, without taking pains, without effort.
ལྷུན-མཉམ	naturally smooth. Klong-chen-pa 2.14, etc.
ལྷུན-ཆེ-བ	gzi brjid che ba. Btsan-lha.
ལྷུན-གྲུབ-ཀྱི-འཆར-ཚུལ-བརྒྱད	Thondup, BM 53, 191, 206. = lhun grub sgo brgyad kyi snang ba.
ལྷུང-བཟེད-བསྐྱམས-པ	lhung bzed bshal ba. Btsan-lha.
ལི	JD 41. DG 110.3.
ལི-ཊཾ	See rgya skyags.
ལི-ཧི	See rgya lgab.
ལི-ཀ	shing khyad par can zhig. Btsan-lha.
ལི-ཁྲི	See se 'dur ra. Blan 308.3. minium orange. Aris, Discourse 31. orange. Anyetsang in TSB 15 (1980) 6. JD 61. JD 61. YTTM 291.13. = sin dhu ra? SS 406.1. LW 453. TM I 50. DG 140.4.
ལི-ལི	Katze. Kaschewsky2.
ལི-མུན	= rlung. air. Karmay, Treasury. This is, in fact, a Zhang-zhung word.
ལི-རྒོད	See li shi.
ལི-རི	? li ri ltar sgrim pa. Samdo A VI 190r.1.
ལི-ཤང	"ceremonial rewarding." TS5 671.
ལི-ཤི	JD 76. = la baM ka. TM IV 62. = ku pi su ma. YTTM 291.14. a tree. SS 417.4. clove. TM I 50. Dhongthog. DG 149.5. Clifford, list. sngo li shi, Mdo 104. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). TM I 62: Eugenia caryophyllata, Thunb. TM I 50, Dhongthog: clove. Hübotter/1 70: Caryophyllus aromaticus L. Both DG 149.5 and JD 76 distinguish between wild & cultivated varieties, both of them imported from China. Mdo 104-6 describes a herb called li shi native to Tibet. The identical name may signify that this was considered to be a domestic substitute for the imported li shi (which comes from trees).
ལི-ཐགས	? dper na li thags yi ges btan la mi phebs pa bzhin no. Zhi-byed Coll. V 36.2.
ལི-ཙི	plum. LW 516. Looks suspiciously like the lychee (native to S. China).
ལི-དོང-གྲ	See (sman) sga.
ལི-ཚེ-རི	a kind of iron. DG 108.2.
ལི-ཁ-ར	a word for both bu ram, and shel ka ra. BBNP 479. bu ram. Btsan-lha. shing li kha ra, see ka ra. LW 455.

ལིག-ཤི-ཝེར	O.T. = dzA ti. = sna ma'i me tog. Blan 301.4. Btsan-lha. Certainly looks like a Zhang-zhung word, meaning something like 'king of life.' (A handwritten note next to the entry in Das suggests it might be Zhang-zhung.)

ལྭ	dar zab bye brag pa zhig. Btsan-lha 925.

མ	For words with ma as suffix, see Laufer, Bird Divination 48. He says that it is usually used with words denoting space or time, but this doesn't really work!
མ-འདལ	a 'Tibetanizing' spelling for maNDal.
མ-འགབ	ma rung ba'am mi chog pa. Btsan-lha.
མ-འགྱུར	a pledge which is retained by the authorities if a promise remains 'unfulfilled' (ma 'gyur). Sources.

མ-ཧེ	O.T. deriv. from Skt. mahIrza. = sar nyal ('sleeping on the ground'). Blan 309.2. JD 235.
མ-ཇོ	translated as 'nun' in BA 181, etc. It might be a shortened formed of a ma jo mo?? It could possibly mean 'abbess' (see Zhang G.yu-brag-pa's autobiography), or a nun who teaches other nuns. In the Zhi-byed Coll. it seems to be a title for females that corresponds to bla ma for males.
མ-ལ	[= mar la] nach unten, dort unten. Kaschewsky 84. O.T. = kye ma. = kyi 'ud. Blan 298.1. kye ma. kye hud. ngo mtshar ba. gzhi nas sam rtsa ba nas dang rkang nas. Btsan-lha.

མ-མཐའ	literally means 'low end,' but used adverbially to mean 'at least,' or sometimes in clause initial position to mean 'even....'

མ-སྟེས	ma legs pa dang nyes pa. Btsan-lha.
མ-ཐ	last. Karmay, Treasury. See under ya tha. mas nas. Btsan-lha. ma tha yang yi ge drug pa 'grang myi shes pa ga na 'ong. Zhi-byed Coll. II 317.5. ma tha yang 'tsho ba sla ba cig gi sar myi bzhugs par zer bas. Ibid. II 150.7. Samdo A I 81r.6. It seems to me that ma tha yang and ma tha na yang mean 'in the lower extreme,' or 'in the very least,' 'at the low end of the scale' (for confirmation, see Jaeschke under tha na).
མ-ཐེམ	A part of a door. The threshold. See Dag-yig 167. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 4.
མ-ཐེངས	ma phyin nam ma skyel. Btsan-lha.
མ-ཐུན	lte ba. Btsan-lha.
མ-ཡར	ma'i tshab. Btsan-lha.
མ-ཡིག	may refer to the main line of the text, as distinguished from the added '[foot]notes' (mchan bu).
མ-ཞུ	= ma zhu ba. Mkhyen-rab/11 no. 16. Kong-sprul/1 30 ff: General symptoms: Flatulence is obstructed or occurs at irregular intervals, causing distension. After a time, it sometimes produces massive diarrhea. Heaviness of the body, loss of appetite, nausea at meal time, belching, headaches. Specific symptoms: Undigested residues (stickiness in the mouth giving off a bad smell). 'Crowding' of the stomach with eructations & vomitting. Eyes, face and the tops of the feet swell up. Undigested chyme (dwangs ma) stagnates and stops the appetite. Belching, leanness, heart pains, pains in the side of the rib cage. The causes and conditions producing ma zhu are easily known by questioning the patient. Old people & others who suffer a decline in their digestive heat get such 'cold' symptoms as distention and eructation as soon as they begin to eat. In cases of occasional ma zhu, the pulse is full and thick. In chronic ma zhu, there is little physical strength and the pulse is thin. If you closely examine the urine, you will find that it smells slightly of whatever food was not digested. When the ma zhu is a result of overeating, it is important to abstain from food. If one eats 'on top of' indigestion then it will be difficult to benefit from medicine. When it is a result of a decline in digestive heat, a warmth-producing medicine is very important.
མ-འཆུན-པ	ma theg pa'am ma khyag pa. Btsan-lha.
མ-ཉེས-པ	gros mthun pa. Btsan-lha.
མ-ལོངས-པ	a problematic phrase used by Rong-zom-pa in Almogi, MA thesis 213 n. 453.
མ-གྲངས-གྲོལ-བ	yid g.yengs shing spyad lam ma bsdams pa.
མ-གཡོས-པ	unmoved, unmovedness, uncompromised.

མ-བཅོས-པ-བཞི	Listed in Tsering Thar's paper on the Bon tantric practitioners of Reb-gong (Kokonoor). 1. skra ma bcos pa lcang lo (natural hair like a weeping willow), 2. snod ma bcos pa thod pa (a natural container skullcup), 3. gos ma bcos pa dkar po (a natural white cloth), 4. a natural mind like innate mind (he doesn't supply Tibetan for this one).

མལ	a clan. Btsan-lha. In Zhi-byed Coll. one often finds the expression bde mal, 'comfortable bed,' to mean 'a good place to be.' Example: Simply having extricated oneself from desiring thoughts is a good place to be, since the ultimate result of ulterior desire is suffering. 'dod blo cig pu thongs pas / des bde mal 'chos pa yin te / zhe 'dod kyi mtha' sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro. Zhi-byed Coll. V 174.7.
མལ-ལི-ཀ	LW 470.

མདའ-དཔོན	Avedon 30. arrow captain. Sources. Das, JTL&CT 80.
མདའ-གཡབ	a kind of wall on roof for protection from arrows, a part of the mandala.. A part of the design of the entryway to a mandala. This part is decorated with white lotuses. See Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 62.
མདའ-གཞུ	bow and arrow; an architecture & mandala term, it means the design on top of pillars, the capitals (which vaguely have the form of a bow and arrow). This acc. to Jinpa.
མདའ-ལྔ	See dga' rab dbang phyug gi me tog gi mda lnga.
མདའ-མོ	arrow divination. This is discussed, along with similar practices, in Yules-Cordier, Marco Polo I 243.
མདའ-རྒོད	Decorated arrow used in bsang ritual, see Karmay in JA (1995) 172.

མདའ-ཚད	an arrow's length; an arrow's length. Jackson.
མདའ-ཡབ	a mandala part, acc. to Jinpa, it should be translated 'parapet walls.'
མདའ-ཡིག	Goldstein, History 291. arrow letter. See Bernard 299, 309. Official pass for visitors to areas of Tibet, by which they are provided with transport and hospitality.
མདའ-མི-སྲང-པོ	a faulty reading for mda' yi srang po. Eimer, Dbyangs 55.
མདའ-སྟེའུ-ཁ-མ	mda'i rtse mo ste'u 'dra ba'i mda'i bye brag cig. Btsan-lha.

མདའ-ཁ-འུག-མ	mda' mde'u med pa. Dpe-chos 511. Btsan-lha.
མདའི-རྔ-མོ	See nya.
མདད	An O.T. word used in relation with burial or interment (Mike Walter's forthcoming paper). Haarh, Yar-lun 359 & esp. 361. Spelled mda'ad in Btsan-lha, where it is said to be equiv. to a 'dad that achieves virtue for the deceased. Generally seems to be used in the verbal phrase mdad btang ba. It is the final phase of burial, taking place about 3 years after death. In Btsan-lha. spelled mda'ad: gshin por dge ba sgrub pa'i 'dad. Btsan-lha.
མདག-གཞུག	O.T. = g.yog po. Also, ci bgyi. Blan 304.1.

མདུང-དོར	O.T. = rgyan 'gyed. Blan 285.5. rgyan dor ram rgyan po 'gyed pa. Btsan-lha.
མདུང-ཁྲ	mdung ring gi rked par lcags kyi dkris ring yod pa zhig go. Illustrated in Nomads 274, with parts labelled: mdung so, mdung yu, mdung dkris, & mdung phur.
མདུང-རྩེ	= (rdo) chig thub, (rdo) a ba. JD 45. = leg gu dmigs. YTTM 291.12. SS 402.5.. Original entry: (rnag thur) mdung rtse. medical implement in class of 'spoons' (thur ma). JD 278 (item 2). Called 'spear' because of the shape of the tip.
མདུང-ཤིང	Seee sgron shing.
མདུང-སློངས	rig pa mdung slongs su bskyur cig. Zhi-byed Coll. II 311.7.
མདུང-དོར-ཆམ-དུ-ནོད-པ	rgyan 'gyed gtan du thob pa. Btsan-lha.
མདུང-གང-ཡོད	ja mdong gang yod ces par gsal. 367 I 241.1.
མདུང-རྩེ-ཉེར-ལྔ	a medicinal preparation. BP 207.4.
མདུར-རྒྱུག	dal brel ran par rgyug pa'i 'dur rgyug Btsan-lha.
མཛའ-གད	chang phud. Compare dza gad. Btsan-lha.
མཛའ-སྡེ	grogs po. Btsan-lha.
མཛའ-ན-མོ	snying nye ba'am yang na bgrod bya bud med. Btsan-lha.
མཛད-པ-བཅུ-གཉིས	rgyal ba'i mdzad pa bcu gnyis ni / dga' ldan gyi gnas nas 'pho ba dang / sku bltams pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyis rol ba dang / bzo yi gnas la mkhas pa dang / khyim nas mngon par byung ba dang / dka' ba spyad pa dang / byang chub snying por gshegs pa dang / bdud sde bcom pa dang / mngon par byang chub dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskyor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdzad pa rnams so. 600 170.
མཛད-མཁྱོན-རླབས-ཆེ-བ	extemsive sphere of action, far-ranging endeavours. Sources.
མཛད-ཆེན-བཞི	rje rin po che'i mdzad chen bzhi ni / dga' ldan gyi dkyil 'khor sgrub mchod / rdzing phyi'i byams pa zhig gsos / lha sar cho 'phrul smon lam / gnyal gyi lung rwa chen mo rnams so. 600 50-51.
མཛར-བ	byes su 'gro ba'i rgyags. Btsan-lha.
མཛེ-འཇོམས	See so ma ra dza.
མཛེ-ཅན	See ru rta.
མཛེ-ནད	'go ba'i rang bzhin can gyi pags nad drag po zhig. Dag-yig. Text 25, 44, 46, 48, 84.
མཛེ-པོ	tshe phyi ma'i chos ni ma byas mdze po dang khyad ci yod gsung. "Not practicing the dharma of future lives they are no different than lepers." Zhi-byed Coll. II 230.7 (later Dam pa says, A leper is comfortable in his own way.) dper na mdze po'i lag nas byung ba'i khyung sgrub ste (like a garuda sadhana from the hand of a leper; a similar simile in Zhang's works). Zhi-byed Coll. V 246.3.
མཛེ-ཚ	SS 431.4.
མཛེར-བ	SRZT 105.
མཛེར-བུ	shing mdzer. sha mdzer chung ngu. Btsan-lha.
མཛེར-པ	Or, sha 'dzer pa. wart. Dhongthog.
མཛེས-སྦྱིན	See a ka ru.
མཛོ	JD 243.
མཛོ-མོ	T&BS I 339.
མཛོ-རྒོད	= sri ma ra, ba lang nog can, lkog shal can. JD 235.

མཛོ-ཚ	JD 67.
མཛོ-ཚེར	See mdzo mo shing.
མཛོ-མོ-ཤིང	JD 112. = bod kyi tsan dan, glang shing. YTTM 293.2. SS 481.4. LW 516. = mdzo tsher, kho tho, a la kha su, khyi rnga spyang cher. DG 229.3.

མཛོད-པུ	dpral ba'i spu. mdzod spu. Btsan-lha.
མཛོད-ཤེ	See under Kha btags. Tucci, Lhasa 74.
མཛོལ-བུ	rnyong. gal. smad 'tshong ma'i bu. Btsan-lha.
མཛུ-གུ	= mdzub mo. "toe, finger." Kuijp (1986) 35.
མཛུབ-གང-གི-ཚད	A bazaar measurement from tip of index finger to base of thumb. Waddell, Lhasa 354.
མཛུད	Vitali, Tho.ling 72.
མེ	a clan. Btsan-lha.
མེ-འདྲ	See tsi tra ka.
མེ-འཁོར	'fire-wheel,' a barbaric N. Nepalese (Men-zhang) custom of burning people alive. BA 643-4. Combe 52.
མེ-བཀྲ	(Amdo, Khams) the brightness created by a mass of flowers (in a meadow).
མེ-བཤུར	gang zhig dngos ma tshig par spu shun tsam tshig bcug pa. Btsan-lha.
མེ-བསྐོར	chung ma len pa'i cho ga. Btsan-lha.
མེ-བཙའ	spark, ember, cauterization; From Chinese. = me tsa, = sa gnad che ba. an appropriate site for erecting stUpas or temples. This term was originally used in medicine where vegetable tinder is burned on the part where the pain is in the belief that it will relieve it. Karmay, Treasury. Goldstein defines as spark, ember, cauterization. Metaphorical usage in Zhi-byed Coll. II 234.5.
མེ-བུམ	'fire vessel,' used in moxa. Pictured in JD 282 (item 4).
མེ-དགའ	See spos dkar.
མེ-གྷེ	me ghe me ghe zer ba'i tshe. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 314.4.
མེ-གཤེ	'gun ranch.' N. for a tax, started in 1918, when guns were supplied to nomads, in return for which they were expected to pay the produce of a single 'bri. Tsarong in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 28.
མེ-ཁྱེར	firefly. See srin bu me khyer.
མེ-ལྕགས	flintstone. Used as a practical metaphor for emptiness by Pha-dam-pa, who mentions that "In our India we haven't such a thing." Zhi-byed Coll. II 294.1.
མེ-ལྡེ	me bsro ba. Btsan-lha.
མེ-ལྷ	See tsi tra ka.
མེ-ལོང	mirror; Bellezza, Divine Dyads 102, 126, for use of mirror in iconography & for mirror divination.
མེ-མར	lamp; = mar me, sgron me, snang gsal. "butter lamp, oil lam, lamp." Kuijp (1986) 35. grub thob nyams kyi man ngag me mar cig nas cig tu rgyud pa lta bu gal che. Zhi-byed Coll. V 443.2.
མེ-མེ	Ladakhi term of respect. B in L 20.
མེ-མོ	sgye'u'am snod chung ngu. Btsan-lha.
མེ-ཕོར	'fire pot' illus. in Po-ta-la (1996) 191.
མེ-རག	See ra gan.
མེ-རྫས	gunpowder, also called sman nag, q.v.
མེ-རི	Also called, 'od zer gyi 'phreng ba. This is the outer circle of multicolored flames of the mandala. Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 60.
མེ-རིས	flame design. Jackson.
མེ-རོ	embers.
མེ-ཤེལ	'burning lens,' as discussed by Laufer in Sino-Tibetan Studies I 563, etc. Skt. sUryakAnta. Combe. me shel 'od ni ras kyi bal la tsha. Zhi-byed Coll. I 272.2. me shel drang mo (grang mo) me nyid yin. Ibid. I 306.2. JD 34. DG 87.4. = sUrya kanti.
མེ-ཤིང	See dbyi mong.
མེ-སྟོབས	See tsi tra ka.
མེ-ཏོག	rather idiosyncratically used to refer to collected grain offerings. Ramble in Karmay, New Horizons 301.
མེ-ཚང	Zündstoff, ölgetränkter Stoffballen. ZAS VII 474. Beyer 265.

མགོན-བླ	chos skyong gsol ba po. Nomads 234.
མགོན-ཁྱི	n. for liberated dog. Holler in TS9 II 208.
མགོན-མཚུན	Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 164.
མགོན-པོ-རིགས-ལྔ	sku'i mgon po / gsung gi mgon po / thugs kyi mgon po / yon tan gyi mgon po / 'phrin las kyi mgon pa'o. 600 54.
མགོས	a clan. Btsan-lha.
མགྲི-མ	Enumerated among ridable creatures in Pha-dam-pa dang Ma-cig (PRC 1992) 441.
མགྲིན-བཟང	See bong bu.
མགྲིན-རིང	bya mgrin ring. See khrung khrung.
མགྲིན-སྔོན	1. dbang phyug. 2. rma bya. Blan 527.
མགྲོན	'guest.' General word for the deities or spirits invited to a ritual. For the mgron po bzhi, see Beyer 165, 174, 217-222, etc. lam gyi mgron po, see 'grul pa. Epstein, Dissertation 106. Special feasts in western Tibet. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 56.
མགྲོན-འཐུད	(= gzhung gi mgron po khag la sprod rgyu'i lto mthud) entertainment allowance (due to government guests and officials on tour and realised in kind from selected households (see lto 'thud) Sources.
མགྲོན-བབས	= mgron por sprod rgyu'i babs sgo. board and lodging for government officials on tour (see lto 'bab & zhag babs). Sources.
མགྲོན-བསུ	See skya ga.
མགྲོན-བུ	= kar Sa pa ni ('money'). YTTM 292.17. See 'gron bu, 'cowrie.'
མགྲོན-གཉེར	two of these accompany the ya shor spyi khyab at court of Dalai Lama and Panchen Lamas--chamberlain. With high officials, a sort of liaison & public relations man. Petech. Velm I 133. Sources.
མགྲོན-བུ-བུ-མ	See dus gcig skyes pa'i ma bu.
མགྲོན-གཉེར-ཆེན-མོ	Chief Chamberlain of the Dalai Lama, he was responsible for establishing the official calendar of state events. Essais 130.
མགུ-བ-དགུ	chu / chu rgyun / chu bo / char / legs brgal / gzhan min / mig bzang / 'od can / lus mchog go. 600 123.
མགུར-ལྷ	See rje yi mgur lha bcu gsum.
མགུར-གྱི-ཕྱག-རྒྱ	Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 153-4.
མགྱོགས-རྭ	A horn used for the 'shot' and gunpowder used in Tibetan-style guns. Illus. in Yisun.
མི	SS 498.2.
མི-འབྱེད	mi mjed ces pa'i 'bri tshul gzhan zhig. Btsan-lha.
མི-འདྲེ	Bellezza, Divine Dyads 307.
མི-འགོ	leader. Sources.
མི-འགྱུར	unchanging; untransformable. unchanging.
མི-འཁུབ	mi 'gul ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-འཚེང	mi dga' ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-བཅེད	mi mjed. Btsan-lha.
མི-བོགས	'human lease.' A dud chung holding mi bogs could lease freedom of movement from his lord. They were the only type of serf with territorial mobility. Goldstein, Taxation 5. Dargyay, TVC 19.
མི-བརྡོག	mi bdog Btsan-lha.
མི-བརྫི	mi thub pa dang mi gnod pa sogs. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཆོག	(Amdo,Khams) = mi 'thus. is not permissible. with. MTTP. mi phod. Btsan-lha.
མི-དར	mi dar chu ru brug ni chu ru brub ces pa ste chu rgyas pa ltar mi rgyud dar ba'i don. Dpe-chos 510.
མི-དབྱི	Enumerated among aquatic creatures in Pha-dam-pa dang Ma-cig (PRC 1992) 439.
མི-དཔང	witness; human witness to an oath. (see lha dpang). Sources.
མི-དཔོན	overlord, headman (of village or district). Sources.
མི-གཡང	mi'i tshe bsod kyi g.yang. Nomads 246.
མི-གདའ	mi 'dug. Btsan-lha.
མི-གཙིགས	mi gces pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa dang mi 'os pa dang mi rigs pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-གུ	mi zhum pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཧྲིང	mi rkyang. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཁ	gossip. As a type of pollution, see Epstein, Dissertation 91.
མི-ཁྱིམ	habitation, household. Sources.
མི-ལ	a clan. Btsan-lha.
མི-ལྕོགས	mi nus pa. Btsan-lha. Eimer, Dbyangs 57.
མི-མཇེད	bzod pa'am sran thug pa sogs. Btsan-lha. Explained in SBKK I 179.
མི-མནང	mngon chung ba'am mi snang ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-མངགས	bang chen. Nomads 246.
མི-ན	hinunter. ZAS VII 474.
མི-ངས	mi nad dang mu ge. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཕེར	mi thub pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-རེ	(ich) versichere, schwöre. Kaschewsky2.
མི-རེང	mi rkyang ngam mi hreng. Btsan-lha.
མི-རྒོད	wild men (sometimes believed to mean 'abominable snowmen,' who are not really Homo sapiens at all, and are believed not to really exist by those who believe themselves to be more rational beings than a lot of us). Chag 57. Stories of 'abominable snowmen' told to McGovern (To Lhasa in Disguise 119 ff.) on the pass between Sikkim & Tibet. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 51 (phyugs rgod are also mentioned). JD 238.
མི-རིན	bride price. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 68.
མི-རྨེ	mi 'phel ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-རྨོ	mi smra. Btsan-lha.
མི-སྡེ	(secular) community (distinguished from lha sde, community under authority of a monastery). Sources. a government-owned manor. Tucci, Deb-ther Dmar-po 194.
མི-སྡུབ	mi rung ba.
མི-སེར	'subject.' There are three types, with various levels in their lack of personal freedom of movement. See Dargyay, TVC 17. See masters thesis of William M. Coleman.
མི-ཤ	flesh (color). Jackson.
མི-སྐྱིན	gta' mar bzhag pa'i mi. Btsan-lha.
མི-སློན	mi zlog pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-སྣ	envoy. Sources.
མི-སྤོབས	mi phod. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཐབས	gnyen skyong thabs. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཐང	mi dgos. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཐེངས	mi phyin nam mi skyel. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཐིག	mi 'dzul. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཐོག	generation; human generation.
མི-འཚལ-བ	mi shes pa dang mi za ba sogs. Btsan-lha.
མི-རྩ-ཅན	mi tshod med ham pa can. Dpe-chos 512. rtsa can tshig gi lo ma nyab pa'i mi rigs de tha snyad la rga bas (dga' bas) / de la myong ba rgyud la mi skye. Zhi-byed Coll. V 443.3.
མི-ཅུང-བ	mi chung ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཚེ-ཕྱིད-པ	mi tshe yol ba dang 'phul ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-འཇབ-པ	O.T. = rtsub pa. Blan 287.1. Btsan-lha.
མི-གཤའ-བ	mi rigs pa'am mi 'os pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-རྟོ-བ	mi 'gran pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-རྟོན-པ-བཞི	gang zag la mi rton pa / tshig la mi rton pa / drang don la mi rton pa / rnam shes la mi rton pa'o. 600 31-32.
མི-ཟས-མི-འཇུ-བའི-ཚད-ལྔ	btsan dug la longs spyod pa dang / gnang ba la longs spyod pa dang / 'dag me la longs spyod pa dang / bu lon la longs spyod pa dang / me lce 'bar ba la longs spyod pa dang lnga'o. Bka'-gdams Thor-bu 40r.4
མི-སྟོ-བ	mi 'gran pa. Gces 586.2. mi sto ni mi gnod. Dpe-chos 510. mi skyon nam mi gnod pa. Btsan-lha. Namdak. See sto ba.

མི-གཙང-བའི-རླིབས	mi gtsang bas gang ba'i 'obs. Btsan-lha.
མི-གཙང-བའི-རྫས-སོ-དྲུག	The 36 unclean substances that make up the body, listed in Dpe-chos 510.
མི-བྲ-བ	mi nus pa'am mi phod pa dang mi thub pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཙི-ར	See pho ba ri.
མི-ཁོམ-པའི-གནས-བརྒྱད	dmyal ba / yi dwags / dud 'gro / lha tshe ring po / yul mtha' 'khob tu skyes pa / dbang po ma tshang ba / rgyal ba'i bka' med pa'i yul du skyes pa / log lta can rnams so. 600 101.
མི-བསྙེངས-པ	mi 'jigs pa. Btsan-lha.

མི-འཐན-པ	mi zhum pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཡི-སེང-གེ	1. sangs rgyas. 2. khyab 'jug. Blan 530.

མི-བདེན-པའི-འདུ-ཤེས	Sinitic vocab. for rnam par rtog pa. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 162.
མི-ནག-པ	khyim pa'am skya bo'i mi. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཕྱེད-པ	mkhregs pa'am sra ba'am brtan pa dang ma chod pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-འཆབ-པ	mi mngon par mi byed pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-འཇིགས-པ-བཞི	Germano, Poetic Thought 888. Pabongka, Liberation I 151. Gser Sbram 160.
མི-འགོད-པ	mi skrag pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-མཐོང-བའི-རྒྱུ-བརྒྱད	ha cang ring ba / ha cang nye ba / dbang po nyams pa / yid dbang nyams pa / cha phra ba / sgrib byed dang bcas pa / zil gyis mnan pa / yul 'dres pa rnams so. 600 115.
མི-ཤིག-པའི-ཐིག-ལེ	The nature of mind, the Clear Light, Void from the very beginning forms the subtle body, speech & mind. The part which is depended on (substantial) is the veins. The moving parts are the spiritus and the qualitative aspects are the 'thoughtdrops.' The rnam shes comes from the portion that cause (meditative) appearances (char sgo). The totality of these is also called mi shig pa'i thig le.
མི-གྲུང-བ	mi legs pa'am bcud chung ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཤ-གླན-པ	mi bsad pa'i sha 'khon len pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-སྤྱོམས-པ	mi ngom pa dang mi bstod pa. Btsan-lha.
མི-བདག-དགའ-བྱེད	See a ka ru.
མི-སྒྲུང-པ	mi srun pa'am ma dul ba dang ma rungs pa sogs. Btsan-lha.
མི-བཀྱིག-པ	mi 'gyangs pa'am myur ba. Btsan-lha.
མི-ཆེ-རི	is supposed to mean a kind of strong iron, probably steel. Pelliot, Notes on Marco Polo 640.

མི-དོ-པོ	mi ngo ma de. Btsan-lha.
མིའམ-ཅི	kinnaras; On possible classification of kinnaras as humans or as animals, see Mimaki in Karmay, New Horizons 101.
མིའུ	'Midget' [of the eye], i.e., 'pupil.' This is actually a hidden borrowing from the Chinese word for eye pupil. Beyer, CT Lang. 139. See Chödag under mig gi mi'u.
མིའུ-གདུང-དྲུག	'bri gung skyu ra'i gdung / stag lung ga zi'i gdung / sa skya 'khon gyi gdung / chos rgyal bya'i gdung / 'od gsal lha'i gdung / sne'u gdong gong ma lha'i gdung dang drug go. 600 79.
མིའུ-རིགས-བཞི	bod kyi mi rgyud thog mar spra nas mched pa'i bod kyi rtsa ba'i rus rgyud bzhi. Btsan-lha.
མིད-པ	esophagus. kha nang nas pho bar zas 'gro sa'i lam sbu gu lta bu de'i ming ste, yul skad du <<myid thag> zer. Dag-yig.

མིག-བུ	long khrid byed mkhan. Btsan-lha.
མིག-དཀར	A word for 'foreigner' acc. to David-Neel, My Journey to Lhasa 268.
མིག-དམའ	ngo tsha. Btsan-lha.
མིག-དམར	1. srin po. 2. res gza'. Blan 530. See snying rtsa mig dmar. DD illus. 3.
མིག-གཡོར	smig rgyu chur snang dang zla ba gnyis snang sogs. Btsan-lha.
མིག-གཟོང	concave bladed engraving tool. See Man LXI no. 102 (p. 83b).
མིག-ལར	? kun gyi mig lar 'doms pa gcod nges. See Dung-dkar 74.
མིག-མངས	chess; a game. Samdo A V 137r.4. Usually this game is identified as a kind of chess or checkers. However, it is more likely that it is the game of go (or possibly in some places a kind of 'Chinese checkers'). Chess proper might be referred to as rgyal spyi'i mig mangs ('foreign go'), or mchong 'grig mig mangs (which should rather be 'checkers'). An ancient stone "go" board was found recently; see Hazod in TS9 I 42.
མིག-མཐོང	(Sherpa) "mindung," a kind of diviner. TS5 717. The distance a flying arrow may be seen with the eye. White Crystal 25.
མིག-ནད	SRZT 70. Text 27 ff. Lag-len 284.5.
མིག-ར	Eye protectors. Illus. in Yisun. Huber, Pure Crystal 68.
མིག-རླུང	Lag-len 285.5.
མིག-རྩ	DD illus. 4.
མིག-སེར	chags pas bslangs pa'i khong khro. Btsan-lha. jaundice? Das, Dhongthog. jealousy. Goldstein. Text 5, 6, 21, 70.
མིག-སྤྲིན	lit., eye-cloud, the white of the eye. In JD 277.7 it seems to mean cataracts. DD illus. 27.
མིག-ཐོས	who hears with the eyes. See sbrul.
མིག-ཐུར	medical implements for removing cataracts. three kinds pictured in JD 277 (items 6-8).
མིག-ཚགས	Achard, L'Essence 143.

མཁའ-སྤྱོད-སྐོར-གསུམ	sa skya ba'i mkha' spyod skor gsum ni / nA ro mkha' spyod / indra mkha' spyod / mai tri mkha' spyod do. 600 19.
མཁའ-འགྲོའི-དབང-ཕྱུག	1. bya khung. 2. DA ki'i gtso mo. Blan 526.
མཁའ-འགྱིང-ཁ	mkha' ni thugs nyid skye med zhi ba'i ngang tshul nas mkha' ltar rnam par dag pas mkha' / 'gying ni skye ba ye shes kyi cho 'phrul du thugs rje khros pa'i tshul gyis 'gying ba'i // kha zhes pa ni de ltar bstan pa yang gzhan snang tsam du ma yin gyi rang snang thugs nyid skye med nam mkha' ltar las skad cig kyang ma g.yos pa la kha zhes bya'o. 506A 337.
མཁལ-མ	DD illus. 21. Snellgrove (in his review of F. Meyer's book on Tibetan medicine) says Tibetans did not know that urine passed through the kidneys. He is mistaken (to judge from DD 59 60, 114).
མཁལ-ནད	SRZT 82.
མཁལ-རྐེད	Text 37. Lag-len 258.1.
མཁལ-རྐྱེད	Btsan-lha.
མཁལ-རླུང	Text 74.
མཁལ-རྩ	Text 34, 44, 74.
མཁལ-མའི-རྨེན-བུ	DD illus. 31.
མཁལ-མ-ཞོ-ཤ	See zho sha.
མཁན	This has a special meaning in O.T., as a type of title/name. See Richardson in HP,PE 17.
མཁན-འབྲུ	= seng phrom su. YTTM 291.27.
མཁན-ཆེ	(also, MKHAN CHUNG) See under mkhan drung.
མཁན-ཆུང	SS 522.1.
མཁན-དྲུང	= mkhan po drung yig. Monk members of the yig tshang. 1. mkhan che (= mkhan drung che ba), senior chairman. 2. mkhan chung (= mkhan drung chung ba), 3 junior monks. Petech.
མཁན-པ	TR XIV #4, p. 16. Norbu, Drung 261. JD 156. Varieties: mkhan skya, mkhan dkar, mkhan dmar. SS 476.3. Mdo 68.
མཁན-སློབ-ཆོས-གསུམ	mkhan po bo dhi sa twa / slob dpon padma 'byung gnas / chos rgyal khri srong lde btsan no. 600 25.
མཁན-པོ-གཉིས	rab byung gi mkhan po dang / bsnyen rdzogs kyi mkhan po'o. 600 6.
མཁན-པོ-བུག-ཏོག-ཕབས-སྦྱར-ཆུ-ལུམས	a medicinal preparation. BT 14v.5.
མཁར	mkhar dpe ni khang brtsegs la byed snyam. Dpe-chos 508.
མཁར-བ	superior alloy with brass, higher grade than khro. Btsan-lha. a staff, as emblem of Ma-ni Bla-mas, see Havnevik, Dissertation 167. = kan ba. YTTM 291.10.
མཁར-དཔེ	Btsan-lha.
མཁར-གོང	= dkar gong, dkar yol rgyu. JD 54.. See dkar gong.
མཁར-གཞོང	mkhar gzhong nang gi rul rbal (rus sbal) nyi ma'i 'od la dga'. Zhi-byed Coll. I 268.7. 'khar zhong gi nang du 'thigs pa ltar. Zhi-byed Coll. I 256.7. 'gro bar mi nus mkhar zhong nang gi rul rbal tshi chad 'gyur. Zhi-byed Coll. I 219.4.
མཁར-ལན	khang pa gsar rgyag byas pa. BBNP 472. obs. for mkhar las. construction work. Samdo A VI 264v.5. Btsan-lha. BD of T&TB VII 93. ngal sar mkhar lan byed pa'i skyes bu blun. Zhi-byed Coll. I 295.7. bde ba dang skyid pa'i dus su mkhar lan dang rtsed 'dzings dang ri ltad la sogs pa ye mi bya. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum IV 457.5. 'bri gung gi mkhar lan 'di shin tu legs pa zhig byung bas de la rgyu gnyis yin. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) VI 243.2.
མཁར-ལྷན	khang pa gsar rgyag. Dpe-chos 511. Btsan-lha.
མཁར-ཉལ	1. lha. 2. bya. Blan 526.
མཁར-རྗེ	kha rje bsod nams che zer ba'i kha rje de'o. Dpe-chos 508.
མཁར-རུ	= 'bo. = bstan 'dzin mkhar ru. A standardized measure, 27-33 lbs., but a volume measure. Goldstein, Taxation 8.
མཁར-སྒོང	Btsan-lha.
མཁར-སླེ	mkhar spo. Gces 586.5.

མཁྲིས	See rdo mkhris. See rtsa mkhris.. Original entry: (snod) mkhris. gall bladder. Text 58.
མཁྲིས-ནད	SRZT 13.
མཁྲིས-པ	SRZT 86. Lag-len 270.4. DD illus. 2, 17. 1) mi phyugs kyi mkhris pa ste, mchin pa'i logs g.yas pa'i 'og na yod pa'i khug ma'i dbyibs can zhig yin zhing nang na gsher khu mdog ljang ser ro kha ba zhig yod pa la mkhris khu zer. de ni zas 'ju ba dang, nad 'bu phra mo 'joms pa, rul ba 'gog pa bcas la nus pa yod pa zhig yin. sman gzhung du de la snod kyi mkhris pa zer. tshig bsdus na mkhris zhes 'bri chog ste: mkhris khu zhes pa lta bu. 2) sman gzhung du bshad pa'i rlung mkhris bad kan gsum gyi nang tshan gyi mkhris pa ste, rang bab tu gnas tshe lus kyi drod bskyed pa sogs la phan pa zhig dang, tshad las 'das na mkhris nad du 'gyur ba yin. de la mkhris pa 'ju byed, mkhris pa mdangs sgyur, mkhris pa sgrub byed, mkhris pa mthong byed, mkhris pa mdog gsal bcas lnga phye 'dug. Dag-yig.

མཁུས-པ	Btsan-lha.
མཁྱེན-གཉིས	1. ji lta ba mkhyen pa. 2. ji snyed pa mkhyen pa. Germano, Poetic Thought 952.
མཁྱེན-ཕོ	mkhan po. Btsan-lha.
མཁྱེན-རབ	Stein.
མཁྱེན-པ-གཉིས	ji lta ba mkhyen pa dang / ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'o. 600 8.
མཁྱེན-པ-གསུམ	gzhi shes / lam shes / rnam mkhyen no. 600 27.
མཁྱིད	O.T. form of mkhyud. Both forms occur in Haarh, Yar-lun 358. In Yisun, mkhyud pa seems to mean 'to secrete away, to occultate [something or someone].'
མཁྱུད-དཔྱད	Explained in forthcoming article by Mike Walter: where he determines it to mean an examination of hidden connections. Occurs in title of a work by Mi pham.
མཁྱུད-གང	= mkhyid gang. Btsan-lha. A measurement. Das says it is the measurement of the fist plus the extended thumb, about 6 inches. chos mkhyid gang ma. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 201.
མཁྱུད-སྤྱད	O.T. man ngag phran bu sbas te 'chad pa. Blan 291.3-.4. n. for minor precept. BBNP 476.
མཁྱུན-བུ	mkhyun bu mkhyun bur rgyu ba. Silk, Dissert. 311.
མནའ-དགག	mna' skyel du bcug pa. Btsan-lha.
མནའ-མ	bride; basic meaning is 'bride,' although mother-in-laws continue to use it, long after the marriage is over, to refer to their daughter-in-laws. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 67.
མནའ-རྒྱབ	mna' yi don lag tu len pa. Nomads 241.
མནའ-སྒོག-པ	mna' skyel ba. Btsan-lha.
མནབ-རྩལ	O.T. = kha zas. Blan 288.2. Btsan-lha.
མནབས-པ	O.T. = gyon pa. Blan 289.4.
མནབས-སྒྱེ	Haarh, Yar-lun 368.
མནག-ནོག	nag ge nog ge. Btsan-lha. nag nog gi skyon gzhi la ma grub pa bzhin du... Zhi-byed Coll. IV 176.5.
མནག-དཀའ-བ	mi bzod pa'am / sran dka' ba. Btsan-lha.
མནགས-པ	O.T. = bzod pa. = bstan pa. Blan 300.1. bzod pa. sran pa. Btsan-lha.
མནལ-བུ	rgyud gcig pa'i ming sring gi bu. Compare nal bu. Btsan-lha.
མནལ-སད-པ	gnyid sad pa. Btsan-lha.
མནམ-པ	zhal yang mnam [~dri nga ba] par gyur nas su. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 136.5.

མནངས-ཕལ	dpya khral lam rgyu nom pa blangs pa. Btsan-lha.

མངའ-བདག	Haarh, Yar-lun 71.
མངའ-ཞབས	Translated 'serfs' in Kuijp in Lungta 14 (2001) 68.
མངའ-བྱད-ལེགས-པ	byad bzhin mdzes pa. Btsan-lha.
མངའ-རི-མེ-ཏོག	See leb rgan rtsi.
མངའ-གསོལ-བ	Namdak.
མངའད-བཏང-བ	OTA, year 651. Probably related to mnga' thang, power, might.
མངད-པ	dri ngad ldang ba. Btsan-lha.
མངག-གཞུག	Btsan-lha.
མངལ-བཤོལ	Years added to account for time in womb, and extra lunar months, in order to ordain monks ahead of time. BA 573. But see Yisun, where it seems to mean months spent in the womb beyond the ordinary number.
མངལ-ཁ	DD illus. 22.
མངལ-སྐེ	DD illus. 22.
མངལ-སྐྱི	DD illus. 22.
མངལ-ཐུར	forcepts for extracting a still-born child from the womb. JD 280 (item 2).
མངན	mthu. skyon. dkon gnyer, mdzod gnyer. Btsan-lha.
མངན-དཔོན	dpon po'am blon po bye brag pa zhig. Btsan-lha.
མངན-བསྒྲང-བ	Btsan-lha.
མངར	The tree, shing mngar. See shing mngar.
མངར-གསུམ	ka ra / bu ram / sbrang rtsi'o. 600 13.
མངར-སིང	mngar ba. Gces 585.1.
མངོན-ཆུང	Stein.
མངོན-གྱུར	mngon du gyur pa. Used specifically for the ultimitization of meditative experience through the latter's continuous cultivation (falling slightly short of 'realization,' rtogs pa). Zhi-byed Coll. II 329.7.
མངོན-མཐོ	ascendance, ascendent status. Skt. abhyudaya. Thurman. Elevated existence.
མངོན-མཚན	bun skyed. dbyig dang gser dngul gyi ming. Btsan-lha.
མངོན-རྟོགས	In terms of visualization practice, it doesn't mean the purposeful visualization of the form or a simple recollection of the impeccability of the deity, but rather means realizing what the practice is all about (what's been there all along). Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 356.3 ff.
མངོན-སྤྱོད	destructive magic. lit.: manifest action. Sources.
མངོན-པའི-ང-རྒྱལ	arrogance of showing off. Kawamura.
མངོན-པར-བརྗོད-པ	articulation; articulation. Skt. abhilApana. Thurman.
མངོན-པར-ལྡར-བ	Btsan-lha.
མངོན-པར-གྲུབ-པའི-སྲིད-པ	synonym of intermediate state's subtle body. Lati Rinbochay, Death 52.
མངོན-པར-མཐོ-བ	gnas skabs kyi bde ba dang bcas pa'i bde 'gro'i phun tshogs dge legs so. Gser Sbram 184.
མངོན-པར-རྟོག-པ	supposition; supposition. Thurman.
མངོན-ཤེས-དྲུག	mngon shes lnga'i steng du zag zad mngon shes bsnan pa'o. 600 81.
མངོན-ཤེས-ལྔ	mig gi mngon shes / rna ba'i mngon shes / sngon gnas rjes dran gyi mngon shes / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon shes / gzhan sems shes pa'i mngon shes rnams so. 600 62-63.
མངོན-དུ-འགྱུར	coming into the fore. Germano, Poetic Thought 851. Stein.
མངོན-དུ-བཞག	Stein.
མངོན-དུ-གྱུར-པ-བཅུ	bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i skabs kyi mngon du gyur pa bcu ni / ston pa mngon du gyur pa / sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa / chos mngon du gyur pa / mkhan po mngon du gyur pa / slob dpon mngon du gyur pa / bsnyen par rdzogs 'don mngon du gyur pa / yo byad mngon du gyur pa / yongs su dag pa mngon du gyur pa / gsol ba mngon du gyur pa / las mngon du gyur pa'o. 600 142.
མངོན-དུ-བཞེན-པ	earnestly wishing, an obsession. Kawamura.
མངོན-དུ-ལྡང-བ	yar langs nas bsu ba byas pa. Btsan-lha.
མངོན-པ-སྡེ-བདུན	ji skad du / ye shes la 'jug ka tya'i bus // rab tu byed pa dbyig bshes kyis // rnam shes tshogs ni lha skyid kyis // chos kyi phung po shA ri'i bus // gdags pa'i bstan bcos mo'u 'gal bus // 'gro ba'i rnam grangs gsus po ches // khams kyi tshogs ni gang pos byas // zhes gsungs pa ltar ro. 600 94-95.
མངོན-རླམ-པ	Btsan-lha.
མངོན-སུམ-ཚད-མ	perceptual validating cognition. Skt. pratyakSapramAna. Thurman.
མངོན-སུམ-སྣང-བ	See snang bzhi.
མངོན-སུམ-མེ-འདྲའི-སྦྱོར-བ	a medicinal preparation. BP 146.4.
མངོན-བྱང-ལྔ	Short for mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa lnga. 1. gzhi--stong pa nyid. 2. gdan--pad zla. 3. thugs--phyag mtshan. 4. gsung--yig 'bru. 5. sku--yongs rdzogs. Mkhyen-rab-rgya-mtsho 1557 244.4. Thondup, BM 19-20. zla ba las byang chub pa / nyi ma las byang chub pa / sa bon las byang chub pa / phyag mtshan las byang chub pa / sku yongs rdzogs las byang chub pa'o. 600 68. Beyer 109. Zhe-chen Rgyal-tshab's work on the Nine Vehicles, p. 38. In the 12th-cent. Zhi-byed history by Rog Rin-chen-shes-rab, (Zhi-byed Coll. IV 328.7), it is said that the Buddha ShAkyamuni entered the womb in the manner of the Mngon byang lnga.
མངོན-མཚན-ཅན	Btsan-lha.
མནོ-བ	sems pa. Btsan-lha. See ci mno ba. Gces 586.5.
མནོད-པར-བྱ-བ	blang bar bya ba. Btsan-lha.
མནོག-ཆོས	sbed skung ngam gsang ba byed pa'i chos. Btsan-lha.
མནོག-ཆུང	insignificant. Thondup, EL 126.See mnag dka'. Blan 303.3. spogs dang phan chung ba. Btsan-lha.
མནོག-པ	mang po ('the many'?). zhim pa. gya nom pa. Btsan-lha.
མནོག-ཟན	snog zan nam snum btsos kyi 'khur ba. Btsan-lha.
མནོལ	impurity. Karmay, Treasury. A kind of 'pollution' which may be ritually purified through lustrations. Norbu, Drung 106, etc. TS6 130. btsog pa. Btsan-lha. Probably related to the words for 'incest' like mnal and nal. Sometimes spelled gnol.
མནོལ-བ	Prob. = snol ba. gnyis pa lag pa mnyam bzhag tu mnol bas / byang chub kyi sems gnyis ka rgyud la skye. Zhi-byed Coll. II 87.3.
མནོལ-རི	grib can. Btsan-lha.
མནོལ-རིགས	mi gtsang ba'i rigs rgyud. Btsan-lha.
མནོས-པ	O.T. = bsams pa. Blan 287.4. thob pa dang blangs pa. bsam pa. Btsan-lha.
མནུན-བསྙོད	nu zho ldud pa. Btsan-lha.
མཉལ-བ	ngal ba. Btsan-lha.
མཉམ-བཞག	mnyam par bzhag pa; ting nge 'dzin sgom skabs gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu dmigs nas mnyam par bzhag pa zhes bya la / yang na sems dmigs pa gcig la dmigs te bying ba dang rgod pa'i skyon gnyis dang bral ba'i sgo nas rtse gcig tu 'jog pa zhes kyang bya'o. Gser Sbram 297.
མཉམ-རྗེས	short for mnyam bzhag and rjes thob. Stein.
མཉམ-སྦྱོར	Stein.
མཉམ-ཉིད-བཅུ	chos thams cad mtshan ma med par mnyam pa nyid dang / mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid dang / skye ba med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dben pa dang / gdod ma nas rnam par dag pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / blang dor med pa dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor dang brag cha dang chu zla dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul ba lta bur mnyam pa nyid dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med par mnyam pa nyid de bcu'o. 600 146-7.
མཉམ-པ-ཉིད-གསུམ	sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid gsum ni / tshogs bsags par mnyam pa / chos sku brnyes par mnyam pa / 'gro ba'i don spyod par mnyam pa'o. 600 27.
མཉམ-པ-ཆེན-པོ	Great Levelness. Great Equality, etc. Defined in Klong-chen-pa 8.1 comm. as union of 4 Levelnesses. Skt. mahAtulya [?], tulya--equal to, in the same class, carrying the same weight.
མཉན-དཔོན	(Dbus, Gtsang) = gru dpon. navigator, boatman.
མཉན-པ	Stein.
མཉེ-མ	nang khrol zhig. Btsan-lha.
མཉེད-པ	See mnyad pa (?).
མཉེལ-པ	O.T. = ngal ba. Blan 302.6. ngal ba'am thang chad pa. na ba'i zhe sa. Btsan-lha. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 470.1-2.
མཉེས-གཤིན	gces pa. sems rgyud zhi zhing 'jam pa. mdza' ba'i grogs. brtse gdung che ba. Btsan-lha.
མཉེས-པ-གསུམ	Sky Dancer 192, n. 3.
མོ-བོན	Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 173. As a possible explanation of this phrase, which is used in (roughly) 12th-century Chos works, see the citation from O.T. texts in Stein's article on Zhang-zhung at p. 239: mo ngan bzlog phyir bon gcig byed, "doing a bon in order to reverse the unfavorable prognostic." There are references to mo bon, and to mo bon rtsis, as ineffectual funerary rites, a few pages into the Bu-chos (Bka'-gdams Glegs-bam) text entitled Bka'-rgya / Khu-chos gnyis... (thanks to Mike Walter for this ref.). It occurs in Zhi-byed Coll. V 168.3: 'chi nad la mo bon sman la sogs pa'i...

མཐའ-བཅད	outlining along an outer edge; outlining along an outer edge. Jackson.
མཐའ-བྲལ	[= mtha' bzhi bral ba] devoid of the 'four extremes' (Skt. caturanta), that Buddhists must, by definition, avoid. 'Without extreme views.' Klong-chen-pa 3.6 comm.
མཐའ-བརྟུལ	mjug sdud pa. Btsan-lha.
མཐའ-བཞི	'dul ba lung las / bsags pa kun gyi mtha' 'dzad cing // mthon po rnams kyi mtha' lhung 'gyur // phrad pa'i mtha' ni 'bral ba ste // gson pa'i mtha' ni 'chi ba yin zhes gsungs pa ltar / bsags mtha' 'dzad pa dang / mtho mtha' lhung ba / 'dus mtha' 'bral ba / skyes mtha' 'chi ba ste bzhi'o. Gser Sbram 296.
མཐའ-ཆགས	kha tshar gyi mtha' btsems pa. Btsan-lha.
མཐའ-དཔྱོད	detailed investigation. Vostrikov, Critical 63, 71 ff. Often misspelled thal spyod & thal sbyor & mtha' gcod. This signifies the MOST detailed form of commentary which brings out arguments for & against various things contained in a text & tries to establish veracity through use of syllogistic logic. Acc. to Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 18, this is a kind of teacher's guide devoted not to a general outline, but to specific difficult points in the subject to be studied.
མཐའ-གཉིས	rtag pa'i mtha' dang / chad pa'i mtha'o. 600 5.

མཐའ-བསྐོར-རི-བསྐོར-བྱས	to go all the way around the outer edge, all around the mountain. An expression for seeing something from every possible angle. Pabongka, Liberation II 29.
མཐའ-ཆགས-སུ	rim pa bzhin du. Btsan-lha.
མཐང	See bla mthang. (mthad?) = smad. Blan 516.6. mdangs. smad. sha'am nang khrol. Btsan-lha. sang phyod kyi tshis byed pa'i mkhan po tsho 'khor 'das kyi sha mthang 'byed pa'i dus 'dir rang gis rang ma bslu'. Zhi-byed Coll. II 230.2. Here it obviously means entrails, innards.
མཐང-ཅོག	nang ngam nang sha. Btsan-lha.
མཐང-གོས	Outer part of the lower part of the monastic robes, prescribed in vinaya texts.

མཐར-ཆགས	sAvadAna. M.Vy. 8567. Acc. to Silk, Dissert. 347, this word is used in context of the rules for begging rounds, meaning that one should go in a regular and systematic order (not skipping houses here and there). Also spelled 'thar chags.

མཐིང	azurite, deep blue color. mthing chu: light, watery azurite paint. mthing 'bru: deepest azure-colored paint. mthing shul: medium blue azurite pigment. mthing shog: black paper. mthing skya: light blue. mthing zhun: azurite (the substance). Indigo blue. Anyetsang in TSB 15 (1980) 6. = mthing zhun. JD 55. SS 505.4.

མཐིང-རིལ-མཆུ	Original entry: (skam pa) mthing ril mchu. lit., 'wild duck beak.' surgical pinchers pictured in JD 275 (item 1).
མཐོ	'span.' the distance from the extended thumb to the tip of the middle finger, = cha chen. Jackson. Vitali, Tho.ling 66. The bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang, 'span of the TathAgata' is a measurement equivalent to 1 and 1 half cubits of a medium sized man, in vinaya terminology (this acc. to Dalai Lama XIV, Advice from Buddha Shakyamuni; Karma Lekshe Tsomo, Sisters in Solitude, p. 160, says it is equivalent to 1 foot and 2 inches). BA 624. Stein.
མཐོ-བླ	the highest ranking monastic official. Vitali, Tho.ling 139.
མཐོ-དོགས	Stein.
མཐོ-ལམ	I thought maybe a mistake for thu lum (?), but it occurs several times in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 233.1, 234.2, and seems to mean something like high position or pride of status (or in one's goodness; see ibid. IV 238.5). mtho lam ma snyogs pa'i dman sa myi rtsis med pa. Zhi-byed Coll. V 195.5. chos kyi mthun rkyen 'jig rten pa'i mtho lam men bar bstan pa. Zhi-byed Coll. V 463.7.
མཐོ-ལྡིང	n. for 'thunderstones.' See under thog rde'u. 56 34.

II 471.7. mtho' yor myi ru shes pas de tshe 'jigs dang bral. Ibid. I 311.1. lus mi rtag mtho yor dang 'dra ste 'jig pa'i chos can. Zhi-byed Coll. V 133.6.
