མཐུག-པོ-ལྔ	Refers to the five aspirated letters, gha, jha, bha, dha and .dha, which are not used in Tibetan. Naga in TJ 24 no. 3 (1999) 67.
མཐུན-འཇུག	to make adjustments to conform with something else. conformity. ting nge 'dzin rgyud la skye ba la phyi'i mthun 'jug spong dgos pa. Zhi-byed Coll. II 168.7; IV 233.7, 234.4, 240.1. ngo srung mthun 'jug 'jig rten pa'i chos lugs yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 280.5 (further discussion follows). mthun 'jug ni byang chug gyi dgra yin no gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 71.6.
མཐུན-ཤས	ston thog gi phud dang / dpya khra. Btsan-lha.
མཐུན-འཇུག-གི-གྲོགས	khyo shug. Btsan-lha.
མཐུན-པ-སྤུན-བཞི	Pabongka, Liberation II 270.
མཐུན-པའི-དྷརྨ	Karmay, Great Perfection 95, 97.
མཐུར-མདའ	halter-rope, = mthur thag. bod sna leb pas lha la mthur mda' ma thogs pas. Flat nosed Tibetans have not attached their halter-ropes to the deity. Zhi-byed Coll. II 252.3. dngos grub kyi mthur mda' myi thogs. Ibid. II 463.7. mchog la mthur mda' thogs na thun myong zhar la 'byung ba yin no. "Those who have attached their halter-ropes to the supreme, will in the course of things have the ordinary [accomplishments]." Zhi-byed Coll. IV 42.2.
མཐུས-མ-ཚུར-ཁྲིད-མ	n. for a 'bri when it has given birth to its first yak calf. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 38.
མཚའ	gcan gzan 'phar ba. me. gcan gzan gsa'. dred mo. Btsan-lha.
མཚའ-ལུ	rta drel sogs rting pa dkar po. dmar po la dkar po'i thig les mtshan pa. khyim bya. Btsan-lha. See bya.
མཚའ-མེས	gcan gzan 'phar ba. Btsan-lha.
མཚག-བཟང-བ	yan lag dang nyin lag sogs rgyas pa. Btsan-lha.
མཚལ	vermillion. vermillion red from cinnabar stone. Anyetsang in TSB 15 (1980) 6. For its use in O.T. funerals, see Haarh, Yar-lun 344. ISTS 41. = nyi ma, lha min bu, taM ka na. JD 59. = da chu. YTTM 291.24. SS 408.3. DG 117.4.
མཚལ-བཅུད	See dngul chu.
མཚལ-ཆུ	See dngul chu.
མཚལ-དཀར	DG 117.1.
མཚལ-ལུ	O.T. = rting dkar. Blan 303.4.
མཚལ-མ	za ma. Btsan-lha.
མཚལ-སྐྱ	vermillion pink.
མཚལ-སྐྱེས	See dngul chu.
མཚལ-ཐལ	SS 531.4.
མཚལ-ཐང	a thangka in which vermillion color predominates. Jackson. Kreijger, Tibetan Painting 23.
མཚལ-ལུའི-རྟ	buntes Pferd (vgl. Sumatiratna, 615). Kaschewsky2.
མཚམས-བཅོས	mtshams nang rung khang byin gyis ma brlabs par bcos pa'i zas. Btsan-lha.
མཚམས-གཡོག	retreat servant. Havnevik, Dissertation 185.
མཚམས-སྦྱར	composition; (in composition) transition or linking passage. Literally it means to join things together at their boundaries.
མཚམས-སྦྱོར	"sandhi" in Skt. grammar. mtshams sbyor lnga. Vostrikov, Critical 70. Interconnections (of words and topics). Almogi, MA thesis 17.
མཚམས-ཐོ	Kvaerne, A-khrid 253.
མཚམས-བཅད-པ	khrims bcad pa. Btsan-lha. In Zhi-byed Coll. II 344.6-7, it seems that ri khrod refers to retreat in the wilderness, while 'tshams bcad means a walled-in retreat.
མཚམས-མེད-ལྔ	pha bsad pa / ma bsad pa / dgra bcom pa bsad pa / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba'o. 600 56. See also nye ba'i mtshams med lnga. Germano, Poetic Thought 818.
མཚམས-བསྐུམ-པ	mtshams ma bcad pa. Btsan-lha.
མཚམས-ཆེན-པོ-གཅད-དོ	gnod pa chen po bya'o. Btsan-lha.
མཚན-འགེབས	mtshan mor 'jab rgol byas pa. Btsan-lha.
མཚན-དབྲག	DD illus. 22.
མཚན-དཀོར	mtshan legs. Btsan-lha.
མཚན-མ	definitive. Klong-chen-pa 8.9.
མཚན-ནམ	night. MTTP.
མཚན-ཐུབ	Literally, an 'all night lasting' light. In Nomads 269 there is one at the top of the stove, evidently in order to preserve the fire for the next day. It is also a religious practice (known in late 12th century works of Zhang Rin-po-che) to offer butterlamps that will last all night.
མཚན-ཞིང	mtshan mo'i tshe kha nas me 'bar ba. Btsan-lha.
མཚན-ཉིད-བཅུ	'dul ba nas bshad pa'i gnas kyi bla ma'i mtshan nyid bcu ni / brtan pa / mkhas pa / lus tha mal du gnas pa / sa rang bzhin du gnas pa / snying rje dang ldan pa / bzod pa dang ldan pa / nang gi 'khor dag pa / chos kyis phan 'dogs pa / zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa / dus su gdams ngag 'doms pa rnams so. 600 143. theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid bcu ni / lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pas dul ba / lhab pa ting nge 'dzin gyi bslab pas zhi ba / lhag pa shes rab kyi bslab pas nye bar zhi ba / lung gi yon tan gyis phyug pa / stong pa nyid rtogs pa / slob ma las yon tan lhag pa / smra mkhas pa / brtse ba dang ldan pa / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa / skyo ngal spang ba'o. 600 143-144.
མཚན-ཉིད-གསུམ	kun btags pa'i mtshan nyid / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do. 600 10. An explanation of the positive (path-conducive) 'three marks' as well as the sangsara-conducive 'three marks.' Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 375.1.
མཚན-ཉིད-ཉི-ཤུ	nad kyi mtshan nyid nyi shu. DD 704.
མཚན-ཉིད-ཀྱི-གྲྭ-ས	Dung-dkar 172.
མཚན-མའི-བློ	mtshan 'dzin gyi shes pa ste bden 'dzin gyi sems dang phyin ci log gi rtog pa sogs so. Gser Sbram 358.
མཚན-མཁན-པ	rtags mtshan lta mkhan nam rtsis pa. Btsan-lha.
མཚན-བར-རྡོལ-བ	O.T. = mo mtshan gyi nad. Blan 305.1.
མཚན-མོའི-འོད	See cong zhi.
མཚན-མོའི-མདོངས	sgron me. Btsan-lha.
མཚན-བཟང-གི-བདུན-མཐོ-བ	See bdun mtho ba.
མཚན-ཤད-བཏང	mtshan mo'an shar shar btang ba. Btsan-lha.
མཚང	nyes pa che ba. Gces 586.6. skyon nam nyes pa che ba. Btsan-lha. For this syllable, in various compounds, see Chödag. gdams pa'i mtshang ma rig na kun gyi gnad myi rtogs. Despite what the dictionaries say, when Phadampa uses the word he doesn't mean 'fault,' but something more like 'true essentials' or 'deep implications.' Zhi-byed Coll. II 239.6. zab mo don gyi mtshang go bas / rnal 'byor pa gsang ba'i mdzod rtol. Ibid. 234.1. Ibid. II 246.5-6. rtsa ba'i mtshang ma rig na sde snod don spyi yin. Ibid. II 278.3. nyams su len ma myong ba'i myis skad cig ma'i mtshang myi shes. Ibid. II 459.2. skad cig ma'i mtshang ma rig na 'gro 'ong myed pa'i don myi rtogs. Ibid. II 460.1. skad cig ma'i mtshang ma rig na / chos bden myed du go yang / rang rgyud pa'i blo myi 'dzad. Ibid. II 462.4. bla ma'i ngo sprod ma thob na / mdo' rgyud stan chos bltas kyang / mtshang myed pas zab mo'i gdam ngag myi go. Ibid. II 463.1. 'khrul pa khong du zhig la mtshang gi gdams pa yod. Ibid. I 321.4. dred po chos rgyus can la gdam ngag gi mtshang myed. Ibid. II 189.1. smyig rgyu'i mtshang shes pas chu'i 'du shes myi skye ba dang 'dra. Zhi-byed Coll. V 273.2.
མཚང-ཅན	nyes can. Btsan-lha. shes pa 'khris dang phrel ba mtshang can dong nas thar pa lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 471.3.
མཚང-སྔོག	skyon 'bru ba. Btsan-lha.
མཚང-འདྲུ-བ	skyon 'don pa. Btsan-lha.
མཚང-ཆེ-བ	nyes pa che ba. Btsan-lha.
མཚང-ལ-རྒོལ-བ	nyes pa 'don pa. Gces 581.5. nyes pa ther 'don byed pa. Btsan-lha.
མཚེ	a plant with ritual uses, discussed by Karmay in JA (1995) 170. He identifies it as Ephedra sp. 'twins' (considered as an inauspicious occurrence, perhaps the birth of 'siamese twins'). Norbu, Drung 260, n. 25. TR XIV no. 4, p. 16. Karmay, Arrow 341. Das (an added note reads: "a plant similar to Schachtehelm" [?]). JD 155. TM IV 60.
མཚེ-གཟུགས	phru gu mtshe ma. Btsan-lha.
མཚེ-ལྡུམ	SS 482.6. = mtshe. TM IV 60.
མཚེའུ	pond; diminutive of mtsho, therefore meaning pond. khong rang gi pho brang gi mdun na mtshe'u zhig yod pa'i nang nas srog chags sbrul zhig tu skyes nas 'dug skad. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) X 555.1.
མཚེད	shi dur gyi mchod pa. Btsan-lha.
མཚེར-བ	las ka byed par mi spro ba dang skyo ba. Btsan-lha. = mcher ba.

མུ	kha. 'gram. Btsan-lha.
མུ-བསྐྲུངས	mthar phyin par ring du 'dor ba. Btsan-lha.
མུ-བཞི	See discussion by Verhagen in TS9 II 150. In logic, 'intersection' (or possible ways of relating) between two categories. Dreyfus, Sound 223.
མུ-ཅོར	O.T. = kha zer ba. = kha drag. Blan 290.1. rdzun. kha drag pa. Btsan-lha. rtogs tshad kyi nyams mu cor smras na yal 'gro. Zhi-byed Coll. II 143.6.
མུ-གསུམ	In logic, the 'inclusion' of one category within another. Dreyfus, Sound 223.
མུ-ཧྲ	mchod rten mu hras btab / mchod rten phyag rgyas btab pa'i don. 506A 339.

མུ-མཐའ-དང-བྲལ-བ	undelineated, uncircumscribed. The Realm of Dharmas is undelineated and without center or circumference (mtha' dbus med pa). Klong-chen-pa 6.7 comm.

མུ-ཀུ-ལ	me tog cung zad bye ba. Btsan-lha.
མུ-ཉུང-སེར-པོ	(sp?) KP4 545.3.
མུག	A type of ritually purifiable pollution that occurs when a child is born just after the death of its father. Karmay in JA (1995) 166. According to T.N., denotes the birth of an illegitimate child (mug phrug) that can cause misfortune or disasters. Norbu, Drung 259, n. 6. An impurity derived from the birth of bastards. TS6 131.
མུག-བུ	pha shi ba'i bu dang nal bu. Btsan-lha.
མུག-ཆེ	mu ge che ba. Btsan-lha.

མུག-སྐྱོ-གྱུ-ནམ	g.yo zol lam g.yo sgyu. Btsan-lha.

མུཀ-ཏི-ཀ	See mu tig.

མུན-དམག	gsang dmag. mi mngon pa'i dmag so pa lta bu. mi rabs chad pa sogs. Btsan-lha.
མུན-མཚམས	Achard, L'Essence 10, 252.
མུན-སྣམ	A stripe of darkness as part of the design of the entryway to a mandala. See Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 62.
མུན-སྤྲུལ	rmongs mun gyi sprul pa ste rang bzo. blun gtam smra ba. Btsan-lha.
མུན-པ-བཞི	Acc. to Bdal 'bum (Bon Kanjur, 192-vol. version, CXXXI 206r5): mun pa bzhi ni / ri grib dpag med dang / dbang po'i sgo dang / ma rig pa dang / 'khor ba mun pa. The Four Darknesses are the limitless mountain shadow, the doors of the senses, non-awareness, and samsaric darkness.

མུར-རྡོ	a type of gem that can prevent rain from falling; a male foal who opens his mouth to the sky and cries out again and again is said to have one in his mouth. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 43.

ནཡ-གྲོ-དྷ	The seed of this tree is said to measure 1/4 the size of a mustard seed, but 500 chariots can go beneath its branches without touching. BBNP 476. etymology explained in BBNP 473-474. Nyagrodha. Simile of the banyan roots, saying how small sprouts can eventually overcome the king of trees. Flick, Carrying Enemies 100-1.

ནང-རྫོང	an unusual term for referring to the sacred items, relics, etc., placed inside images and mchod rtens; these are generally called gzungs, or gzungs gzhug. Have noticed this word especially in Bon consecration texts, but it also occurs in Tshe-mchog-gling Yongs-'dzin, Works VI 131.4.

ནང-ཡན-མཛོད	nang chags zhen lhod de sems gu yangs khur med gyis. Btsan-lha. 367 I 239.

ངན-པ-བཅུ	Sinitic vocab. for mi dge ba bcu. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163.
ངང	continuing state, continuation, continuity. The action of the preceding verb (in the Tibetan!) continues while the action of the following verb is occuring. No exact Sanskrit equivalent, but sometimes used to render rasa, aesthetic experience, prevailing mood (of a work of art), sap, juice.
ངང-གིས	means without relying on the exertion of others. ngang gis grub is equivalent to lhun gyis grub pa. In this sense of 'nature' it is same as Skt. nisarga. "ngang gis phan pa ni rang shugs kyis phan pa." BBNP 465.
ངང-ལག	banana; banana. Aris, Discourse 31. Havnevik, Dissertation 213.
ངང-མོ	Stein.
ངང-པ	For the simile of the goose that can separate the milk out of water, see MahAyAnasamgraha, chap. 1, verse 49, for example. = ngang skya, bya khyung dkar po, ngur pa dkar po, 'gor po'i lag ldan. JD 258. At times in sUtras, it means a red-yellow color. Silk, Dissert. 378.
ངང-ཕྱིད	ngang pas 'da' ba'am dus yol ba. BBNP 471.
ངང-རྒྱུད	Stein.
ངང-སེར	See mgur ba.
ངང-སྐྱ	hellbeige. Kretsch. See ngang pa.

ངར-ཐུག	rjen phye'i thug pa. Btsan-lha.
ངས	Original entry: [mi] ngas. O.T. = mi nad. = rims nad. Blan 301.1. Btsan-lha.
ངས-པོ	gna' dus su 'phan po sa cha'i ming. Btsan-lha.
ངེས-ལག	occurs in Havnevik, Dissertation 213, as a peculiar spelling for ngang lag, 'banana.'
ངེས-མེད	unstable, uncertain. Klong-chen-pa 4.2.
ངེས-པ	uncompromisingly presented, certain. As in, nges pa'i don, for sUtras in which the Buddha preaches the "uncompromisingly presented significance" Skt. niyama/niyata; constant, steady, definite.
ངེས-རྟགས	sure evidence, certain proof. Sources.
ངེས-ཤེས	ascertainment.
ངེས-ཚེ	A medium or inferior type of porcelain. Dung-dkar 139.
ངེས-པ-ལྔ-ལྡན	longs sku nges pa lnga ldan ni / gnas nges pa / chos nges pa / 'khor nges pa / dus nges pa / sku nges pa'o. 600 69. CFMS 75.
ངེས-པར-ལེགས-པ	'ultimate good.' IN Pabongka, Liberation I 71; pt. 2, 40. gtan du bde ba ste thar pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang. Gser Sbram 184.
ངོ	the principal on a loan. Jampel Kaldhen, Interest Rates in Tibet, TJ 1 no. 1 (1975) 109.
ངོ-འཛིན	Stein.
ངོ-བོ	substance. NOT in the sense of material substance (as in materialism). Skt. bhAva, being; rUpa, form; vastu, substance. Corresponding to Dharmabody in its depth, while 'nature' (rang bzhin) is the potentially visible aspect corresponding to Total Assets Body.
ངོ-བྱའོ	rag lus par bya'o. Btsan-lha.
ངོ-ཅན	(important) person. lit.: having face. Sources.
ངོ-དགའ	snang ngor. Btsan-lha. rang gi don shor nas 'gro bas byang chub ngo dgar mi gtong dgos pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. V 163.6.
ངོ-ག	snang ngo. Btsan-lha.
ངོ-ལྕོག	mdun du che brjod byas pa. Btsan-lha.
ངོ-ལྐོག	Stein (also, under his word 'chos).
ངོ-ལྟས	mgo btags zhus pa. Btsan-lha.

ངོ-མཐོན	nan tan. Btsan-lha.

ངོ-སྐལ	respective; respective. Thondup, BM 383. = rang skal.
ངོ-སོ	Samdo A IV 31v.2, 32v.2. [1] appreciation, credit, admiration, good opinion, [2] contribution, effect. Yisun. bzang lan. Btsan-lha. khyed kyis chos byas pas nga la ngo so che rgyu myed. Zhi-byed Coll. II 298.6. ngo so'i mgo 'phang ma khugs na chos khe grags su 'chor ro gsung. Ibid. II 431.6. In general, it seems to mean 'result, reaction,' but also 'truth.' sngos su che ba ci la ngo so che ba yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 313.7. byas pa med pa'i ngo so che ru re spobs can rnams ni nyams drod skams pa yin gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 56.6. sang drung du 'gro ba'i dus tshod na // ngo so bzang po ji ltar gsol. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 393.2. ngo so dang drin bzhag la sogs pa de lta bu yang 'byung srid pa dang. Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 393.2.. bzang lan te / phar phan btags pa'i lan gyi rnyed pa lta bu. 367 II 132.2. Samdo A V 120r.1.
ངོ-སྤྲོད	Germano, Poetic Thought 898. ngo thug pa'am ngo gnyis 'phral du 'jug pa dang ngo shes su 'jug pa. Chödrag. rgyus med pa'i mi sogs ngo sprod pa'i byed bskul. Dagyab. The importance of the Lama's direct introduction is emphasized in Zhi-byed Coll. II 322.6.
ངོ-སྲུངས	saving face, face-saving. Goldstein. Stein. mi ji ltar byams pa ltar de la ngo bsrung cig skye ba yin te / nyung na lan sla ba yin / bsgrub pa po'i ngo srung gi gyeng 'gyel ba dga' ba yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 468.2.
ངོ-ཏི	Stein. ngo thog. Btsan-lha. dgon pa'i ngo ti de brag dmar po seng ge gnam du 'phyong ba 'dra ba'i sked pa la. 64 I 48.2. See Yisun. cho ga'i ngo ti sbyor ba skyabs 'gro nas. Encyclopaedia Tibetica CXXV 318.4. cho ga'i ngo ti sbyor ba skyabs 'gro nas. Zhi-byed Coll. I 118.5.
ངོ-ཚ	Stein.
ངོ-རྫུན-བྱེད-པ	verlogen, betrügerisch; betrügen (deceive). Kretsch.
ངོ-ལ-བལྟ-བ	to pay regard to, obey. MTTP.
ངོ-ཚ-ཤེས-པ	self respect. Kawamura.
ངོ-ཚ-བ-དྲུག	dam chos nyi ma shar ba lta bu'i sgor zhugs nas / mngon spyod ngan pa byed pa 'di yang ngo re tsha / 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan sngar khas blangs nas / spyod pa bab col byed pa ngo re tsha / byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas / gzhan la skur ba 'debs pa 'di yang ngo re tsha / phung po mi gtsang rgyan gyis brgyan pa la / shin tu phyi bdar byed pa 'di yang ngo re tsha / theg pa chen po yin zhes khas blangs nas / shes rab snying rje bral ba 'di yang ngo re tsha / gsang sngags zab mo'i sgor zhugs nas / dam tshig mi bsrung le lo byed pa 'di yang ngo re tsha'o. ངུར-སྨྲིག	known to be orange cloth, but in O.T. it meant "made with tshos snyigs ma." Blan 305.2. OR = ngur. sapphron color. Jackson. Btsan-lha. See gur gum.

ཉ	fish; fish. This has clear T.-B. cognates (Beyer, CT Lang 99), but the ZZ tsa is difficult to explain! In cursive texts, a syllable appearing like the nya stands as a shorthand way of writing bdag. This is certainly explained by the famous mantra used in many sAdhana texts, which has the Skt. word aham, spelled with the avagraha as 'ham. The avagraha looks very much like nya. = gser mig can, mig mi 'dzum, mda'i rnga mo. JD 261. SS 538.5.
ཉ-འགྱུར	cramp in the leg, Charley Horse.
ཉ-བྲིག	KP3 260.5.
ཉ-བཟློག	bcos ma. Gces 584.4. Btsan-lha.
ཉ-དྲག	rtsub 'gyur. Btsan-lha.
ཉ-དུག	KP3 286.1. KP4 455.4.
ཉ-ག	= srang. "currency unit, weighing scale." Kuijp (1986) 36. Samdo A II 302v.3; V 2r.2. sbyangs pa'i stobs kyis nya ga mkhyen. Ibid. IV 258r.6. nya ga 'gag la gzab par zhu. Ibid. IV 258v.4 (also, V 2r.2, 118r.6, 209r.5). srang gi nya ga phyi la srang shing khyi la rgyob. Zhi-byed Coll. II 162.5. yar 'gag dang nya gar ma phyin na. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 258.2.
ཉ-ཁ	? Samdo A V 179v.5.
ཉ-ཁྲ	See skyar mo.
ཉ-ཁྲལ	fish tax. Sources.
ཉ-ལྕིབས	mu tig gi a ma. nya phyis. dud pa bya ba ma. Btsan-lha. = dud pa bya bal. JD 171.
ཉ-ལྡིར	= byin pa. "waist." Kuijp (1986) 36.
ཉ-མ	bud med ces pa'i yul skad. 367 II 132.3. a kye. Gces 587.4. 'woman' (this word is not really 'obsolete,' since used in works of DL VII). BBNP 473. Seems to be especially common in Milarepa biographies, for his female disciples and patrons (but also sometimes used there for both male and female disciples / patrons!). Perhaps related to nag ma, another word for 'woman.' There are various opinions: those who say it means bud med, bud med slob ma. ris med slob ma pho mo, a ce [a lce]. Btsan-lha. bu mo dang slob ma. Dagyab.
ཉ-མིག	Original entry: [tshags srang] nya mig. fish-eye design embossing tool. Schmied 148.
ཉ-མོ	nya gser mig can.
ཉ-ཉོག	Samdo A V 76v.5, but spelled nyag nyog on p. 77r.1.
ཉ-ཕྱི	= nya skyogs. JD 38.
ཉ-ཕྱིས	See mu tig. SS 400.6. DG 95.6.
ཉ-ར	= gnyer ba. "to search." Kuijp (1986) 36. dogs zon byed pa. Btsan-lha. tshe 'di'i nya ra mkhan la byang chub dka' ste mchi' gsung. Seems to mean the small struggles of daily worldly life. Zhi-byed Coll. II 449.2. grags pa gtso bor bsgrubs nas lto rgyab kyi nya ra byas pas chos myi mchi'. Ibid. II 455.2. 'dod na tshe 'di'i nya ra 'jog dgos pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. V 163.3. chos ma 'grub pa'i tshe 'di'i nya ra la dgos pa med de. Zhi-byed Coll. V 470.3.

ཉལ-ཐ	opium; sleeping tobacco (i.e., opium).
ཉལ-ལེ-ཉིལ-ལེ	flaccidly. Soundings 29.
ཉམ-པག	Haarh, Yar-lun 368.
ཉམ-ཚད	= ya mtshar po. BBNP 484. Btsan-lha.
ཉམ-དྲོད-རྟོག	gnas tshul shes pa'am nyams rgyus lon pa. Btsan-lha.
ཉམས	experience; 'experience.' Gyatso, Apparitions 190. Stein. rtogs pa myed pa'i nyams bskyangs pa la zhen pa mang / bsgom chen pa phal cher 'dir ldus pa yin. There are many who are attached to tending experiences without realization. Most contemplatives leave it at that. Zhi-byed Coll. II 330.3 (more discussion found here). nyams ni mtshan nyid bzhi' ldan du skye ste / bde' / gsal / myi rtog / ngo bos grol / blo gzung 'dzin dang bral ba ka myi rtog pa zhes bya. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 8.7.
ཉམས-འུར	a feeling of excitement. "a general term that according to my informants can describe anything from excited children, to a yogin performing feats like leaping onto a high rock, to the state of mind just before a vision dawns." Gyatso, Apparitions 223. See under 'ur.
ཉམས-བརྒྱད	= gar thabs brgyad (OR bcu, OR dgu). 1. sgeg pa, zRGgAra, eroticism. 2. drag shul [can], raudra, wrath. 3. dpa' bo, vIra, heroism. 4. snying rje, kAruNya, compassion. 5. mi sdug pa, bibhatsa, revulsion. 6. bzhad gad, hAsya, humor. 7. rmad byung, adbhuta, marvel (amazement). 8. 'jigs rung, bhayAnaka, terror. M.Vy. 5036-5045. Dag Yig under nyams. [9]. zhi ba, zanta, peaceful. [10]. gar, tANDava, dance. Eastman, Eighteen Tantras, says these are in the Sarvabuddhasamayoga Tantra. See also Wayman, Yoga of GuhyasamAja 22, 327-8.
ཉམས-ཆུང	'humble' (indicating pious or holy persons). Epstein, Dissertation 216.
ཉམས-ལད	nyams chag. Btsan-lha.
ཉམས-མཆར	(= nyams 'char). wunderbar, merkwürdig.
ཉམས-མྱོང	dper na lang tsho bcu drug pa'i bu mo'i bde ba smra mi shes pa bzhin du / rang gi nyams myong gi ngo bo de yang smra mi shes pa'o gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. I 443.2.
ཉམས-རངས	'dod pa la lhag par longs spyod pa. Btsan-lha.
ཉམས-སོད	nyams tshod. Namdak.
ཉམས-པ-རྣམ-པ-བཞི	40.3 (also, 41.2, nyams pa rnam pa gsum).
ཉམས-ཀྱིས-མི-ལྕོགས	stobs kyis mi nus. Btsan-lha.
ཉམས-བྲོད-ཆུང-བ	nyams rgyus nyung ba, spro ba chung ba. Btsan-lha.
ཉམས-སྣང-གོང-འཕེལ	One of snang ba bzhi, q.v.
ཉན	dürfen. bzhes mi nyan, nicht essen dürfen. Kretsch.
ཉན-རང	an abbr. for nyan thos and rang rgyal.
ཉན-རྣ	pho nya. mi mngon par lkog nas nyan pa. Btsan-lha.
ཉན-ཐོས	Hearers. Skt. Sravaka.

ཉི-འོག	shar phyogs. Rtse-le VIII 429. Often refers to a specific 'chamber' in a building. See the rather confusing explanation in Das, JTL&CT 77: "an open quadrangle on the roof of a house, enclosed on all sides by walls, in two of which are door-like openings."

ཉི-ངོག	Coblin in TH&L 73. nye 'og gam mtha' 'khob. Btsan-lha.
ཉི-རྒ	KP1 190.2.
ཉི-རི	SFHB 721.2.
ཉི-ཙེ	phyogs re'am cung zad. Btsan-lha.
ཉི-ཚེ-བ	prAdezika; [1] approximation, simulacrum. nyi tshe ba yi stong par ltung. Rnying Rgyud 1982 I 693.1. Bsam-gtan Mig Sgron 342.6. [2] trivialists, particularists (philologists). [3] In the phrase nyi tshe ba'i sems can gyi dmyal ba, it evidently means an 'individually tailored' hell (?). Silk, Dissert. 282. The meaning of 'insignificance' may correspond to the literal meaning, 'day' (nyi) 'life' (tshe), as one whose life is but a day (such as moths). Skt. may be prAdezika (local, limited; M.Vy.).

ཉིས-ན	O.T. = rnams pa gnyis su na. = yang na. Blan 287.3.
ཉོ-བ	Stein.
ཉོ-ཏིང	pear (the fruit).
ཉོ-ལོང-བྱ-ཐང	nyon long bya grangs. Gces 587.4.
ཉོབ-བེ	a rather unusual word for 'chapter' used in some Bon 'dul ba texts, for example.
ཉོབ-པ	Often understood to be the Tibetan word for 'being bored,' but seems rather to point to a desultory frame of mind, feeling bogged down and ineffectual (but geeze, I often feel that way when staring at this dictionary on the computer screen, and maybe that's what boredom is, after all). In Alex Berzin's transcribed talks, 'Buddhist Terminology,' he says there are no words in Tibetan (or, it would seem, in Sanskrit) for the notions of emotion, boredom and loneliness. He's surely wrong (the notion of emotion could, of course, be considered so culturally specific in its precise parameters that noone else could possibily have it, but then what is the point of making absolute cultural contrasts? Most of the emotional states known to us are to be found among the klezas, and with quite similar parameters of meaning.)
ཉོད-པ	= thug pa. "noodle soup." Kuijp (1986) 36. zas. za ba. Btsan-lha.
ཉོད-རོད	O.T. food and clothing. lto gos. Btsan-lha.
ཉོད-པ-ཉོད-དམ	zas zos sam. Have you eaten? Btsan-lha.
ཉོག	Stein.
ཉོག-ཤེལ	nyag nyog bris pa. Gces 584.2. Btsan-lha.
ཉོལ-ལྕིགས	? nyol lcigs phru gu bsdug bsngal rtsa ba yin // 'di la dgos pa myed de ding ri ba. Zhi-byed Coll. III 88.
ཉོན-མོངས	afflictive emotion, addiction (affect). Skt. kleza. Thurman. ego-logical emotions. Germano, Poetic Thought 872.
ཉོན-ཡིད	addictive mentality. Skt. kliSTamana. Thurman.

པཉཙ-ལི-ཀ	Haarh, Yar-lun 354.
པར	'print,' derived from Chinese acc. to Beyer, CT Lang. 141.
པར-འགྱའ	An O.T. spelling for prajñA, noted in Dge-'dun-chos-'phel-gyi Gsung-rtsom (1990) I 263.
པར-བུ	snod bye brag cig. Btsan-lha.
པར-ཆ	? an article one may carry with one (but here certainly NOT a photo). Gold Ms. I 11r.1.
པར-ཆས	camera; camera. See Das, JTL&CT 80: "After dinner he showed me a work he was writing on history, rhetoric, astrology, and photography. The latter section he had composed from notes I had furnished him, in 1879, from Tassinder's 'Manual of Photography,' and I was delighted to see the diagrams he had drawn to represent the various photographic apparatus I had then left with him."
པར-མ	Generally means an 'imprint,' however in Gung-thang Dkar-chag, it is twice used for images (evidently cast ones), so here it must mean 'casting.'
པར-ཏང	O.T. = stan khra bo. Also, dra'u rdog. Blan 298.1. rngog stan nam / stan khra bo. Btsan-lha.

པར-སིག-པ	mi sha za mkhan. Btsan-lha. Persians are supposed to be cannibals?
པར-པ-ཏ	medicinal herb. Das. TR XIV no. 4, p. 16. Acc. to Huber, Pure Crystal, p. 240, n. 17, parpa, or, parpa ta, refers to a type of leech or worm, and should not be confused with par pa ta, the "horned cumin" (Hypecoum leptocarpum or H. erectum), a medicinal herb.

ཕ-བ	'father' (?).a term used in connection with the gshen rab priests in O.T. documents, as well as in Bon texts. See, for example, Norbu, Drung 35. Discussed by R.A.Stein.
ཕ-བི	O.T. = pha rol. Blan 295.1. Btsan-lha.
ཕ-བཙས	pha nor. Btsan-lha.
ཕ-དམག	Nationalarmee. Kaschewsky2.
ཕ-གི	there (opposite of tshu gi, 'here'). Samdo A V 225r.1.
ཕ-གུ	brick. Rin po che'i pha gu is the rim of jewelled bricks which occurs in mandala representations. Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 61. sa phag. Btsan-lha. Wayman, Buddhist Tantras 88. 27 143. It is interesting that the Tibetan word for 'brick' should be a diminutive for the Tibetan word for 'pig,' phag. The English word porcelain is also said to have originated in Italy as porcellana, a word for cowries, given them because of their resemblance to the back of a pig (Hobson-Jobson 725).

ཕ-ཝང-ལོང-བུ	Seems to have literal meaning 'bat's anklebone.' This is a stone said to serve as a soul-stone of the btsan. See Yisun under both pha bang long bu and pha wang long bu. Gyatso, Apparitions 70. = sman byi drang srong, pha wang cho long. JD 58. My guess is it's galena (lead ore).

ཕང-བ	thu ba'i sgang ngam pang ba. Btsan-lha.
ཕང-ལོ	wheel; = phang long. wheel, round like full moon, globular, ball, pendant. T&BS II 279. 'khor lo. Btsan-lha. Compare phol mig. In the sense of 'wheel' see usage (with spelling 'phang lo) in a fresco inscription in pp. 244-5 of Fresco Art of the Buddhist Monasteries in Tibet, Si-khron Mi-dmangs Dpe-skrun-khang (1994). Zhi-byed Coll. IV 246.7 (on p. 247.5, rten 'brel gyi 'phang lo seems to refer to a device for concentration exercises, in this case containing the letter 'a'). rten 'brel 'phang los skor te thod par bzhugs. Zhi-byed Coll. I 82.1. I've noted an occurrence in a work by AbhayAkaragupta: shing rta'i 'phang lo'i tshad tsam. stong gsum gyi 'jig rten yang shing rta'i 'phang lo bzhin du bskor bar nus pa. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) VI 44.2.

ཕང-མཁན	rigs ngan pa. Btsan-lha.

ཕང-ཕང-གི	localism for the mammal 'bat.' See under lpags byi'u.
ཕངས-པ	valuable.
ཕར-བ	wild dog; A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 293. The lesser wild dog, Cuon primaevus. Das.
ཕར-ཆིན	embroidery; embroidery. Equiv. to 'tshem drub. Yisun. Appears to be a borrowing from Chinese.
ཕར-ཀན	pha rol lam phar phyogs. Btsan-lha.
ཕར-ཕྱིན	pha rol tu phyin pa; Apart from its use as a contraction of pha rol tu phyin pa, I have also noticed this as a [mis]spelling of phar chin, 'embroidery.'
ཕར-རྒྱབ	(Khams) on that side (of the hill). MTTP.
ཕར-སྦྱང	Pallas's wild-dog, Cuon alpinus. Das.

ཕྲ-རྒྱས	Skt. anuzaya. An Abhidharma concept. I recommend translating it as 'insinuators,' since these are 'poisons' that insinuate themselves in the mind stream, and are subsequently 'amplified' Perhaps 'infiltrators' would also do the trick. rkyen ngan gyi 'phra rgyas ldang. V 139.6. nyon mongs pa phra ba las rgyas par byas pa ste / ngo bo mthong dka' bas na phra ba dang / dmigs pa dang mtshungs ldan gang rung gi sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur bas na rgyas pa'o. Gser Sbram 129. ཕྱག-དབང	to do a blessing with the hands (phyag gis byin rlabs byed pa). Nomads 242. mi phal pa rnams bla ma rtsa ba chen po'i drung du bcar ba'i tshe mi de dag gis phyag rgya dang bcas te bla ma'i drung du mgo bos btud pa na / bla ma des bkra shis pa'i bden tshig brjod cing phyag g.yas pa mi de dag gi mgo thog tu 'jog pa'o. Nomads 277.
ཕྱག-ཁང	Evid. a Tibetan way of referring to mosques (masjid), because of the Muslim practice of prostration. See Dung-dkar 17.
ཕྱག-མ	In a list of small creatures in Pha-dam-pa dang Ma-cig (PRC 1992) 441.
ཕྱག-མཛོད	bang mdzod. mdzod khang. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-མཇལ	gifts (offered to a superior). Sources.
ཕྱག-ནས	phyag nas bzhugs (preceded by the name of a person ending in genitive case) is an abbreviated way of writing (noticed in dkar chag's like the Rwa sgreng Dkar chag), meaning that the image or thangka contains the hand-barley of the named person. Acc. to Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 39, it means hand-held sacred barley. This phrase also occurs in an inscription on the back of a wooden statue of Karma-pa I, which says it contains the hand-barley of Karma-pa VIII (statue in possession of Michael Henns).
ཕྱག-རྡོར	rdzas kyi phyag rdor, see gu gul.
ཕྱག-རིས	byas rjes. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-རྗེད	brtsi bkur byed mkhan gyi yog po. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-རྗེས	'hand-print.' Fig.: a token to someone's achievements. Sources.
ཕྱག-སྦལ	btson dong. yig mdzod dam bang mdzod. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-སྦྱལ	archives.
ཕྱག-ཤུལ	n. of a clan. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-ཙང	g.yos khang ngam thab khang. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-ཚ	n. of a clan. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-ཚང	thab ka pa'am za ma bcos mkhan. g.yos khang. lag bde ba. Cook. Kitchen. Btsan-lha. he he rgya mtsho'i drung na phyag tshang rku ba'i chu dang 'dra gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 191.2. kun dga' khyod rang bden myed khong du chug la phyag tshang rku ba chub bor gsung. Ibid. II 232.2.
ཕྱག-ཡར	'phrin las. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱག-ན-རྡོ-རྗེའི-ཆེ-བ-བརྒྱད	'khor lo chen po dbang gi che ba / gos sngon can chos skyong gi che ba / 'byung 'dul me dmigs kyi che ba / rnam 'joms khrus kyi che ba / u tsarya drag sngags kyi che ba / gtum po khyung gi che ba / phyag rdor mdo lugs mdze gsos kyi che ba / bha ba ma gdams ngag gi che ba rnams so // phyag na rdo rje me lce sde brgyad gnad la 'bebs pa'i che ba bsnan na dgur yang grags so. 600 118.
ཕྱག-མི-བཞུགས	bzhugs med pa. Btsan-lha.

ཕྱག-དར-ཁྲོད	Skt. pAMzukUla, a heap of rags in the garbage. Silk, Dissert. 60.
ཕྱག-དར-ཁྲོད-པ	sweeper? Zhi-byed Coll. V 407.1. Actually, this is Skt. pAMzukUlika, something made from rags found in the refuse heap (used for monastic robes as a special asceticism).
ཕྱག-རྟེན-དམར	mjal rten bzang ba. Dpe-chos 511.

ཕྱལ	(hon.) = lto ba. Blan 312.2. "mooring." Klong-chen-pa 10.18 comm. grod khog gi zhe sa. Btsan-lha.

ཕྱལ-བར	= yal ba (?), "to dwindle, vanish, be wiped out." Or, scribal error for phral ba, "to throw away, remove, get rid of." Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 318.
ཕྱལ-བྱལ	rtsal cir yang 'char ba / phyal byal ba / rjen rjen pa / bun bun pa. Zhi-byed Coll. III 51.3.
ཕྱལ-པ	(= chal pa) float, buoy, coracle boat (with inflated skin for flotation). Samdo A V 100r.5. For a symbolic usage of the inflated bag, see BA 922.

ཕྱལ-པ-ལྷུག-པ	loose buoy (floating freely). Common in Klong-chen-pa.
ཕྱལ-བར-བོར	yal bar bor ba. Btsan-lha.

ཕྱམ	In architecture, the rafters. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3. de'i steng du phyam zhes dpyam las phra ba'i shing chas. Namdak, Bzo-rig 77.. (elsewhere, cham) utter, utterly, to-the-limit. beam (also, the support place of a beam), as something overarching, level and enduring. Klong-chen-pa 8.6, etc. 'cham. Gces 583.1. Btsan-lha. Namdak. See under lcam.
ཕྱམ-བརྡལ	Thondup, BM 330, n. 67.
ཕྱམ-བུ	? Gold Ms. I 21r.2.
ཕྱམ-བྱུང	pham par btang ba. cham la phab pa byung. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱམ-ཆད	mnyam nyid. Btsan-lha. See phyam phyad.
ཕྱམ-གདལ	spread-out-to-the-limit. Phyam means (roof) beam, also, and sometimes this meaning is played on. Klong-chen-pa 3.5.
ཕྱམ-གྱིས	Samdo A IV 175r.3. See phyams kyis.
ཕྱམ-མེ	equalness. Thondup, BM 364.
ཕྱམ-ཕྱད	O.T. = mnyam nyid. Skt. samata. Blan 286.1. Btsan-lha. See phyam chad.

ཕྱེ-མར	A mixture of barley flour and butter, kept in a container on the altar at New Year. A pinch of this is thrown into the air by guests. See gro so phye mar. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 9. Norbu, Drung 110. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 47.

ཕྱིང-ཀ-ལོག	lag gnyis rgyab tu bcings pa. Arms tied behind the back. Btsan-lha. Also spelled phyin ka log.
ཕྱིར	As it occurs at the end of a statement in debate, it indicates the reason (see under thal).
ཕྱིར-བསྣུར	phyir nur ba'am 'then pa. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱིར-ནང	am Morgen. Kaschewsky2.

ཕྱིར-བསླན-པ	phyir bsdus pa. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱིར-ཕྱིར-ཕྱིར	In debates, accompanied with 3 hand claps, it is meant to hurry up the defender of the thesis. Dreyfus, Sound 213 convincingly explains the phyir as a short version of ci'i phyir, 'why'?
ཕྱིར-ཞིང-དབྱུང-བ	'phel ba. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱིས	dbyi ba'i bskul tshig. Dagyab.
ཕྱིས-བུ	O.T. = snod. Blan 289.6. zangs gzhong snod. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱིས-གནོན	mthu yis mnan pa dang zil gyis gnon pa. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱོད-ཀྱིས	glo bur. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱོད-ཆེ-བ	tshegs chung. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱོད-ཆུང-བ	'gor 'gyangs sam dal ba. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱོགས	side, orientation, leaning toward a particular side, headed in a particular direction. Especially philosophical or 'ideological' orientations. Skt. diz, pakSa, etc. = dam bca'; position, thesis. Skt. pakSa. Thurman.
ཕྱོགས-བཅུ	phyogs bzhi / mtshams bzhi / steng 'og gnyis rnams so. 600 136.
ཕྱོགས-བཟུང	khas blangs pa. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱོགས-ལྷུང	partial definition, bias, partiality. Skt. pakSapAta (?); lit., falling of feathers (wings), maintaining a thesis, taking sides in an argument, partisanship.
ཕྱོགས-མེད	impartial, nonpartisan (opposite of 'partial' in the several different senses of the English word). undirected, without prejudice.
ཕྱོགས-སྤྲང	tinker (Kesselflicker). Wandering smiths. Schmied 89, 103.
ཕྱོགས-ཞེན	biased.
ཕྱོགས-སྐྱོང-བཅོ-ལྔ	dbang po / gshin rje / chu bdag / gnod sbyin / me lha / srin po / rlung lha / 'byung po / tshans pa / sa'i lha mo dang bcu / de'i steng du nye dbang / tshogs bdag / nyi ma / zla ba / thag bzang ris bsnan pa'o. 600 183.

ཕྱུ-བ	Probably the correct spelling of chu ba, q.v., the Tibetan national garb. See Hobson-Jobson, p. 205 (the entry for choga), which relates it to a Turkic word.
ཕྱུ-རུ-རུ	nad kyi blangs pa thams cad gyen du phyu ru ru song bar bsam mo. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 288.1 (also, 288.5).
ཕྱུག	See Beckwith in TS7 II 1049. Cattle as wealth.
ཕྱུག-ཕྱུང-མ	slim beauty. mdzes ma lus phra ma. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱུགས-ཆུང	lang tsho dar la bab pa'i gzhon nu ma. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱུགས-ཅུང	gzhon nu ma. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱུགས-ཕྱུང	O.T. = gzhon nu ma. Blan 300.4.
ཕྱུགས-རྒོད	'animal gorilla.' Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 51.
ཕྱུགས-རུ	nor 'brog, she 'brog. Nomads 242.
ཕྱུགས-རྫིའི-འཛར-བ	367 I 237.
ཕྱུགས-ཆུང-མ-ཉམས-པ	gzhon nu ma grong pa'i chos kyis ma gos pa. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱུར-བ	cheese; = phyu ra. For the two types of cheese, one bluish and one lightish, see Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 41. Sngo phyur is produced at higher elevations. An iron cheese container illus. in Precious Deposits V 140.
ཕྱྭ	'lots, prophecy.' See BBNP 473. Acc. to ShAk-mchog (ShAkya-mchog-ldan), 'maker of worldly vicissitudes.' BBNP 473. mo pa dang ltas mkhan. Dpe-chos 503. 'jig rten pa'i lha'i bye brag cig. mo pa dang ltas mkhan. Btsan-lha. As an ancient clan, discussed in Karmay, Arrow 250 ff. Risking the inevitable derision of seasoned linguists, we might venture to suggest that this word is somehow related to Greek phua, which is behind a number of other words. The Greek word seems to mean 'natural' genius or talent (as opposed to technique) in the arts, and has meaningful connections with the concepts of nature (Gr. phusis), productivity (Gr. phuein, 'to produce') and tribe (Gr. phUlé). Hence the 'English' words physics, physical phylum etc.
ཕྱྭ-ལེབ	O.T. = mnyam pa. Blan 289.1.
ཕྱྭ-མཁན	a fortuneteller of worldly vicissitudes, astrologer, diviner. BBNP 473. ltas dang rtags lta mkhan dang / mo pa sogs. Btsan-lha.
ཕྱྭ-མོ	mo 'debs pa. Nomads 242.
ཕྱྭ-བླན-པ	to consult a soothsayer. Karmay, Treasury.
ཕྱྭ-སྲིད-སྐོས-གསུམ	phywa rje ring dkar dang / srid rje 'brang dkar / skos rje drang dkar bcas gsum mo. 506A 335.
པི-མུ	79 87, no. 78. Also spelled pis mu.
པི-ཤི	cat; cat. LW 478.
པི-སྤལ	Pipal tree. Ficus religiosus. LW 458.
པི-ཙི	See pe tse.
པི-ཝང	'lute.' Acc. to Beyer, CT Lang. 140, this as well as Chinese word both derive from an unknown Khotanese word. Attested already in M.Vy. Some old examples illus. in Precious Deposits I.
པི-པི-ལིང	See grog sman pi pi ling. = sman nag, nag ring, drod sman nar mo, grog ma'i gzugs can, spod kyi bran. JD 89. a tree. SS 424.4. = kri na. YTTM 292.6. = tsa pa la, nag po tsan de. YTTM 292.24. = drod sman. Piper longum. LW 458. = bai de hi, byi ril, lus 'phags skyes, ma ga dhi, yul dbus skyes, zeg ma g.yo byed, byang chub ljon shing, a ri ha ta, sel sel. DG 196.4. Clifford, list. Laufer (p. 458): Piper longum. JD 89: The best is that which comes from China. Lacking that, Indian pi pi ling is next best. The inferior is called elephant pepper (glang po che'i pi pi ling). The sort found in Tibet & the Himalayan regions to the south are mildly flavored and least favored for medicinal use. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16).
པི-ཥཊ-སཽ-བྷཾ	See tsandan dkar po.
པི-ཤུ-ཀ	See 'bu su hang.
པི-ཚུ-རའི-ཤིང-འབྲས	BD of T&TB I 797.
པི-ཀ-ཤ-ལ	See ba sha ka.
པི-ཙུ-ལཱ-ལ	LW 479.
པིཎཋི	See (sman) sga.
པིད-ཀྱིས	Samdo A III 232v.2; V 114r.3. la pid kyis 'das la. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 264.3.
པིང-གཏོང-བ	Apparently a kind of Lhasa beggar? Dung-dkar 42.
པིར	brush; brush. From Chinese (T. J. Norbu). Jackson. a fish-like sea creature used as a mount for certain deities, and sometimes found in Bonpo art. ST. Name of an animal in Bon Kanjur (192-vol. version) CLIV 272a.4. An opponent of the chu srin. Sga 331.1. sbal ba'i rigs. JD 260.
པིར-དོང	brush container; brush container.
པིར-ཁ	brush point; brush point.
པིར-སྤུ	brush hair; brush hair.
པིས-མུ	See pi mu.
པོ-ལུ	In architecture, seems to refer to the ends of the crossbeams resting on the main beam, also used as a design element. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3. Also above doors. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 4.
པོ-མཐའ	ji ltar thogs kyang. Btsan-lha.
པོ-མཐོ	See po zos kyang.
པོ-པོ	grandfather. BBNP 478. mes po. Btsan-lha.
པོ-ཏི	O.T. deriv. from Skt. pustaka. Blan 308.3.

པྲོག-ཞུ	Word used to label a (bodhisattva-type) royal crown with 5 lobes. Illus. in Yisun. Used for an Indian royal turban (made of silk with jewels). Chag 65. dbu rgyan dang rtse zhwa. Btsan-lha, q.v. For bya rog prog zhu, see Terrone in TS9 VIII 223.
པུ	ZZ = 'go. Bru II 290.5.

པུ-ཤུ	said to be equiv. to Skt. harmika, the 'little house,' a part of the stUpa that may have eyes painted on it.
པུ-ཤུད	hoopoe; bya khra chung zhig. mda' yab bam lan kan dang mchod rten byi bre. Btsan-lha. hoopoe bird. Das. = sgro gtsug can. JD 228. SS 537.2.

པུ-ཚེ	bran, husks of barley; bran, husks of barley. Das. An added note suggests it might be Chinese.

རགས	dyke. For Atisa's construction of a dyke to benefit living beings, see BA 256. There is much literature about the Lhasa dyke. Adding stones to it was considered an act of religious merit.

རམ-བུ-ཉབ	rtsa ram bu tho ba. Gces 584.3. rtswa ran pa'i 'bras bu lag pas rnyab pa'am 'thog pa. Btsan-lha.
རམ-བུ-འདེགས-པ	phyar chung ram bu theg dang gsung nas. Phyar-chung, accompany me (in the song). Zhi-byed Coll. II 275.4.
རམ-པའི-སེའུ	See dur ba.
རམས	indigo; indigo. Jackson. JD 61. SS 527.5. indigo. LW 503. DG 141.2. Varieties (?): tshon, tshos, rkyags.
རམས-སེ	light indigo color; light indigo color. Jackson.
རན	rtswa zhig. Btsan-lha.
རན-པ	O.T. = lcug phran. Blan 294.2. Btsan-lha.
རན-པོ	(coll.) moderate. MTTP.
རང-འགྱུར	autotranslation (without the help of a native speaker). Note use of this term in Dge-'dun-chos-'phel-gyi Gsung-rtsom (1990) I 280. Several South Asian teachers, including Pha-dam-pa, Bal-po A-su, and VairocanarakSita, made autotranslations.
རང-འཐག	A grain-grinding apparatus powered by a waterwheel. Illus. in Yisun. 'bras bu rang thag chu bskor la dris. Zhi-byed Coll. II 226.7.
རང-བབས	lit., 'self-fallen.' As it lies.
རང-བུ	'brel ba med pa'am rkyang pa. Btsan-lha.
རང-བྱུང	self-engendered, self-produced (not caused or conditioned by anything apart from itself).
རང-བཞིན	nature. NOT the nature of nature walks or the natural sciences so much as human nature, the nature of illusion, etc. Unlike the English word, it has nothing about it that connotes 'birth.' It literally means 'own-ness.'
རང-ཆགས	phun tshar sogs kyi mtha' bcum pa. Btsan-lha.
རང-གསལ	self-luminous[-ity]. light that lights itself up, self-displaying.
རང-ཁར	chags sdang rang khar spyod pa'i 'tshogs dpon mang po gda' na gsung. There seem to be a lot of leaders who practice the passions as they are. Zhi-byed Coll. II 338.3.
རང-ལྡོག	categorical differential. Thurman.
རང-མལ	'whole' in the sense 'every part of' or 'all that there is.' Karmay, Treasury.
རང-མཚན	eigene (verborgene) Fehler. Kaschewsky2.
རང-མཚང	rang skyon. Btsan-lha.
རང-ཉམས	O.T. = rang bzhin. Blan 296.6.
རང-རྒྱལ	solitary realizors.
རང-རྒྱུད	Thurman (p. 104) argues for his translation "dogmaticist privacy." It has more general meanings of one's own customary outlook. gang la yang rang rgyud du ma bzung na las sog myi nus pa lags sam zhus pas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 296.5. rang rgyud pa gang la yang myed pa'i brda' ru / dngos po re re la mying du ma 'dogs / rang rgyud du bzung na 'khrul pa yin pa'i brda' ru / spyod lam la nges pa myed. Zhi-byed Coll. II 114.4.
རང-རིག	self-awareness, appropriate awareness. reflexive awareness (awareness that awares itself).
རང-རྐྱང	Achard, L'Essence 135.
རང-རོང	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 300. rough, unsmoothed (roadway). Samdo A V 210r.6. rang rong thams cad glod lags pas. Samdo A III 191r.6. See rad rod!
རང-སྐྱ	las dang po pa'i gang zag gis rang skya myi thub pas bshes gnyen dam pa dang 'bral ma snga. Zhi-byed Coll. II 249.7. shes rab gsum la 'byongs pas rang skya thub. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 228.5. nyams ma rdzogs kyi bar la rang rkya mi thub par bstan pa. Zhi-byed Coll. V 189.4. zhe sdang gis rang kya pher te tshod du byas pas / bzod pa zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pas. Also spelled rang rkya, rang kya. Zhi-byed Coll. V 282.7. lam rtags dang rdo rus ma phrad par bla ma dang bral bas rang skya myi thub. Zhi-byed Coll. V 316.5. ability to stand on one's own, independence.
རང-སྣང	appropriate manifestation. showing itself as it is, OR, displaying itself by its own light. Klong-chen-pa 4.5.
རང-སོ	Achard, L'Essence 190.
རང-སྤྱོམས	rang gis rang nyid gzhan la 'phyar ba. Btsan-lha.
རང-ཏག	phye 'thag byed mchig gam rang 'thag. Btsan-lha.
རང-ཐང	defined at Samdo A IV 21v.4, 'not made up by antidotes or thoughts.' Seems to mean 'wears itself out' (with addition of the verb 'to go') in phrases like: myi chos pa dang 'brel ma chod na rnal 'byor rang thang du song ba. Zhi-byed Coll. II 172.2. gzung 'dzin ma sol na lta ba rang thang du 'gro ba'i brda' ru... Zhi-byed Coll. II 168.1. 'khor ba las blo ma log na dad pa rang thang du song ba'i brda' ru. Zhi-byed Coll. II 171.5. rtsang pa'i skad du rang thang yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 311.2.
རང-ཙམ	= nyung ngu. "a few." Kuijp (1986) 36.
རང-ཚོད	(as in rang tshod bzung). die eigenen Grenzen (beachten), die eigenen Möglichkeiten (nicht überschätzen). Kaschewsky2.
རང-ཡལ	self-solvent. Klong-chen-pa 11.2.
རང-རྡོལ-མཁྱེན	skyes stobs sam rang bzhin gyis shes pa. Btsan-lha.
རང-ཤར-རང-གྲོལ	sems byung rang shar rang grol la // rtog pa spangs pas ci zhig bya. Zhi-byed Coll. I 327.5.
རང-བཞིན-གྱི-སྐད	Prakrit (a group of early Indian languages). 133 9.4.
རང-བཞིན-བརྒྱད-ཅུའི-རྟོག-པའི-སེམས	Lati Rinbochay, Death 38 ff. SBKK I 236.17. Kelsang Gyatso, Clear Light of Bliss 82 ff.
རང-བཞིན-རྣམ-བཅུ	The 10 natures (from the Kun Byed Rgyal-po). Characterizing the 8 lower Vehicles. Klong-chen-pa 5.3, 5.16.
རང-བྱན-ཆུད-པ	dbang du gyur pa. Btsan-lha.

རང-བྱན-དུ-འཁོར-བ	skor mkhan med par rang bzhin gyis 'khor ba. Btsan-lha.
རང-བྱན-ཚུད-པ	= nang byan tshud pa, = nang rgyus lon pa. See BBNP 474. rgyus lon pa. Btsan-lha. man ngag la rang byan tshud. Zhi-byed Coll. V 326.1.
རང-བབས-སུ	according to its (their) natural condition, as is natural (for such a thing).
རང-འཁྲིས-ཀྱི-བྱེད-སྒོ	rang nyid kyi las 'gan. Btsan-lha.
རང-བྱོན-བཅུ-ཅིག	5 111.
རང-ཁ-མ	Evid. equiv. to rang ga ma, rang ga ba. Samdo A V 81r.3, 135r.1.
རང-གི-ལག-བདར-བ	rang gi lag tu blangs pa. Btsan-lha.
རང-གི-ཐིག-ལེ	See dngul chu.

རང-བཟོས-བློས-བྱས	rang nyid kyi blo gros kyi rtsal las 'don pa. Btsan-lha.
རང-དགའ-བ	ordinary; unreflective (inquiry, :::'i brtag pa/ usage, ::: 'jug pa). Thurman. ordinary. Jinpa.
རང-དབང-མེད	This occurs in a sUtra translation. Silk, Dissert. 283.

རང-བྱུང-ཡེ-ཤེས	'Total Knowledge made by Total Knowledge,' a synonym of Bodhicitta (= Clear Comprehension Mind).

རྡ-ཀོ	a food item given to child about 2 months after its birth in Bonpo families in Kathmandu. The mother also eats it. It is a dough consisting of refined rtsam pa, butter, salt & milk or water. Ishii in Karmay, New Horizons 361. The Lhasa form is supposed to be rda ka.
རྡ-ལོག	As ex. of an irreg. Old Tantra term, corresponding to gnas 'gyur pa, see the work of Dge-rtse in Rnying Rgyud 1973 XXXVI 455. See under ja log.

རྡོ-རྗེ-འཛིན	1. rdo rje 'chang. 2. phyag rdor. 3. brgya byin. 4. gsang sngags kyi sgrub pa po. Blan 529.
རྡོ-རྗེ-ཅན	spyi 'joms rdo rje can. a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 67. Lag-len 46.3. = zur lugs rdo rje can (Lag-len 37.1).
རྡོ-རྗེ-དབྱིངས	Realm of Vajra. Tends, in lower Tantra Vehicles, to be identified with the subjective-sphere aspect of Buddhahood in contradistinction to Realm of Dharmas, the objective-sphere aspect. In Ati, this distinction no longer applies. Klong-chen-pa 7.4 comm.
རྡོ-རྗེ-གུར	'Vajra tent,' the canopy of vajra that surrounds the mandala. Doboom, Buddhist Path to Enlightenment 60.
རྡོ-རྗེ-ཕ-ལམ	= badzra hi ra. JD 31. DG 79.2.

རྡོ-རྗེ-ཉེར-ལྔ	ge hA rdo rje nyer lnga. BT 56V.6.
རྡོ-རྗེ-ཁྲི-བོ	See mchil ba.
རྡོ-རྗེ-སྙིང-པོ	Vajra Heart. May be used as a synonym for Great Perfection teachings. Klong-chen-pa 5.3. May be further 'translated' as "self-engendered Total Knowledge matrix." Skt. vajragarbha. vajrahRdaya.

རྡོ-རྗེའི-གནས-བདུན	rgyud bla ma'i brjod bya rdo rje'i gnas bdun ni / sangs rgyas chos tshogs khams dang byang chub dang // yon tan sangs rgyas 'phrin las tha ma ste // bstan bcos kun gyi lus ni mdor bstan na // rdo rje yi ni gnas bdun 'di dag go // ces gsungs pa ltar ro. 600 98.
རྡོ-རྗེའི-ཚེར-མ	'brum nad. Rtse-le VIII 427. 'brum nad. Btsan-lha.
རྡོ-རྗེའི-མཆུ-ཅན	1. tshogs bdag. 2. khyab 'jug bzhon pa bya khyung. Blan 529.
རྡོ-གསུམ-སྦྱོར-བ	a medicinal preparation. BP 139.3.
རྡོ-ཡི-འཛེངས	rdo'i tshigs sam rdo'i bye brag mkhregs rdo zhig. Btsan-lha.
རྡོ-ཡི-བྱུག-པ-ངོ-མཚར-ཅན	a medicinal preparation. BP 245.4.
རྡོ-ཡི-སྙིང-པོ	See as ma garbha.
རྡོ-ཡི-རྒྱལ-པོ-བཞི	YTTM 290.20.
རྡོ-རུས-ཕྲད	Blue Annals 944: "a famous saying often quoted in religious texts, meaning that if one wishes to eat the marrow of the bone, one should crush the bone with a stone. In meditation there is need of a direct contact between the Mind and the Doctrine." Cf. Gyatso, Apparitions 68, 182. Pabongka, Liberation II 101.
རྡོ-རུས-ཐུག	To the last extremity. Das.
རྡོ-ཁ-བྱས	Stein.
རྡོ-ཐལ-དཀར-པོ	Chayet in TH&L 32.
རྡོའི-འཛིང	rdo bzang po. Btsan-lha.
རྡོའི-མི	stone man. Frequent metaphor for being impervious. Zhi-byed Coll. I 417.3. don la go rgyu 'am go bar byed pa'i mkhan po myed pa'i brda' ru / rnal 'byor pa cig gis rdo'i myi la chos bshad gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 167.5.
རྡོའི-སྙིང-པོ	chu nang gi rdo las skyes pa'i rin po che mdog nag po dang dmar po sogs yod pa zhig. Btsan-lha.

རྫས	= rgyu. Notwendigkeit, zu rufen. ZAS VII 474.
རྫས-རྒྱུན	material continuity (like the clay of a cup), as distinguished from rigs 'dra'i rgyun, 'type continuity' (like the cuphood of the cup). Jinpa. These terms are important for DharmakIrti, but perhaps for others as well.
རྫས-ཡོད-བཞི	rigs pas grub pa'i rdzas yod / brtan pa mi 'gyur ba'i rdzas yod / don byed nus pa'i rdzas yod / rang rkya thub pa'i rdzas yod do. 600 32-33.

རྫིའུ	phru ba / 'bras thag gi phru ba bre bcu lhag btsor btub pa'i rdzi'u / rdza ma chung ngu la rdzi'u dang de'i nang du 'bras btsos pa la rdzi'u tshos zer. See 367 II 130.1 ff. རྫིག-པོ	(Khams) wonderful, handsome. MTTP.
རྫིག-སྤམ	phyi nang mi mtshungs pa'o spom yor. Btsan-lha.
རྫིང-བུ	bcos pa'i mtshe'u. Btsan-lha.
རྫིང-དབོལ	rdzing bu rgya che ba'am rdzing bu rdol ba. Btsan-lha.
རྫིང-མནན-པ	rdzing la chu bskyil ba. Dpe-chos 516. Btsan-lha.
རྫོབ-པ	sgrib pa. Btsan-lha.
རྫོག-རྫོག	mang po. Btsan-lha.
རྫོགས-བྱེད	sngar mu stegs kyi ston pa zhig. Btsan-lha.
རྫོགས-ཆེན	Great Completion. Since the three Inner Method Tantras (nang thabs kyi rgyud) among the nine Vehicles, (i.e., Maha-, Anu- and Ati-yoga Tantras) are identical to Generation (Bskyed), Completion (Rdzogs) and Great Completion (Rdzogs-chen), properly speaking, Great Completion is equivalent to Ati-yoga alone. But, actually, Great Perfection is the aim of all three.
རྫོགས-ལྡན	dge ba bcu yongs su rdzogs par ldan pa. phun tshogs sde bzhi yongs su rdzogs par longs spyod pa. rtsa ba bzhi yongs su ma nyams par gnas pa. Btsan-lha.
རྫོགས-ཤོ	O.T. = rdzogs so. Blan 283.2-.3. Btsan-lha.
རྫོགས-ཚོན	"complete color." The painting method using opaque colors applied in distemper. = tshon chen. Jackson.
རྫོགས-པ-ཆེན-པོ	Occurs in a late Dunhuang text (Hackin, Formulaire 30), where it glosses this Skt. in Tib. transliteration: pa-ri-pu-ru-na (i.e., paripUraNa, 'rendering complete'). See P. tib. 849.143.
རྫོང	CITADEL, fort, district capital. Used in a literary sense in Klong-chen-pa--something that neither gains nor loses anything due to the strength of its 'walls.' spros med byang chub snying po'i rdzong. Rnying Rgyud 1982 663.6. fee for safe-conduct, the act of escorting, accompanying, a price of peace or protection. Huber, Pure Crystal 171.
རྫོང-འཁྱེར	a kind of district-wide corvée levy where pack animals had to be assembled at the district headquarters (rdzong) to handle large shipments of goods. Goldstein, Taxation 19.
རྫོང-བ	a parting gift. 27 33. dismiss. Chayet in Facets 73.
རྫོང-དཔོན	Sources. Their duties and terms are described in McGovern, To Lhasa in Disguise 142 ff.
རྫོང-ཁ	district under the administration of a rdzong. (modern spelling is rdzong-khag; the term rdzong kha has today the meaning of 'fort-language,' i.e. the official language of Bhutan). Sources.
རྫོང-ཕྲུ	lam rgyags sogs lam chas. Dpe-chos 508. Btsan-lha.
རྫོང-ཕྱི	citizen? non taxpayer? Kuijp (1986) 36.
རྫོང-སྟ	pho nya ba. Btsan-lha.
རྫོངས	'bul ba. skyes. Btsan-lha.
རྫུ-འཕྲུལ	Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 199.
རྫུ-བག-ཅན	g.yo sgyu can. zor rdzu can. Btsan-lha.
རྫུ-འཕྲུལ-རྐང-པ-བཞི	129 V 455.3. rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi ni / 'dun pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa / brtson 'grus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa / dpyod pa'o rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa / sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o. 600 42-43.
རྫུབ-པ	g.yo zol. rdzu bag. Btsan-lha.

རྫུད-པ	sha srab cing skem pa. Btsan-lha.
རེ	(Einschubpartikel). Kaschewsky2. For the use of this syllable inserted between the two syllables of a word, making an exclamatory sentence, see Beyer, CT Lang 385. It is used several times in clause-final position in 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 286.
རེ-འབོག	re ba'i khug ma. Nomads 250.
རེ-འབྱམས	a poisonous snake (?). Norbu, Drung 29. Enumerated among aquatic creatures in Pha-dam-pa dang Ma-cig (PRC 1992) 439.
རེ-འཕྱར	re ba'i khebs. Nomads 250.
རེ-བ	yak hair (used to make felt tents of nomads). Norbu, Drung 6 (and note), 101. re lde. Nomads 250.
རེ-བལྟོས	expectation, reliance (on a specific outcome).
རེ-བརྙས	= re gnyis. BBNP 475. Btsan-lha.
རེ-དོགས	bzang po yong gi re ba dang ngan pa 'byung gi dogs pa'i bsdus ming. Btsan-lha. hope/fear, anxiety.
རེ-ག	Possible spelling for re kha, besides meaning the 'lines' of a drawing or whatever, perhaps means 'layers' of a wall (in the mandala).
རེ-གསོས	sbra re gsar du bsnan pa. Nomads 250.
རེ-ཀན	"never," "[not] at all." See Kuijp in JAOS 111, p. 100. Also spelled re skan.
རེ-ཁ	ri mo. Btsan-lha.
རེ-ཁྲ	rtsid re khra bo. Nomads 250.
རེ-ལྕག	= sprel mjug, dung thod bcings blon. JD 150. SS 494.3. KP3 260.2. = shog shing. YTTM 293.10. Slovar' nos. 664, 666: Also known as shog shing. Stellera chamaejasme. JD 150: Several stems grow to the same height from a single root. As the flowers open, they are red, but turn to white with age. The white root, (shaped) like a rough horn, is single. The middle part (of the root) is used in making paper. Sde-srid/2 494.3. Hübotter/1 126: Stellera chamaejasme Wikstr., Euphorbia lasiocaula Boiss.
རེ-ལྡེ	rtsid pa las byas pa'i snam bu. smyug ma'i lhas ma. Btsan-lha.

རེམ	491 19.2. so nam la rem kyang thun shas su song. "They do a quick bit of farming, but it's gone with the harvest tax." Zhi-byed Coll. II 221.5 (also, II 254.5). quick. T&BS I 329. gsol ba rem la thob cig. Zhi-byed Coll. II 280.1. so mkhar rem du srungs shig. Ibid. III 13.2. de'u dgun de dge sbyor rem du byas pas 'khor 'das dbyer med kyi go ba snyed gsung ste. 64 I 42.4. mo sham la bu myed pas rem ngan gyi rtsi gdab dang bral. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 129.2 (also, V 411.4).
རེམ-པ	to concentrate hard on (something). myi dge ba til 'bru tsam cig la myi 'dzem par / khru bshal rem par gda' ste. To give all one's attention to washing, without shrinking back from the least sesame seed of nonvirtue. Zhi-byed Coll. II 279.2.
རེན	KTDN 131.4.
རེང-བ	'brel med dam rkyang pa. Btsan-lha.
རེང-བུ	O.T. = 'grel med. = rkyang pa. Blan 294.3.. 'brel med dam rkyang pa. spos thur. yar langs pa dang dga' ba sogs. Btsan-lha. rkyang ba'am gcig pu. Gser Sbram 79.

རྒུ	See under skye dgu.
རྒུ-དྲུས	= ser po rgu drus. JD 206. SS 475.2. KP1 219.5. KP3 325.6. rgu brus in KP4 531.2.

རྒུམ	grain. Karmay, Great Perfection 59-61, 66, 70 n. 49, 83, 85. See sgum.
རྒུན	dbus par la rgud ces 'byung bas gad pa zhes pa'i yul skad do. Dpe-chos 511.
རྒུན-འབྲུམ	grapes. dgun 'brum gyi chang is listed in Zhi-byed Coll. IV 160.2 among things unknown in Tibet, along with la du and go la. Dhongthog 336 says 'plum.' JD 96. KP3 270.3. SS 422.1. = a sa sha ta, drA kSa, mri rdhi ka, gau bA nI, ba'i nu ma, ra sa rI, ro ldan, ma dhuu ra sa, ro mngar, ma sib. DG 206.6. Fundamentals 15.3 (Item 16). Singh 208 (Skt. drAkSA, etc.). 'grape' or 'raisin' (but sometimes 'plum'). JD 96, obviously refers to grapes and raisins. For medical uses, the most favored are the seedless yellow pea-sized grapes of India & Kashmir. Blue and black grapes are less recommended.
རྒུན-འགྱེད	yon skyabs grongs pa'i rgun 'gyed bre gsum mo. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 524.4.

རྒྱ	extent, width, trap. In Rdzogs-chen texts, often means confinement. Skt. jAla; net, trap, latticework. Klong-chen-pa 9.1, 9.2. n. of a clan (rus). Btsan-lha.
རྒྱ-འབག	rgya 'bag mig gis phan tshun 'phrul shes pa ltar / zhes pa ni / gar mkhan gcig nyid kyis stag seng sogs sems can gyi mgo brnyan mang pos mig 'phrul sna tshogs ston pa shes pa ltar / zhes pa yin snyam mo. Dpe-chos 516. gnad kyi zab don mi go ba'i shes rab rgya 'bag gi dmyig dang 'dra. Zhi-byed Coll. II 424.6. hrig hrig pa rgya 'bag gi mig lta bus rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rtsal sbyong bar byed pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. II 102.1.

རྒྱལ-ལ	= rgyal po. "king." Kuijp (1986) 37.
རྒྱལ-མོ	As part of an eye, see Dag-yig 587.
རྒྱལ-མཚན	Banner of victory, illus. in Yisun. Metal versions used as roof ornaments, also illus. in Yisun. Germano, Poetic Thought 958. Ordinary houses do not have them as roof ornaments, unless they contain a chapel with the Kanjur volumes. Palden Gyatso, Autobio. 9.
རྒྱལ-ནག	a clan (rus). Btsan-lha.
རྒྱལ-སྐར	Fenster (of a palace?). Kretsch.
རྒྱལ-སློད	rgyal po'i rgyu nor ram nom pa. Btsan-lha.

རྒྱལ-མཚན-གྱི-རྩེ-མོ	Generally it is said that the wishgranting jewel must be elevated to the top of a victory banner before it will grant wishes. Zhi-byed Coll. I 418.3, 437.2.

རྒྱམ-ཚྭ-བཞི	a medicinal preparation. BP 133.2 TM IV 61.

རྒྱན	Ornament (of Realm of Dharmas). Consider also the translation 'gloss.' Skt. alaMkAra; ornament, decoration. Also used as verb: brgyan pa, ornamented.
རྒྱན-བརྒྱད	rin po che'i rgyan brgyad ni / dbu rgyan / snyan rgyan / mgul rgyan / phyag gdub / zhabs gdub / ske rags / do shal / se mo do rnams so. 600 107-108.
རྒྱན-བཞི	robe decorated with 4-clawed dragon design. Also called mang nug and mang lhug. The 4 ornaments are 1. water. 2. rocks. 3. dragons and 4. clouds. Worn by ya sor spyi khyab & others on important occasions. Velm I 134-5. tshul khrims kyi rgyan / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan / shes rab kyi rgyan / gzungs kyi rgyan no. 600 44-45.
རྒྱན-དྲུག	61 51v. Name for the monastic vest, also called stod 'gags. In Tibet it mostly wool, with brocade trim. Refugee monks in India make it with cotton or silk, since it is too hot for wool.
རྒྱན-གཞི	Namdak.
རྒྱན-མདོས	Norbu, Drung 83.
རྒྱན-གྱི-ངང	state of being an ornament; state of being an ornament. Norbu, Cycle.
རྒྱན-གྱི-འཁོར-ལོའི-མཛད-པ-སུམ-ཅུ-རྩ-དྲུག	Listed in 445 III 11.7 ff., 13.4, 20.1.
རྒྱན-བཟང-མ	N. for the 2 maids of honor & the main maid-servants from household of the ya sor spyi khyab. Velm I 135.
རྒྱན-ཤར-བ	display. Karmay, Treasury.
རྒྱང-བཀྲག	a great brightness, lit.: bright at a distance. MTTP.
རྒྱང-བུ	Norbu, Drung 79. A ritual object. See Tucci, Religions 185. Beyer 322, 327. Blondeau in Karmay, New Horizons 254, translates it as 'tree symbols.'
རྒྱང-མིག	See Yisun. rgyang myig mdun du ltos. Look forward [with] the long view. Zhi-byed Coll. II 441.3.
རྒྱང-ངེ	See under shes pa rgyang nge cog ge ba. lag pa rgyan nge byas nas. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) X 121.3.

རྒྱས-བཏབ	(or rgyas 'debs pa) to seal (a matter with prayers). Sources. Btsan-lha. In 8,000 PrajñApAramitA, the sacred volume was 'sealed with seven layers of seals' (rgya rim pa bdun gyis btab bo).
རྒྱས-པ	in sexological contexts, it means either arousal or afterglow.

རྒྱུ-འབྲས	cause/result, causation.

རྒྱུ-ཅན	Literally, means 'that which has cause,' but in effect means 'result.'

རྒྱུག-སྡོམ	a measuring stick used for measuring fabrics, with a length equal to a span (about 1.75 meters). Twelve of these make a roll. Tsarong in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 27.

རི-ཟུག	Acc. to Tsuguhito Takeuchi, this is the name for the hill stations used by watchmen during the period of the O.T. empire. The 4-watchmen (so pa) units were called tshugs, headed by a tshugs dpon.

རི-ལྟར-ཐོགས-ན	ji ltar thogs na'am ji tsam ring na. Btsan-lha.
རི-པའི-ཕ-རྒན	the leader of a hunting party, he gets the biggest share of the kill. Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 42.
རི-མོར-བྱ-བ	bkur sti rim gro bya ba. Btsan-lha.
རི-ཐང-མཚམས	lit., 'edge of mountain and plain,' colloquially, 'neither here nor there.' When used to describe a fever disorder, it means neither high nor low. SRZT 44.
རི-རྒྱ-ལྷུངས-རྒྱ-སྡོམ-པ	to prohibit hunting & fishing, "to seal up the hills & streams."
རི-ཤོ-མ	Samdo A III 233v.1-2.
རི-ཤ-ཝ	See zangs rtsi.
རི-ཟུག-པ	ri sdod so pa'am bya ra ba. Btsan-lha.
རི-ཁ-དྷ	(sp?) shing ri kha dha. KP3 335.4.

རིའི-གཏོས-ཙམ	ri'i tshad tsam mam ri'i khyon tsam. Btsan-lha.
རིའི-རྩེ-མོ	See shu dag.
རིའུ-ལྕག	shog rgyu'i me tog. Btsan-lha.
རིའུ-རྒྱགས	367 I 233.
རིའུ-ཚེ	young goat. Skorupski TA.
རིབ-མ	shing sogs gyang gi tshul du bskor ba'i ra ba. Btsan-lha.
རིད-པ	Also, sbreg pa. O.T. = dngos ngan pa. = sha chung ba. = skem pa. Blan 285.2, 516.4. skam po. Gces 587.4. Btsan-lha.
རིག-བྱེད	yi ge cig gis rig byed kun la 'jug // rig byed kun gyis yi ge cig ma shes. Zhi-byed Coll. I 278.6. rig byed & rig byed ma yin pa appear to be special prAtimokSa terms discussed in Sobisch, Dissert. chap. 3 (it's a truncated form of the more exact rnam par rig byed, q.v.).
རིག-གེ	prob. equiv. to hrig ge. Samdo A V 119r.1.
རིག-གནས	See under rig pa'i gnas.
རིག-གཏད	A level of initiation associated with Kriya tantras.
རིག-པ	vidyA; Awareness. The opposite of the most basic of the basic poisons, ma rig pa. Capitalized when it is used as an equivalent of Bodhicitta. Sometimes it means 'science' or awareness in an ordinary sense in which case it is not capitalized. When in the plural, it is naturally the ordinary sense that is intended. Skt. vidyA, knowledge, science, learning [Buddhist works generally give the word higher values]. Germano, Poetic Thought 828.
རིག-སྔགས	spyir lha'i 'phrin las dang thugs rdo rje shes rab kyi cha gtso bor sgrub pa'i sngags la go dgos kyang / skabs 'dir gdams pa zab mo'am gsang ba'i man ngag sogs la go dgos. Gser Sbram 358.
རིག-སྟོང	See lta ba bzhi. See 27 58.
རིག-བྱེད-བཞི	nges brjod / mchod sbyin / snyan tshig / srid srung ngo. 600 36-37.

རིག-རིག-པོ	'grig po. Gces 483.1. Btsan-lha. Samdo A IV 13r.4, 24v.6.
རིག-གནས-ཆུང-བ-ལྔ	snyan ngag / mngon brjod / sdeb sbyor / skar rtsis / zlos gar rnams so. 600 64.
རིག-གྲོལ-གྱི-ཡོན-ཏན-བརྒྱད	ji lta ba rig pa'i yon tan / ji snyed pa rig pa'i yon tan / nang rig pa'i yon tan / rig pa'i yon tan / chags sgrib las grol ba'i yon tan / thogs sgrib las grol ba'i yon tan / dman sgrib las grol ba'i yon tan / grol ba'i yon tan no. 600 117. Pabongka, Liberation II 185.

རིགས	See Sa Pan in 145 V 375c.6 ff. He refers to work by Grags-pa-rgyal-mtshan (1147-1216). Here the translation 'archetype' works well for rigs bdag. Rigs lnga and rigs brgya in Sdom-gsum comm. by Ngag-dbang-chos-grags 337 ff, 332.6, 405 ff. Namdak.
རིགས-འགྲེ	= rigs 'grel, 'dra ba'i 'gres rkang. parallel or identical enumerations. Karmay, Treasury.
རིགས-བདུན	so thar gyi rigs bdun ni / dge bsnyen pha ma'i sdom pa gnyis / dge tshul pha ma'i sdom pa gnyis / dge slob ma'i sdom pa / dge slong pha ma'i sdom pa gnyis te bdun no. 600 93.
རིགས-བརྒྱད	so thar rigs brgyad ni / bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa / dge bsnyen pha ma gnyis kyi sdom pa / dge tshul pha ma gnyis kyi sdom pa / dge slong pha ma gnyis kyi sdom pa / dge slob ma'i sdom pa rnams so. 600 111.
རིགས-བཞི	'phags pa'i rigs bzhi ni / chos gos ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa / bsod snyoms ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa / gnas mal ngan ngon tsam gyis chog shes pa / spong ba dang skom pa la dga' ba'o. 600 40-41. spyir rigs bzhi zhes pa sngar rgya gar gyi mi'i rigs rim pa bzhi ru phye ba der go zhing / bod la'ang rigs bzhi phye tshul yod par snang ste. རིལ	O.T. = thams cad. Blan 295.3. Btsan-lha.
རིལ-འཛིན	short for ril bur 'dzin pa. grasping the whole (picture). Applied in visualization contexts in opposition to the subsequent dissolving phase (rjes gshig), it means rather a form of dissolution in which the whole visualized object is dissolved toward a central point. Skt. piNDagraha.
རིལ-རིལ	grags pa ril ril. plump. Soundings 21.
རིལ-འཛིན-བརྟགས-པ	materialistic construction; materialistic construction. Skt. piNDagrahakalpana. ril 'dzin lta ba, materialistic philosophy. Thurman. Functionalism, perhaps?
རིལ-བ-སྤྱི-བླུགས	word for a round-bellied water-pitcher used in ritual, but (the author) thinks that it is a name for a vessel for containing dam rdzas. BBNP 466. Illus. in Yisun. kha bshal byed kyi chu blugs pa'i bum pa. pan grub rnams kyi rdzas sogs 'jog snod kha sbyar za ma tog. Btsan-lha.

རིང-བསྲེལ	Thondup, BM 73, 82, 136. In a forthcoming article, Mike Walter argues that the ring comes from an O.T. concept of the 'enduring presence' of the Emperor. SS 401.5.

རིང-མཁན	See forthcoming article by Mike Walter.
རིང-བསྲེལ-གསུམ	chos sku'i ring bsrel / sku bal gyi ring bsrel / sku gdung gi ring bsrel lo // dang po ni gzungs kyi rigs so // gnyis pa ni dbu skra dang phyag sen sogs so // gsum pa ni sku gdung gi ring bsrel dngos so. 600 26-27.
རིངས	Not only "to extend, stretch, pervade, join hands," but also "to go fast, hurried." See forthcoming article by Mike Walter for discussion of the O.T. meaning. It may even refer to the 'corpse' of the Emperor, evidently in an embalmed state. Haarh, Yar-lun 360.

རྗེས-གཤིག	subsequent dissolution (phase of visualization); it seems to mean dissolving one part of the visualized thing at a time, probably starting from below (like the hUm). See under ril 'dzin.

རྗེས-དྲན-བཅུ	sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa / chos / dge 'dun / tshul khrims / gtong ba / lha / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba / skyo ba / 'chi ba / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa'o. 600 147.
རྗེས-དྲན-དྲུག	rjes su dran pa drug ni / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa / chos rjes su dran pa / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa / gtong ba rjes su dran pa / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa / lha rjes su dran pa'o. 600 80-81.
རྗེས-དྲན-ལྔ	As taught in Bka'-gdams Thig-le Bcu-drug: 1. bla ma rjes su dran pa'i bla ma'i rnal 'byor. 2. lus lha'i rang bzhin du sgom pa. 3. ngag la sngags kyi bzlas brjod dang ma bral ba. 4. sems kyi gnas lugs stong pa nyid du sgom pa dang / byams snying rje sgom pa. 5. dge rtsa rdzogs byang du bsngo ba. Dung-dkar 166.

རྐྱང-བཅད	Btsan-lha.
རྐྱང-ཁུག	Yisun has the rather glib definition: ya dang cha. This seems to refer to the impossibility of these two letters to receive any prefixed letters in the writing system. In the Rgya Bod Yig-tshang (PRC ed.) 6, it seems to be part of a name of a historical source: rgyal rabs rkyang khug blon po'i zhal gdams dang // rba bzhed yar lungs jo bo 'tshal pa dang. Dagyab reads: rkyang pa dang khug pa. BA 179 has it in the name of a teaching: Pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam rkyang khug, interpreted to mean the 'straight' and 'circuit' paths of the PAramitAs.
རྐྱང-མ	lalanA; solitary channel. Germano in JIABS 17 no. 2 (1994) 318. Achard, L'Essence 130, 134. Skt. lalanA (Hindu iDA). The left side vein.
རྐྱང-ནུལ	Btsan-lha. See skyang nul, etc.
རྐྱང-ཕུལ	This term describes a Tibetan-language syllable which has a 'simple' root letter (without super- or sub-script consonants) in combination with prefix- and suffix-letters.
རྐྱང-ཤིང	stretcher; (canvas?) stretcher. Jackson
རྐྱང-ཚབ	Also called grus log, name for a 'bri that calves every year (most calve every 2 years). Topgyal in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998)

རླུགས-པ	O.T. = lug ba. = zas ma zhu ba phyir byung ba. Blan 290.5. zas ma zhu bar gyen du skyugs pa. zas ma zhu bar 'og tu 'khru ba. Btsan-lha.
རླུན-ཆུང	See byi ba.
རླུང	as a classification of diseases. Lag-len 253.1. Fundamentals 16.1 (item 16). 'Air' is one of the three primary humours which lie at the basis of the traditional pathology. It applies on the one hand to persons who show a preponderance of the 'air' humor. On the other, it is the principle of motility (g.yo ba) and thus applies to 'pressure' in every sense of the English word. 'Air' diseases are especially common in intellectuals. Kong-sprul/1 6: General conditions for the arising of 'air' disorders — an overactive mind; impurities in the blood' diarrhea & vomitting; too much serious thought; eating unnutritious (bcud med) food; thirst and coldness. Air diseases often lead or come at the end of other diseases, so close observation is necessary. General symptoms — Much yawning; broken sleep; dizziness; ringing in the ear; pains in the heart, upper body, waist and hip joint which trade place in an uncertain manner; chills & shivers migrate from one place to another; problems with the joints; flighty thoughts, soft coughing at night and when you get up in the morning. Although the pulse may be slow or fast, it is difficult to press down, like a coracel on top of the water. Sometimes the pulse settles down a little. The urine is thin and bluish, with lots of bubbles. The smell, taste and vapour are very little. If a fever is beginning, it has an orange color, but if it is clear and free of sediment, it is a rlung disorder. The tongue is red and dry with little bumps protruding slightly on the sides.
རླུང-བཤགས	'windbreakers' (an architectural feature). See Precious Deposits III 256.
རླུང-བུ	See lung bu. Text 57.
རླུང-དགའ	See rnga mong.
རླུང-དམར	storm, gale. Karmay, Treasury.
རླུང-གཤོག	(poet.) wings swift as wind. MTTP.
རླུང-ལང	addiction. MTTP.
རླུང-ལྷ	rlung rta'i lha lnga. Nomads 251, 292.
རླུང-ལྔ	Text 56.
རླུང-མཁྲིས	SRZT 15.
རླུང-ནད	SRZT 6.
རླུང-པོ	(Dbus) = slung chen. the wind, or, a great wind. MTTP.
རླུང-རྟ	See Uray, Earliest Evidence 358, note 56, which argues that this is a Chinese concept, translating Ch. i-ma. See Epstein, Dissertation 93. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 11. The order of colors from left to right are Blue, White, Red, Green, & Yellow. Karmay in JA (1995) 172, etc. Beyer, CT Lang. 145. The term used in its yogic sense (mind riding on the 'wind horse') in Zhi-byed Coll. II 12.2. Discussed in Karmay, Arrow 254 ff. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 141.

རླུང-སེམས-གནས-ལོག-པ	A fault in meditation involving the inverting of the locations of pranic winds and mind. Explained in Zhi-byed Coll. II 327.2 ff. (and preceding pages).
རྨ	yul ming. Dpe-chos 517. dri ba dang rtsad gcod pa. bshad pa. nyams pa'am skyon. rus ming zhig. Btsan-lha. On wounds resulting from weapons (mtshon rma), see SRZT 126.

རྨ-བ	dri ba. Btsan-lha.
རྨ-བྱ	Beyer, CT Lang. 145, takes it to be part borrowing from Skt. = mdong mtha' can (having a face-tail), gtsug phud can, lag 'gro za, dug zan. JD 223. SS 499.3. LW 464. Clifford, list. For its typical ability to eat poison & thereby make its feathers more colorful, see 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 269.1.
རྨ-གསུམ	Some vinaya writers prefer to speak of the 'three wounds, rather than the 'three paths,' lam gsum, q.v.

II 170.4. mdzo' phung du 'jug pa rnal cu yin / 'di ma bcag na skyid myed. Ibid. II 226.5. mdzo phung du 'jug pa'i mkhan po snal cu yin gsung ngo. Zhi-byed Coll. རྣམ-དབྱེ-བདུན	ngo bo brjod pa / las su bya ba / byed pa po / dgos ched / 'byung khungs / 'brel ba / gnas gzhi rnams so. 600 89.
རྣམ-དབྱེ-བརྒྱད	sgra'i rnam dbye brgyad ni / snga ma bdun gyi steng du bod pa bsnan pa'o. 600 105.
རྣམ-གཞག-མ-འཆགས-པ	has not developed a proper understanding. Jinpa.
རྣམ-ཐར-བརྒྱད	gzugs can gzugs la lta ba'i rnam thar / gzugs med gzugs la lta ba'i rnam thar / sdug pa'i rnam thar / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam thar / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam thar / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam thar / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam thar / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam thar ro. 600 117-118.

II 472.7 (note that here it seems to mean 'bear,' not 'camel'). Ibid. II 160.6, 158.2, 163.1. = rlung dga', 'khor lo'i mgrin can. JD 244. SS 546.1.

རྔ-ཡབ	animal-tail duster. yak-tail fan. metaphorical usage, see Zhi-byed Coll. I 418.6.
རྔ-ཟོམ	(Amdo) the "barrel" of a drum (on open end of which a hide is stretched), constructed of staves (zom shing) of seng ldeng wood (see illus.). MTTP.

རོམ-པོ	ser ba. Btsan-lha.
རོང-བུ	Also, rong ngu, bu ron. A type of horse. TS7 II 614.
རྟ	horse; See dor rta. 'horse.' Specialized medical meaning, see sman rta. 'Horse,' the substance on which the medicine figuratively 'rides' into the body. Generally it means sugar, molasses, honey, and possibly beer. SS 546.5. = bang ldan, rtag za, rnga rngog 'dren byed, chu 'thung, gshogs pa can. JD 244. SS 501.6.
རྟ-འབོག	rta la 'gel bya'i khug ma. Nomads 238.
རྟ-བབས	Germano, Poetic Thought 919, 'portico.' pho brang sogs kyi sgo chen gyi phyi rol tu yod pa'i khang rtseg dbyibs can gyi phyi sgo. bang rim. Btsan-lha.
རྟ-བླ	JD 255. Dag-yig.
རྟ-བོག	rta dang me mda'. Nomads 237.
རྟ-བྲེས	rta 'dogs sa'i ra. Btsan-lha.

རྟ-ཀླད	'horse brain, agate.' Supposed to be a 'loan translation' from Chinese. Beyer, CT Lang. 142. See also rdo klad.
རྟ-ལྕག	horsewhip; horsewhip used for legal punishments. French, Yoke 322.
རྟ-ལྤགས	= me tog phreng ba, pa ri pa (sp?), ha'u pa. JD 205. SS 455.4. KP1 67.4. KP3 270.6. KP4 411.5. Mdo 143.

རྟ-མགྲིན	a disease? Text 21.
རྟ-མིག	= gza' dug khra ba, ti mu sa pa. JD 195. SS 480.6.
རྟ-མཐུར	'horse's halter.' n. of a vein. TM #4, 61. DD illus. 24.
རྟ-ངན	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 299.
རྟ-ནོར	rta drel dang g.yag. Nomads 237.
རྟ-རྒ	KP4 574.5.
རྟ-རྐྱ	skya mi. Btsan-lha.
རྟ-རྨིག	'Horse print,' a part of the design on the entryway to the mandala. See Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 62. David-Neel, My Journey to Lhasa 267. See rta rmig ma.
རྟ-རྔ	Horsetail hair. Samdo A IV 167v.5. In phrases like rta rnga tsam, it means 'even the least bit' (a horse's tailhair being something quite trifling) [thanks to Christoph Cüppers, for correcting my earlier mistranslation]. This is quite common in 12th century Bka'-brgyud-pa works. khab rmig tu rta rnga btsud la sgom. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 269.5. 'khor ba las rta rnga'i 'dres cig 'phag ma nus. Zhi-byed Coll. V 23.3. rta rnga chur bcug pa la srog chags su gyur pa bzhin. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 547.2.
རྟ-སྦངས	horse manure. TM IV 64.
རྟ-ཤ	Original entry: (dpyi yi) rta sha. DD illus. 30.
རྟ-སྐོམ	See ma nu.
རྟ-སྐྱིན	A mammal. The name suggests that it is a horse-like skyin (q.v.). See Sandberg, Tibet 297, where it said to be Budorcas taxicolor (i.e., the takin).
རྟ-སོ	'horse tooth.' Could perhaps be translated zigzag (crenelation, in the case of walls)? As an architectural term (see illus. in Pho-brang Po-ta-la [1988], illus. no. 15 following p. 29). Po-ta-la (1996) 17. See also Yisun. As decorative motif, TS7 II 1087. As a special kind of stitching pattern used for sewing together monastic robes (distinguished by its squared zig-zag pattern from the 'birdfoot stitch' which has a triangular zigzag; Kieschnick's article on Chinese robes).
རྟ-ཐབས	dgra 'dul thabs. Btsan-lha.
རྟ-ཟམ	79 n. 111. This would seem to literally mean 'horse bridge,' but it actually means a halting spot where one could get fresh horses. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 37.
རྟ-མོན-པ	KP3 334.4. KP4 549.1.
རྟ-ཟི-རིལ-བུ	a medicinal preparation. BP 339.4.
རྟ-ཟི-དམར-པོ	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 21. Lag-len 18.1. TMC 30 (61). BP 173.1.
རྟ-འཁྲིད-པ	ceremonial horse grooms. Velm I 135.
རྟ-རུག-པ	See bong rna ba.
རྟ-རྨིག-མ	'horse-hoof ingot.' Pabongka, Liberation II 109. An example is illus. in Precious Deposits V 104-5.
རྟ-སུག-སྐམ-པོ	Samdo A V 3r.4.
རྟ-སྣད-རོ	rta rmas ma. Btsan-lha.
རྟ-ལྗང-ཅན	1. brgya byin. 2. nyi ma. Blan 528.
རྟ-ལས-གཞོལ-བ	rta las babs pa. Btsan-lha.
རྟའི-དྲི-མ	See a shwa gandha.
རྟའུ	See rkang 'gro.
རྟབ-རྟབ	[= bstab stob] schnell, plötzlich, unversehens. Kaschewsky 83.
རྟབ-རྟོབ	367 I 242.6.
རྟབ-ཤོར-བ	tsab langs pa. Dpe-chos 505. Btsan-lha.
རྟབ-རྟབ-པོ	bred pa. rings pa. Btsan-lha.
རྟབ-བེ-རྟོབ-བེ	= rtab rtob. hastily. Soundings 33.
རྟབས-པ	ma rtabs pa, O.T. = mi rings pa. Blan 303.5-.6. brel ba'am 'tshab pa. byed pa. rings pa. Btsan-lha.
རྟག-བཟླས	khas rtag bzlas kyang ni khas shom ra 'then kyang zhes pa'am kha nas rtag tu bzlas brjod byas kyang zhes pa yin snyam mo. Dpe-chos 509.
རྟག-ཁོངས	ltag kong. Btsan-lha.
རྟག-རྔུ	rtag tu rngu. N. of a plant. TR XIV no. 4, p. 16.
རྟག-ཟ	See rta.
རྟག-ཆད-མུ-བཞི	See 9 60.
རྟག-ཏུ-ངུ	'forever weeping.' Varieties: spyan ras gzigs rtag tu ngu, phyag rdor rtag tu ngu, 'jam dbyangs rtag tu ngu (= 'jam dbyangs zil can). JD 191.
རྟག-རེས-འཁོར	rtag tu sbyor ba'i zas. Btsan-lha.
རྟག-པ-བཞི	242 III 209.2.
རྟག-རྩེན-པ	rgyun chad med par rtag tu rtse ba'i sgo nas gnas pa. Btsan-lha.
རྟག-རྔུའི-སྦྱོར-བ	a medicinal preparation. BP 289.4.
རྟགས	As the 3rd term of a syllogism, 'the reason.' Dreyfus, Sound 206-207.
རྟགས-འགྲུབ	the reasoning is established. The negative, rtags ma 'grub, is much used.
རྟས-པ	O.T. for rgyas pa, as in the increase or generating of bodily elements. BBNP 472. brtson 'grus rtas drag pa ni brtson 'grus dos drag pa ste shugs drag po zhes pa'i don no. Dpe-chos 517. rgyas pa. Sometimes: lus zungs skyed pa'am nad pa gso ba. Btsan-lha. rtog pa mthu' rtas pa'i snang ba yin. Zhi-byed Coll. II 199.4.
རྟེ-མིག	Original entry: (glo bu) rte mig. DD illus. 2, 19.
རྟེའུ	colt. rta'i phru gu. Dpe-chos 516. Have seen this spelled rti'u.
རྟེའུ-མིག	shing gi phor pa'i nang du shing gi rte'u mig gis / yun ring du dkrugs pas dngul chu dngos med du sngon por 'gro. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 347.4.
རྟེན	'reminder' (Dagyab), support, prop, dependency, object of veneration. Skt. Azraya, nizraya, etc.
རྟེན-འབྲེལ	= rten cing 'brel ba[r 'byung ba]. "Emerging through containment-connection." Usually tr. as interdependent origination, etc. "Arising through a situation of connectedness and dependence." Each 'thing' so produced is connected with the 'others' to the point of containing them. Therefore, concepts of linear causation do not apply. Each is a necessary (but atemporal) result (pratItya) of all the others as a totality... not one following from the other. The totality is, though, void. 'Supporting links' in Germano in JIABS 17 no. 2 (1994) 259. Gyatso, Apparitions 179. Colloquial usages approach the meaning of 'coincidence,' 'circumstances,' also, 'omen,' a 'connection' with a particular teaching or teacher. It may also be used in the sense of 'provisions' (see under gal te).
རྟེན-འགྲོ	rol mo mkhan gyi bye brag cig. Btsan-lha.
རྟེན-འཕྱེ	rkang lag bzhir brten nas 'gro ba. going on all fours. Btsan-lha.
རྟེན-མཁར	kind of shrine. Huber, Pure Crystal 119.
རྟེན-སྒམ	See Bellezza, Divine Dyads 389.
རྟེན-སྐོར	See under 'bum 'khor.
རྟེན-སོ	rten gzhi. Btsan-lha.
རྟེན-ཐེབས	rten gzhi, ma rtsa (investment capital, colateral).
རྟེན-ཐབས-བུ-བཙུགས-པ	lha rten du btsug pa. Btsan-lha.
རྟེན-བྱེད-པ	'symbolize' Dhongthog.
རྟེན-འབྲེལ-གསུམ	gang zag cig grub pa thob par byed pa khyad par gyi rten 'brel gsum tshang dgos / tshogs sog pa'i rten du bla ma la / dngos grub kyi rten du yi dam / bar chod sel ba'i mkha' 'gro ma gsum sbrel dud gos bya ba bla ma sku drin can gsung ngo. Zhi-byed Coll. V 316.6.
རྟེན-འབྲེལ-གྱི-ཆེ-བ	a phrase used in Zhi-byed Coll. frequently to mean "the greatness of Phadampa's insight into interdependent connectedness" {meaning that he had mastered skilful means}.
རྟེན-འབྲེལ-གྱི-ཡན-ལག-བཞི	'phen pa'i yan lag / 'phangs pa'i yan lag / mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag / mngon par grub pa'i yan lag go // dang po ni / ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang rnam shes so // gnyis pa ni / ming gzugs skye mched drug reg pa tshor ba dang bzhi'o // gsum pa ni sred len srid pa gsum mo // bzhi pa ni / skye ba dang rga shi'o. 600 39.
རྟེན-འབྲེལ-གྱི-ཁང-པ	As a symbol that, if you don't block the doors of the senses, you might go to the roots of Awareness — Many times his eyes would travel to the threshold of the Interdendence House. Zhi-byed Coll. 143.4. A kind of explanation at BA 935 (also, 961).
རྟེན-འབྲེལ-ཡན-ལག-བཅུ-གཉིས	ma rig pa / 'du byed / rnam shes / ming gzugs / skye mched / reg pa / tshor ba / sred pa / len pa / srid pa / skye ba / rga shi rnams so. 600 153-4.
རྟི-པ	= sor mo(?). "toe, finger." Kuijp (1986) 37.
རྟིག-གཏད	blo gtad pa. Btsan-lha.
རྟིང	Stein.
རྟིང-གནོན	rgyab skyor. Btsan-lha.
རྟིང-མ	rjes ma'am phyi ma. Btsan-lha. Stein.
རྟིང-སོར	in Zukunft. Kretsch.
རྟིང-པའི-ཆུ-བ	= Rting chu. DD illus. 1, 6, 30.
རྟོབ-ཤ	thob bya'am sbyin bya. Btsan-lha.
རྟོད-པ	rtsod pa. Btsan-lha. to place a domestic animal out to pasture tied to a tether rope (rtod thag). Haarh, Yar-lun 215, line 6. Karmay, Arrow 263.
རྟོད-ཕུར	tether post. 367 I 232. gzung 'dzin gyi rtod phur nang nas bton pa. Zhi-byed Coll. II 233.3. 'dzin pa'i rtod phur theng pa ('to yank at the tether post that binds one'). Gling-ras-pa, Bka'-'bum I 115.6. In Zhi-byed Coll., sometimes misspelled as stong phur and bstod phur.
རྟོད-པས-བཅིངས	phur par btags pa. Btsan-lha.

རྟོག-ཁང	ra yod pa'i khang pa bye brag pa zhig. Btsan-lha.
རྟོག-པ	as type of tantric text, see 166 492. See general discussion of several meanings of rtog pa and kal pa in Almogi, MA thesis 212.

རྟོག-དཔྱོད-བྲལ-བ	without deliberation or research.
རྟོག-ཆེན-པ	spy. Karmay, Great Perfection 28. so pa'am bya ra ba. Btsan-lha.
རྟོག-པའི-ཞེན-གཞི	basis of conceptual adherence; basis of conceptual adherence. Thurman.
རྟོག-པ-བཅུ	See rnam g.yeng gi rtog pa bcu.
རྟོག-པ-མེད	undistracted, without psychic whirligigs (that disturb the meditative flow). Skt. akalpa [= avikalpa]. Klong-chen-pa 2.8.
རྟོག-པ-རང-གསལ-དུ-གཟུང-བའི-གསང-བཅུད-གཉིས	listed in Klong-chen-pa 12.8 comm.
རྟོགས-ལྡན	1. mkhas pa. 2. sangs rgyas. Blan 528. Stein. Has a special meaning, particularly in the 'Brug-pa Bka'-brgyud-pa, of a renunciate (whether or not they have full monastic vows) yogi / contemplative.
རྟོགས-པ	realization; realization. Although early Zhi-byed-pa and Bka'-brgyud-pa take care to distinguish this from 'understanding' (go ba), Sa-pan, in his Sdom Gsum Rab-dbye, disagreed with this distinction as being simply 'Tibetan.' For one discussion of the difference, see Zhi-byed Coll. II 329.6 ff. (and following are definitional distinctions between nyams myongs and rtogs pa).
རྟོགས-ཤིག	soms shig. Btsan-lha.
རྟོགས-ལྡན-མཁས-པ	In Dge-lugs-pa usage, means a learned and reflective person.
རྟོལ	N. of an ox-like animal. TMP 213 no. 81: "Ox or hybrid bull/dzomo (skom po zhes rtol; Bos taurus q)." See skom.
རྟོལ-བ	= phyin pa. BBNP 481. slebs pa'am 'byor ba. rnag sogs brdol ba. phyin pa. Btsan-lha.
