རྟོལ-མེད	= nges pa med, = thabs med pa. BBNP 473. Btsan-lha.
རྟོལ-ཤེས	rang bzhin gyis shes pa. Btsan-lha.
རྟོན-པ	O.T. = 'dod pa. = rjes su 'brang ba. Blan 290.3-.4 q.v. = 'dod pa, = rjes su 'brang ba, = yid brtan rung ba. BBNP 472. yid ches pa. 'dod pa. rjes su 'brangs pa. Btsan-lha. Imperative of rten pa. Laufer, Bird Div. 48.
རྟོན-པ-བཞི	chos la rton pa / don la rton pa / nges don la rton pa / ye shes la rton pa'o. 600 31. See also mi rton pa bzhi.
རྩ	sometimes occurs alone, as an abbreviated form of "nyi shu rtsa." Generally in medicine it refers to blood vessels. White ones (rtsa dkar) are, however, what we know as nerves. This differs from yogic physiology.
རྩ-འདབ	Germano, Poetic Thought 850.
རྩ-འདྲུལ	Text 59.
རྩ-འཛིན	Vitali, Tho-ling 5.
རྩ-འགགས	disappearance. Karmay, Treasury.
རྩ-འཇིང	gnyen nam rtsa lag. Btsan-lha.
རྩ-བ	basic (text, on which commentary is based), fundamental (teacher, in a lineage; personal teacher identified with the same).
རྩ-བདུན	or, ngo mtshar rtsa bdun. The seven nerves for pulse taking (or seven amazing things one may discover by taking pulse!). TM-BH 23.
རྩ-བུ	glang po che 'dul ba na rna la gser gyi rtsa bu rgyab nas 'dul bas. Zhi-byed Coll. I 426.6. gser gyi rtsa bu mkha' la phyar ba 'di la glang po snyon ba 'bros. Zhi-byed Coll. I 220.5.

རྩ-གསུམ	rgsa gsum zhes pa ni dbang gi rtsa ba bla ma / byin rlabs kyi rtsa ba yi dam / dngos grub kyi rtsa ba mkha' 'gro'o. Nomads 282.
རྩ-ཁབ	gtar kha byed pa'i khab. Btsan-lha.
རྩ-ལག	O.T. = gnyen. Blan 285.2. Skt. bandhu, 'kindred.'
རྩ-མདུད	place where 2 or 3 blood channels branch off. DD.

རྩ-ལག-ཏུ-གྱུར-པའི-བུད-མེད	a woman who has become a friend, or a kindred (with whom, therefore, one should not have sexual relations according to KAma SUtra, although GuhyasamAja of course recommends it).
རྩ-དཀར-ནད	sman dper <<rna rgyab 'jing ba skrangs shing zhe rengs dang, lag pa'i mtheb srin sbrid cing glo chung lu, kha sna g.yo zhing lus 'gul bskyod mi thub, dri chu rlugs sam sdom dang dran nyams lkugs, de sogs ngo mtshar nad rtags du ma ston>> zhes bshad pa ltar gyi nad rigs shig gi ming. Dag-yig. Text 44, 45, 57, 79, 84.
རྩ-དཀར-བསམ-འཕེལ-བརྒྱད-པ	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 110. Lag-len 80.1.
རྩ-ལྷོངས-བྱེད-པ	to transfer a tax estate, to settle it upon someone else. Sources.
རྩ-གུར-གུམ	See under gur gum.
རྩབ	btung ba'i bye brag cig. ru ma. A drink especially for monks. Compare rtsang nan. A list of synonyms is given: sla mo, lcum sdong rtsa ba, zan chang, sbang ma, dar ba, rlung tog. Btsan-lha. See Dagyab.
རྩབ-ཧྲལ	'dod chags kyis kun nas bslangs pa'i spyod pa rtsing po. btung ba mi zhim pa. Btsan-lha.
རྩབ-མོ	See ra skyur. See shing mngar.
རྩབ-རྩུབ	'phral gyi rtsab rtsub de 'dra bas phan pa men zer bas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 298.7. See tsab be tsub be in Yisun. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 423.5.
རྩབ-ཤིང	KP3 373.5n. See shing mngar. See lcum rtsa.
རྩབ-རུ-ཚ	JD 65.
རྩབས	ru ma. Btsan-lha. SS 524.6.
རྩབས-མོ	'bras dang khre sogs btsos nas rtsi med par bsnyal ba'i khu ba skyur po zhig. Btsan-lha.
རྩབས-པ	gtubs pa. Btsan-lha.
རྩབས-རུ-ཚ	sman bye brag pa zhig. Btsan-lha.
རྩད	= sbrul dug, snyag, rgu thub dman pa. JD 144. SS 457.5. DG 267.1.
རྩད-གཅོད	investigation, search.
རྩད-ནས-འཛད	gtan nas zad pa'am rtsa ba nas zad pa. Btsan-lha.
རྩད-ནས-ཕྱུང-བ	rtsa ba nas bton pa. Btsan-lha.
རྩལ	special power (of abstract things), special skill (of people). In terms of Three Bodies, it is identified with the Complete Assets Body (SambhogakAya). See also rol pa. "potency." Norbu, Cycle. Energy manifested on the "subjects"'s side as distinguished from rol pa, which is energy manifested on the "object"'s side. Norbu, Dzog Chen and Zen 27. Germano, Poetic Thought 866, translates 'dynamism, dynamics, creative efflorescence.' rtogs pa la nyams kyi rtsal myi 'tshar myi srid gsung (he said, 'It hardly possible that the special powers of meditative experience would not abound during realizations.'). Zhi-byed Coll. II 330.4.
རྩལ-གསུམ	ZZ = srin lag. Bru II 291.3.
རྩལ-ཀ	gzhi'i rtsal ka phyogs myed du shar ba la dgongs pa phyogs myed du grol. Zhi-byed Coll. II 348.7. rtsal ka cir yang 'char bas chad pa'i mtha' dang bral zhes pa. Zhi-byed Coll. V 45.7.
རྩལ-ལྡན	geschicklich. Kaschewsky2.
རྩལ-སྦྱོང	training program (in analogy with physical education). Klong-chen-pa 11.2.
རྩལ-སྣ-དགུ	pho rtsal sna dgu ni / mtheb kyis sha non pa / rkyal gyis chu tshod pa / yang rtsal bya 'dra ba ste lus kyi rtsal gsum dang / lo rgyus kyis dge thon pa / gtam gyis bzhad gad thon pa / shags kyis pha rol gnon pa ste ngag gi rtsal gsum dang / mdzangs la blo 'gyu ba / dpa' la bsran tshugs pa / kha gsal la gting mi dpog pa ste yid kyi rtsal gsum rnams so. 600 120-121. yang rtsal, as in Goldstein, probably means acrobatics.
རྩལ-དུ-བཏོན-པ	nan tan sgos dmigs su bkar nas bton pa. Btsan-lha.
རྩལ-ལྡན-རྒྱལ-པོ	See dur byid.
རྩལ-པོ-ཆེ	See dung.

རྩེ-ཕྱག	short form of rtse phyag mdzod, the state treasury, subject of article in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998).

རྩེད-སྣ-དགུ	"The nine different men's sports." pho rtsed sna dgu ni / gtam yig rtsis gsum / mda' rdo mchong gsum / bang rkyal sbe gsum rnams so. 600 121. The last three are footracing, swimming and wrestling.

རུ	mig rur mi sdug pa ni mig sngar ram mig lam du mi mdzes pa'am mi sdug pa. 367 II 132.4. dmag. rwa co. a long ngam yu ba. Btsan-lha. As part of a saddle (the front and back 'horns'), see illus. in Po-ta-la (1996) 184.

རུ-དར	gna' dus su dmag gi ru so so'i dar cha yin pa sgrung dpe rnams las gsal yang / deng dus su ru dar zhes pa ni rus kha dog gang rung gru gsum pa zhig bzo srol yod pa las dgos don gsal por mi snang ngo. Nomads 291.
རུ-དྲ	log lta. Btsan-lha.
རུ-གསུམ	See under 'bras bu.
རུ-ཁག	(mod.) work unit, the low level of administration which controls housing, food rations, marriage permission, children, changes in employment. Barnett, Resistance.
རུ-ལོག	switched around. Klong-chen-pa 12.9. Seems to refer to taking delusions by the horns! 'khrul pa'i ru mi ldog pa'i phyir. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 233.7. rig pa snang phyir 'brangs pas 'khrul pa'i ru ga na ldogs. Zhi-byed Coll. V 491.3. bsod nams la bdud du ngos ma gzung na 'khrul pa'i ru mi zlog. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 39.1. 'khrul pa'i ru zlog par 'dod na bzung 'dzin la bzo thong. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 40.1.
རུ-མ	lees. Karmay, Treasury. gzung 'dzin ni las kyi ru ma. Zhi-byed Coll. V 215.1. 'di ni rten 'brel gyi ru ma ngos bzung ba bya ba yin te... rnam rtog sdug bsngal gyi ru ma ru 'dis 'gro ba yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 262.5 (also, lines 6-7). Yisun: 1) zho'i ru rtsi. 2) gro zhib kyi skyur rtsi. 3) chang phab.
རུ-མཚམས	military frontier. Karmay, Treasury.
རུ-མཚོན	war-banderoles, flags. Holler in TS9 II 216.
རུ-ང	= ru nga bo. = gang drag sha tsha che tog to. = shin tu che ba. meticulous, assiduous, lovingly careful. This word occurs in Mdzod-phug (Delhi 1966), p. 70, l. 10, where it seems to mean 'irritations' rather than 'fastidiousness.' ngar po'am zhib tshags pa. sdang ba. Btsan-lha.
རུ-པྱཾ	See dngul.
རུ-རཀཤ	= rag sha. rudrakSa. JD 103. SS 530.2. KP1 170.5. KP3 306.7. KP4 490.5. LW 452. Varieties: ru rag sha, tsher rag sha, kham rag sha. DG 212.2.
རུ-རྟ	= ma nu ru rta. JD 132. SS 437.5. = kuSTa, mdze can, so ba la kuSTa, bhU dha ro ga, ruNDa. DG 251.1. Clifford, list. Item suitable for tribute to Mongols; see Wylie (1977) 115, n. 37. Sde-srid/2 437.5 ff: This is not found in the 'khrungs dpe (but see KP). The base of the leafe is yellow-green. Flowers: white. Roots: both black and white, shaped like broken antlers of a stag. See sha pho ru rta. For sdum bu ru rta, see spang rtsi 'byar bag can.
རུ-རུ	Velm I 64. See gnyan.
རུ-ཤན	Achard, L'Essence 102, 148, 189 etc.

རུལ-སྒྲེག	TM IV 114.
རུམ	O.T. = lto ba. Blan 290.3. lto ba'am de'i phag na 'dug pa. Btsan-lha. See gsog rum. phyu-ba pouch/pocket? rgyu ngos zin pas yul gzhan 'gag pa rtsa me rum du bsad pa lta bu (like extinguishing a grass fire in your chuba pocket). Zhi-byed Coll. II 477.4.

རུམ-བུ-ཉབ	rtswa ram bu za ba. Btsan-lha.

རུན	myed pa'i gsog run byed. Zhi-byed Coll. II 297.3. See under sog run.
རུང-བ	rung ba and mi rung ba are used in ethical contexts, just as rigs and mi rigs are used in context of argument and reasoning.
རུང-ཆུ	rab byung gi zas la rung ba byed pa'i chu'am / dge 'dun gyi mang ja la ku shas chu 'thor ba lta bu. Btsan-lha.
རུང-ཁང	dge 'dun gyi spyi rdzas sam zas skom bzhag sa'i khang pa. Btsan-lha.
རུང-ཁུས-ཟ-བ	O.T. = gtum pa. Blan 286.4. Btsan-lha.
རུང-རུང-བྱེད	gang byung byung byed. Btsan-lha.
རུས	bone. For a defense of ritual use of human bone, see 145 V 364.
རུས-བུ	rus pa. rus rgyud. Btsan-lha.

རུས-ཆེན	human bone. Clifford, list.
རུས-གཉོས	lus kyis nad sman mi theg pa lta bu. Btsan-lha.
རུས-ཁ	bone color; bone color. Jackson.
རུས-ཀྲང	sha med rus rkyang. Btsan-lha.
རུས-པ	brus pa. Btsan-lha.

རུས-ཤིང	snying rus. snying stobs. Btsan-lha.

རྭ	a clan. Btsan-lha. See under rwa med. dper na gser la rwa yod pa de / ka 'ji'i rdo dang phrad tsam na / yib sa myed de rnong pa yin. Zhi-byed Coll. I 434.2. khab len gyis ni gser la rwa yod 'jig. རྭ-འདྲ	a stone. DG 128.4.
རྭ-བཅུ	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 297.
རྭ-བཏོད	Namdak.
རྭ-ཅན	ming dang ma bral ji srid du / lta ba rwa can du song ba yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 52.1.
རྭ-གོག	(Dbus) = rwa co. pinchers, horns, beak. MTTP.
རྭ-མེད	rwa myed gser la rtog (rdog?) dpes bzo' myi nus. Zhi-byed Coll. I 276.3 (compare I 434.2). ra myed gser la mkhan pos 'dod dgur bsgyur. Zhi-byed Coll. I 285.4.
རྭ-རྙི	A type of game-animal trap made using an ox horn (rwa). The parts, which include the kha zungs, go leb, go yu, rnyi mdel, rnyi thig, and rwa sga, are illustrated in Yisun.
རྭ-ས	bcad pa'am gzhogs pa. Btsan-lha.

ས-མདའ	earth arrow. According to information from T. Huber, this means a 'booby-trap bow' for killing game animals. Yisun agrees, adding that the bow & arrow are rigged up inside a pit in the ground.
ས-མགུལ	sa 'gul. Btsan-lha.

ས-ར	mansion, resthouse. Borrowing from Urdu. Francke, Antiquities II 146. Compare the Anglo-Indian (Persian-derived) word serai. Hobson-Jobson 811.

ས-ཏྲ	= sa dra. Some say it is a way of saying thab ka, 'oven,' but BA says it is equivalent to sde or tshogs. Many other meanings suggested; see BBNP 471. Skt. is sattra, or satra, evidently.
ས-ཚ	tsha tsha. Btsan-lha.
ས-ཚིག	corvée stations spaced 8-25 miles apart. Goldstein, Taxation 15. Generally 14 English miles apart. transport relay stations. Dargyay, TVC 60.
ས-ཚུབ	BBNP 479.

ས-ལམ-རྣམ-བཞག	Treatment on the Stages and Paths. Besides the usual meaning, it may be used to refer to the 'Buddhist Game of Rebirth,' which resembles the Indian snakes & ladders game.

སར	O.T. for C.T. tshar, as in the words in the O.T. Annals, lo sar, 'the end of the year.' Yamaguchi in Drège, 234.
སར-བུ	rlung gi zhe sa. Btsan-lha.
སར-ཁྱུང	a medicinal preparation. TMC 46 (100).
སར-མི	bang chen. Btsan-lha.
སར-ཛ-པ	See spos dkar.
སར-ཏི-བཙུགས-པ	dam bca' byas nas sa gcig tu bsdad pa. Btsan-lha.
སར-ཏི-འཛུགས-པ	sar ti 'dzugs pa ni sa the btsugs pa zhes kyang 'byung bas dam bca' byas nas sa gcig tu bsdad pa la byed. Dpe-chos 512. I believe that sar ti and sa tha are both hidden derivatives from Skt. vasatha or Avasathya (but refering to a special additional vinaya vow to dwell in a single place, although this requires more thought).

སྦྲང	a clan. Btsan-lha.
སྦྲང-འབུ	compound of sbrang bu and 'bu, together meaning the larger class of winged insects and bugs/worms. As close as you can come to a general word for insects.
སྦྲང-བུ	winged insect. kho la dgra ru sbrang bu la gnad pa myed pa la / kho sbrang bu myed na myi dga' bar 'dug gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 152.5.
སྦྲང-མ	definitely may refer to winged insects in general. but more properly speaking, the general class should be called bung ba, while nectar-collectors (bees in particular) should be called sbrang ma. For background on the Indic bee (bhramara), its symbolism and sounds, see Studholme, Origins 32.

སྦྱངས-པའི-ཡོན-ཏན-བཅུ-གཉིས	zas kyi dbang du byas pa gsum / gos kyi dbang du byas pa gsum / gnas mal gyi dbang du byas pa drug yod pa'i phyir / dang po gsum yod de / bsod snyoms pa dang / stan gcig pa dang / zas phyis mi len pa rnams de yin pa'i phyir / dang po la rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa dang / mthar gyis slong ba'i bsod snyoms pa gnyis su phye nas sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gsum du byed pa yang yod do // gos kyi dbang du byas pa gsum yod de / chos gos gsum pa dang / phying ba ba dang / phyag dar khrod pa gsum de yin pa'i phyir / gnas mal gyi dbang du byas pa drug yod de / dgon pa ba dang / shing drung ba dang / bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / cog bu ba dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa rnams de yin pa'i phyir / kha cig phyi ma gnyis spyod lam gyi dbang du byas par mdzad nas gnas mal gyi dbang du byas pa bzhi yin zhes zer / de dag so so'i ngo bo yod de /... For the whole lengthy discussion, see 600 159-170. Pabongka, Liberation I 146.
སྦྱར-དུག	SRZT 131.
སྦྱར-མ	a term of abuse, like the word 'prostitute' (smad 'tshong ma dang 'dra ba'i smad tshig cig). Btsan-lha.
སྦྱར-པ	poplar tree.
སྦྱར-རྩི	a medicine that restores sexual potency (ro tsa gso ba'i sman). Btsan-lha.

སྡིག-ལམ	Sinitic vocab. for ngan 'gro, ngan song. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163.
སྡིག-མཛུབ	A threatening hand gesture. There seems to be difference of opinion on the literal interpretation of the name, although Amy Heller in 1997 article, quite plausibly suggests, 'scorpion fingers,' which does nicely fit with the appearance of the hand gesture. She notes that this hand gesture is very frequently used by the hand of the deity brandishing a weapon. rdo rje khu tshur las mdzub mo ker ba byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya. Btsan-lha.
སྡིག-པ	= srin bu, ka ka ru, karka Ta. JD 254. SS 539.2.
སྡིག-པོ	nges po. Gces 583.6.
སྡིག-ར	Vitali, Tho.ling 69. pin?
སྡིག-སྲིན	Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). Tibetan medicine knows two kinds of 'crabs' (sdig pa). Sdig srin (= crab) and sdig pa ra dza (scorpion). The former is 'white' and the latter 'black.'

སེ	a clan. Btsan-lha. se ste khrigs khrigs byas nas nu ma 'thungs so. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 159.2.
སེ-འབྲུ	pomegranate; JD 95. a tree. SS 423.6. = mA dhu ra, 'bras bu'i mdzod, mchin nad kyi dgra, pho ba'i gnyen. KP1 175.1. KP3 308.7. sel 'bru. KP4 494.3. YTTM 292.14. = DU di ma, ma hu ra, pha la ta ka. DG 205.2. Clifford, list. Sde-srid/2 423.6 ff.: The taste is bitter, sweet and 'oily.' The leaves are small and round. Flowers — white. The fruit is shaped like a gourd and completely filled with small red kernels. Pomegranate. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). Punica granatum. This identification is beyond doubt. The pharmacological value of pomegranate has been discussed by Kelsang Rapten in his paper 'Tibetan Medicinal Plants and Their Relationship to Modern Chemical Activity, Tibetan Medicine 3, pp. 32-44.

སེལ-གྱིས-དགབ	skyon gyis dgab pa. Btsan-lha.
སེལ-གྱིས-དག-པ	skyon gyis dag pa'am 'khon med pa. Btsan-lha.
སེལ-མ-བྱེད-པ	skyel ma byas pa. Btsan-lha.
སེལ-སྒོར-འདོན	kha la 'thon pa. Btsan-lha.
སེམས	cetas, citta, mind, thought. Sometimes used as an abbr. for Bodhicitta. Frequently a word for 'mind' that is not 'clearly comprehended' (byang chub), in which case it is may be regarded as the special power of Total Knowledge, but not Total Knowledge itself. For the distinction between sems and rig pa see 91 I 579.3 ff. There are said to be 24 distinctions (I 581.2). It obscures the Total Knowledge substantiality (I 581.5).
སེམས-དགུ	dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa'i skabs kyi sems dgu ni / bu mdzangs pa lta bu'i sems / rdo rje lta bu'i sems / sa gzhi lta bu'i sems / khor yug gi ri lta bu'i sems / bran g.yog lta bu'i sems / phyag dar lta bu'i sems / thag pa lta bu'i sems / sgo khyi lta bu'i sems / grogs bzang lta bu'i sems so. 600 127-128.
སེམས-དྲུག	rtsa ba'i sems / rjes su dpyod pa'i sems / rnam par dpyod pa'i sems / nges par 'dzin pa'i sems / sdom pa'i sems / smon pa'i sems so. 600 72.
སེམས-ཉིད	Mind Proper. Equivalent of Three Bodies (Klong-chen-pa 3.7 comm.) which are called its three parts. Guenther in TH&L.
སེམས-ཕྱོགས	91 I 603.5.
སེམས-ཤན	sems can zhes pa'i brda rnying. Btsan-lha.
སེམས-སྐྱོན	'mind fault.' Worry, guilt, anxiety, often attributed to spirit invasion of the veins. Epstein, Dissertation 139.
སེམས-སྣུམ	dga' ba. Btsan-lha.

སྒ	Saddle. For illus. of a saddle said to have been used by Ge-sar, see Precious Deposits III 79. See gser sga. Stein. a clan (rigs rus). Btsan-lha. Also spelled lga & rga. = bca' sga, dong gra, sga smug, sga bo che, sgga dmar, sga rgod, sge gsher, ma nu shu zun, zur pa dkar po. JD 135. a tree in SS 424.6. SS 516.5. སྒེད-པོ	I think it is a weird spelling for rgad po (a name of one of Phadampa's students, which also means 'old man'). sged po la 'di'i mying ci yin gsung // sged po lags mod byas pas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 144.7.
སྒེག-པ	eroticism. See nyams brgyad.
སྒེར-བའི-མི-སེར	subjects of noble estates. Dargyay, TVC 25. I think it comes close to 'private servant.'
སྒོ	sgo ni dar / myi ni btsan. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 197. a cangue, used for legal punishment. French, Yoke 325 (this meaning also found in Yisun). A clan (gdung rus). Btsan-lha.
སྒོ-འབབ	lands at the door (comes to you without going anywhere to get it). Goldstein, Taxation 19.
སྒོ-འགྲམ	doorway; The 'jamb' of a doorway. See Dag-yig 167. As part of the entrance-way to a mandala, see Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 61.
སྒོ-འཇག	(Dbus) = sgo lcags, (door) lock. MTTP.
སྒོ-འཁྱོར	'du khang sogs kyi gzhung sgo'i mdun gyi khyams kyi ming. Btsan-lha.

སྒོ-བཀུམ	sgo bkag pa'am brgyab pa. Btsan-lha.
སྒོ-དར	(coll.) khadar which are hung from the 4-looped "handles" of the door-leaves at main entrance to a Tibetan monastery or other important building. MTTP.
སྒོ-དཔོན	gatekeeper. Flick, Carrying Enemies 107.
སྒོ-དྲུག	In the phrase: sems kyi sgo drug 'khrul pa yul la myi 'jug par bzlog. Meinert in TS9 II 291.
སྒོ-ག	? mo na re dam pa lags sgo ga ngan pa lags mod zer bas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 301.6 (also, 302.1).

སྒོ-གནོན	Stein.

སྒོ-གཏན	A kind of doorbolt (pictured in vinaya illustration, it has the shape of a 'T').
སྒོ-ཁྱོད	As part of the entrance-way to a mandala, see Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 61.

སྒོ-ལྡང	A part of a door. The jamb. See Dag-yig 167.
སྒོ-ལྔ	Sinitic vocab. for yan lag lnga. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163.
སྒོ-ལོགས	As part of the entrance-way to the mandala, see Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 62.
སྒོ-ལྟེ	A part of a door. See Dag-yig 167.
སྒོ-མོ	One of the two wooden parts of a Tibetan door. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 4. Stein. Haarh, Yar-lun 349.
སྒོ-ང	On abstention from eggs, see Das, JTL&CT 98. SS 543.6.
སྒོ-རོག	As a lower element in the pillar-capital in Tibetan architecture. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 3.
སྒོ-སྒོར	so sor ram phyogs re re la. Btsan-lha.
སྒོ-ཤན	The middle strip joining the two halves of a Tibetan door. The lock/latch is attached to it. See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 4.
སྒོ-སྐྱེས	1. sgo gtan. 2. rta babs. Btsan-lha.

སྒྲོན-བཞི-ལམ-དུ-འཁྱེར-བ	[thod rgal]. RGYANG ZHAG CHU SGRON SBREL BA'I MIG GNYIS TE / (one's own two eyes) THIG LE STONG SGRON RMA BYA'I MDONGS DANG MTSHUNGS / (appearance of peacock 'eyes') RNAM DAG SGRON MAS ZHING KHAMS TSHAD PHEBS SHING / (= dbyings kyi rnam dag sgron ma. appearances like Na-ro letters) SHES RAB RANG BYUNG SPROS PA'I MTHA' ZAD 'GYUR / (appearance of all Bodies complete) SGRON BZHI MTHAR PHYIN DBYINGS RIG 'DRES PA'O. སྒུ-རྡོ	sling; Acc. to Das, the sling or sling-shot. See also Hummel in TJ 25 no. 3 (Autumn 2000).
སྒུ-རུ-རུ-བྱས-པ	= sgur sgur rgyug pa. BBNP 480.
སྒུམ	See rgum. de'i dus su dgongs nyams kyi tshig sgum kha yar phyi rabs kyi don du bris pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. II 212.1. "In that time I wrote down for future generations the scattered birdfeed (sgum kha yar) of his expressions of his thoughts and experiences."
སྒུར-འཐེན	rtsed mo zhig. Nomads 235, 261. A rope-pulling context. A rope loop is looped around the back of the neck of each contestant, and between the legs, and they pull while on all-fours.
སྒྱེ-མོ	cloth [salt] bag. T&BS I 342. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 48.
སྒྱེད-བུ	As in mi mgo sgyed bu, the tripod made of 3 human heads on which the skullcup is placed. Stein, in JA (1995) 121, etc.

སྒྱུ-དཔྱ	rgyu nom pa'i dpya khral. Btsan-lha.
སྒྱུ-མ-ལྟ-བུ	Tsongkhapa uses this term, meaning 'like an illusion,' but never says that the world is an illusion.
སྒྱུ-མ-རིགས-གྲུབ	As a way of referring to SvAtantrika, see Sparham in Changing Minds 206.
སྒྱུ-མའི-དཔེ-བཅུ-གཉིས	sgyu ma / chu zla / mig yor / smig rgyu / rmi lam / sgra brnyan / dri za'i grong khyer / mig 'phrul / 'ja' tshon / glog / chu bur / me long nang gi gzugs brnyan rnams so. 600 156-7.
སྒྱུག-མོ	khyo ga'i a ma mna' ma'i sgyug mo dang / mna' ma'i a ma khyo ga'i sgyug mo. Btsan-lha.
ཤཱཎཌི-ལྱ	See bil ba.
ཤཱུ-ཀྲ-གརབྷ	See nye shing.
ཤ	(for sha ba). Hirsch. Kaschewsky2. See rnam gsum dag pa'i sha. a 'secret' way of saying the number 'eight,' used by gamblers. Norbu, Drung 229.
ཤ-འབལ	Namdak.
ཤ-འབྲས	See a 'bras.
ཤ-འཛེར	lus kyi rme ba 'bur du dod pa. Btsan-lha.
ཤ-འགག	phu thung. Btsan-lha. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 190.1.
ཤ-འཁོན	A type of lan chags which bears malice towards one's flesh. Epstein, Dissertation 106. Term used in Pha-dam-pa dang Ma-cig (PRC 1992) 431.
ཤ-འཁྲིག	Text 59.
ཤ-བ	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 298. sha bo. dgra bo. Nomads 251. = rwa bcu pa. JD 231. SS 497.5.
ཤ-བལ	dbyar dus sa'i steng du sngon po bal lta bu chags pa. Btsan-lha. kwo mo nang gi sha bal myi 'grangs pa'i zas la dgos pa myed. Zhi-byed Coll. II 159.5.
ཤ-བཅད	outlining of flesh; outlining of flesh. Jackson.
ཤ-བཀྲའ	sha phrug. Btsan-lha. = pags bkra. ringworm. Dhongthog. SRZT 106.
ཤ-བོ	dgra ya gtso bo. Btsan-lha.
ཤ-བུར	a kind of blister (perhaps a boil?). sha bur ltas na rmen par ma song par reg na myi bzod. When you notice a boil before it has turned into a black-head (or wound), you cannot stand to touch it. Zhi-byed Coll. II 169.2. dmyal ba'i lus rnam par smyin pa las grub pa reg na / sha bu bas 'bum 'gyur gyis myi bzod pa yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 363.1.
ཤ-བྱེད	sha byed cing ni ngar ngar byed cing. Dpe-chos 517.
ཤ-ཅན	sha can [~lpags tshags] dang. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 189.5.
ཤ-ཆེན	human flesh; human flesh. Clifford, list.
ཤ-དག	O.T. = sha stag. Blan 287.5. kha rkyang ngam rkyang rkyang. Btsan-lha.
ཤ-དོར	trousers of spotted deer fur. Velm I 136.
ཤ-དུག	SRZT 134.
ཤ-གདན	DD illus. 15.
ཤ-གོས	smad g.yogs sam nang gos. Btsan-lha.
ཤ-གྲིམས	sran chung ba. Btsan-lha.
ཤ-གཟུག	a quarter carcass of meat. See BA 909, for the proverb sha gzug rang zo. See Dagyab.
ཤ-གཟུགས	sha khog gam lhu gzugs tshang ba. Btsan-lha. Gces 586.1
ཤ-ཁ	flesh colored. sha dkar, light flesh color. sha mdangs, shading of flesh. sha dmar, reddish flesh color. sha ser, yellowish flesh color. Jackson.
ཤ-ཁབ	lit., 'flesh needle,' used in moxa. Pictured in JD 283 (bottom).
ཤ-ཁྲལ	meat-tax (levied in kind on animals slaughtered by the public). Sources.

ཤཔ-ཏ-ཝ-རི	See nye shing.
ཤར-བུ	A series of these occur in the form of white objects with small points on the inside. A shar bu is shaped like a type of bottle, with its spout pointed down. They act as a drainage system for the mandala mansion. See Doboom, Buddh. Path to Enlightenment, p. 61, 62. dra ba. Btsan-lha. Acc. to Jinpa, they are small pegs hanging down, which keep moisture from getting on the walls (making moisture drip down like artificial icicles).

ཤེན-པ	O.T. = bshen pa (?). Skt. badhaka. Blan 297.5. bshan pa. myur ba. Btsan-lha.
ཤེན-ཏེ-མ	ngan pa. Btsan-lha.
ཤེས-བྱ	Germano, Poetic Thought 899.
ཤེས-ལྡན	1. mi. 2. sems can spyi. 3. mkhas pa. Blan 532.
ཤེས-ཉེན	yon tan. Btsan-lha.
ཤེས-རབ	Insight. PrajñA. (I believe the English word insight should be reserved for translating prajñA, and not as is usually done, translating lhag mthong [vipazyana, vipassana]. The latter term could just as well be translated 'further vision,' 'deepening vision' or the like.) In some MahAyAna contexts, it would be best to translate as Transcendent Insight.
ཤེས-ཚུར	wisdom fist. Used as name of a mudrA in Precious Deposits II 81.
ཤེས-ཡ	= shes bya. "to be known, knowable." Kuijp (1986) 37.
ཤེས-པ-བཅུ	mdzod las bshad pa'i shes pa bcu ni / chos shes pa / rjes su shes pa / sdug bsngal shes pa / kun 'byung shes pa / 'gog pa shes pa / las shes pa / zad pa shes pa / mi skye ba shes pa / kun rdzob shes pa / gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams so. 600 145-146.
ཤེས-པ-ཅན	mu stegs gcer bu pa. Btsan-lha.
ཤེས-པ-ལ-མི-གཟན-པ	sems la mi gnod pa'am mi phog pa. Btsan-lha.
ཤེས-པ-རྒྱང-ངེ-ཅོག-གེ-བ	khengs shing 'khyog por byas nas zhes pa'am snying ring 'khyog po zhes pa'o. Dpe-chos 503. Btsan-lha 116.
ཤེས-ཉེན-ཅན	yon tan can. Btsan-lha.
ཤེས-རབ-གསུམ	don dam rtogs pa'i shes rab / kun rdzob rtogs pa'i shes rab / sems can gyi don byed pa'i shes rab bo. 600 16-17.
ཤེས-རེ-སྐན	shes mi yong ngam shes pa re ba ma byas. Btsan-lha.
ཤེས-ལས-སྐྱེས	gang zag gi spyi ming. 'gro ba mi'i mes po'i ming.
ཤེས-ཀྱིས-ཁེ-འདོད-པ	zhor la khe thob par 'dod pa. Btsan-lha.
ཤི-བ	(shi bar?) Aris, Discourse 57.
ཤི-བདུར	"obsequies." "funeral rites." Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 321. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 193.
ཤི-ཆད	death; death penalty (?). Samdo A III 131r-131v.
ཤི-ཀྲུ	See pho ba ri. See na le sham.
ཤི-ནིག	ZZ = shu nig (?). = bgegs. Bru II 155.2.
ཤི-ཤ	spyan mchog dbul ba'i shi sha'i phyir. Derge Kanjur CCXI 745.3. Could this be a deformation of the Skt. word for 'pupil'? Yisun has a mt. named shi sha spang ma.
ཤི-ཤོན	shi shon ni rgyu dar ras gang rigs las byas pa'i thog ral ni gos kyi phyi thog tu gon pa'i gos shig go / deng song stod 'bog ces pa 'di lta bu'o. Namdak, Bzo-rig 72. See discussion in Stein's article on Zhang-zhung, at p. 244. Nine Ways. In the ZZ of the Mdzod-phug, it corresponds to Tib. dran pa.
ཤི-ཀུ-མ-ནི	See na le sham.
ཤི-སྤར-འཐམས	'chi dus spar mo thum khred pa. Gces 584.3. shi dus su'ang sbar mos 'thams pa. Btsan-lha.
ཤི-རི-ཁ-དྷ	KP3 335.5.
ཤི-སྤུ-གཟིངས-ལ	shi 'gro ba tshun la. Btsan-lha.
ཤི-ཤྭ-བེ-ལ	See (sman) sga.
ཤི-མེད-གསོན	[mchongs] ob tot oder lebendig [sich hineinstürzen] d.h. ohne Furcht. ZAS VII 474.
ཤི-མ-རོ	halb tot (half dead). Kaschewsky 86.
ཤི-ལ-བར-ཀ	A plant with an odiferous root. See disc. in Silk, Dissert. 310.
ཤི-ལ-ཛ-དུ	See brag zhun.
ཤི-ལ-པ-པ	See (rdo) dreg.
ཤིའུ	See yu mo shi'u stor ba.
ཤིབས-པ	lkog tu gsang ste smra ba. Dpe-chos 511. Btsan-lha.
ཤིད	O.T. = gshin po. = dmigs pa'i dag pa sgrub pa. Blan 292.1. shi ba'i dge rtsa. BBNP 469. shi po'i dge rtsa. Btsan-lha. hazelnut. LW 498. log par lta ba rnams kyi ming shid ces grags pa de la. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 155.5.
ཤིད-བཏང	mi shi ba'i phung po dur khrod du bskyal ba. Btsan-lha.
ཤིད-ཟན	O.T. = ro zan. = gshin zas. = dad zas ('dad zas). Blan 292.1. ro zan nam gshin zas. Btsan-lha.
ཤིག	lice. Lack of lice as sign of spiritual progress. Thondup, BM 399, etc. (also, Chang, Hundred Thousand Songs 466, 496). Gyatso, Apparitions 66, 226. T.-B. cognates, Beyer, CT Lang 86. Zhi-byed Coll. II 212.4. BA 674. Skal-ldan-rgya-mtsho wrote a beautiful dialogue between himself and his body lice, nits & fleas. Sujata, Dissert. For a story about the Sgom-chen and the flea, see Roesler in Facets 170-171.
ཤིག-གྲི	evidently an untimely death from lice (in this case, it was a leper that it happened to). Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum I 46.2 (here Lo-ras-pa takes the lice from the dead leper's clothing and puts them on himself as a religious practice).
ཤིག-གསོད	sngo shig gsod. See bya rgod spos.
ཤིག-སེ	(shig se shig). bewegt, geschüttelt. Kaschewsky2.
ཤིག-ཤིག	(poet.) ripple ripple. (Amdo) proliferation, crowding. MTTP.
ཤིག-ཤིག-པོ	lhod pa'am dal dal po. Btsan-lha.
ཤིལ-ལི	sound of a whistle. T&BS I 331.
ཤིལ-གྱི-གནའ-རུ	rna ba'i rwa co. 506A 339.
ཤིམ-པ	tog tse'am 'jor. Btsan-lha.
ཤིམ-ཤིམ	zhim pa. Btsan-lha.
ཤིན	ZZ = mchin pa. Bru II 291.5.
ཤིན-སྦྱང	pliancy; pliancy. Thondup, BM 289, 385. Skt. prasrabdhi.
ཤིན-ཏེ-མ	snyigs ma. chud za ba. nyams chung ba sogs. Btsan-lha. See discussion in Silk, Dissert. 313.
ཤིན-ཏེ-མ-མེད-པ	O.T. = snyigs ma med pa. = chud za ba. = nyam chung ba med pa. Blan 304.1.
ཤིན-ཏུ-རྣལ-འབྱོར	lit., extremely joined to the real. Ati-yoga. = a ti yo ga. Equivalent to Great Completedness, Rdzogs-chen, q.v.
ཤིན-ཏུ-ལྐོག-གྱུར	Thoroughly hidden from view. Acc. to DharmakIrti, a special class of phenomenon that can be established not by observation or inference, but only by relying on authoritative statement. Dreyfus, Sound 252 (moral causation, or karma, is an example; 265).
ཤིན-ཏུ-ནས-ཀྱང	überaus, in höchsten Mass. ZAS VII 474.
ཤིང-འཇོམས	See shing rta mo.
ཤིང-བལ	cotton; simile: light as cotton wool. Bsam-gtan Mig Sgron 470.3. lcang rnyid dam ras bal. Btsan-lha.
ཤིང-བཅེར	shing spungs. Btsan-lha.
ཤིང-བཅུད	See shing mngar. See tsan dan dkar po.
ཤིང-བཀུག	mdun du bkug pa lta bu. Utpal 20.5.
ཤིང-བུ	stick; stirring stick. Jackson.
ཤིང-བྱང	used in glud rites. Tucci, Religions 178.. In Dge-'dun-chos-'phel-gyi Gsung-rtsom (1990) I 276, this word is used to describe O.T. woodslips.
ཤིང-ཆ	carpentry (?). Samdo A VI 264v.5.
ཤིང-ཁྲལ	wood-tax (obligation to supply the rdzong with firewood). Sources.
ཤིང-ཀུན	garlic extract. Skorupski, TA. srin sman. Utpal 12.1. = sgog pas bzos pa. JD 125. = rtsi po che. YTTM 292.23. Asafoetida. Clifford, list. LW 459. TM IV 63. SS 428.1. = hing gu la, rtsi bo che, bokka na, heng gu ra, spod, dri chen, shing ku ma, a ghu shir, hel tu la tha, rtsi gnyis, gnod sbyin rkang mar. DG 241.5. In the modern Nepalese spice market, asafoetida may be called simply 'hing.'
ཤིང-ལྡོན	= spyi zhung. YTTM 292.26.
ཤིང-མངར	JD 134. SS 440.6. = rtsar rgyug, shing gi nor bu, rtsa dkar, shing bcud. Both Das & Goldstein seem to identify it as licorice. KP1 157.1. KP3 300.7. KP4 479.5. Mdo 466. = ma dhu yaSTi, bhI ma mU la, thim zi, thil yi, wang tsi'u, shu shu tsus, kli ci don, ri tsi, rtsab shing, rtsab mo, lce mkhris, glo gnyen, gser bzang lcug ma. DG 273.3. Mdo 466-8: A many leafed herb, it grows to a height of 30 to 100 cms. The stem grows straight like a tree (shing). It grows in dry alkaline meadows & sandy river banks at a height of 1,800 to 2,500 feet above sealevel. The root is the part used in medicine. Hübotter/1 82.: Glycyrrhiza uralensis. DG 273.3 ff. specifies the cultivated variety as being best for medicine. Then, in descending order, that which grows on river banks of the northern plateau (byang thang), and that which grows near streams in low-lying forests. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16), 16.2 (item 17).
ཤིང-ནག	See a ka ru.
ཤིང-རྟ	chariot; chariot, cart. metaphorical usage, see Zhi-byed Coll. I 418.5.
ཤིང-རྩི	rtswa dang shing sogs skye dngos. Btsan-lha.
ཤིང-ཤག	See a ru ra.
ཤིང-ཤོད	See rgya skyags.
ཤིང-སློང	begging for wood. Name for the weekly monastic rest day. Dreyfus, Sound 249.
ཤིང-སྤྲ	gdong nag la spu dkar po mjug ma ring ba yang rtsal spre'u las che ba zhig. Btsan-lha. An black faced but white body-haired arboreal simian.
ཤིང-སྲམ	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 299.
ཤིང-ཐག	khang pa'i lcog. Btsan-lha.
ཤིང-ཐགས	cog tse. shing gi dra mig gam rib ma. Btsan-lha.. O.T. = cog. Blan 300.2.
ཤིང-ཐུན	shing 'thu mkhan. Btsan-lha.. shing thub. Gces 588.1.
ཤིང-ཙེ	lion. LW 513.
ཤིང-ཚ	= lho shing, nang blon ka na. JD 119. SS 426.4. KP1 208.3. KP4 521.3. See dal ci ni. = tra tsa, tra kra, tra tstsha, kanytsa tha. DG 237.6. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). Slovar' 63, 66, 190, 191: Arabis hirsuta Scop, A. pendula L., Cinnamomum cassia Blume, or C. ceylanicum Nees. DG 237.6 ff: It grows in the dense forests of river gorges. The trunk is hard and the leaves small. It has thick and thin bark both. The thin promotes and the thick equalizes bodily heat. The taste is dry, hot, sweet and slightly salty.
ཤིང-ཡེགས	shing zang nge zing nge. Btsan-lha.
ཤིང-ཞིབ	KP3 285.5.
ཤིང-ཟིན	A word perhaps coming via Chinese, meaning yoke or yoga. The usual spelling for the Tibetan name for Taoists, evidently reversing the order of the syllables, is zin shing, for which, see Laufer, LW 526.
ཤིང-ང-དཔུང-བཅད	dge slong ma rnams kyi brang gi mdun phyogs gab byed kyi gos shig. Btsan-lha.

ཤིང-མངར-གསུམ-ཐང	BT 11v.2. a medicinal preparation.

ཤིང-ཚ-ཐུག-པོ	See da tsha.

ཤིང-ཤ-པ	a ka ru shing. Btsan-lha. = sha pa'i shing. LW 470. See a ka ru.
ཤིང-ཐོག-བིམ-པ	shing tog bye brag pa shin tu dwangs pas gzugs brnyan shar ba'i 'bras bu zhig. Btsan-lha.
ཤིང-གི-མི	wooden man (evidently means 'puppet,' since it is controlled by a contraption ['khrul 'khor]; see Zhi-byed Coll. V 414). dper na shing gi myi de 'khrul 'khor gyis 'bras sgrub la stsogs pa'i bya ba byas kyang... Zhi-byed Coll. IV 173.7.
ཤིང-གི-བཀའ-ཏང	shing gi bka' thang ste shing las bzos pa'i bka' khrims kyi yi ge chen po. Btsan-lha.

ཤོ	dice; [1] dice (cho lo, q.v., is evidently an older word). TS7 II 1055 ff. For texts on dicing, SBTD I 208, 402. See illus. from Potala mural, showing dice games as well as dominoes, in Precious Deposits V 181. [2] As an item of materia medica, see JD 151. See thang sho (?). [3] a single-file 'column.' Huber, Pure Crystal 141.
ཤོ-བེ	O.T. = rdzun. Skt. mithya. Blan 291.6.
ཤོ-བཀག	'jammed column' (a kind of traffic jam on the circuit of Tsa-ri). Huber, Pure Crystal 141.
ཤོ-གམ	nyo tshong gi khral. lam khral lam yul gyi tshugs pa. Btsan-lha. See also sho gom.
ཤོ-གོམ	a hidden borrowing of Skt. zulka, which means price, value, customs duty, etc. sho gam ste legs sbyar gyi shulka zur chag lam khral dang tshong khral sogs khral rigs spyi. Gser Sbram 184.
ཤོ-ཁྲི	See thang phrom nag po.
ཤོ-མང	SS 485.1. Varieties: ri sho, lug sho, rgya sho, klung sho.

ཤུ-བ	abscess; pags nad rigs shig gi ming ste, de la glang shu dang glog shu sogs du ma yod, phal che ba'i nad rtags ni za 'phrug lang ba yin. tshig bsdu na <<shu>> zhes 'bri chog ste: glog shu, glang shu zhes pa lta bu. Dag-yig. abscess, ulcer, sore. = shu 'bur, shu thor. Jaeschke. Text 52.

ཤུ-མིན	some type of cloth (dar). The word probably from Chinese, as argued by Stein in his Zhang-zhung article, at p. 244. This word is used in Bon texts, and may very well be ZZ (although not listed as such in the ZZ glossaries).

ཤུད	a clan. Btsan-lha.
ཤུད-པ	dbyil ba'am nyil ba. Btsan-lha.
ཤུག-ནུར	glal ba. Btsan-lha. Also spelled shug mur.
ཤུག-པ	= rgya shug, su ra tsan dan, gor tsandan, ba da ra, de ba da ru, jil, lha shing. JD 98. KP3 269.3. Clifford, list. Mdo 472.
ཤུག-ཚེར	= spa ma ra, g.yu 'brug ze ba (?), 'brum rtsi (?). JD 108. = shug pa tsher can. SS 464.5. = ba dra ra, 'brog rtsi sngon po, shug tsher ma can. DG 219.5.

སྐོང-བུ	It may mean 'paint pot.' lha bzo ba 'gro ba la tshon rtsi'i skong bus dgos pa myed. Zhi-byed Coll. II 230.1. shel gyi skong bu'i mar me 'di la grib ma myed. Ibid. I 310.1. The modern spelling is kong bu or skon bu, but see also skun bu.
སྐོར-འཆག	perhaps more correctly, mkhur lcag, a cheek whip used for lighter legal punishment. French, Yoke 321. See under ko shag, snyug lcab. This should actually be spelled ko lcag, or ko shag, q.v.

See also khrag skran. mi dang srog chags kyi lus po'i zungs ci rigs tshad las 'das par 'phel ba las gong bur 'dril ba'i nad rigs shig gi ming ste, mang che ba ni sgrim che ba'i spyod lam dang zas rtsub 'gyur can, lus la zhugs pa'i skye ldan gzhan bcas kyis bskyed pa yin. སྐྲུ-བ	Stein. Btsan-lha.
སྐྲུད-པ	Btsan-lha.
སྐྲུས-པ	O.T. = gcod pa. Blan 302.2. shing skrus pa ni shing dum bur gcod pa'i don. Utpal 31.1.
སྐུ	CHOS SKU: The basic factors behind illusory appearances as if in-corpor-ated. LONGS SPYOD RDZOGS SKU: The common pool of possibilities for social discourse in-corpor-ated. SPRUL PA'I SKU: The protean in-corpor-ation, within the realm of the illusory, of the factors behind those same illusory appearances projected purposefully through the lens of social discourse in order to access those basic factors and thereby transform the dangerously reified classifications of the human mind, thereby aiding in the release of those who would otherwise remain entrapped. See also sku gsum.
སྐུ-འདོང	Btsan-lha.
སྐུ-བེར	a ceremonial cape, illus. in Reynolds article in Orientations (Mar 1981) 17.
སྐུ-བླ	Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 320. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 164, 200-1. Btsan-lha.
སྐུ-བྱད	Gestalt. Kretsch.

སྐྱ-འགམ	skya 'gam ni gri'i rtse mo prig sha'i lo ma 'dra. From Namdak, Bzo-rig 112.

སྐྱ-བ	oar/sail of a boat (?). Rudder (?). BBNP 467. Oar. Samdo A V 161v.3, 180v.6. Btsan-lha, q.v. skya ba ni gru bas chu dkrugs. Utpal 27.5. Tibetan oars may be forked sticks with leather sewn around the forked part; see Hummel in TJ 25 no. 3 (Autumn 2000) 17 n. 16.

སྐྱ-བསེར	Btsan-lha.
སྐྱ-བཤལ	Original entry: (rgyu rims) skya bshal. SRZT 53.
སྐྱ-ཆོས	used for books made on light colored paper, distinguished from sngo chos. Vitali, Tho.ling 75.
སྐྱ-ག	skya ga chu skyar ni chu bya nya gsod mkhan. Utpal 27.4. = mgron bsu, bya khra. JD 227. SS 537.4.
སྐྱ-ཁྲ	= skya ka. = skya ga. "Vogelart." Kaschewsky 82. See under kye ka & kya kra.
སྐྱ-པོད	Btsan-lha.
སྐྱ-རྦབ	swelling of body due to diseases of the don lnga. "mi'i glo snying sogs don lnga la nad byung ba'i rkyen gyis lus skrangs pa'i nad kyi thog ma'i skabs la bod kyi sman gzhung du skya rbab zer. "Tibetan medical texts use this word to describe the initial stages of diseases of the lung and hear (and also liver, spleen and kidneys). Dag-yig. Text 16, 65. Most generally it occurs in connection with lung diseases. Lag-len 276.4. Etiology: The basic causes are the three humours and lymph (chu ser). The contributing factors are: 1) Eating inappropriate foods following a case of diarrhea. 2) Phlebotomy (gtar) or cooling compounds (bsil sbyor) following a fever. 3) Drinking too much water when exhausted. 4) Sleeping in a moist place, etc., where physical heat is weakened. 5) Undigested dhyme stagnating in the liver rather than transforming into other physical constituents. 6) Bad blood diffused in the flesh and skin so that they expand. 7) Pus (chu ser) is scattered by air so that it pervades the body. If skya rbab becomes chronic, it turns to 'or nad. Chronic 'or nad turns to dmu chu. Symptoms: The three general symptoms are 1) General swelling of the body. 2) Shortness of breath. 3) Infrequency of urination. In addition to these, 1) Puffiness of the eyes and face. 2) The side of the body facing downward during sleep. These symptoms are easily recognized by all, yet I have only seen a few who were able to treat it. SRZT 35 ff. [This is classified as a phlegm [bad kan] disorder.] Note: The literal meaning of skya rbab is 'whitish' (skya) 'wave' (rbab, = rba rlab). See also AHT 104.. Original entry: (bad kan) skya rbab. SRZT 35. Text 36.
སྐྱ-རྫས	Tshad Rig.

སྐྱེ-དགུ	'dod pa'i khams las tshe 'phos te khams gsum du skye ba gsum / gzugs khams las tshe 'phos te khams gsum du skye ba gsum / gzugs med khams las tshe 'phos te khams gsum du skye ba gsum la bya'o // 'ga' zhig 'di'i dgu ni ra mgo can gyi rgu yin pas grangs kyi dgu la mi byed zer ro. 600 124-125. rin chen phreng ba'i dar tIk tu phung po lnga dang 'byung ba bzhi bcas chos dgu la btags pa'i gang zag la skye dgu zhes gsungs pa dang / pan chen blo bzang chos rgyan gyis 'dod khams nas shi 'phos te 'dod khams dang gzugs khams dang gzugs med khams su skye ba gsum dang / gzugs dang gzugs med khams gnyis la'ang de ltar sbyar bas dgu la skye dgu zhes pa yin par gsungs la / 'ga' zhig gis grangs kyi dgu ma yin pas skye rgu zhes ra mgo can yin zer ba sogs bshad tshul mang ngo. Gser Sbram 165.
སྐྱེ-ལྡན	See rgya skyags.
སྐྱེ-ལོ	(Gtsang) = lang tsho, beauty. MTTP.
སྐྱེ-མཆེད	445 III 58.3 ff. 9 60. Germano, Poetic Thought 934. Tshad Rig. Based in subject-object dualism, the particular sensory consciousness would seem to project toward the object, produce and enhance it. The internal-to-external medium in which this apparent projection takes place is the skye mched. mig sogs yul yul can bcu gnyis. Utpal 31.3. skye mched seem to exist in a liminal space between the objective realm and the subjective one: de'i stobs kyis rlung lnga nang du chings pas 'byung ba lnga'i skye mched mthong gsal mdangs phyed pas / rig pa cer bu la sang nge sa le la bkrag chags pas / sa'i rlung zind pa'i rang mdangs su 'od du du ba lta bu gsal... Zhi-byed Coll. V 46.6.
སྐྱེ-མེད	unborn; unborn, unproduced, unarticulated. Skt. anutpada, ajAti. Sometimes used as epithet of Bodhicitta [Klong-chen-pa 6.1]. Germano, Poetic Thought 952.

སྐྱེ-ཀའི-ཚོགས-ཀྱིས-འུག-ཆུང-བདའ	Dpa'-ris.
སྐྱེ-ཐང-པ	Btsan-lha.
སྐྱེ-གནས-བཞི	mngal skyes / sgong skyes / drod gsher skyes / brdzus skyes so. 600 29. The womb-born are born through the development of the body from a seed inside of the mother's body, the egg-born are born through the development of the body from a seed inside an egg (and outside the body), the warmth-moisture-born develop bodies from seeds outside a body, but without any egg. Miraculously-born are instantaneously born complete without developing from any seed.
སྐྱེ-བ-རྒྱུན-གཅོད	See gser. See brag spos.
སྐྱེ-མཆེད-བཅུ-གཉིས	mig gi skye mched / rna ba'i skye mched / sna'i skye mched / lce'i skye mched / lus kyi skye mched / yid kyi skye mched de yul can drug / gzugs kyi skye mched / sgra'i skye mched / dri'i skye mched / ro'i skye mched / reg bya'i skye mched / chos kyi skye mched de yul gyi skye mched drug go. 600 154-5. Tshad Rig.

སྐྱེར-པ	See Tucci, Tibetan Folk Songs, fig. 7. JD 120. There are white and black varieties. = gser ldum, pa la ta ka, dhi sha ri, dzi byed ta, ha ri ha, dhA tu, ha lang hA, gser shing, tsher rngon, 'bras skyur, lpags ser, gser shun. DG 239.2. Mdo 42. Indian barberry. Clifford, list.

སྐྱེར-པའི-སྐས	shing ser po skyer bas gyen du 'dzegs sar rkas btsugs pa. Utpal 28.4.

སྐྱིད-རྟག	A chronological term. The 821-2 Sino-Tibetan treaty pillar mentions the 7th, 8th and 9th skyid rtag. It evidently refers to the regnal period of Khri gtsug lde brtsan. Uray, Earliest Evidence 348.

སྐྱུ-རུམ	O.T. = tshod ma. Blan 304.2. Btsan-lha. zas kyi ro gsal ba byed pa'i tshod ma'i ming. Utpal 27.1.

སླེ-ཏྲེས	name of a medicinal plant, which may be of Zhang-zhung origins. See Das, Namgyal Nyima's dictionary, Li-shi'i Gur-khang, etc. = sngo rtag. SS 441.2. JD 134. KP1 206.3. KP3 320.4. KP4 519.3. Mdo 546. = gu ri tsi, a mri ta, tshin da ru ha, bcad skyes, bi rI ga, mchog gi lus, wa yaSTha, na tshod gnas, tan tri kA, rgyud ldan, war sA da nI, ghu ra tsa ya, ghi lo ya. DG 233.6. See bra ma.

སྨན-རྟ	See also under rta. lit., medicine horse.' The medicinal base with which the active ingredients are administered. Some common examples are beer, honey, sugar, molasses etc. Sometimes simply called 'horse' (rta). Mkhyen-rab/11 11 (no. 16). Text 8 et passim.

སྨྱེང-ཚིག	gsang tshig. Btsan-lha.
སྨྱི-གུ	See smyig. smyu gu'am yi ge 'bri byed. smyug chung ngam smyug phran. Btsan-lha.
སྨྱིག	an old spelling for smyug, 'bamboo,' or perhaps a word for very small bamboo. smyig tshul in Dgongs-gcig (1990) 143.1. For a metaphor for the fruit of the bamboo: Flick, Carrying Enemies 78.

སྔས-སྲུང	pillow guarding. This refers to the practice of watching the corpse day and night to make sure there are no demonic attacks (or possibly also to make sure it won't be reanimated in one way or another). See forthcoming article by Bryan Cuevas.

སྣོམ-སྣོམ	snas snom snom byed pa. BBNP 480. kho 'di bas gzhan zab bam snyem ba'i blos sgrub rgyud du ma la sna snom byas kyang / cig la nge[s] shes ma skyes pas / kun gyi rtsi mi 'thung ba chos nyid yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 185.6. Here it really seems to mean 'sniff scents with the nose,' to get a superficial 'whiff' of something. jo bo la la ga na 'dug pa'i gdams ngag la bstug / mang po la sna snom byed par gda' ste. སྙིང-པོ-སེར-པོ	See tsan dan dkar po.
སྙིང-ཚ-སྐྱུ-རུ-རུ-བ	= snying 'jigs yer re ba. BBNP 484. Btsan-lha.
སྙིང-ཞོ-ཤ	See zho sha. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). Clifford, list. See under (snying) zho sha. JD 85: Grows in jungles of river gorges and of Mustang (Glo-yul, Nepal). It has a great trunk and thick leaves. The fruits of the very beautiful white flowers are black. The pit of the fruit is heart-shaped, with five openings. Note: There are 3 medicinals called zho sha, which otherwise means 'strength.' The 'kidney (mkhal ma) zho sha is a type of pea. 'Liver' (mchin pa) zho sha is a seed of an arboreal fruit. 'Heart' (snying) zho sha is the pit of an arborial fruit (Dag-yig). The pit of snying zho sha is the part used in medicine.
སྙིང-རག-མ	Two different interpretations: snying sra ba'am mkhregs pa. snying nye ba. Btsan-lha.
སྙིང-རག-པ	snying nye ba. Gces 587.6.
སྙིང-གི-སྡོད-རྩ	inferior vena cava. DD illus. 20.
སྙིང-གི-འཕར-རྩ	aorta. DD illus. 20.
སྙིང-པོའི-དོན	heart concern. In MahAmudrA ought to be translated 'inner meditational dimension' or something like it. See Schaeffer, Dissert. 245, et passim, where he shows that the phrase is made to stand for the name of Saraha. In Phadampa texts, besides meaning 'inner meditational dimension,' it seems synonymous with MahAmudrA.

སོ	conservative, left unchanged, old-fashioned. Klong-chen-pa 12.9. so na, = sor. As in: sor chud, revival, restoration, making things the way they were. so gnas, keeping things the way they were. See gtad so. 'life.' See Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 317. = lo; Jahr (Alter bei Tieren). Kaschewsky2. a clan. Btsan-lha. Beginners will find the meaning 'tooth' in these words.

སོ-ན	an Indic-derived n. for gold. 17A VII pt. 1, p. 12r.4. See gser.
སོ-ནམ	In Pha-dam-pa's way of speaking, gtan gyi so nam seems to mean 'permanent chores' (in this sense, including housework). Zhi-byed Coll. II 187.6, 446.1; III 66.7. The phrase nam zhag gtan gyi so nam, 'doing regular chores day and night' may be negative, if the chores are worldly, or positive if applied to spiritual practice. nam zhag stan gya so nam dus da res la byed dgos sam mi dgos sems la lta rtog thong. Zhi-byed Coll. V 122.1.

སོ-མ-ར-ཛ	a tree. SS 420.2. JD 186. DG 203.1. KP3 341.7. KP4 567.1. = zla ba'i rdul, tsandra re kha, zla ba'i ri mo, kA la mi shi, lug nag, in dhu ra dza, zla tshes kyi rdul, su balli ka, 'dab bzang, kri SNa pha la, 'bras nag po, bA gu dzI, su ri pha lI. Mdo 493. = rus pa'i 'bras bu, na tri ma ra, mdze 'joms, so ma balli ka, zla ba'i lcug ma.
སོ-ལོ-དམར-པོ	Rhodiola, a medicinal root which has recently been placed in the small class of 'adaptogens' which increase resistance in general. Subject of a paper by Subhuti Dharmananda in a PDF file available thru the internet. While in Lhasa in the mid-90's, I enjoyed a canned drink made from the stuff, but perhaps 'enjoyed' is not quite apropos. It is curious that this name doesn't seem to be in the traditional materia medica.

སོག	a low grade of roasted barley flour. Tsarong in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 26. a clan. Btsan-lha.
སོག-བྱིལ	A jewellery item illus. in Yisun. A long earring. See Precious Deposits V 173.
སོག-ཆས	Mongolian costume illus. in Yisun.
སོག-ཁ	shoulder-bone. See Aris, Discourse 17. Mike Walter has written papers on this subject. I believe that 'originally' it refers to the 'shoulder-bone' shape of Yar-lung valley itself, the small end at the north, and the broad part at the south (See the citations from Lde'u History, Byams-ma Rig-skyob, and Yangs-rtse Klong-chen commentary by Chapel in TJ 23 no. 1 [1998] 51-52.) Haarh, Yar-lun 99, 353. sog ka'am sog kha / 'dzam bu gling gi ming. Btsan-lha. Hackin, Formulaire 7, a late Dunhuang text, has several times sogs ka as equiv. to Skt. trikoNa, 'triangle,' in a cosmological passage. I believe this is a natively Tibetan conception, which continued to exist alongside the Indic conception of the chariot (shing rta) shape of JambudvIpa.
སོག-ལེ	saw; saw (for cutting). Flick, Carrying Enemies 79. Two sorts of surgical saws are pictured in JD 279. One (item one) is an ordinary looking saw, while the second, called a 'long saw' (sog le ring po, item 2) has a long handle with a short, curved saw edge at the end.

སྤང-ལྟུང	abandoning downfalls; 'abandoning downfalls.' In vinaya, this is a class of downfalls, all of them having to do with possessions, in which one ought to give up the item, or confess the infraction, within a day of its occurrence. There are 3 groups of 10 rules in this category.

སྤར-མ	See ding khri spar ma.
སྤར-མོ	paw.
སྤར-རྐོ	par ram dpar rko ba. Btsan-lha.
སྤར-ཤད	the claw one makes with ones hands in order to scratch oneself, or a claw-shaped instrument used for the same purpose (back scratcher). Occurs as a ritual implement together with the phur pa in a Bon ritual. 192-vol. Bon Kanjur XXXIV 35r.6.
སྤར-ཐང	thag ma'i stan ring Btsan-lha.
སྤར-འཆུམས-པ	spar 'khums pa'am / ser sna can. Btsan-lha.
སྤར-ཁ-རྒྱབ	evidently means 'wrestling.' Precious Deposits V 95.
སྤར-ཐབས-སུ-སྐུར-པ-སྒྲོགས	shin tu gtum drag gi sgo nas gzhan la smod pa'am gshe ba. Btsan-lha.
སྤས-ཏོག	spen tog. Btsan-lha.
སྤེའུ	mkhar ram khang chung ngam sdong po dang ba gam sogs. Btsan-lha.

སྤེལ-ཚིག	See Beyer, index under 'appendix.'
སྤེན-ཆུང	(Amdo, Khams) = spen ma, a woody alpine shrub, about 4 ft. tall, found in red and white varieties, of which the white is used for bsangs rites. MTTP. tamarisk wood. Pabongka, Liberation II 95.
སྤེན-དཀར	shing spen ma me tog dkar po can. Nomads 242.
སྤེན-མ	JD 106. Varieties: spen nag, spen dkar. SS 518.2. Mdo 204.

སྤེང-བ	mi 'jigs pa dang rtse ba. Btsan-lha.
སཕ-ཊི-ཀ	crystal. See shel.
སྤིད-ཀ	= dpyid. "spring." Kuijp (1986) 37.
སྤིན	still another spelling for spyin, 'glue.'
སྤིང	glue (from boiled animal skins). Man LXI, no. 102 (p. 83b). = bying. "to sink, drown." Kuijp (1986) 37. See spyin.
སྤོ	rtse mo dang mthon po dang dkyi dang rmang 'gram sogs. Btsan-lha. mtha' mar rdo rje gdan gyi spo la srod la byams pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdud btul. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 541.5.
སྤོ-བླག	go gnas la 'pho 'gyur btang ba. Btsan-lha.

སྤོ-བཙས	rooftop shrine. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 141, 415. One local name for the same thing is lha gtsug.
སྤོ-བཞག	(OR spo 'jog) transfer (on government duty). Sources.
སྤོ-སེ	a small shrine. TS6 134 n. 24. Tucci, Religions 188.
སྤོ-ཐོ	a small mound of earth covered by grass (looking like a head with hair). Norbu, Drung 231, n. 2. spang rtswa sa dang bcas pa dum bur bcad pa. Nomads 242.
སྤོ-ཚིས	Bellezza, Divine Dyads 147. A kind of resin used to seal the vessel containing the mtsho rdzas (lake offering substances).
སྤོ-ཡོར	<<nad hams>> kyi ming gzhan. Dag-yig. Text 70.

སྤོབས-པ	pratibhAna; See Braarvig's article in JIABS 8 no. 1 (1985) 17-29, where he defines it as 'eloquence' (Skt. pratibhAna), one of the two main parts of rhetoric, the other being memory. spobs pa zad mi shes pas sgra gcig gis thams cad la go bar nus pa dang. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 147.1.

སྤྲིས	cream [of an egg]. TPS 712. spris ma is the 'scum' of urine, milk or yoghurt. In the case of the egg, it probably means the membrane (although generally the word for the latter is gdar sha).
སྤྲོ-བསྡུ	to fuse and diffuse (as in the projection and absorption of light in visualization practices), analysis/synthesis. Klong-chen-pa 7.8 comm.
སྤྲོད-དེབ-པ	Stein.
སྤྲོམ	dkar po'am gsal po. Btsan-lha.
སྤྲོན	myig ha cang myi che myi chung par mdun gyi bar snang spron myed dang pa'i ngos su (but here spron myed may be just sprin med!). Zhi-byed Coll. IV 30.4.
སྤྲོས-བྲལ	[= spros pa dang bral ba] undiffusive, unexpanded (beyond its natural, appropriate place). Unfissured, unviolated (integral). Applied to upper levels of meditation, where mind stays with mind. Skt. niSprapañca, aprapañca; subject to no expansion or manifoldness. spros pa'i mtshan ma spangs pa'i chos nyid. Btsan-lha. mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang stong nyid dam chos nyid. Gser Sbram 113. spros dang bral ba / spros pa ni rgya che ba'i mtshan ma dang rtog pa'i don yin la / spros dang bral ba ni mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / stong pa nyid dam chos nyid do. Gser Sbram 296.
སྤྲོས-པ	fabrication, fissured (integral). Thurman. profusion, [over]abundance, elaborations. ('conceptualization,' according to Thondup, BM 246). Germano, Poetic Thought 864. For cognates, see Beckwith in TS7 II 1049. Stein. 127 73.
སྤྲོས-བྲལ-ཟབ-མོ	stong pa nyid. Stein.

III 78.3. dran pa'i spu ris. Zhi-byed Coll. II 324.5, 325.3 (to be disentangled from the dran pa'i spu ris is the realization of the Tenth BhUmi). gnad kyi mtshang ma rig pa 'ga' zhig blo snang gi spu ris la dri mar mthong nas / rgyud la mi rtog pa 'char bar 'dod pa yod de... spu ris dri mar bltas pas / mi rtog pa mi rnyed de / chos can rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro. སྤུག	a kind of cats eye stone or coral. IN Pabongka, Liberation I 173. chab rom lo stong lon pa na gong bur chags pa'i rin po che zhig. Thousand year old ice forms balls, which are this stone. Btsan-lha.
སྤུགས	phug pa'am bu ga brtol ba. Btsan-lha.
སྤུགས-རིངས-ཤུ-ཤུ	Stein.

སྲེ-མོ	srog chags sre mong. mi dred. 367 I 233. Emmerick in G. Meulenbeld & D. Wujastyk, Studies on Indian Medical History, Motilal (Delhi 2001), pp. 62-3.
སྲེ-མོག	soot color. rang gi gdong la sre mog byugs pa de / me long gi gzugs brnyan la bsubs kyang phan med (on the lack of effectiveness of outer sciences). Gold Ms. III 92v.2. dper na snam bu dkar po dri ma med pa la sre mog la sogs pa bag tsam gos kyang. Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 315.4.
སྲེ-མོང	nakula; mongoose. See discussion in BBNP 466. A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 293. sre mo'am sgre mong. ne'u le. bsre mong. Btsan-lha. = ne'u le, rigs med (nakula). JD 248. SS 537.6. LW 464. Note that the English word mongoose is derived from a S. Indian language, probably Telugu, while the N. Indian name resembles the Tibetan transcription, ne'u le. Hobson-Jobson 596. Skt. nakula, etc.
སྲེ-མོང-སྟག-ཆུང	KP3 288.7. See (sre mo) stag chung.
སྲེ-མོང-བུ-ནད-ལངས-པ	metaphor explained in 367 II 129.4. sre mong, = ne'u le.
སྲེ-མོ-སྟག-ཆུང	See (sre mo) stag chung.
སྲེ-མོ-སྒོ-སྐྱ	? Samdo A V 241r.4.
སྲེད	JD 212.
སྲེད-མདོངས	sred pa'am chags pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲེད-དེ-ཚོལ-བ	nyan pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲེད-པ-གསུམ	tshor ba sdug bsngal / tshor ba bde ba / tshor ba btang snyoms rnams so. 600 11.
སྲེད-ཟད-པ	sred pa zad pa ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags zad pa ste. Btsan-lha.
སྲེག-པ	= tir ti ri. JD 224. SS 543.4.
སྲེག-བྱེད-ཙི-ཏ	See tsi tra ka.
སྲེལ-བ	'chang ba dang 'dzin skyong byed pa dang nya ra byed pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲེང-གིས-འགྲོ-བ	thogs gtugs med par 'gro ba. Btsan-lha. 367 I 232.
སྲི	[1] mthar byed de gshin rjes za ba'i lam srol bya ba'i gdon 'dre'i rigs shig. Btsan-lha. [2] constriction [of urinary tract], difficulty urinating. gcin cung zad re cung zad re las gtong mi thub pa'i nad rtags shig gi ming ste, bod kyi gso ba rig pa'i gzhung du <<gcin sri>>, <<gcin snyi>>, <<gcin kha sra ba>> zhes pa'i nad rtags gsum bshad yod pa'i nang gi gcin sri ba'i don. Dag-yig Text 30. Perhaps refers to prostate condition.
སྲི-བ	skyil ba. Btsan-lha. btsun chung la gtad nas srir bcug pas / btsun chung gi sri bar ma nus par / rgyags thams cad myur du zad de. Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum I 74.2.
སྲི-དར	gnod byed dam nyams byed dar ba. Btsan-lha.
སྲི-ཁ	sri kha lang ba. to meet one's fate. Karmay, Treasury.
སྲི-ཕུང	gnod byed dang nyams byed. Btsan-lha.
སྲི-ཞུ	'reverence' (for elders, parents, etc.). Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 317. As translation of a sinitic concept, see Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163, 195. khrus dang sku mnye dang dril phyis byed pa. bka' drin bsam nas bkur sti byed pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲི-ཤིང-རྣ-མ	See (sri shing) rna ma.
སྲི-མ-ར	See mdzo rgod.
སྲིའུ	the only surviving child. Skorupski, TA.. bu chung. khye'u. Btsan-lha.
སྲིའུ-གསོ-བ	phru gu'am khye'u'i nyer spyod byas pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲིབས-པ	O.T. = bsgribs pa. = grib ri. = mtshan mo. Blan 290.6-291.1. bsgribs pa. grib ri. mtshan mo. Btsan-lha.
སྲིབས-ཤིང-སྣང-མ	See (sribs shing) snang ba.

སྲིད-རྒྱས-པ	the whole universe.

སྲིད-པ-ཆགས-པའི-ལྷ-དགུ	'o de gung rgyal la bu brgyad byung ste / yar lha sham po / gnyan chen thang lha / rma chen spom ra / sgyogs chen ldong ra / sgam po lha rje / zhogs lha rgyug po / jo bo g.yul rgyal / she'u kha rag rnams so // 'di dag stod mnga' ris skor gsum dang / bar dbus gtsang ru bzhi / smad mdo khams sgang gsum ste bod kyi stod smad bar gsum la gnas pa'o. 600 125-126.

སྲིན-ཞུགས	srin bus zos pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲིན-གྱི-མེ	'bu srin sdom. sdom 'bu dang 'dra zhing des mi la so btab na mi ring bar smyos nas 'chi ba zhig yod pa de'i ming. Btsan-lha. A bug with a poisonous bite, in more recent language called sdom, q.v., 'spider' (see Yisun).
སྲིན-ནད-སེལ-བྱེད-དུད-པ	a medicinal preparation. BP 378.5.

སྲིན-ལྷམ-བྱ-མགོ	a style of felt boots. Terrone in TS9 VIII 223.
སྲིན-བུའི-རིགས-བརྒྱད-ཁྲི	Monks are supposed to think while they eat that they are feeding the 80,000 'worms' that inhabit their bodies. Silk, Dissert. 350.
སྲིན-བུ-པད-པ	chu nang gi 'bu mi'i nad khrag 'jib cing zungs khrag 'jib mi 'dod pa'i 'bu zhig. Btsan-lha. Leech.

སྲིན-བུ-ལྡན-བུ	'bu yi bye brag srin bu me khyer. Btsan-lha.

སྲིན-ཤིང-སྣ-མ	JD 97. SS 466.1. DG 208.1. = blangs pa, dza la dkar po, stag chung ba, stag bu chung. Mdo 521.
སྲིན-ལག-རྒྱབ-རྩ	DD illus. 23.
སྲིང-གདན	kha gdan. Nomads 252.
སྲིང-མོ	sister; sister. T.-B. cognates in Beyer, CT Lang 86.
སྲིང-རྒྱུད	chest. ZZ = brang. Bru II 292.1. Looks very much like pring rgyud, the ZZ word for Tib. yi dags.
སྲིས-མ	A word used in Ye-khri cycle (192-vol. Bon Kanjur CI 793) instead of the more usual spris ma. sgo nga'i sris mas bsgribs nas phur mi shes pa" 'unable to fly because covered by the film/scum of the egg.' For a similar difference, compare srin, for sprin, above.
སྲིས-སེ	gron chung dang ser sna byas pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲོ	courage, cheerfulness. Thondup, EL 122. yi mug gam yi chad pa'am dpa' zhum pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲོ-གང	O.T. = khrus. = dku mnye. = dril phyi. = me. = stan. Also, bsro khang. Blan 294.4. khrus dang dku mnye dang dril phyis dang stan dang me'i reg bya bcas bsten sa'i khang pa. Btsan-lha.

སྲོད-འཇིང	srod dus kyi 'jing ngam srod dkyil. sa rub pa. Btsan-lha.
སྲོག	life(force). probably ultimately related to bsreg and sro & other words connected with heat. T&BS I 335. An old article by R.A. Stein studies this word, among others.
སྲོག-འཛིན	one of the rlung lnga. Text 56.
སྲོག-བསླུ	Tshe thar means the animal belonging to oneself that is set free, while srog bslu is the animal bought from another for this purpose. Holler in TS9 II 218.
སྲོག-གཏད	to entrust one's lifeforce (to a deity, master, etc.). An initiatory act for followers of the Rdo-rje-shugs-ldan neo-traditionalism. In wider tradition, it was something done by a worldly spirit in the presence of the VajrayAna master, such as Padmasambhava (and not a kind of oath of fealty by a human to a spirit).
སྲོག-མཁར	Nine Ways 31.
སྲོག-ནོར	ransom (in return for someone's life). Sources.
སྲོག-ཕོངས	"life-concern, concern for the preservation of one's life." Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 318.
སྲོག-རླུང	snying dang srog rtsa'i nad cig gi ming ste, nad rtags ni smyo 'bog sogs byed. Dag-yig.

སྲུབ-མ	See tsa ta ra.
སྲུབ-པ	the fire stick or the churning stick. rdzas ma 'tshogs pa'i srub pas mye myi thon. Zhi-byed Coll. I 271.5.
སྲུབ-ཤིང	Skorupski, TA.
སྲུབ-ཐག	rdza'i 'khor lo srub thag ma then bar. Not to pull a churning rope on a potter's wheel. Zhi-byed Coll. I 279.7. rdza mkhan 'khor lo skor tsam na gzhan gyi bya ba myi nyan ste / srub thag chad na nyan srid (a potter turning his wheel won't hear of other business, but perhaps if you were to cut his turning rope he could hear you). Ibid. I 424.3. 'khor lo'i srub thag chad pa'i rdza mkhan blo sems bde'. Ibid. I 313.6.
སྲུབས	'seam' or seamlike joining of two halves of tongue, organ, etc., in medicine. Related to 'drub pa, to sew. Velm I 68. kun dga' sgong nga la bsrubs ni myed rnam par shes pa gang nas zhugs na gsung ([Pha-dam-pa] said, "Kunga, if the egg has no seams how does the consciousness enter into it?"). Zhi-byed Coll. II 169.5.
སྲུལ	rul ba. ri sul lta bu'i shur can. Btsan-lha.
སྲུལ-པོ	Beyer 342.
སྲུན-པ	tame (an animal). glang chen smyon pa myi rtse yan du bcug pas srun. Zhi-byed Coll. I 312.3. glang po che smyon pa ma bsgul na bsrun gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 177.2.
སྲུང-མདུད	knotted protection cord (blessing cords with mantraized knots tied into them by a holy person). ye shes rnam lnga'i rang bzhin skud pa la // yi dam lha'i bsrung mdud byas nas su // rten 'brel snying pos rab tu gnas pa bya gang la brtags pa don dang ldan par byed. Zhi-byed Coll. I 88.6. The origin of the practice is perhaps to be found in the lay custom of tying on threads or strips of monastic robes.
སྲུང-མཁན	guard. Flick, Carrying Enemies 110.
སྲུངས-རྟ	Norbu, Drung 258, n. 4.

སྟག-རལ	See under dong pa (BBNP 467).
སྟག-རུ	? Haarh, Yar-lun 202, 209.
སྟག-སྦྲང	hornet; hornet. Norbu, Drung 48.
སྟག-ཤ	JD 169. SS 456.3. KP1 34.2. KP4 387.4n. TM IV 64. Oxytropis falcata Bunge. Mdo 149 & color plate.
སྟག-ཤར	full grown youth; a full grown youth. skyes pa dar ma. Dagyab. See also Chödag. Note that dman shar means 'maiden.'
སྟག-ཤུན	'tiger skin.' silk with pattern of rgyan bzhi minus the water & rocks. Velm I 137.
སྟག-སྨན	(Amdo Khams) men & women, or boys & girls (stag shar = men, mo sman = women). MTTP.
སྟག-ཚེར	n. of a herb. Beyer 290. See ga bra. = kaNDa ka ri smug po. YTTM 291.18. red raspberry, etc. Clifford, list.
སྟག-ཟིལ	bhin 'du gnyis rtseg stag zil gyi 'od can la dmyigs pa gtad de. Zhi-byed Coll. III 76.1. stag zil lta bur gnas pa'o. Zhi-byed Coll. I 53.7. rtag zil la dung gi mdog re ba lta bu'o. Zhi-byed Coll. V 238.3 (here it is saying that changing the usual mind in old age is like changing the color of the rtag zil to white). SS 414.1: stag zil mdangs ser la sul mang ba dang / mdangs ser la sna ring zhing mnyen pa dang gsum 'byung bas tsha ba rgyas pa rnams thog babs su gsod cing / lus la yun ring du rnying shing zhen pa'i tsha ba rnams rtsad nas 'byin no. The dictionaries are no help with this, but my present guess is that it is some kind of quite colorful shelled sea creature with a name meaning 'brilliant tiger' which suggests that it had tigerlike stripes.
སྟག-ཆུང-བ	See srin shing sna ma.
སྟག-ཆུང-དམར-ཁྲ	See byang pa.
སྟག-བུ-ཆུང	See srin shing sna ma.
སྟག-རུ-པ	See bong rna ba.
སྟག-ཟིལ-ག-བུར	JD 72.
སྟག-སླག-ཅན	stag lpags kyi gos can. Nomads 238.
སྟག-གི-མདེལ-རྫི	mda' kha 'tsho mkhan. Nomads 238.
སྟག-གི-སྡེར-མོ	See ti lo.
སྟག-གི-སྤར-ཐབས	'jal byed kyi tshad bye brag pa zhig. Btsan-lha.
སྟག-གི-ཐོག-བུ	sngar btsan po'i dus rabs su dpa' bo rnams la stsal pa'i chas shig. Btsan-lha.
སྟམས-ལས-བཅད-པ	Also, stams las gcod pa. "oppression." Coblin in JAOS 111, p. 316.
སྟན	Stein.
སྟན-པ	Original entry: [mgar ba'i] stan pa. = gtan pa. anvil, Amboss. Kretsch. stan pa'i 'og na ni sgo gtan gyi 'og na. Dpe-chos 517. zin pa stan par byas pa seng ge stod la gnan pa lta bu / stan pa las su rung ba rdza la so btang ba lta bu. Zhi-byed Coll. II 476.5.
སྟན-སྟོན	bod kyi stan ston rnams phyogs cig tu zhe thag pa nas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 264.7.
སྟན-གླིངས-པ	nang tshangs can ma yin pa'i phying gdan. Btsan-lha.
སྟང	gzhu stang 'gengs ni gzhu la mda'i stongs sprad de 'gengs pa. Dpe-chos 513.
སྟང-པོ	stag shar ram skyes pa. Btsan-lha.
སྟང-ཟིལ	See lig bu mig. JD 48. SS 405.1. DG 127.3.
སྟངས	Art und Weise. ZAS VII 474.
སྟངས-དབྱལ	See de Jong in IIJ 31 (1988) 164. Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 163, 194, where one also finds the pair sribs gdags. May represent the Chinese concept of yin-yang, or a still more ancient Sino-Turkic-Tibetan concept. Occurs in the Bsam-yas bell inscription. Often found in Bon texts. The stangs is the 'male' and the dbyal is the 'female.'
སྟངས-ཞལ	yab yum mam khyo shug gi zhe sa. Btsan-lha. Seems same as stangs dbyal, q.v.
སྟངས-ཞན	dbyibs ngan pa. Gces 583.2. dbyibs ngan pa. byed stangs mi legs pa. Btsan-lha. weak position? 'o na pan tri ta stangs re zhan na zhus pas / stangs zhan pa dang de men kyang mang gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 318.4.
སྟངས-ཤེས-ཐོས-པ	glo bur du rna bar lhang nger thos pa. Btsan-lha.
སྟར-བུ	Hippophae, a medicinal fruit which has recently been placed in the small class of 'adaptogens' which increase resistance in general. Subject of a paper by Subhuti Dharmananda in a PDF file in the internet. JD 94. KP1 110.6. KP3 280.2. KP4 446.4. Varieties: tar dkar, tar nag. TM IV 61, 94. A tree. SS 423.1. Mdo 152. = gla ba tsher ma, gle tsher, 'tshas tsher. DFG 206.1.
སྟར-བྱང	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 53. Lag-len 35.3. TMC 65 (146).
སྟར-ག	See star ka. = star 'bras. JD 102. DG 211.5. KP3 345.5. Walnut? T&BS I 333, n. 66.
སྟར-ཀ	walnut; walnut tree. Haarh, Yar-lun 124, in the phrase: mtsho la star ka byas nas yur bar drang ba dang. Haarh takes it to mean flood-gates by fixing it to stor kha, and relating it to stor khung (this is just too many steps to follow!). Aziz 32. See tar ka.
སྟར-བུ-ལྔ-པ	a medicinal preparation. BT 54v.4. BP 216.3. TM IV 62.
སྟར-བུ-བཅུ-དགུ	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 114. Lag-len 83.2. TMC 61 (136). BP 257.4.
སྟར-བུ-བཅུ-གཅིག	a medicinal preparation. bP 257.5.
སྟེ-པ	See under gte pa.
སྟེ-ཁ-འདྲ-བ	medical implement in the class of 'spoons' (thur ma). JD 278 (item 4).
སྟེའུ-འདྲ	medical implement in class of 'spoons' (thur ma). JD 278 (item 3).
སྟེའུ-ཀ-མ	sta re chung ba. Btsan-lha.
སྟེག-པ	sgeg pa. Btsan-lha.

སྟེགས	As a form of 'deg pa, q.v. See Chödag.

སྟེགས-ཤིང	a part of a loom. See Dag-yig 325.

སྟེངས-ན	Stein.
སྟེས	legs pa. stabs legs pa. Btsan-lha.

སྟིར-མེད	mnar med. Btsan-lha.
སྟོ	See so sto. Blan 304.5. See mi sto ba. Gces 586.2. Samdo A V 120r.3, 120v.5 (here in negative form, mi sto). mi sto / gnod pa med pa'am skyon mi snang ba. Gser Sbram 78. sna tshogs dkar dmar 'khrugs kyang mi sto. Zhi-byed Coll. V 272.4 (also, 273.1).
སྟོ-བ	khrid pa. Btsan-lha. ci yang mi sto, it doesn't at all matter, it makes no difference. See under mi sto. See under to.
སྟོ-ཀ	O.T. Skt. = chung ngu. Blan 307.2. chung ngu'am cung zad. Btsan-lha.

སྟོབ-པ	O.T. = 'brim pa. = ster ba. = mgron du gnyer ba. See also bstabs pa. Blan 287.2.

སྟོབས	1. rgya khyon stobs. 2. khu ba. Blan 528.
སྟོབས-བཅུ	gnas dang gnas yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs / mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs / khams sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs rnams so. 600 150. Germano, Poetic Thought 943. Lopez, Heart SUtra Explained, p. 195, n. 42 (has further refs.). IN Pabongka, Liberation I 151, n. 95. Listed in 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 579.
སྟོབས-བསྐྱེད	See gangs sbal. See dbang lag.
སྟོབས-བཞི	Thondup, EL 120, 151 n. 6. Pabongka, Liberation I 208. Sobisch, Dissert. lists these in his chap. 9: [1] rten gyi stobs (reliance). [2] rnam par sun 'byin pa'i stobs (repentance). [3] nyes pa las slar ldog pa (not repeating the fault). [4] gnyen po kun tu spyod pa (antidote). These are for repairing transgressions of bodhisattva vows.
སྟོབས-ལྔ	blo sbyong las 'byung ba'i stobs lnga ni / sa bon gyi stobs / 'phen pa'i stobs / sun 'byin pa'i stobs / goms pa'i stobs / smon lam gyi stobs rnams so. 600 62.

སྟོད	mi phyugs kyi lus kyi lte ba yan gyi ming ste. Dag-yig.
སྟོད-འགག	name for the monastic vest, also called rgyan drug, q.v.

སྟོང-འབྱམས	stong 'byams lhags pa 'gam ni lag stong du 'khyams te rlung 'gam pa. Dpe-chos 517.
སྟོང-གསལ	void-clarity. Klong-chen-pa 5.11 comm.
སྟོང-གསུམ	Germano, Poetic Thought 831.
སྟོང-གཟུགས	Seems to me it often refers to visionary phenomena, signs of spiritual development (as in KAlacakra) and the like. Hartzell, Dissert. 717, says it is a Tibetan translation of sUkSma-zarIra, 'subtle body.' While admitting that such a translation might have some meaning, generally speaking I believe it doesn't hold.
སྟོང-ཁ	notch of the arrow. Tucci, Religions 178.
སྟོང-ལྡབ	perhaps a different spelling for stongs gdab pa, q.v. mi lus stong ldab byas. Zhi-byed Coll. II 447.4. nor bu'i gling du tshud nas stong ldab ma byed. Ibid. II 448.5.
སྟོང-ལྟ	Stein.
སྟོང-ཕུར	In Zhi-byed Coll., often seems to be a misspelling (or alternative spelling, since subscript 'ga' is often replaced with superscript 'sa' in this manuscript) for gtod phur, q.v. khyim gyi bya ba spong dgos te / 'di 'khor ba'i stod phur yin pas. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 118.5.
སྟོང-རྭ	rtsa lam sbyong ba'i sngon du bsgom bya zhig. Dagyab.
སྟོང-སྐུད	(coll.) = gos skud, silk thread. MTTP. Nomads 238.
སྟོང-སྟོང	tausendfach. Kretsch.
སྟོང-ཐུན	Cabezon translates it 'dose of emptiness.' It may mean 'a thousand sessions, thousand doses.' Dudjom, Nyingma History, p. 655, translates it as 'Lecture notes.' Almogi, MA thesis 16, shows that this is used by Rong-zom-pa.
སྟོང-ཚད	SRZT 46. TM II 68.

སུབ	In the phrase je sub je subs: more and more erased, progressively wiped away. Samdo A III 188r.5; V 86v.1. chu bo snyogs pas [~rnyog pas] gzugs snyan [~gzugs brnyan] subs. 'Erase the image with dirty water!' Zhi-byed Coll. I 306.4.
སུབས-ཀྱིས	res bder gshegs su yang 'ong gi gda' ste subs kyi 'gro'i gda'. Zhi-byed Coll. II 343.3.
སུད-སུད	sound of wind. MTTP.
སུག	a 'secret' way of saying the number 'three,' used by gamblers. Norbu, Drung 229, n. 65.
སུག-བྲིས	handwritten.
སུག-བརྔན	lag gis bslu ched kyi rgyu nor sprad pa. Btsan-lha.
སུག-བཞི	legs of quadruped. MTTP.
སུག-དཀར	ba lu me tog dkar po can. Nomads 252.
སུག-མེལ	lesser cardamom, deriv. from Skt. sUkSmelA (compound of sUkSma and elA). Blan 312.4.
སུག-ནག	ba lu me tog nag po can. Nomads 252.
སུག-པ	O.T. = lag pa. BBNP 483. lag pa. rkang pa. Btsan-lha. a plant used for washing. TR 14 no. 4, p. 16. Das, JTL&CT 100. JD 167. SS 517.6.
སུག-ཕ	O.T. = lag pa. Blan 288.4.
སུག-པོ	rta'i bde lag bskyod par byed pa sug po yin te. Zhi-byed Coll. V 424.6.
སུག-རྒྱ	Scherrer-Schaub in TH&L 434. phyag rgya'am lag rgya. Btsan-lha.
སུག-སྦྱིན	lag pas sbyin pa. Btsan-lha. lags pas sbyin pa yin nam. Eimer, Dbyangs 58.
སུག-སྨེལ	cardamon. Clifford, list. JD 75. = sikmil, seg brda', sukmel, tri pi ti. YTTM 291.14. = se dang ris. YTTM 292.22. a tree. SS 416.6. LW 459 (a kind of cardamon). lesser cardamon. TM I 50. DG 150.3. TM IV 61. = e la rtsi. JD 75: There are 3 types: Indian, Himalayan & Chinese. The Indian variety is 'triangular' with a 'hooked' tip. The Chinese type is fairly round while the Himalayan is oblong. DG 150.3 considers the Indian variety to be the best for medicine. Sde-srid/2 416.6: Although not found in the botanicals ('khrungs dpe), it is what is currently called e la phra mo (tiny cardamon). The trunk is black or green when young. The 'beans' (gong bu) are white and 'triangular' (zur gsum). Skt. sUkSmelA. Fundamentals 15.3 (item 16). This term covers several smaller varieties of cardamons. Amomum amarum, Eleltaria cardamomum, etc. Slovar' 50, 259. Singh 59. Hübotter1 60.

ཏ-ཀི	'dod pa. It is a word for sexual union in Rgyal-mo-rong language. Btsan-lha.
ཏ-ལ	As in: ta la sbyin. O.T. deriv. from Skt. ta la (tala?). = sgron me (the tree?). Blan 309.4. ta la'i sdong po bregs na mgo rtsa gnyis ka skam. Zhi-byed Coll. I 310.1. See bu ram. See spos dkar.
ཏ-རེ	zhal 'gyur ta re ni zhal 'gyur sgrol ma. BBNP 477. For use following verbs as a 'warning particle,' see Beyer, CT Lang, pp. 355-356, in which case it might be translated 'beware.' Note also the form nor ra re. H.H. said it means 'undoubtedly.'

ཏ-ཊི-བྷ	bya tri tri zhes pa'i tshang rgya mtsho'i 'gram na yod pa rgya mtsho'i rlabs kyis tshang dang sgo nga rgya mtsho'i nang du khyer ro // der bya des rgya mtsho zad par 'dod nas gshog pas rgya mtsho'i chu phyir 'bo bas / drang srong zhig na re dud 'gro mthu chung ba rgya mtsho la ci byar yod zhes khrel rgod byas pa la / bya khyung de na yod pa thos nas khros te gshog pa gcig gis rgya mtsho bkab / gcig nam mkha' la 'phyar bas klu rnams skrag ste / tshang dang sgo nga de ma thag phyir bton te btad do zhes grags pas bya tri tri zhes pa deng sang yul skad la bya dru dru zhes pa che chung phug ron tsam mdog skya bo zhig yod pa de yin nam snyam. ཏ-ལ-ལ	O.T. = sgron me. Blan 296.1. mar me 'bar ba lta bu zhes bya ba mar me zad kar rtse mo ta la la 'gro ba lta bu'i snang ba 'byung ngo. "an appearance called 'like a burning butter-lamp.' It is like the sputtering point of a butter-lamp flame when it is about to go out." Lati Rinbochay, Death 38.

ཐ-བ	O.T. = rengs pa. Blan 287.4. hard sterile [ground]. Samdo A VI 7v.3, ff. fallow, unplowed [ground]. Samdo A V 23v.6 (but note likewise that tha rgod occurs on p. 24r.1). nyon mongs pa chags sdang gti mug gi tha ba gsum. sa zhing rengs pa'am sra mkhregs can. Btsan-lha. like hard rough ground. Stein. yid ches dad pa'i sa gzhi 'di // nyon mongs kyi tha bar ma gzhag cing ang. Zhi-byed Coll. III 16.1. yon tan gyi chu ma chags na gdul bya'i tha ba myi 'bangs / gdul bya'i tha ba ma bangs na smon lam gyi rtsi myi 'khrung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 306.1. sems kyi tha ba nyes pa'i gzhi bcom zhing. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 339.4.

ཐ-ལིང	a tha ling tha ling tha ling lang. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 340.5.
ཐ-ན	police station, a Hindi term used in Havnevik, Dissertation 177, Hobson-Jobson 896. See Jaeschke for other meanings.
ཐ-རམ	[1] O.T. = ngan pa. Blan 286.3. [2] For tha rams, q.v.. Occurs in title of a book of Stag-bla Padma-ma-ti (1591-1637), Dri-ba Lung-gi Tha-ram, pub. 1985, a zhu lan text. [3] the herb. = be khur. JD 196. SS 489.4. KP1 39.1. KP3 255.6. KP4 391.5. YTTM 293.17. = a sha. YTTM 292.19. Mdo 158.
ཐ-རམས	gang ba'am gtams pa. 'ching thag. Namdak. Btsan-lha. O.T. = gtams pa. Blan 289.6. This word is used at the beginning of the main text of the Gab-pa dgu skor, where none of these or other meanings found in the dictionaries work. Here is a sample sentence: nyon rmongs tha rams sngon po dam // de 'byed 'phrul gyi lde mig stor // "[To] the solid blue lock (?) of negativities [we have] lost the miraculous key that opens it." This word is also found in the Gsang-ba Bsen-thub. Also found in Bon vinaya text (192-vol. Bon Kanjur CLXXIV 252): tha ram btsan byed lde mig rnyed bzhin dga' ba'o. Have located it in an early collection of Zhi-byed works: tha rams myi 'byed pa'i lde dmyig la dgos pa myi gda' gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 168.1 (for example). This word is actually preserved in Darma language as tarum, 'key' (Shree Krishan's article in Nagano & LaPolla, eds., New Research on Zhangzhung, p. 394).
ཐ-རེ	thar pa. Btsan-lha.
ཐ-རེངས	Stein.
ཐ-རྒོད	wild & uncultivated ground. Samdo A V 2v.1. rang rgyud tha rgod dul na rin chen mchog tu 'gyur. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 177.5.

ཐ-སྐར	KB 30.1.
ཐ-སྙད	technical terms. words designating what they cannot 'point to,' i.e., a conventionally accepted designation for something that is beyond verbalizations. "Conventions." Thurman. Stein.
ཐ-ཐད	tha dad de gcig ma yin pa so so ba'i don. Gser Sbram 136.

ཐ-ཚིག	O.T. = tshig gi don. Blan 285.6. Karmay, Great Perfection 46, 57, 58. Acc. to Jinpa, it means 'final word,' and is therefore used in the sense of 'this is the real meaning of the whole thing' (after various positions have been discussed).

ཐག	as used to form comparatives or superlatives, see under chung thag (BBNP 469).
ཐག-བཞུར	rope sliding. "rGyal-mkhar-thag-bzhur, sky rope sliding." An extreme sport practiced in Lhasa, sometimes witnessed by travellers. Precious Deposits V 86.

ཐག-ཀ	'brog mi tshos lug 'o 'jo ba'i tshe bzhon lug rnams kyi mgo bo rnams phan tshun du bsnol te thag khug 'grol chog tu bzos pa'i bar du bcings pa. Nomads 266. The way nomads tie together their sheep or goats for milking.

ཐག-གི-ཐུག-གི	touching here and there. Soundings 29.
ཐགས-ཁྲི	Loom. For drawing with parts labelled, see Dag-yig 325. Illus. in back of Yisun.
ཐགས-རན	O.T. = btags pa. Blan 293.4. gos btags pa. Btsan-lha.
ཐགས-ཟངས	snam bu thags pa'i shing. Btsan-lha.
ཐལ	ZZ = dpyi. Bru II 291.4. See under mo thal. Coming at the end of a statement in debate (or debate-like compositions), it indicates the logical consequence ('It would follow that'). It is usually followed by a statement ending in phyir, which indicates the reason. As a mineral, called rdo thal, = bya rdo, zho rdo, rdo zhun. JD 53. SS 409.4. = tshos rdo, zhun rdo, brag rdo, rdo dkar. DG 133.5.
ཐལ-འབྲས	See a shwa gandha.
ཐལ-འཆག	thal ba 'phyag pa dang chu 'chag btab pa. Btsan-lha.
ཐལ-འགྱུར	Inference. N. of an Ati-yoga Tantra often quoted in Klong-chen-pa.
ཐལ-བ	consequence. Skt. prasaGga. Thurman. 'bad med du grol bar thal ba'i phyir ro. Since it would be absurd that (they) be effortlessly liberated. Lati Rinbochay, Death 47.
ཐལ-བྱི	A mammal. See Sandberg, Tibet 299.
ཐལ-དཀར	whitish grey. See glang po che.
ཐལ-དྲེས	See ba sgrub.
ཐལ-གྲོལ	unhindered; unhindered. Thondup, BM 363.
ཐལ-ཁ	ash colour, grey. glang chen thal ka ni glang chen dkar po. Utpal 16.3.
ཐལ-ལེ	Stein.
ཐལ-མོ	'Palm.' The length of the palm and fingers, synonym of cha chen. Jackson.
ཐལ-ཕྲན	lcags gzer. Btsan-lha.
ཐལ-ཕྱིར	It follows... because. Dreyfus, Sound 208.
ཐལ-སྦྱོར	As in: bdud rtsi thal sbyor. This is a mistaken translation of the original Indian language, which should be rendered: bdud rtsi thab sbyor. Blan 311.4-.5.
ཐལ-སྔོན	bluish grey. Jackson.
ཐལ-སྤྱོད	See mtha' dpyod.
ཐལ-ཏྲེས	See lug ru smug po. Indian sarsaparilla. Clifford, list.
ཐལ-ཚ	JD 71. SS 431.3.
ཐལ-བ-ལྔ	a class of medicinals. KB 48.5.
ཐལ-མོ-ཇབ-ལྗབ-པོ	thal mo'i nang cung zad khong stong du gyur pa. Btsan-lha.

ཐམས-ཀྱིས-སོང-བ	ngo bo dbyer med du song ba. Btsan-lha.

ཐམས-སུ-བཅུག	dong du bcug pa'am / btson du bcug pa. Btsan-lha.
ཐན	les signes imprécatoires. Karmay in JA (1995) 166. An impurity derived from bad omens. TS6 131. This may perhaps be a 'hidden' borrowing from Skt. tandrI (bad omens seen in dreams). As ex. of an irreg. Old Tantra term, corresponding to phrin, see the work of Dge-rtse in Rnying Rgyud 1973 XXXVI 455. lan ['response']. Btsan-lha. May also mean drought (see than pa).
ཐན-འབྱེད	ltas ngan. Btsan-lha.
ཐན-འགྲོགས	than 'grogs dka' thub la gyis. Zhi-byed Coll. II 453.7.
ཐན-འཁོར	nye 'khor. Btsan-lha.
ཐན-ཀོར	O.T. = nye 'khor. Blan 294.3. Also, than skor. Blan 298.3.
ཐན-པ	drought; drought. spu rangs kyi chu 'di than pa'i dus su 'byung par 'dug gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 163.4.
ཐན-སྐོར	drung ngam rgyal phran. nye 'khor. Btsan-lha. See than kor.
ཐན-སྐྱེལ	= 'phrin skyel ba. "to deliver a letter, message." Kuijp (1986) 37.
ཐན-ཐུན	bka' gdams kyi chos than thun thos mod kyang des ma tshim. Las-chen, Chos-'byung II 228.6. than thun gyi mi slongs slongs cig slongs na bar chad cho 'phrul shin tu che ba 'ong gsung. 64 I 79.2.
ཐན-ཡན	phyi'i bar chad la smon pa thang yan gyi rtul shugs kyis. Zhi-byed Coll. V 381.7 (also, 382.4).
ཐང	khro mi thang ni khro mi dgos. BBNP 470. 'decoction' (boiled down to 1/3 its original volume). 'dose.' TM IV 108. A porcelain mark on cups made at Thang-po-che (hence the thang) during the Sa-skya rule. Rinchen Sandhutsang, 'Tibetan Porcelain,' Tibet Soc. Newsletter no. 12 (Fall 1984).
ཐང-བཀྲངས	sbang thang bkrams pa ni gos chu la sbang ba thang la bkram pa. Dpe-chos 508.
ཐང-ཆུ	decoction? DG 243.6. tree resin. Chayet in Facets 74.
ཐང-དཀར	ISTS 40. Bellezza, Divine Dyads 419, where it is a mythical white bird, sometimes used as mount of Bon deities. See go bo.
ཐང-གཡེ	sa cha ri med pa'am thang kha rgya che ba. Btsan-lha.
