ཐི-གི	chung chung ngam cung zhig. Btsan-lha.
ཐི-གུ	evidently a diminutive of thag, "rope." See under the gu, as well as thig gu. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 546.2. bya rkang la thi gu btags pa dang 'dra bar slar yang ngan song dang 'khor bar ltung ba las. Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum IV 488.4.
ཐི-ཐོར-ཀོ-ཐོར	Seems to mean 'everyone out for their own gain.' Vitali, Tho.ling 48.
ཐིའུ	See under the'u.
ཐིབ-བུ	mun pa. Btsan-lha.
ཐིབ-ནོན	rdib kyis non pa. Btsan-lha.
ཐིབ-བྲེག-པ	pickpocket. French, Yoke 258.
ཐིབ-སེ-ཐིབ	flattern (Lautmalerei). Kaschewsky 83.
ཐིག-འཕགས	rtsed mo zhig. Nomads 339, 271.
ཐིག-ཆེན	major proportional class; major proportional class. Jackson.
ཐིག-གུ	thig. Gces 581.6. dbu skra la thig gu btags. 602 20r.6. lham la thig gu ser po zhig btags nas btang bas. Lo-ras-pa, Gsung-'bum II 227.2. See thi gu.
ཐིག-ཁང	proportional grid of exactly positioned lines; proportional grid of exactly positioned lines. Jackson.
ཐིག-ལེ	bindu; drop, spot. Skt. tilaka, freckle, sesame seed, mark worn (in India) on the forehead; bindu, generally meaning 'drop,' like a 'drop' of water. May mean 'spot,' like a 'spot' of land, or a leopard's 'spot.' It also means the numerical zero which, like the form of the numeral actually used in Arabic, is shaped like a spot, or dot. Also means reproductive substances of male and female (this meaning generally restricted to medical analogies or contexts). "sphere, bead." Norbu, Cycle. a) small circle. b) disc. c) centre, nucleus, focus of attention. d) essence, germ. MTTP. seminal nuclei. Germano in JIABS 17 no. 2 (1994) 307 & elsewhere. Gyatso, Apparitions 193.
ཐིག-མ	a lesser grade of more coarse woolen material. Tsarong in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 27.
ཐིག-ཕྲན	Germano, Poetic Thought 910.
ཐིག-རྐུད	chalk line. Jackson.
ཐིག-རྐྱལ	powder bag for chalk line; powder bag for chalk line. Jackson.
ཐིག-སྒམ	rtsed mo zhig. Nomads 238, 270. A kind of knotted rope pulling game.
ཐིག-ཤིང	ruler, wooden straightedge. Jackson.
ཐིག-སྐུད	Beyer 265.
ཐིག-ཚད	proportions of a figure laid out with the aid of lines; proportions of a figure laid out with the aid of lines. Jackson.
ཐིག-ནག-འབམ	Text 46.
ཐིག-ལེའི-ལུས	1. sbrul. 2. gzig. Blan 528.
ཐིག-ལེ-བཞི	sgom pa'i thig le bzhi ni / snying ga'i thig le / nor bu'i thig le / sprul pa'i thig le / mi shigs pa'i thig le'o. 600 47.

ཐིང	pünktlich; (ein Ziel) treffen; (zeit od. Entfernung) abschätzen. Kretsch.. (mod.) < Ch. ting. Government department or office at the level of a province or autonomous region. Barnett, Resistance.

ཐོ-བ	for various types of hammers, see Schmied 145. Namdak. skal myed log lta skye ba 'khor bar 'khyam du tho ba yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 307.3. Compare Hindi hathau.dI.
ཐོ-བོ	'marker stones' placed in the way of the groom; at each one he must answer the song of the marriage broker. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 70. There are supposed to be 80, but these are represented by 17 actual stones.
ཐོ-ཆེམས	testimentary record. Sources.
ཐོ-ཆོ	See under tho co.
ཐོ-ཅོ	gang la'ang 'dzem dogs mi byed pa. 367 II 132.1. Samdo A III 307r.2 (used 3 times; once spelled tho cho), 307v.2; V 51v.6. Namdak. spyi brtol lam spobs pa. Dagyab. shameless or bold. See Snellgrove's vocab. tho co sna tshogs ma yin pa. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 317.3.

ཐོད	See gar thod. gtod pa'am sprod pa. Btsan-lha. Stein.
ཐོད-དཀར	As a possible spelling for the thug kar spirits, see Norbu, Drung 51.
ཐོད-གྲི	gos sogs 'dra byed kyi gri dang gri khug. Btsan-lha.
ཐོད-རྡིང	dbu'i gtsug tor. Btsan-lha.
ཐོད-རྒལ	Crossover. A 'leap-over' on the Path to Enlightenment. A special practice of Ati-yoga. Klong-chen-pa 8.9 comm. Rnying Rgyud 1982 I 685.6. Germano, Poetic Thought 841. Gyatso, Apparitions 301-2. Guenther, Buddhist Philosophy 230, n. 23. This term appears in the Abhidharmako'sa. See the English version, p. 968, where 'phar, Skt. pluta, 'jumper,' cognate to English 'float,' is one who is able to leap over, without abiding in, the intermediate states. The text of the commentary also defines the 'half-jumper' (ardhapluta, phyed-'phar). The term thod-rgal itself occurs in Abhidharmakoza, chap. 8 (English version, p. 1248, where it is translated 'transitional absorption'). lar gang zag dbang po rab thod rgal du grol ba yang yod. Zhi-byed Coll. II 320.3. snying rje thod rgal du skye ba yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 264.5.
ཐོད-རྒྱལ	go rim steng nas rgal ba'am rim pa 'chol ba. Btsan-lha.
ཐོད-ཐོད	gang byung mang byung. Gces 582.4. ci thod thod ni rung rung ngam ci byung byung. BBNP 466. ci thod thod ni ci byung byung ngam ci rung rung dang ci phrad phrad sogs kyi ming. Dpe-chos 509. Btsan-lha. gang thod thod du. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) V 480.5 (481.1: gar thod thod bzlas pas).
ཐོད-ཏོ	mgo skra gyen du bcings pa'i thor cog. Btsan-lha.
ཐོད-རུས-བཅུ-པ	a medicinal preparation. BP 122.5, 354.1.

ཐོད-ལེ-ཀོར	alabaster; JD 52. The dictionaries (Jaeschke, Das) say it is alabaster. thod lo skor gyis nam mkha' mtshon myi nus. Zhi-byed Coll. I 277.4. thod le kor ni rdo dkar po ri mo 'bri bskyed. Utpal 13.2. See ha shig.
ཐོད-པ-ཅན	thod pa can gtsang sbra can du bsgyur du btub ni thod pa bzung nas gtsang tsog la mi 'dzem pa gtsang sbra can du bsgyur thub ces pa'o. Dpe-chos 517.

ཏིང-ཕོར	This modern Tibetan way of referring to the water bowls used in usual altar offerings Dagkar Namgyal Nyima believes to be corrrectly explained as containing the ZZ word for 'water,' ting (he believes that the recent lexical explanation of ting as meaning a 'small offering bowl' is not really correct).
ཏིང-ཙུག	A type of kinnara, evidently. Mimaki in Karmay, New Horizons p. 112, n. 22.
ཏིང-སག-སྒྱུར	See pri yang ku.
ཏིང-ངེ-འཛིན	samAdhi; Germano has an interesting etymological discussion of this term. Jan Nattier believes it involves a direct borrowing of Chinese ting i, like ting alone, used to translate Skt. samAdhi. Germano believes it comes from a 'reduplicating' of the Tib. syllable gting (like sal le from gsal). Mental focus on an object (not always necessarily meditative).
ཏིང-ངེ-འཛིན-བརྒྱད	listed in Bsam-gtan Mig Sgron 420.
ཏིང-ངེ-འཛིན-གསུམ	1. de bzhin nyid kyi... 2. kun tu snang ba'i... 3. rgyu'i... Said to be speciality of Rnying-ma. Mkhyen-rab-rgya-mtsho 1557 244.5. 1. mtshan bcas rtsol bcas kyi ting nge 'dzin. 2. mtshan bcas rtsol med kyi ting nge 'dzin. 3. mtshan med rtsol med kyi ting nge 'dzin. yang na rnam thar sgo gsum la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin. 600 16.
ཏིང-ངེ-འཛིན-གྱི-རྒྱལ-པོ	A way of referring to the miraculous lights Buddha displayed when teaching the Heart Sutra. Zhi-byed Coll. III 98.3 ff.

ཚ	Also, tshwa. On the myth of origins of salt, see Haarh, Yar-lun 332. The five types of salt are discussed in Hartzell, Dissert. 712 n. 199.. Original entry: (rgya) tsha. = chu'i snying po, mtshon cha rnon po, rgya nag sman ring. JD 64. a tree. SS 430.2. KP1 54.1. sal-ammoniac. LW 448. TM I 51, IV 63. borax. Dhongthog.

ཚ-བབས	the onset of fever. Text 43.
ཚ-བོ	See under tsha'u.
ཚ-བྱུག	nye du dang tsha byug bskyangs pa la mgu' ba myi 'ong par 'dug ste zhen pa myi thongs. Zhi-byed Coll. II 319.1.
ཚ-ཆུ	Mkhyen-rab/11 item 17. Kong-sprul/1 38: One of the two categories of dmu chu (q.v.). Symptoms: The pulse, while weak, is at a deeper level tight and hard. The urine forms a yellowish color on the surface which, as the disease develops, becomes reddish orange and bubbling.

ཚ-ཚ	[1] O.T. deriv. from Skt. sa-tstsha. Blan 308.5. [2] In a list of carnivorous animals. Samdo A V 52v.3. LW 453. [3] spark (of a fire, of an anvil). [4] For the tree, shing tsha tsha, see shal ma li.
ཚ-བའི-ནད	SRZT 43 ff.
ཚ-གི-ཚི-གི	[<tshig, to burn] = tshag tshig. hastily. Soundings 26.
ཚ-གྲངས-འཐབ-པ	Mkhyen-rab/11 no. 16: conflict ('thab pa) between 'hot disorders' (tsha nad) and 'cold disorders' (grang nad). 'Hot' and 'cold' are the most general classification for diseases. 'Hot' refers to diseases which are accompanied by an increase in temperature, while 'cold' is applied to diseases not accompanied by an increase in temperature.

II 229.7 ff. tshe 'di'i tshis bya ba dang phyi ma'i don bsgrub pa gnyis... Ibid. II 251.7. khyod rang a tsa ra la nyan na / 'bangs kyi tshis bas rang gi tshis gal che bar go ba long. Ibid. II 261.5. gzhan gyi gnyer bas rang gi tshis dga'. Ibid. II 445.6. sdod tshis mi bya 'gro tshis bya. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 180.3. gzhan gyi grogs ngan la mi tshe rgas su bcug na mdo med du 'gro bas rang tshis rang gis gyis. Zhi-byed Coll. IV 51.6.
ཚིས-འཇམ	spyir tshis. Btsan-lha.
ཚིས-ཉེས-པ	thabs jus ngan pa'am thabs shes nor 'khrul can. Btsan-lha.
ཚིས-སུ-འགྲོ-བ	phan grogs su 'gro ba. Btsan-lha. go in friendship (see Das).
ཚོ	OR, rgya tsho. county, administrative unit. Goldstein, Taxation 2. See Ricca & Fournier in TJ 26 no. 3/4 (Autumn/Winter 2001) 115, which says these new administrative entities, which seem to have been taxation units, originated with the monks of the Phyi-dar (but don't they rather mean the modern word chus? In the Phyi-dar, these were nothing more than splinters in the monastic ordination transmissions).
ཚོ-བ	tsho khag. Nomads 247.
ཚོ-ཤ-དཀར	a non-shaded color gradation commonly used in the painting of woodwork, etc; a non-shaded color gradation commonly used in the painting of woodwork, etc. Jackson.
ཚོད-མ	khu ba med pa'i skam tshod. Btsan-lha.
ཚོད-ཞོལ	tshod ma'i lhag ma. Btsan-lha.
ཚོད-ཟུང	to hold in judgement. M.Vy. 7028: gang zag gis gang zag tshod ma zung shig; one person must not judge another person.

ཚུད-པ	blo tshud pa ni blo 'gyur ba. BBNP 465.
ཚུད-མོ-མཁན	O.T. = rkos mkhan. Blan 289.2. Btsan-lha.
ཚུགས	slu ru mi tshugs ni bslu mi nus. Dpe-chos 512. tshugs / 'dzugs pa dang / 'tsho zin pa dang / 'tshe ba bcas don du ma la 'jug ste / 'dir 'tshe ba'am gnod pa'i don. Gser Sbram 142. According to Tsuguhito Takeuchi, this is the name for the units of watchmen that worked in Central Asia during the O.T. empire.
ཚུགས-དཔོན	Acc. to Tsuguhito Takeuchi, this is the name of the leader of the unit called tshugs. His assistant was called the 'og dpon (or 'og pon).
ཚུགས-པ	zug pa'am gzugs pa dang thub pa'i ming. See Silk, Dissert. 319.
ཚུགས-རིང-ཐུང	'Printed' type of Tibetan letters in their long and short forms.
ཚུགས-མ-འཁྱུག	Semi-cursive handwriting, especially used for scribing books. Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 12.
ཚུལ-བཞི	1. spyi'i don. 2. yi ge'i don. 3. sbas pa'i don. 4. mthar thug gi don. These are somehow comparable to the fourfold levels of interpretation according to medieval Christians: the literal, allegorical, moral and anagogical. "The letter teaching the things that were done, the allegory what you should believe, the moral what you should do, the anagogical where you are headed." (See P.J. Archambault, tr. A Monk's Confession: The Memoirs of Guibert of Nogent, Pennsylvania State Press [University Park 1996], p. 60.) Tiso in TJ XXX no. 3 [1998] 123.
ཚུལ-ཆོས	rang la med bzhin du gzhan gyi mthong sar yod mdog bstan pa. Btsan-lha.
ཚུལ-གསུམ	phyogs chos / rjes khyab / ldog khyab kyi tshul lo. 600 9.
ཚུལ-གཟོབ	tshul 'chos pa. Btsan-lha. Eimer, Dbyangs 56.
ཚུལ-ཁང	pilgrimage resthouse. Huber, Pure Crystal 238, n. 32.
ཚུལ-པ	keepers of the tshul khang, q.v.
ཚུལ-ཤིང	This word occurs in M.Vy. no. 8679 as Tib. translation for zalAkA, meaning "a round piece of wood used in giving ones consent, or vote (among the priests)." It may also be a monastic 'meal-ticket' (see index to Joel Tatelman, The Glorious Deeds of PUrNa).

ཨུ-སྲ	phying pa'i gzhi la u sra'i skud pas lham bu phyin ci log tu 'tshem zhing. Zhi-byed Coll. II 101.1.
ཨུ-ཙ-ལ	dur khrod chen po u tsa la'i nang nas. Zhi-byed Coll. III 78.6.

ཨུ-མོ-ཏ	? de la sku'i sras rto bu 'bum sras gis rgyan dang cha lugs legs par mdzad nas / u mo ta'i mchod pa phul nas zhus pa. Bon Kanjur (3rd ed.) LXXIV 4.3. u mo ta'i me tog mchod par phul. Ibid. LXXIV 71.1.
ཨུ-ཤི-ར	See bu shel rtsi.
ཨུ-ཚུགས-བསྐྱེད-པ	arousing effort.
ཨུ-ལུ-ཁ-ལ	See gu gul.
ཨུ-ནུ-ཁན	Mong. borrowing? TS5 672.
ཨུ-བྷི-ཏ	a mineral or metal. Namdak, Bzo-rig 89.
ཨུ-དུམ-བ-ར	See E.J. Thomas, The Life of the Buddha, p. 40, where he says that the udumbara is a kind of fig and has no visible flowers. Symbol for the rarity of buddhas, who might flower sometime or somewhere. "As, O king, an udumbara flower at some time & place arises in the world, even so at some time and place after countless cycles revered Buddhas arise in the world." (words of Asita, after examining the child SiddhArtha).
ཨུ-མའི-མངལ-ཁྲག	See brag zhun.
ཨུད-པ	lus la ud pa ltar gas. Zhi-byed Coll. V 363.4.
ཨུག-ཆོས	JD 188. SS 486.2. KP1 103.4. Varieties: dkar, dmar. KP3 276.7 (khug chos!). KP4 441.1. Incarvillea compacta Maxim. Mdo 573 & color plate.

ཝ-དོམ	Fox tassel. A kind of 'badge of dishonor' that is 'attached' (btags) to the coward who failed to rescue a person falling beneath a yak. The element dom means a 'tassel' or 'hanging ornament.' This word also occurs in the form 'o dom. Coblin in Linguistics of the Tibeto-Burman Area, vol. 17, no. 2 (Fall 1994), pp. 117-119.

ཡན-འཇད	yan chad. Btsan-lha.
ཡན-ཆད	yan chod; Also spelled yan chod. When used in temporal rather than spacial contexts, this and its opposite, man chad, cause considerable confusion when faced with the task of translating them. Jaeschke seems to have a mistaken explanation for phrases including the syllables "nas [...] yan chad," that it means 'from [that time] forth' (i.e., toward the present). It would be more accurate to say, 'from the [time of] X upwards (backwards) in time to [the time of Y].' Likewise "nas man chad" means 'from that time forward.' There are examples in Mang-thos, Bstan-rtsis which show that Jaeschke and later lexicographers are mistaken in taking "lo brgyad yan chad" as meaning 'above eight years old' if 'above' is taken to mean of higher age; in fact, it means, in effect, 'up to his eighth year.' In lineage accounts contained in thob yig texts, it is quite clear that yan chad means the part of the lineage from that point 'upward' (meaning backward in time), while man chad means from that point 'downward' (forward in time). With numbers, of course, yan would mean going up to higher numbers (with age it seems also possible), but in historical time, yan always means backward, man means forward. Hahn, Grammar 170, charts out the various forms corresponding to the pattern: ya > yan > yar > yas. Identical patterns apply to the syllables pha, tshu, ma, phyi and sla. The forms of these syllables that end with 'n' may all have the ending chad added to them.
ཡན-དུ	more than [a number]. Klong-chen-pa 9.18 comm.
ཡན-ཁ	yang dag min pa. Btsan-lha.
ཡན-ཁར	höher, übergeordnet, Sieger.
ཡན-པ	free ranging. See rgya yan. kha yan pa ni / gang 'dod du btang ba / ba yan sna med ni/ ba lang gang 'dod du btang ste sna phug nas thag ma btags pa / rta yan srab med (etc., similarly). 367 II 128.2 ff. unclaimed, unowned. Sources. 'khams pa cig la khyod kyi yul na g.yag yan pa yod dam myed gsung gi gda'. He asked a Khams pa, Do you have wild [free ranging] yaks in your country or not? Zhi-byed Coll. III 27.5.

ཡན-ལག-བརྒྱད	See bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa'i spang bya yan lag brgyad. See gso dpyad yan lag brgyad. See 'phags lam yan lag brgyad. The eight branches of medicine: 1) general. 2) gynecology. 3) pediatry. 4) spirits. 5) wounds. 6) toxicology. 7) geriatrics. 8) fertility and sexual disorders.

ཡར-གྱུ	kha yar gcu ba. Nomads 249.
ཡར-ལྡན	In contexts of explaining the way the three vows go with each other, it means something like 'possessing [the vows] upwardly/progressively' As Sgam-po-pa uses the term it seems to mean that in cases of conflict between them, the higher vows have predominance, and so there is no fault in thereby neglecting the lower. Later, some seem to believe that the lower vows are 'improved' by the taking of the higher vows. Sobisch, Dissertation. Phadampa uses the term in this passage which tells his ideas about combining the three vows: 'o na nyan thos kyi tshul khrims sna cig la rten 'tshal lam myi 'tshal lam zhus pas / rten na yang bzang thar pa'i skas yin / lar mang po mang po'i nang du nyung ngu nyung ngu 'du ba yin / gsang sngags kyi dam tshig gtsang par bsrung na / 'og ma'i bslab pa ma bsrungs kyang der 'du ba yin / sdom pa gsum la rdzas tha dad pa myed / tha dad du bsrung pa yang yod de / de yang yar ldan yin gsung // //.

ཡེ-ནས	= gdod ma nas. BBNP 480. Germano, Poetic Thought 919. ye nas rnam par dag pa occurs in a late Dunhuang text; Hackin, Formulaire 12 (note, too, ye nas sangs rgyas pa on p. 1).
ཡེ-རེ	See yer re. khyed gdams pa la ye re byon nas... Zhi-byed Coll. III 47.6.
ཡེ-ཤ	? 491 16.1, 16.4.
ཡེ-ཤེས	[etymologically, = ye nas shes pa] The subject which knows the Realm of Dharmas, the Dharmaity, insofar as it may be said that there is a subject in this context. It is the result of purifying the obscurations due to knowables (dharmas), acc. to MahAyAna. Unlike Total Knowledge, self-engendered Total Knowledge (rang byung ye shes) cannot even in the least be assigned to the subjective sphere. It = Clear Light Bodhicitta.
ཡེ-ཙེ	(blue) hawk. Discussed in Norbu, Drung 119 & note. "ye tse OR yel tse may also be synonymous with the ZZ words tse ze, that corresponds to the Tibetan gna' ba... a type of wild sheep... finally, it could also be the water bird with flat bill known in China as ya tsi." Norbu, Drung 263, n. 77.

ཡོན-ཏན-བརྒྱད	In context of gtum mo practices, 1-5 are five elements, 6-7 are sun & moon, 8 is universal. Samdo A IV 170r.1. Listed in 45 lahul II 322.3. A list of eight qualities of the ideal teacher in Zhi-byed Coll. V 248.2. Lobsang Dorjee Rabling, Five Treatises, p. 186-7 has the eight qualities of dbang phyug. See rnam smin gyi yon tan brgyad. See dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad. See rig grol gyi yon tan brgyad.
ཡོན-ཏན-གསུམ	rdul / mun pa / snying stobs rnams so. 600 15. These are three principles accepted by SAmkhya. Lobsang Dorjee Rabling, Five Treatises, p. 167 ff. They are the usual three guNas: sattva, rajas & tamas.

ཡུ-མོ	(coll.) the hind, female of the shwa ba deer (yu = hornless, as in g.yag ru, the hornless yak of either sex). MTTP. rwa co med pa. Rtse-le VIII 432. Enumerated among ridable creatures in Pha-dam-pa dang Ma-cig (PRC 1992) 441.
ཡུ-ར	evidently means a watertrough or irrigation ditch. See yur. kyag rkyog gi yu rar chu myi 'grongs [drongs]. Zhi-byed Coll. III 21.7.

ཡུ-ཐུང	Illus. in Po-ta-la (1996) 188. Evidently means 'short handle,' but in this case a short stand under the cup.
ཡུ-ཏི	491 260.5. A kind of chang made from 9 cereals. TS6 130. Nine Bon texts use this word (see Namgyal Nyima's forthcoming Zhang-zhung dictionary). chang skya'am chang gi sbang ma. Btsan-lha. Stein, in his article on Zhang-zhung, p. 244, discusses this word and sees it as deriving from a Chinese word meaning something like 'jade juice' (therefore a type of wine) that may be the Taoist drug of immortality.

ཡུལ-ཆོས-བཟང-པོ	Stein, Tibetica Antiqua I 171.
ཡུམ-འཁོར	See under 'bum 'khor.
ཡུང-བ	[1] yul ming. Dpe-chos 517. [2] JD 136. SS 438.2. = sga ser, 'jam dpal mdog, zer cig, hing li. DG 256.2. turmeric. Das. Clifford, list. DTMM identifies it with Curcuma longa L.
ཡུང-མ	KP1 153.2.
ཡུང-ང	sga ser. Btsan-lha. yung ba ste sga ser gyi ming du bshad. Eimer, Dbyangs 55.
ཡུང-རྡོག	Rübe. Kaschewsky2.
ཡུང-བ-ཁྲག-ཅན	KP3 332.4.
ཡུངས-དཀར	= nyungs dkar. white mustard. JD 216. SS 525.3. Varieties: dkar, dmar, nag. white mustard. Clifford, list. KP1 151.6. KP3 298.5. KP4 475.3.
ཡུར	O.T. = gnyid. Also, g.yur. Blan 298.1. Btsan-lha. See yu ra.
ཡུར-ཆུ	drangs pa'i chu. Btsan-lha.
ཡུར-མ	weed. 367 I 235.
ཡུར-པ	See dbur ba.
ཡུར-ཏེ	bden te. Btsan-lha.
ཡུར-པོ-ཆེ	sa shur chen po. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས	pham pa'am sdug po. Gces 581.6. bden pa. pham pa. sdug po. Btsan-lha. rang gis dka' las byas pa'i yus che gzhan la ma shad. Zhi-byed Coll. II 310.4. chos rnams mying du ma go bas nga bden yus kyis gnangs. Zhi-byed Coll. II 316.6. nga bden yus kyis snangs pa'i 'dod pa rnams. Zhi-byed Coll. V 78.7. yus smon du lus pas chos shes pa'i dgos pa stor ba la sbyor. Zhi-byed Coll. V 241.7.
ཡུས-བདག	do bdag. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས-བཀྲོལ	bden yus bshad pa. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས-བོ	= yu bo, = rwa med. a cow without horns. Karmay, Treasury.
ཡུས-ཀ	ma nyes pa'i smreng 'don pa. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས-ཀྱི	bden gyi. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས-ཏེ	O.T. = bden te. Blan 297.4. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས-བྱས-པ	drin bgrang ba'am bden khul ngom pa. 367 II 132.5. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས-མི-སྒོམ	sngar phan btags kyang nga rgyal sogs mi byed pa. Btsan-lha.
ཡུས-ཁ-སྐྱུངས	rang che rang stod mi byed pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟ	as a part of women's names, immediately following the clan name, may also be spelled bza', or, more problematically, tsha or btsa'.
ཟ-འགྲམ	mkhur tshos rgyab kyi 'gram pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-འོག	kha cher dar gyi tshon sna lnga 'dus pa la za 'og zer. Mkhyen-brtse, Works III 183. gong 'og. gos chen. Btsan-lha. SS 528.1.
ཟ-འཕྲུག	itching; SRZT 105. phyi nang gi rkyen gyis lus kyi skyi pags la zug reg phran bu bskyed pa'i myong tshor gyi ming ste: lus la za 'phrug langs lta bu. Dag-yig. itching. Jaeschke.
ཟ-བ	"to eat," to inherit. Sources.
ཟ-བོག	za 'og gam dar dang gos chen. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-བྱེད	1. srin po. 2. kha. 3. me. 4. brgya byin gyi phyag mtshan rdo rje. Blan 531. As an image of VajrapAni, used as a burner of certain materials, see Stein in JA (1995) 121, etc.
ཟ-དུར	mi ro chu nang du 'phangs nas chu'i nang gi srog chags la zar bcug pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-གུ	grang ba dkar po'am zla mtshan dkar po. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-མ	One who lacks sexual organs. Pabongka, Liberation II 76. dus kyi bye brag cig. ma ning. More generally means 'spouse.' za ma chos ma grub na mo ngan yin. Zhi-byed Coll. V 235.2. skyes pa na yang skyes pa, za ma na yang za ma, ma ning na yang ma ning. Zhi-byed Coll. V 361.7. dus brgya la za ma nad cig tu gda' yis. Zhi-byed Coll. V 524.6. In M.Vy., corresponds to saNDha, explained to mean a female eunuch (unsuitable for monastic orders).
ཟ-ཕྱིད	za thengs gcig tsam 'khyol thabs byed pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-རེས	Namdak.
ཟ-རྐོང	za 'phrug che ba'i pags nad 'brum bu can zhig gi ming ste, yul skad la lar <<rngo>> yang zer. Dag-yig. a skin disease. Text 46.
ཟ-ཟ	yum. ma. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-ཟི	= zang zing. = zang gne zing nge. chaotic, disordered, tumultuous. Klong-chen-pa 8.8, 9.19.
ཟ-མ-མོ	woman; = za ma., = bud med. woman. Karmay, Treasury.
ཟ-མ-ཏོག	nor rdzas kyi snod cig. sgam kha sbyar zhig. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-མིན-དར	landlord. Borrowing from Urdu. Francke, Antiquities II 146.
ཟ-མའི-བུ-རྫི	bud med kyi byis pa 'tsho mkhan. Nomads 248.
ཟ-ཕྱེད-རིལ-བུ	(sp?) a medicinal preparation. RR 78.
ཟ-ར-ཚག	chu 'gro sa'i wa kha. Btsan-lha.
ཟ-ཟ-མོ	woman. Karmay, Treasury vocab.
ཟ-འགྲམ-རུས-པ	DD illus. 10.
ཟ-འཆག-ཉལ-འདུག	daily activities; eating, walking, sleeping & sitting; daily activities, everyday routines. See also 'gro 'chag nyal 'dug. Klong-chen-pa 9.21.
ཟ-ཕོད-པ	O.T. = lto ba che ba. Blan 298.4. Btsan-lha.
ཟའུ-བྲིན	za rten nam 'tsho rten. Btsan-lha.
ཟབ-བརླིང	gting ring po'am phra mo. Btsan-lha.
ཟབ-སྦྱོང	Lit., 'profound cultivation.' Specialization, acc. to Dungkar in TJ 8 no. 4 (Winter 1993) 37.
ཟབ-ལག-ཅན	See chu rtsa.
ཟབ-ལག-བརྒྱད-པ	a medicinal preparation. Prescriptions 117. Lag-len 86.5. = zag lag brgyad pa (Lag-len 38.1). TMC 64 (142).
ཟད-པར-བཅུ	zad par sngon po'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par ser po'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par dmar po'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par dkar po'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par sa'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par chu'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par me'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par rlung gi ting nge 'dzin / zad par nam mkha'i ting nge 'dzin / zad par rnam shes kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams so. 600 148-150.
ཟད-པར-གྱི-སྐྱེ-མཆེད	all-pervading bases. Pabongka, Liberation II 299. Zhi-byed Coll. I 147.4.
ཟག-བཅས	Skt. sAsrava. contaminating influences. Germano, Poetic Thought 859.
ཟག-པ	sometimes it just means 'waste,' or even 'excrement.' Zhi-byed Coll. IV 379.6. nyon mongs pa. Btsan-lha. outflows. Skt. Azrava (M.Vy. no. 2141), a synonym of 'state' of the klezas, often translated as 'fluxes' ('exhudations' may be a good translation).
ཟག-ཟོག	zol zog. Gces 585.6. zol zog gam zog rdzu. Btsan-lha.
ཟག-ལག-བརྒྱད-པ	See zab lag brgyad pa.
ཟག-པ-རྒྱུན-གཏོར	'continual offering of excretions.' For mantras for phlegm, snot, perspiration, feces & urine, see Pabongka, Liberation II 71.
ཟག-ལྷན-མ-བྱས-པ	chu 'dzag sgo ma bkag pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟགས-པ	technically the past of zag pa, it means 'leakage,' as in leakage of secrets, which may involve still other kinds of losses. Zhi-byed Coll. V 243.7. bla mas thugs la btags nas snang (gnang) ba'i gdams ngag khar zags su ma gzhug. Zhi-byed Coll. V 395.2.
ཟལ	zal zhes pa dkar zhur gyi brda rnying du snang ba / mdo khams zal mo sgang zhes pa'ang yul gyi gzhung thams cad gangs ri rgyun ma chad pa dkar pos thig btab pa bzhin yod pa la brten nas. Mkhyen-brtse, Works V 60-61. Note: dkar zal also means a 'white stripe' (see Yisun).
ཟལ-པོ	khra bo. Btsan-lha.
ཟལ-ཐོན	gzengs thon pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟམ	May be a borrowing from Mongolian zam, 'postal station,' as in rta zam. Beyer, CT Lang. 145.
ཟམ-འབུམ	zam stegs. Btsan-lha.
ཟམ-པ	bridge; bridge. On origins of bridges in Tibet, see Haarh, Yar-lun 121.
ཟམ-མི-ཟིམ-མི	winking, drizzling. Soundings 30.
ཟམ-མ-ཆད-པ	rgyun ma chad pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟམ-བར-མ-ཆད-པ	'ongs dang chu bo sogs la zam pa btsugs pa bar du ma chad pa ltar zhes pa'o. Dpe-chos 504.
ཟན	a lump of kneaded rtsam pa, known as spag in Central Tibetan. Almogi, MA Thesis 87, n. 255.
ཟན-དྲོན	rtsam phye sogs sor mo lnga'i rjes dod nus pa. thug pa'i bye brag cig. Btsan-lha.
ཟན-ནེ	bla ma'i zhal du zan ne cig song ba'i cha'i phyogs su... Zhi-byed Coll. IV 63.1.
ཟན-པ	zas g.yo mkhan. Btsan-lha.
ཟན-རྡེ	rtse lde'i chos ston brgya bas zhang zhung dge' po'i zan rde cig 'tshogs che bar gda'o gsung. Zhi-byed Coll. II 154.4.
ཟན-རིལ	a dough-ball with a prophecy inside. A form of divination. Havnevik, Dissertation 355.
ཟན-སྤགས	zan dang mnyan du za rgyu'i tshod ma. Btsan-lha.
ཟན-ཡང	bsam yas gtsug lag khang. Btsan-lha. See Das.
ཟང	rkyang pa'am sgrib pa med pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟང-གིས	zang thal du. Gces 589.6. bar mtshams med pa zang thal du. Btsan-lha.
ཟང-ཀ	penetrating (?), permeable, loopholed. Klong-chen-pa 9.14 comm., 9.21. ye shes gsal dag zad ka ste. 91 I 588.3.
ཟང-མ	passing-through. (?) Klong-chen-pa 7.6. kho na'am rkyang pa. exclusive. Karmay, Treasury.
ཟང-མར	always, without admixture. T&BS II 278.
ཟང-རྐྱང	kha rkyang ngam 'ba' zhig. Dpe-chos 508. Btsan-lha.
ཟང-ཐལ	[= zang ka thal byung, OR zang mthal] passing-right-through. Awareness is said to "pass right through" obstacles like a body "passing through" a wall. Skt. tamrabhasma (copper ash??). OR, = zang nge thal le ba (?). Klong-chen-pa 3.6. transparent. Thondup, BM 363. Germano, Poetic Thought 953. The phrase ye shes zang thal occurs in Samdo A IV 255v.5. thad kar 'gro ba. thogs rdugs med par 'gro ba. Btsan-lha. Dagyab. yul sems gnyis myed zang thal la // tha dad 'dzin pa nyon re mongs. Zhi-byed Coll. I 323.6.
ཟང-ཟིང	O.T. = sha. = zas. (see za zi, ?) Blan 290.3, q.v. sha. zas. rnyed pa. 'dod yon. Btsan-lha.
ཟང-ཀ-མ	permeable. (?) Klong-chen-pa 9.19. Germano, Poetic Thought 953.
ཟང-ཟིང-ཕན-ཕུན	zang zing dam dum. Btsan-lha.
ཟངས	= tA mraM. JD 41. SS 399.2. = me ha ra. YTTM 291.9. SS 505.1. DG 106.4.
ཟངས-འགར	des na zangs 'gar gyi grub mtha' la mi brten par chags pa med par gyis dang. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) VI 241.2.
ཟངས-བརྒྱའ	zangs kyi sgrom bu. Btsan-lha.
ཟངས-བུ	chu snod. Btsan-lha.
ཟངས-གྲི	copper-cutters. See Schmied 146.
ཟངས-ཀྱིས	thogs rdugs med par zangs thal du 'gro ba. Btsan-lha.

ཟངས-སྡེར	[<sder ma, plate] a plate with a small pedestal attached, made of copper. Hon.: gsol sder. Schmied 193.

ཟངས-ཀྱི-ཡི-གེ-པ	zangs kyis bzos pa'i byang bu'i thog go gnas sogs bkod yod pa'i thob rtags dang yi ge pa'i go gnas gnyis ldan can. Btsan-lha.
ཟངས-ཟེ-ཅན	See bya.
ཟངས-མོ-ཆེ	vessel used in royal burials. Haarh, Yar-lun 354, etc.
ཟངས-རྩི-བ	Varieties: dkar po (= gsang ba sman gcig, seng ge 'jigs med), nag po (= ma thang 'ching bu). JD 197. SS 484.2. KP1 101.4. KP3 275.7. KP4 439.4. = ri sha wa. YTTM 292.7.
ཟངས-ཐལ-ཉི-ཤུ	a medicinal preparation. BP 331.5.
ཟངས-ཐལ-ཉེར-ལྔ	a medicinal preparation. TMC 40 (86). BP 167.6, 216.4.
ཟངས-ཐལ-ཉེར-དྲུག-པ	a medicinal preparation. Three Tibetan Medical Texts 47 ff.
ཟངས-མའི-གླེགས-བུ	zangs las bzos pa'i leb mo pang leb lta bu. Btsan-lha.
ཟར-བུ	Namdak.
ཟར-གོག	(Dbus) = 'gram pa. cheeks. MTTP.
ཟར-མ	Nagano in Karmay, New Horizons 585. JD 215. = til dmar. KP1 155. KP3 300.3. KP4 478.5. Sesamum orientale. LW 448. See ri skyes zar ma.
ཟར-རབ	mint master. Borrowing from Urdu. Francke, Antiquities II 146.
ཟར-ཟིར	See ban bun. 367 II 133.2.
ཟར-ཟུར	n. of a very high number. Samdo A III 109r.5. sbyin pa chang chung la sogs dge ba yi // las la 'bad pa'i rnam thar zar zur mchis // 'dir bri ma lang zur du gzigs par zhu. Samdo A III 188r.3.
ཟས-འཐེབ	za ma'i rin. Btsan-lha.
ཟས-བསྐྲུ	zas slong ba. Btsan-lha.
ཟས-བསྔོས	blessed food (offered to a dead person as part of funerary rite). Sources.
ཟས-བསྙོད	zas za ba'am sos bldad pa. Btsan-lha.
ཟས-བསྲེལ	zas bzang ba'am zhim pa. Btsan-lha.

ཟེང	prob. mistake for zing.
ཟེར-ཅིག	See yung ba.
ཟེར-གཉིས	Achard, L'Essence 140.
ཟེར-མ	(wie ein) Lichtstrahl, d.h. ungreifbar. Kaschewsky2. chu thigs. rlung. Btsan-lha.
ཟེར-མཆུ	lab lob. Gces 584.5.
ཟེར-མོ	n. of a small bird. Karmay, Arrow 348. JD 229. SS 498.6. a bird. Clifford, list. See Emmerick in G. Meulenbeld & D. Wujastyk, Studies on Indian Medical History, Motilal (Delhi 2001) 62, where he decides to translate it as 'antelope.'
ཞ-འབྲིང	O.T. = zhabs 'bring. Also, zham 'dring. Blan 297.4. Haarh, Yar-lun 369. zhabs 'bring ba. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-འཐེང	limping. Naga in TJ 24 no. 3 (1999) 70.
ཞ-བ	? 'khrul pa yul la zha ba dus mnyam. Zhi-byed Coll. II 26.1. perhaps zhi ba is intended.
ཞ-ཆག	ma sgrub pa. ma 'grig pa. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-ལག	yan lag. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-ལུ	myu gu sogs thon ma thag pa. a clan. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-ནེ	zha nye; = zha nye (?). = si sa. YTTM 291.10.
ཞ-ཉེ	lead; lead (the metal). 'bro sgom gyi nu bo zha nye'i sta ri yin brdar ba la bul myed gsung. The axe being one of lead, don't give it for filing. Zhi-byed Coll. II 172.2. = mA gaM, gser dgra. JD 43. SS 505.3. = zha ne, re nye, tshon mo ta, klu nag. DG 112.2. See ti tsha ser po. On lead used as a sealant for metal pegs joining bricks or stone in early Tibetan buildings, see Templeman in TJ 26 no. 3/4 (Autumn/Winter 2001) 200-201.
ཞ-ཕྱལ	? 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 134.5.
ཞ-པོ	= chags. ? Kuijp (1986) 38.
ཞ-སྒྲ	O.T. = rna med. Blan 293.3.
ཞ-སྒྲེ	rna ba med pa. 'on pa. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-ཞུ	zha zhu gtam gyis mi bzlog 'chi tshe. 601 38r.4.
ཞ-ཞུམ	unterwürfiges Verhalten. Kaschewsky 85.
ཞ-གི-ཞི-གི	[<zhig po, ragged] = zhag zhig. raggedly. Soundings 26.
ཞ-ཉེ-ནག-པོ	carbon. Dhongthog.
ཞ-ཉེའི-འབྱར-འདབ	zha nye las byas pa'i zhabs stegs. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-འབྲིང-སྣང-མ	zhabs 'bring nang ma. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-སྔ-ནས	zhal snga nas. sku ngo mas. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-ཞ-ཞ-ཞར	dus nam yang. Btsan-lha.
ཞ-ལུ-སྐྱེས	lo ma gsar pa kha 'bus pa. Btsan-lha.
ཞའུ-ལི	a Chinese term, used for lowranking clerical workers. Tsarong in TJ 23 no. 3 (1998) 26.
ཞབས-བསིལ	lham phud pa. Btsan-lha.
ཞབས-ཆགས	shoe. Kaschewsky 85.
ཞབས-དག	(coll.) salutation for drinking beer, "drain your cups!" MTTP.
ཞབས-དོར	(hon.) pantaloons. Wylie 132, n. 147.
ཞབས-མ	zhol lam gos sgab la'ang.
ཞབས-རྡོག	Schuhsohle. Kaschewsky 85.
ཞབས-རྗེས	On Buddha's footprints at Rdo-rje-gdan, see Chag 71. For what could be the earliest Tibetan example of a footprint thangka, see Vitali in TS9 I 87.
ཞབས-རྟེག	bsnyen bkur. Btsan-lha.

ཞལ-བསྲོ	lit., "warming the face," special ritual prayer for softening (and making human and kind) the heart of the deity. "warming the heart" works better in English. ST. spyan dbye ste rab gnas. rmang gzhi dang gzhi btsugs pa sogs. Btsan-lha. Namdak.

[2] Name for various plants: Karmay, Arrow 347. JD 85. SS 435.1. KP3 344.1. KP4 571.4.. Original entry: (gla gor) zho sha. = zla gor zho sha, mcher ba zhog, glang mig. JD 85. SS 435.3. KP3 344.4. ཞུགས-ཀྱིས-དྲལ	me nang bsregs pa. Btsan-lha.
ཞུགས-གནས-བརྒྱད	rgyun zhugs zhugs pa / rgyun zhugs 'bras gnas / phyir 'ong zhugs pa / phyir 'ong 'bras gnas / phyir mi 'ong zhugs pa / phyir mi 'ong 'bras gnas / dgra bcom zhugs pa / dgra bcom 'bras gnas rnams so. 600 112.
ཞུམ-བུ	cat; Domestic cat. See Sandberg, Tibet 293. 'a 'u zhum bu byi la gsum la 'dam ka gda' ste. Zhi-byed Coll. II 9.4 (also, IV 180.2). See byi la.
ཞུམ-པ	ngu ba'i zhe sa. Btsan-lha.
ཞུམ-པོ	spu ngan zhum po la dbus par du zhu ngan zhum po zhes 'byung ste snying chung dpa' zhum pa. Dpe-chos 512.
ཞུམ-ཞིང-འཛུར	dpa' khum zhing gzhan du byol thabs byed pa. Btsan-lha. dpal zhum zhing gzhan du byol thabs sam 'dzur thabs byed pa'i ming. Eimer, Dbyangs 55.
ཞུན	See zhu mkhan.
ཞུན-དཀར	Namdak.
ཞུན-རྡོ	See (rdo) thal.
ཞུན-རྩེ	byu ru. Btsan-lha.
ཞུན-ཐར	= the tshom. BBNP 472. In most cases it would seem to mean 'doubt,' but it also is clearly a name of a (smeltable) material substance (which might be the basis for the metaphorical meaning 'doubt'). See Yisun. zhun thar chod pa / the tshom thag gcod pa. rang rgyud kyi zhun thar nang du 'byongs kyang... Zhi-byed Coll. III 17.6. zhun thar 'byongs pa'i ngar gyis sha rus bcad. Ibid. I 265.6. zhun thar sbyangs pa'i gser la 'gyur ba myed. Ibid. I 287.6. rgyud dka' thub kyi zhun thar gyis sbyongs. Ibid. II 314.2. rang rgyud zhun thar 'byongs pa'i gser shog lta bur gyurd pas / nyon mongs pa'i 'phan mi ldang. Ibid. V 177.2. mtha' phyir mi ldog pa lcags la zhun thar 'thems pa lta bu cig dgos pa yin te. Ibid. V 224.3.
ཞུན-ཐར-བཅད-པ	Das gives two meanings: 1) to scrutinize, make critical examination. skabs skabs su bla ma'i drung du gdams ngag gi zhun thar legs par bcad (his source is part 3 of Blue Annals). 2) to join together white-heated iron by beating again.
ཞུན-ཐར-བྱེད-པ	to melt and beat to pieces. Jaeschke (his source is Milarepa).
ཞུང-གིས	yas mar zhung gis byung ba ni steng nas mar shar te byung ba. Dpe-chos 511.
ཞུང-ངེ	Samdo A V 259r.4.
ཞུང-ཞུང	btsun btsun zhung zhung ltar byas kyang phan med. Samdo A V 260r.1.
ཞུར-པོ	rta rgyug pa dang mgyogs pa. Btsan-lha.
ཞུས-ལན	interview. Karmay, Great Perfection 67-8.
ཞུས-ཐིག	zhu ba'i thig pa. Gces 584.3.
ཞྭ	hat. For a text called 'Brug pa'i zhwa khrid, see SBTD I 302.

ཞྭ-ཐེབས	In a list of types of hats in Pha-dam-pa dang Ma-cig (PRC 1992) 438.

ཞྭ-བྲང-སྐོར	a horseback riding feat, in which one circles the hat around the chest of the horse. Khenrap in TJ 25 no. 4 (2000) 58.

ཟོ-བ	a pail. a measure, about equiv. of a litre. Havnevik, Dissertation 311. Ramble in Karmay, New Horizons 298 ff. says it is about half a litre (but on p. 315, n. 4, he says it is one twentieth of a 'bo khal).

ཟོ-བཟང	rang bzhin bzang po drang zhing bsam pa dge ba. Btsan-lha.
ཟོ-ཆུ	'dod pa'i gnas der zo chus chu rgyun bsring. Zhi-byed Coll. I 274.5. snga ris kyi zo chu des 'khor ba'i chos thams cad gtan la phab pa rgod bro gsung. Ibid. II 160.5. zo chu khyud mo gyen mthur 'gro la brtson. Ibid. I 284.6. srid pa'i 'hor lor ris drug gi skye gnas su zo chu khyud mo bzhin du 'khor ba'o. Ibid. V 234.1.
ཟོ-ཆུན	bucket-wheel, "A devise for raising water from a well for irrigation, consisting of buckets fixed to an endless rope passing over a wheel, so as to fill themselves at the bottom and empty themselves at the top." Essential Nectar. Skt. araghaTTa. (related to 'irrigate'?!) T&BS I 51. 476 IV 402.1. Related to zo ba. BBNP 477, 484. See B. Laufer, The Noria or Persian Wheel, Oriental Studies in Honour of C.E. Pavry (1933). sa mthon por chu 'dren byed kyi 'khor lo. Btsan-lha. The bucket-wheel (ghaTiyantra) of rebirth is something that figures in a very early version of the Wheel of Life. See Neumann in TS9 VII 77-78.
ཟོ-དོར	Ortsgottheit. Kaschewsky2.
ཟོ-གསོད	overseer (?). BA 300.
ཟོ-མར	= rgya phrum. "cream on unboiled milk, butter." T&BS II 278. "butter [that has accumulated] on the wall of the bucket": 'o ma'i zo ba'i mar rnying lta bu. Chödag. SS 529.6.
ཟོ-མདོག	Namdak. nad bral lus de zo mdog snga sor tshud. Zhi-byed Coll. I 288.2.
ཟོ-རིས	As in, zhag gi zo ris. Mistake for zhag gi sor ris. = sor mo gsum gyi ri mo. Blan 311.6. gdong pa sogs la zhag sogs byugs pa'i sor ris. byugs pa'i rdzas shig. Btsan-lha. See so ris.

ཟུན	dgra zun gyi ru phyed pa ni / dgra gnyen gyi khyad par phyed pa. 367 II 128.5. An archaism for gnyen, 'companion, friend (or perhaps something helpful or favorable to oneself)' Samdo A III 235v.4, 251v.4; V 171v.4. rang phyogs pa'am mdza' bshes gnyen 'brel. Btsan-lha. dgra dang zun [~gnyen] gyi rgyal po rnams. 'Jig-rten-mgon-po, Bka'-'bum (2001) IV 29.4. gnyen nas yid dga' ba'i phyogs te dgra zun zhes pa'ang yod.
